braSyt bra alhym at hSmym wat harz in the beginning to-no-these created the namespaces and the earth. bereshit bara ’elohim, hashamayim ve’et ha’arez.
wharz hyth thw wbhw wxSk el pny thwm wrwx alhym mrxpt el pny hmym and the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face-turns of the deep. and breath-spirit of to-no-these moved upon the face-turns of the from-waters. veha’arez hayetah tohu vabohu vekhoshekh ‘al penei tehom, veruakh ’elohim merakhefet ‘al penei hamayim.
wyamr alhym yhy awr wyhy awr and to-no-these said, let there be light: and there was light. vayomer ’elohim yehi ’or, vayhi ’or.
wyra alhym at hawr ky Twb wybdl alhym byn hawr wbyn hxSk and to-no-these saw the light, that it was good: and to-no-these divided the light from the darkness. vayar ’elohim ha’or ki tob, vayabdel ’elohim ben ha’or uben hakhoshekh.
wyqra alhym lawr ywm wlxSk qra lylh wyhy erb wyhy bqr ywm axd and to-no-these called the light day, and the darkness he called night. and the evening and the morning were the first day. vayiqra ’elohim la’or yom velakhoshekh qara layelah, vayhi ‘ereb vayhi boqer yom ’ekhad.
wyamr alhym yhy rqye btwk hmym wyhy mbdyl byn mym lmym and to-no-these said, let there be a firmament in the midst of the from-waters, and let it divide the from-waters from the from-waters. vayomer ’elohim yehi raqia‘ betokh hamayim, vihi mabdil ben mayim lamayim.
wyeS alhym at hrqye wybdl byn hmym aSr mtxt lrqye wbyn hmym aSr mel lrqye wyhy kn and to-no-these made the firmament, and divided the from-waters which were under the firmament from the from-waters which were above the firmament: and it was so. vaya‘as ’elohim haraqia‘ vayabdel ben hamayim ’asher mitakhat laraqia‘ uben hamayim ’asher me‘al laraqia‘, vayhi khen.
wyqra alhym lrqye Smym wyhy erb wyhy bqr ywm Sny and to-no-these called the firmament namespaces. and the evening and the morning were the second day. vayiqra ’elohim laraqia‘ shamayim, vayhi ‘ereb vayhi boqer yom sheni.
wyamr alhym yqww hmym mtxt hSmym al mqwm axd wtrah hybSh wyhy kn and to-no-these said, let the from-waters under the namespaces be added together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so. vayomer ’elohim yiqavu hamayim mitakhat hashamayim ’el maqom ’ekhad vetera’eh hayabashah, vayhi khen.
wyqra alhym lybSh arz wlmqwh hmym qra ymym wyra alhym ky Twb and to-no-these called the dry land earth; and the gathering together of the from-waters called he seas: and to-no-these saw that it was good. vayiqra ’elohim layabashah ’erez ulemiqveh hamayim qara yamim, vayar ’elohim ki tob.
wyamr alhym tdSa harz dSa eSb mcrye cre ez pry eSh pry lmynw aSr crew bw el harz wyhy kn and to-no-these said, let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so. vayomer ’elohim tadshei ha’arez deshe ‘eseb mazria‘ zera‘ ‘ez peri ‘oseh peri lemino ’asher zar‘o bo ‘al ha’arez, vayhi khen.
wtwza harz dSa eSb mcrye cre lmynhw wez eSh pry aSr crew bw lmynhw wyra alhym ky Twb and the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and to-no-these saw that it was good. vatozei ha’arez deshe ‘eseb mazria‘ zera‘ leminehu ve‘ez ‘oseh peri ’asher zar‘o bo leminehu, vayar ’elohim ki tob.
wyhy erb wyhy bqr ywm SlySy and the evening and the morning were the third day. vayhi ‘ereb vayhi boqer yom shelishi.
wyamr alhym yhy mart brqye hSmym lhbdyl byn hywm wbyn hlylh whyw latt wlmwedym wlymym wSnym and to-no-these said, let there be lights in the firmament of the namespaces to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years: vayomer ’elohim yehi me’orot birqia‘ hashamayim lehabdil ben hayom uben halayelah, vehayu le’otot ulemo‘adim uleyamim veshanim.
whyw lmawrt brqye hSmym lhayr el harz wyhy kn and let them be for lights in the firmament of the namespaces to give light upon the earth: and it was so. vehayu lim’orot birqia‘ hashamayim leha’ir ‘al ha’arez, vayhi khen.
wyeS alhym at Sny hmart hgdlym at hmawr hgdl lmmSlt hywm wat hmawr hqTn lmmSlt hlylh wat hkwkbym and to-no-these made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also. vaya‘as ’elohim shenei hame’orot hagedolim, hama’or hagadol lememshelet hayom ve’et hama’or haqaton lememshelet halaylah ve’et hakokhabim.
wytn atm alhym brqye hSmym lhayr el harz and to-no-these set them in the firmament of the namespaces to give light upon the earth, vayiten ’otam ’elohim birqia‘ hashamayim, leha’ir ‘al ha’arez.
wlmSl bywm wblylh wlhbdyl byn hawr wbyn hxSk wyra alhym ky Twb and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and to-no-these saw that it was good. velimshol bayom ubalaylah ulahabdil ben ha’or uben hakhoshekh, vayar ’elohim ki tob.
wyhy erb wyhy bqr ywm rbyey and the evening and the morning were the fourth day. vayhi ‘ereb vayhi boqer yom rebi‘i.
wyamr alhym ySrzw hmym Srz npS xyh wewp yewpp el harz el pny rqye hSmym and to-no-these said, let the from-waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of namespaces. vayomer ’elohim yishrezu hamayim sherez nefesh khayah, ve‘of ye‘ofef ‘al ha’arez ‘al penei reqia‘ hashamayim.
wybra alhym at htnynm hgdlym wat kl npS hxyh hrmSt aSr Srzw hmym lmynhm wat kl ewp knp lmynhw wyra alhym ky Twb and to-no-these created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the from-waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and to-no-these saw that it was good. vayibra ’elohim hataninim hagedolim, ve’et kal nefesh hakhayah haromeset ’asher sharezu hamayim leminehem ve’et kal ‘of kanaf leminehu vayar ’elohim ki tob.
wybrk atm alhym lamr prw wrbw wmlaw at hmym bymym whewp yrb barz and to-no-these knee-fluffy-blessed them, saying, be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the from-waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth. vaybarekh ’otam ’elohim lemor, peru urebu umil’u hamayim bayamim veha‘of yireb ba’arez.
wyhy erb wyhy bqr ywm xmySy and the evening and the morning were the fifth day. vayhi ‘ereb vayhi boqer yom khamishi.
wyamr alhym twza harz npS xyh lmynh bhmh wrmS wxytw arz lmynh wyhy kn and to-no-these said, let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, in-them-animal, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so. vayomer ’elohim tozei ha’arez nefesh khayah leminah behemah varemes vekhayto ’erez leminah, vayhi khen.
wyeS alhym at xyt harz lmynh wat hbhmh lmynh wat kl rmS hadmh lmynhw wyra alhym ky Twb and to-no-these made the beast of the earth after his kind, and in-them-animal after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and to-no-these saw that it was good. vaya‘as ’elohim khayat ha’arez leminah ve’et habehemah leminah ve’et kal remes ha’adamah leminehu, vayar ’elohim ki tob.
wyamr alhym neSh adm bzlmnw kdmwtnw wyrdw bdgt hym wbewp hSmym wbbhmh wbkl harz wbkl hrmS hrmS el harz and to-no-these said, let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the ai-islandr, and over the in-them-animal, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth. vayomer ’elohim na‘aseh ’adam bezalmenu kidmutenu, veyirdu bidgat hayam ube‘of hashamayim ubabehemah ubekhal ha’arez ubekhal haremes haromes ‘al ha’arez.
wybra alhym at hadm bzlmw bzlm alhym bra atw ckr wnqbh bra atm so to-no-these created man in his own image, in the image of to-no-these created he him; rememberer and pierced created he them. vayibra ’elohim ha’adam bezalmo bezelem ’elohim bara ’oto, zakhar uneqebah bara ’otam.
wybrk atm alhym wyamr lhm alhym prw wrbw wmlaw at harz wkbSh wrdw bdgt hym wbewp hSmym wbkl xyh hrmSt el harz and to-no-these knee-fluffy-blessed them, and to-no-these said unto them, be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the earth, and shepherd-preserve it: and go down on over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the ai-islandr, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth. vaybarekh ’otam ’elohim vayomer lahem ’elohim peru urebu umil’u ha’arez vekhibshuha, uredu bidgat hayam ube‘of hashamayim ubekhal khayah haromeset ‘al ha’arez.
wyamr alhym hnh ntty lkm at kl eSb cre cre aSr el pny kl harz wat kl hez aSr bw pry ez cre cre lkm yhyh laklh and to-no-these said, behold, i have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face-turns of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it be for meat. vayomer ’elohim hineh natati lakhem kal ‘eseb zorea‘ zera‘ ’asher ‘al penei khal ha’arez ve’et kal ha‘ez ’asher bo feri ‘ez zorea‘ zara‘, lakhem yihyeh le’akhlah
wlkl xyt harz wlkl ewp hSmym wlkl rwmS el harz aSr bw npS xyh at kl yrq eSb laklh wyhy kn and to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the ai-islandr, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, i have given every green herb for meat: and it was so. ulekhal khayat ha’arez ulekhal ‘of hashamayim ulekhol romes ‘al ha’arez ’asher bo nefesh khayah kal yereq ‘eseb le’akhlah vayhi khen.
wyra alhym at kl aSr eSh whnh Twb mad wyhy erb wyhy bqr ywm hSSy and to-no-these saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. and the evening and the morning were the sixth day. vayar ’elohim kal ’asher ‘asah vehineh tob me’od, vayhi ‘ereb vayhi boqer yom hashishi.
wyklw hSmym wharz wkl zbam thus the namespacess and the earth were finished, and all the troop-cluster of them. vaykhulu hashamayim veha’arez vekhal zeba’am.
wykl alhym bywm hSbyey mlaktw aSr eSh wySbt bywm hSbyey mkl mlaktw aSr eSh and on the seventh day to-no-these ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made. vaykhal ’elohim bayom hashebi‘i melakhto ’asher ‘asah, vayishbot bayom hashebi‘i mikal melakhto ’asher ‘asah.
wybrk alhym at ywm hSbyey wyqdS atw ky bw Sbt mkl mlaktw aSr bra alhym leSwt and to-no-these knee-fluffy-blessed the seventh day, and dedicated-finished it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which to-no-these created and made. vaybarekh ’elohim yom hashebi‘i vayqadesh ’oto, ki bo shabat mikal melakhto ’asher bara ’elohim la‘asot.
alh twldwt hSmym wharz bhbram bywm eSwt yhwh alhym arz wSmym these are the generations of the namespacess and of the earth when they were created, in the day that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these made the earth and the namespacess, ’eleh toldot hashamayim veha’arez behibare’am, beyom ‘asot yhvh ’elohim ’erez veshamayim.
wkl Syx hSdh Trm yhyh barz wkl eSb hSdh Trm yzmx ky la hmTyr yhwh alhym el harz wadm ayn lebd at hadmh and every plant of the field before-turns it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before-turns it grew: for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground. vekhol siakh hasadeh terem yihyeh ba’arez vekhal ‘eseb hasadeh terem yizmakh, ki lo himtir yhvh ’elohim ‘al ha’arez ve’adam ’ayin la‘abod ha’adamah.
wad yelh mn harz whSqh at kl pny hadmh and there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face-turns of the ground. ve’ed ya‘aleh min ha’arez, vehishqah kal pene ha’adamah.
wyyzr yhwh alhym at hadm epr mn hadmh wypx bapyw nSmt xyym wyhy hadm lnpS xyh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living being. vayizer yhvh ’elohim ha’adam ‘afar min ha’adamah vayipakh be’apav nishmat khayim, vayhi ha’adam lenefesh khayah.
wyTe yhwh alhym gn bedn mqdm wySm Sm at hadm aSr yzr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these planted a garden eastward in eden-eon; and there he put the man whom he had formed. vayita‘ yhvh ’elohim gan be‘eden miqedem, vayasem sham ha’adam ’asher yazar.
wyzmx yhwh alhym mn hadmh kl ez nxmd lmrah wTwb lmakl wez hxyym btwk hgn wez hdet Twb wre and out of the ground made yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and bad. vayazmakh yhvh ’elohim min ha’adamah kal ‘ez nekhmad lemar’eh vetob lema’akhal, ve‘ez hakhayim betokh hagan ve‘ez hada‘at tob vara‘.
wnhr yza medn lhSqwt at hgn wmSm yprd whyh larbeh raSym and a river went out of eden-eon to from-waters the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads. venahar yozei me‘eden lehashqot hagan, umisham yipared vehayah le’arba‘ah rashim.
Sm haxd pySwn hwa hsbb at kl arz hxwylh aSr Sm hchb the name of the first is pison-mouth-old: that is it which compasseth the whole land of havilah-sick, where there is gold; shem ha’ekhad pishon, hu hasobeb kal ’erez hakhavilah ’asher sham hazahab.
wchb harz hhwa Twb Sm hbdlx wabn hShm and the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx-that-they father-child-stone. uzahab ha’arez hahiv tob, sham habedolakh ve’eben hashoham.
wSm hnhr hSny gyxwn hwa hswbb at kl arz kwS and the name of the second river is gihon-emerged: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of cush-spindle-spindle. veshem hanahar hasheni gikhon, hu hasobeb kal ’erez kush.
wSm hnhr hSlySy xdql hwa hhlk qdmt aSwr whnhr hrbyey hwa prt and the name of the third river is hiddekel-trunk-palm: that is it which goeth toward the east of assyria-beech-tree. and the fourth river is euphrates-cow. veshem hanahar hashelishi khideqel hu haholekh qidmat ’ashur, vehanahar harebi‘i hu ferat.
wyqx yhwh alhym at hadm wynxhw bgn edn lebdh wlSmrh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these took the man, and put him into the garden of eden-eon to dress it and to keep it. vayiqakh yhvh ’elohim ha’adam, vayanikhehu began ‘eden le‘abedah uleshamerah.
wyzw yhwh alhym el hadm lamr mkl ez hgn akl takl and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these direct the man, saying, of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat: vayzav yhvh ’elohim ha’adam lemor, mikol ‘ez hagan ’akhol tokhel.
wmez hdet Twb wre la takl mmnw ky bywm aklk mmnw mwt tmwt and of the tree of the knowledge of god and bad, no eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou surely die. ume‘ez hada‘at tob vara‘ lo tokhal mimenu, ki beyom ’akhalekha mimenu mot tamut.
wyamr yhwh alhym la Twb hywt hadm lbdw aeSh lw ecr kngdw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these said, it is not good that the man should be alone; i will make him a helping counter-touch for him. vayomer yhvh ’elohim lo tob heyot ha’adam lebado, ’e‘eseh lo ‘ezer kenegdo.
wyzr yhwh alhym mn hadmh kl xyt hSdh wat kl ewp hSmym wyba al hadm lrawt mh yqra lw wkl aSr yqra lw hadm npS xyh hwa Smw and out of the ground yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the ai-islandr; and brought them unto adam-earth-blood-man to see what he would call them: and whatsoever adam-earth-blood-man called every living creature, that was the name thereof. vayizer yhvh ’elohim min ha’adamah kal khayat hasadeh ve’et kal ‘of hashamayim vayabei ’el ha’adam lir’ot mah yiqra lo, vekhol ’asher yiqra lo ha’adam nefesh khayah hu shemo.
wyqra hadm Smwt lkl hbhmh wlewp hSmym wlkl xyt hSdh wladm la mza ecr kngdw and adam-earth-blood-man gave names to all in-them-animal, and to the fowl of the ai-islandr, and to every beast of the field; and for adam-earth-blood-man there was not found a helping counter-touch for him. vayiqra ha’adam shemot lekhal habehemah ule‘of hashamayim ulekhol khayat hasadeh, ule’adam lo maza ‘ezer kenegdo.
wypl yhwh alhym trdmh el hadm wyySn wyqx axt mzletyw wysgr bSr txtnh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these caused a deep sleep to fall upon adam-earth-blood-man, and he slept: and he took one of his side-zolea-ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof; vayapel yhvh ’elohim tardemah ‘al ha’adam vayishan, vayiqakh ’akhat mizal‘otav vayisgor basar takhtenah.
wybn yhwh alhym at hzle aSr lqx mn hadm laSh wybah al hadm and the rib, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man. vayiben yhvh ’elohim hazela‘ ’asher laqakh min ha’adam le’ishah, vaybi’eha ’el ha’adam.
wyamr hadm cat hpem ezm mezmy wbSr mbSry lcat yqra aSh ky mayS lqxh cat and adam-earth-blood-man said, this is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she be called woman, because she was taken out of man. vayomer ha’adam zot hapa‘am ‘ezem me‘azamay ubasar mibesari, lezot yiqarei ’ishah ki me’ish luqokhah zot.
el kn yecb ayS at abyw wat amw wdbq baStw whyw lbSr axd therefore a man leave his father and his mother, and cleave unto his woman: and they be one flesh. ‘al ya‘azab ’ish ’abiv ve’et ’imo, vedabaq be’ishto vehayu lebasar ’ekhad.
wyhyw Snyhm erwmym hadm waStw wla ytbSSw and they were both naked, the man and his woman, and were not ashamed. vayihyu shenehem ‘arumim ha’adam ve’ishto, velo yitboshashu.
whnxS hyh erwm mkl xyt hSdh aSr eSh yhwh alhym wyamr al haSh ap ky amr alhym la taklw mkl ez hgn now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these had made. and he said unto the woman, yea, hath to-no-these said, ye not eat of every tree of the garden? vehanakhash hayah ‘arum mikol khayat hasadeh ’asher ‘asah yhvh ’elohim, vayomer ’el ha’ishah ki ’amar ’elohim lo tokhelu mikol ‘ez hagan.
wtamr haSh al hnxS mpry ez hgn nakl and the woman said unto the serpent, we may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden: vatomer ha’ishah ’el hanakhash, miperi ‘ez hagan nokhel.
wmpry hez aSr btwk hgn amr alhym la taklw mmnw wla tgew bw pn tmtwn and of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, to-no-these hath said, ye not eat of it, neither ye touch it, lest ye die. umiperi ha‘ez ’asher betokh hagan ’amar ’elohim lo tokhelu mimenu velo tige‘u bo, pen temutun.
wyamr hnxS al haSh la mwt tmtwn and the serpent said unto the woman, ye not surely die: vayomer hanakhash ’el ha’ishah, lo mot temutun.
ky yde alhym ky bywm aklkm mmnw wnpqxw eynykm whyytm kalhym ydey Twb wre for to-no-these doth hand-know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes be opened, and ye be as to-no-these, knowing good and bad. ki yodea‘ ’elohim ki beyom ’akhalekhem mimenu venifqekhu ‘enekhem, vihyitem kelohim yode‘ei tob vara‘.
wtra haSh ky Twb hez lmakl wky tawh hwa leynym wnxmd hez lhSkyl wtqx mpryw wtakl wttn gm laySh emh wyakl and when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her man with her; and he did eat. vatere ha’ishah ki tob ha‘ez lema’akhal vekhi ta’avah hu la‘enayim venekhmad ha‘ez lehaskil vatiqakh mipiryo vatokhal, vatiten gam le’ishah ‘imah vayokhal.
wtpqxnh eyny Snyhm wydew ky eyrmm hm wytprw elh tanh wyeSw lhm xgrt and the eyes of them both were opened, and they hand-knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons. vatipaqakhnah ‘enei shenehem vayede‘u ki ‘erumim hem, vayitperu ‘aleh te’enah vaya‘asu lahem khagorot.
wySmew at qwl yhwh alhym mthlk bgn lrwx hywm wytxba hadm waStw mpny yhwh alhym btwk ez hgn and they heard the voice of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and adam-earth-blood-man and his woman hid themselves from the presence of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these amongst the trees of the garden. vayishme‘u qol yhvh ’elohim mithalekh bagan leruakh hayom, vayitkhabei ha’adam ve’ishto mipenei yhvh ’elohim betokh ‘ez hagan.
wyqra yhwh alhym al hadm wyamr lw aykh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these called unto adam-earth-blood-man, and said unto him, where art thou? vayiqra yhvh ’elohim ’el ha’adam, vayomer lo ’ayekah.
wyamr at qlk Smety bgn wayra ky eyrm anky waxba and he said, i heard thy voice in the garden, and i was afraid, because i was naked; and i hid myself. vayomer qolekha shama‘ti bagan, va’ira ki ‘erom ’anokhi va’ekhabe.
wyamr my hgyd lk ky eyrm ath hmn hez aSr zwytyk lblty akl mmnw aklt and he said, who told thee that thou wast naked? hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof i direct thee that thou shouldest not eat? vayomer mi higid lekha ki ‘erom ’atah, hamin ha‘ez ’asher zivitikha lebilti ’akhal mimenu ’akhaleta.
wyamr hadm haSh aSr ntth emdy hwa ntnh ly mn hez wakl and the man said, the woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and i did eat. vayomer ha’adam, ha’ishah ’asher natatah ‘imadi hi natenah li min ha‘ez va’okhel.
wyamr yhwh alhym laSh mh cat eSyt wtamr haSh hnxS hSyany wakl and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these said unto the woman, what is this that thou hast done? and the woman said, the serpent beguiled me, and i did eat. vayomer yhvh ’elohim la’ishah mah zot ‘asit, vatomer ha’ishah hanakhash hishi’ani va’okhel.
wyamr yhwh alhym al hnxS ky eSyt cat arwr ath mkl hbhmh wmkl xyt hSdh el gxnk tlk wepr takl kl ymy xyyk and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these said unto the serpent, because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all in-them-animal, and above every beast of the field; upon thy nurture-belly thou go, and dust thou eat all the days of thy life: vayomer yhvh ’elohim ’el hanakhash ki ‘asita zot ’arur ’atah mikal habehemah umikol khayat hasadeh, ‘al gekhonekha telekh ve‘afar tokhal kal yemei khayekha.
waybh aSyt bynk wbyn haSh wbyn crek wbyn creh hwa ySwpk raS wath tSwpnw eqb and i will put enmity between-bin thee and the woman, and between-bin thy seed and her seed; it bruise thy head, and thou bruise his heel-jacob-backstreet. ve’ebah ’ashit benekha uben ha’ishah uben zar‘akha uben zar‘ah, hu yeshufekha rosh ve’atah teshufenu ‘aqeb.
al haSh amr hrbh arbh ezbwnk whrnk bezb tldy bnym wal aySk tSwqtk whwa ymSl bk unto the woman he said, i will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou bring forth children-betweens; and thy desire be to thy man, and he rule over thee. ’el ha’ishah ’amar harbah ’arbeh ‘izebonekh veheronekh be‘ezeb teledi banim, ve’el ’ishekh teshuqatekh vehu yimshal bakh.
wladm amr ky Smet lqwl aStk wtakl mn hez aSr zwytyk lamr la takl mmnw arwrh hadmh bebwrk bezbwn taklnh kl ymy xyyk and unto adam-earth-blood-man he said, because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy woman, and hast eaten of the tree, of which i direct thee, saying, no eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in sorrow thou eat of it all the days of thy life; ule’adam ’amar ki shama‘ta leqol ’ishtekha vatokhal min ha‘ez ’asher zivitikha lemor lo tokhal mimenu, ’arurah ha’adamah ba‘aburekha be‘izabon tokhalenah kol yemei khayekha.
wqwz wdrdr tzmyx lk waklt at eSb hSdh thorns also and thistles it bring forth to thee; and thou eat the herb of the field; veqoz vedardar tazmiakh lakh, ve’akhalta ‘eseb hasadeh.
bcet apyk takl lxm ed Swbk al hadmh ky mmnh lqxt ky epr ath wal epr tSwb in the sweat of thy face-turns thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust thou return. beze‘at ’apekha tokhal lekhem ‘ad shubekha ’el ha’adamah ki mimenah luqakheta, ki ‘afar ’atah ve’el ‘afar tashub.
wyqra hadm Sm aStw xwh ky hwa hyth am kl xy and adam-earth-blood-man called his woman's name eve -biosphere; because she was the mother of all living. vayiqra ha’adam shem ’ishto khavah, ki hi hayetah ’em kal khay.
wyeS yhwh alhym ladm wlaStw ktnwt ewr wylbSm unto adam-earth-blood-man also and to his woman did yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these make you-wrote-coats of light-skins, and clothed them. vaya‘as yhvh ’elohim le’adam ule’ishto katenot ‘or vayalbishem.
wyamr yhwh alhym hn hadm hyh kaxd mmnw ldet Twb wre weth pn ySlx ydw wlqx gm mez hxyym wakl wxy lelm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these said, behold, the man is become as one of us, to hand-know good and bad: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever: vayomer yhvh ’elohim hen ha’adam hayah ke’akhad mimenu lada‘at tob vara‘, ve‘atah pen yishlakh yado velaqakh gam me‘ez hakhayim ve’akhal vakhay le‘olam.
wySlxhw yhwh alhym mgn edn lebd at hadmh aSr lqx mSm therefore yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these sent him forth from the garden of eden-eon, to till the ground from whence he was taken. vayshalekhehu yhvh ’elohim migan ‘eden, la‘abod ha’adamah ’asher luqakh.
wygrS at hadm wySkn mqdm lgn edn at hkrbym wat lhT hxrb hmthpkt lSmr at drk ez hxyym so he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of eden-eon inward-cherubims-multi-intern, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life. vaygaresh ha’adam, vayashken miqedem legan ‘eden hakerubim ve’et lahat hakhereb hamithapekhet lishmor derekh ‘ez hakhayim.
whadm yde at xwh aStw wthr wtld at qyn wtamr qnyty ayS at yhwh and adam-earth-blood-man hand-knew eve -biosphere his woman; and she climaxed-tahar, and conceived-of cain-cell, and said, i have gotten a man from yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. veha’adam yada‘ khavah ’ishto, vatahar vateled qayin vatomer qaniti ’ish ’et yhvh.
wtsp lldt at axyw at hbl wyhy hbl reh zan wqyn hyh ebd admh and she again conceived-of his brother abel-vapor. and abel-vapor was a keeper of sheep, and cain-cell was a tiller of the ground. vatosef laledet ’akhiv habel, vayhi hebel ro‘eh zon veqayin hayah ‘obed ’adamah.
wyhy mqz ymym wyba qyn mpry hadmh mnxh lyhwh and in process of time it came to pass, that cain-cell brought of the fruit of the ground an rest-absorber unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vayhi miqez yamim, vayabei qayin miperi ha’adamah minkhah yhvh.
whbl hbya gm hwa mbkrwt zanw wmxlbhn wySe yhwh al hbl wal mnxtw and abel-vapor, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had respect unto abel-vapor and to his rest-absorber: vehebel hebi gam hu mibekhorot zono umekhelbehen, vayisha‘ yhvh ’el hebel ve’el minkhato.
wal qyn wal mnxtw la Seh wyxr lqyn mad wyplw pnyw and unto cain-cell and to his rest-absorber he had not respect. and cain-cell was very wroth, and his countenance fell. ve’el qayin ve’el minkhato lo sha‘ah, vayikhar leqayin me’od vayipelu panav.
wyamr yhwh al qyn lmh xrh lk wlmh nplw pnyk and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto cain-cell, why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen? vayomer yhvh ’el qayin, lamah kharah lakh velamah nafelu fanekha.
hlwa am tyTyb Sat wam la tyTyb lptx xTat rbz walyk tSwqtw wath tmSl bw if thou doest well, thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, miss lieth at the opening. and unto thee be his desire, and thou rule over him. halo ’im tetib se’et ve’im lo tetib lapetakh khatat robez, ve’elekha teshuqato ve’atah timshal bo.
wyamr qyn al hbl axyw wyhy bhywtm bSdh wyqm qyn al hbl axyw wyhrghw and cain-cell talked with abel-vapor his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that cain-cell rose up against abel-vapor his brother, and slew him. vayomer qayin ’el hebel ’akhiv, vayhi bihyotam basadeh vayaqam qayin ’el hebel ’akhiv vayahargehu.
wyamr yhwh al qyn ay hbl axyk wyamr la ydety hSmr axy anky and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto cain-cell, where is abel-vapor thy brother? and he said, i hand-know not: am i my brother's keeper? vayomer yhvh ’el qayin ’ei hebel ’akhikha, vayomer lo yada‘ti hashomer ’akhi ’anokhi.
wyamr mh eSyt qwl dmy axyk zeqym aly mn hadmh and he said, what hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground. vayomer meh ‘asita, qol demei ’akhikha zo‘aqim ’elay min ha’adamah.
weth arwr ath mn hadmh aSr pzth at pyh lqxt at dmy axyk mydk and now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand; ve‘atah ’arur ’atah, min ha’adamah ’asher pazetah piha laqakhat demei ’akhikha miyadekha.
ky tebd at hadmh la tsp tt kxh lk ne wnd thyh barz when thou tillest the ground, it not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond thou be in the earth. ki ta‘abod ha’adamah lo tosef tet kokhah lakh, na‘ vanad tihyeh ba’arez.
wyamr qyn al yhwh gdwl ewny mnSa and cain-cell said unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, my punishment is greater than i can bear. vayomer qayin ’el yhvh, gadol ‘avoni mineso.
hn grSt aty hywm mel pny hadmh wmpnyk astr whyyty ne wnd barz whyh kl mzay yhrgny behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face-turns of the earth; and from thy face-turns i be hid; and i be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it come to pass, that every one that findeth me slay me. hen gerashta ’oti hayom me‘al penei ha’adamah umipanekha ’esater, vehayiti na‘ vanad ba’arez vehayah khal moze’i yahargeni.
wyamr lw yhwh lkn kl hrg qyn Sbetym yqm wySm yhwh lqyn awt lblty hkwt atw kl mzaw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto him, therefore whosoever slayeth cain-cell, vengeance be taken on him sevenfold. and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah set a mark upon cain-cell, lest any finding him should kill him. vayomer lo yhvh lakhen kal horeg qayin shib‘atayim yuqam, vayasem yhvh leqayin ’ot lebilti hakot ’oto kal moze’o.
wyza qyn mlpny yhwh wySb barz nwd qdmt edn and cain-cell went out from the presence of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and dwelt in the land of nodi-nomadic, on the east of eden-eon. vayezei qayin milifnei yhvh, vayesheb be’erez nod qidmat ‘eden.
wyde qyn at aStw wthr wtld at xnwk wyhy bnh eyr wyqra Sm heyr kSm bnw xnwk and cain-cell hand-knew his woman; and she conceived, and conceived-of enoch-teach: and he between-between-builded a light-city, and called the name of the light-city, after the name of his child-between, enoch-teach. vayeda‘ qayin ’ishto vatahar vateled khanokh, vayhi boneh ‘ir vayiqra shem ha‘ir keshem beno khanokh.
wywld lxnwk at eyrd weyrd yld at mxwyal wmxyyal yld at mtwSal wmtwSal yld at lmk and unto enoch-teach was born irad-descend-bronze: and irad-descend-bronze begat towards-from-live: and towards-from-live begat towards-weakening: and towards-weakening begat lamech-fool. vayivaled lakhanokh ‘irad ve‘irad yalad mekhuya’el, umekhiya’el yalad metusha’el umetusha’el yalad lamekh.
wyqx lw lmk Sty nSym Sm haxt edh wSm hSnyt zlh and lamech-fool took unto him two women: the name of the one was adah-witness, and the name of the other zillah-shadow. vayiqakh lo lemekh shetei nashim, shem ha’akhat ‘adah veshem hashenit zilah.
wtld edh at ybl hwa hyh aby ySb ahl wmqnh and adah-witness conceived-of jabal-spend-time: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have in-them-animal. vateled ‘adah yabal, hu hayah ’abi yosheb ’ohel umiqneh.
wSm axyw ywbl hwa hyh aby kl tpS knwr wewgb and his brother's name was jubal-river: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ. veshem ’akhiv yubal, hu hayah ’abi kal tofes kinor ve‘ugab.
wzlh gm hwa yldh at twbl qyn lTS kl xrS nxSt wbrcl waxwt twbl qyn nemh and zillah-shadow, she also conceived-of tubal-worldcain-seasoned-cell, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of tubal-worldcain-seasoned-cell was naamah-pleasant. vezilah gam hi yaledah qayin lotesh kal khoresh nekhoshet ubarzel, va’akhot tubal qayin na‘amah.
wyamr lmk lnSyw edh wzlh Smen qwly nSy lmk hacnh amrty ky ayS hrgty lpzey wyld lxbrty and lamech-fool said unto his women, adah-witness and zillah-shadow, hear my voice; ye women of lamech-fool, hearken unto my speech: for i have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt. vayomer lemekh lenashav ‘adah vezilah shema‘an qoli neshei lemekh ha’zenah ’imrati, ki ’ish haragti lefiz‘i veyeled lekhaburati.
ky Sbetym yqm qyn wlmk Sbeym wSbeh if cain-cell be avenged sevenfold, truly lamech-fool seventy and sevenfold. ki shib‘atayim yuqam qayin, velemekh shib‘im veshib‘ah.
wyde adm ewd at aStw wtld bn wtqra at Smw St ky St ly alhym cre axr txt hbl ky hrgw qyn and adam-earth-blood-man hand-knew his woman again; and she conceived-of a child-between, and called his name seth-set: for to-no-these, said she, hath set me up with another seed instead of abel-vapor, whom cain-cell slew. vayeda‘ ’adam ‘od ’ishto vateled ben vatiqra shemo shet, ki shat li ’elohim zera‘ ’akher takhat hebel ki harago qayin.
wlSt gm hwa yld bn wyqra at Smw anwS ac hwxl lqra bSm yhwh and to seth-set, to him also there was born a child-between; and he called his name enos-man: then began men to call upon the name of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. uleshet gam hu yulad ben vayiqra shemo ’enosh, ’az hukhal liqro beshem yhvh.
ch spr twldt adm bywm bra alhym adm bdmwt alhym eSh atw this is the book of the generations of adam-earth-blood-man. in the day that to-no-these created man, in the likeness of to-no-these made he him; zeh sefer toldot ’adam, beyom bero ’elohim ’adam bidmut ’elohim ‘asah ’oto.
ckr wnqbh bram wybrk atm wyqra at Smm adm bywm hbram rememberer and pierced created he them; and knee-fluffy-blessed them, and called their name adam-earth-blood-man, in the day when they were created. zakhar uneqebah bera’am, vaybarekh ’otam vayiqra shemam ’adam beyom hibare’am.
wyxy adm SlSym wmat Snh wywld bdmwtw kzlmw wyqra at Smw St and adam-earth-blood-man lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a child-between in his own likeness, and after his image; and called his name seth-set: vaykhi ’adam sheloshim ume’at shanah vayoled bidmuto kezalmo, vayiqra shemo shet.
wyhyw ymy adm axry hwlydw at St Smnh mat Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and the days of adam-earth-blood-man after he had begotten seth-set were eight hundred years: and he begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vayihyu yeme ’adam ’akharei holido shet shemoneh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhyw kl ymy adm aSr xy tSe mawt Snh wSlSym Snh wymt and all the days that adam-earth-blood-man lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died. vayihyu kal yemei ’adam ’asher khay tesha‘ me’ot shanah usheloshim shanah, vayamot.
wyxy St xmS Snym wmat Snh wywld at anwS and seth-set lived an hundred and five years, and begat enos-man: vaykhi shet khamesh shanim ume’at shanah, vayoled ’enosh.
wyxy St axry hwlydw at anwS Sbe Snym wSmnh mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and seth-set lived after he begat enos-man eight hundred and seven years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vaykhi shet ’akharei holido ’enosh sheba‘ shanim ushemoneh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhyw kl ymy St Stym eSrh Snh wtSe mawt Snh wymt and all the days of seth-set were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died. vayihyu kal yeme shet shetem ‘esreh shanah utesha‘ me’ot shanah, vayamot.
wyxy anwS tSeym Snh wywld at qynn and enos-man lived ninety years, and begat cain-cellan: vaykhi ’enosh tish‘im shanah, vayoled qenan.
wyxy anwS axry hwlydw at qynn xmS eSrh Snh wSmnh mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and enos-man lived after he begat cain-cellan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vaykhi ’enosh ’akharei holido qenan khamesh ‘esreh shanah ushemoneh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhyw kl ymy anwS xmS Snym wtSe mawt Snh wymt and all the days of enos-man were nine hundred and five years: and he died. vayihyu kal yemei ’enosh khamesh shanim utesha‘ me’ot shanah, vayamot.
wyxy qynn Sbeym Snh wywld at mhllal and cain-cellan lived seventy years and begat mahalaleel-praise-towards: vaykhi qenan shib‘im shanah, vayoled mahalal’el.
wyxy qynn axry hwlydw at mhllal arbeym Snh wSmnh mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and cain-cellan lived after he begat mahalaleel-praise-towards eight hundred and forty years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vaykhi qenan ’akharei holido mahalal’el ’arba‘im shanah ushemoneh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhyw kl ymy qynn eSr Snym wtSe mawt Snh wymt and all the days of cain-cellan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died. vayihyu kal yemei qenan ‘eser shanim utesha‘ me’ot shanah, vayamot.
wyxy mhllal xmS Snym wSSym Snh wywld at yrd and mahalaleel-praise-towards lived sixty and five years, and begat jared-come-down: vaykhi mahalal’el khamesh shanim veshishim shanah, vayoled yared.
wyxy mhllal axry hwlydw at yrd SlSym Snh wSmnh mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and mahalaleel-praise-towards lived after he begat jared-come-down eight hundred and thirty years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vaykhi mahalal’el ’akharei holido yered sheloshim shanah ushemoneh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhyw kl ymy mhllal xmS wtSeym Snh wSmnh mawt Snh wymt and all the days of mahalaleel-praise-towards were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died. vayihyu kal yemei mahalal’el khamesh vetish‘im shanah ushemoneh me’ot shanah, vayamot.
wyxy yrd Stym wSSym Snh wmat Snh wywld at xnwk and jared-come-down lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat enoch-teach: vaykhi yered shetayim veshishim shanah ume’at shanah, vayoled khanokh.
wyxy yrd axry hwlydw at xnwk Smnh mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and jared-come-down lived after he begat enoch-teach eight hundred years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vaykhi yered ’akharei holido khanokh shemoneh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhyw kl ymy yrd Stym wSSym Snh wtSe mawt Snh wymt and all the days of jared-come-down were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died. vayihyu kal yeme yered shetayim veshishim shanah utesha‘ me’ot shanah, vayamot.
wyxy xnwk xmS wSSym Snh wywld at mtwSlx and enoch-teach lived sixty and five years, and begat methuselah-death-brings: vaykhi khanokh khamesh veshishim shanah, vayoled metushalakh.
wythlk xnwk at halhym axry hwlydw at mtwSlx SlS mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and enoch-teach walked with to-no-these after he begat methuselah-death-brings three hundred years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vayithalekh khanokh ’et ha’elohim ’akharei holido metushelakh shelosh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhy kl ymy xnwk xmS wSSym Snh wSlS mawt Snh and all the days of enoch-teach were three hundred sixty and five years: vayhi kal yemei khanokh, khamesh veshishim shanah ushelosh me’ot shanah.
wythlk xnwk at halhym waynnw ky lqx atw alhym and enoch-teach walked with to-no-these: and he was not; for to-no-these took him. vayithalekh khanokh ’et ha’elohim, ve’enenu ki laqakh ’oto ’elohim.
wyxy mtwSlx Sbe wSmnym Snh wmat Snh wywld at lmk and methuselah-death-brings lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat lamech-fool. vaykhi metushelakh sheba‘ ushemonim shanah ume’at shanah, vayoled lamekh.
wyxy mtwSlx axry hwlydw at lmk Stym wSmwnym Snh wSbe mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and methuselah-death-brings lived after he begat lamech-fool seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vaykhi metushelakh ’akharei holido lemekh shetayim ushemonim shanah usheba‘ me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhyw kl ymy mtwSlx tSe wSSym Snh wtSe mawt Snh wymt and all the days of methuselah-death-brings were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died. vayihyu kal yemei metushelakh tesha‘ veshishim shanah utesha‘ me’ot shanah, vayamot.
wyxy lmk Stym wSmnym Snh wmat Snh wywld bn and lamech-fool lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a child-between: vaykhi lemekh shetayim ushemonim shanah ume’at shanah, vayoled ben.
wyqra at Smw nx lamr ch ynxmnw mmeSnw wmezbwn ydynw mn hadmh aSr arrh yhwh and he called his name noah-rest, saying, this same rest us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath cursed. vayiqra shemo noakh lemor, zeh yenakhamenu mima‘asenu ume‘izebon yadenu min ha’adamah ’asher ’ererah yhvh.
wyxy lmk axry hwlydw at nx xmS wtSeym Snh wxmS mat Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and lamech-fool lived after he begat noah-rest five hundred ninety and five years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss: vaykhi lemekh ’akharei holido noakh khamesh vetish‘im shanah vakhamesh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyhy kl ymy lmk Sbe wSbeym Snh wSbe mawt Snh wymt and all the days of lamech-fool were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died. vayhi kal yeme lemekh sheba‘ veshib‘im shanah usheba‘ me’ot shanah, vayamot.
wyhy nx bn xmS mawt Snh wywld nx at Sm at xm wat ypt and noah-rest was five hundred years old: and noah-rest begat shem-name, ham-hot, and japheth-beautiful. vayhi noakh ben khamesh me’ot shanah, vayoled noakh shem kham ve’et yafet.
wyhy ky hxl hadm lrb el pny hadmh wbnwt yldw lhm and it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face-turns of the earth, and children-betweenesss were born unto them, vayhi ki hekhel ha’adam larob ‘al penei ha’adamah, ubanot yuledu lahem.
wyraw bny halhym at bnwt hadm ky Tbt hnh wyqxw lhm nSym mkl aSr bxrw that the he children-betweens of to-no-these saw the she children-betweens of men that they were fair; and they took them women of all which they chose. vayir’u bene ha’elohim benot ha’adam ki tobot henah, vayiqkhu lahem nashim mikol ’asher bakharu.
wyamr yhwh la ydwn rwxy badm lelm bSgm hwa bSr whyw ymyw mah weSrym Snh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said, my breath-spirit not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days be an hundred and double-ten-twenty years. vayomer yhvh lo yadon rukhi ba’adam le‘olam beshagam hu basar, vehayu yamav me’ah ve‘esrim shanah.
hnplym hyw barz bymym hhm wgm axry kn aSr ybaw bny halhym al bnwt hadm wyldw lhm hmh hgbrym aSr mewlm anSy hSm there were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when children-betweens of to-no-these came in unto children-betweenesss of men, and they conceived-of children-betweens to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown. hanefilim hayu ba’arez bayamim hahem vegam ’akhare khen ’asher yabo’u benei ha’elohim ’el benot ha’adam veyaledu lahem, hemah hagiborim ’asher me‘olam ’anshei hashem.
wyra yhwh ky rbh ret hadm barz wkl yzr mxSbt lbw rq re kl hywm and to-no-these saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only bad continually. vayar yhvh ki rabah ra‘at ha’adam ba’arez, vekhal yezer makhshebot libo raq ra‘ kal hayom.
wynxm yhwh ky eSh at hadm barz wytezb al lbw and it repented yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart. vayinakhem yhvh ki ‘asah ha’adam ba’arez, vayit‘azeb ’el libo.
wyamr yhwh amxh at hadm aSr braty mel pny hadmh madm ed bhmh ed rmS wed ewp hSmym ky nxmty ky eSytm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said, i will destroy man whom i have created from the face-turns of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the ai-islandr; for it repenteth me that i have made them. vayomer yhvh ’emkheh ha’adam ’asher barati me‘al penei ha’adamah me’adam ‘ad behemah ‘ad remes ve‘ad ‘of hashamayim, ki nikhamti ki ‘asitim.
wnx mza xn beyny yhwh and noah-rest found attractiveness in the eyes of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. venoakh maza khen be‘enei yhvh.
alh twldt nx nx ayS zdyq tmym hyh bdrtyw at halhym hthlk nx these are the generations of noah-rest: noah-rest was a just man and perfect in his generations, and noah-rest walked with to-no-these. ’eleh toldot noakh noakh ’ish zadiq tamim hayah bedorotav, ’et ha’elohim hithalekh noakh.
wywld nx SlSh bnym at Sm at xm wat ypt and noah-rest begat three children-betweens, shem-name, ham-hot, and japheth-beautiful. vayoled noakh sheloshah banim, shem kham ve’et yafet.
wtSxt harz lpny halhym wtmla harz xms the earth also was corrupt before-turns to-no-these, and the earth was filled with violence. vatishakhet ha’arez lifnei ha’elohim, vatimalei ha’arez khamas.
wyra alhym at harz whnh nSxth ky hSxyt kl bSr at drkw el harz and to-no-these looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth. vayar ’elohim ha’arez vehineh nishkhatah, ki hishkhit kal basar darko ‘al ha’arez.
wyamr alhym lnx qz kl bSr ba lpny ky mlah harz xms mpnyhm whnny mSxytm at harz and to-no-these said unto noah-rest, the end of all flesh is come before-turns me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, i will destroy them with the earth. vayomer ’elohim lenoakh qez kal basar ba lefanay ki male’ah ha’arez khamas mipenehem, vehini mashkhitam ’et ha’arez.
eSh lk tbt ezy gpr qnym teSh at htbh wkprt ath mbyt wmxwz bkpr make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms thou make in the ark, and pitch it within and without with pitch. ‘aseh lekha tebat ‘aze gofer qinim ta‘aseh ’et hatebah, vekhafarta ’otah mibayit umikhuz bakofer.
wch aSr teSh ath SlS mawt amh ark htbh xmSym amh rxbh wSlSym amh qwmth and this is the fashion which thou make it of: the length of the ark be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits. vezeh ’asher ta‘aseh ’otah, shelosh me’ot ’amah ’orekh hatebah khamishim ’amah rakhebah usheloshim ’amah qomatah.
zhr teSh ltbh wal amh tklnh mlmelh wptx htbh bzdh tSym txtym Snym wSlSym teSh a window thou make to the ark, and in a cubit thou finish it above; and the opening of the ark thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories thou make it. zohar ta‘aseh latebah ve’el ’amah tekhalenah milma‘lah ufetakh hatebah bezidah tasim, takhtiyim sheniyim ushelishim ta‘aseha.
wany hnny mbya at hmbwl mym el harz lSxt kl bSr aSr bw rwx xyym mtxt hSmym kl aSr barz ygwe and, behold, i, even i, do bring a flood of from-waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under namespaces; and every thing that is in the earth die. va’ani hini mebi hamabul mayim ‘al ha’arez leshakhet kal basar ’asher bo ruakh khayim mitakhat hashamayim, kol ’asher ba’arez yigva‘.
whqmty at bryty atk wbat al htbh ath wbnyk waStk wnSy bnyk atk and with thee will i establish my covenant; and thou come into the ark, thou, and thy children-betweens, and thy woman, and thy children-betweens' women with thee. vahaqimoti beriti ’itakh, ubata ’el hatebah ’atah ubanekha ve’ishtekha uneshe banekha ’itakh.
wmkl hxy mkl bSr Snym mkl tbya al htbh lhxyt atk ckr wnqbh yhyw and of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they be rememberer and pierced. umikal hakhay mikal basar shenayim mikol tabi ’el hatebah lehakhayot ’itakh, zakhar uneqebah yihyu.
mhewp lmynhw wmn hbhmh lmynh mkl rmS hadmh lmynhw Snym mkl ybaw alyk lhxywt of fowls after their kind, and of in-them-animal after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort come unto thee, to keep them alive. meha‘of leminehu umin habehemah leminah mikol remes ha’adamah leminehu, shenayim mikol yabo’u ’elekha lehakhayot.
wath qx lk mkl makl aSr yakl waspt alyk whyh lk wlhm laklh and take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou gather it to thee; and it be for food for thee, and for them. ve’atah qakh lekha mikal ma’akhal ’asher ye’akhel ve’asafta ’elekha, vehayah lekha velahem le’akhlah
wyeS nx kkl aSr zwh atw alhym kn eSh thus did noah-rest; according to all that to-no-these direct him, so did he. vaya‘as noakh, kekhol ’asher zivah ’oto ’elohim ken ‘asah.
wyamr yhwh lnx ba ath wkl bytk al htbh ky atk rayty zdyq lpny bdwr hch and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto noah-rest, come thou and all thy daughter-house into the ark; for thee have i seen just before-turns me in this generation. vayomer yhvh lenoakh bo ’atah vekhal betekha ’el hatebah, ki ’otekha ra’iti zadiq lefanay bador hazeh.
mkl hbhmh hThwrh tqx lk Sbeh Sbeh ayS waStw wmn hbhmh aSr la Thrh hwa Snym ayS waStw of every bright-climaxing beast thou take to thee by sevens, the rememberer and his pierced: and of beasts that are not bright-climaxing by two, the rememberer and his pierced. mikol habehemah hatehorah tiqakh lekha shib‘ah shib‘ah ’ish ve’ishto, umin habehemah ’asher lo tehorah hi shenayim ’ish ve’ishto.
gm mewp hSmym Sbeh Sbeh ckr wnqbh lxywt cre el pny kl harz of fowls also of the ai-islandr by sevens, the rememberer and the pierced; to keep seed alive upon the face-turns of all the earth. gam me‘of hashamayim shib‘ah shib‘ah zakhar uneqebah, lekhayot zera‘ ‘al penei khal ha’arez.
ky lymym ewd Sbeh anky mmTyr el harz arbeym ywm warbeym lylh wmxyty at kl hyqwm aSr eSyty mel pny hadmh for yet seven days, and i will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that i have made will i destroy from off the face-turns of the earth. ki leyamim ‘od shib‘ah ’anokhi mamtir ‘al ha’arez ’arba‘im yom ve’arba‘im layelah, umakhiti kal hayqum ’asher ‘asiti me‘al penei ha’adamah.
wyeS nx kkl aSr zwhw yhwh and noah-rest did according unto all that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah direct him. vaya‘as noakh, kekhol ’asher zivahu yhvh.
wnx bn SS mawt Snh whmbwl hyh mym el harz and noah-rest was six hundred years old when the flood of from-waters was upon the earth. venoakh ben shesh me’ot shanah, vehamabul hayah mayim ‘al ha’arez.
wyba nx wbnyw waStw wnSy bnyw atw al htbh mpny my hmbwl and noah-rest went in, and his children-betweens, and his woman, and his children-betweens' women with him, into the ark, because of the from-waters of the flood. vayabo noakh ubanav ve’ishto uneshe banav ’ito ’el hatebah, mipenei mei hamabul.
mn hbhmh hThwrh wmn hbhmh aSr aynnh Thrh wmn hewp wkl aSr rmS el hadmh of bright-climaxing beasts, and of beasts that are not bright-climaxing, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth, min habehemah hatehorah umin habehemah ’asher ’enenah tehorah, umin ha‘of vekhol ’asher romes ‘al ha’adamah.
Snym Snym baw al nx al htbh ckr wnqbh kaSr zwh alhym at nx there went in two and two unto noah-rest into the ark, the rememberer and the pierced, as to-no-these had direct noah-rest. shenayim shenayim ba’u ’el noakh ’el hatebah zakhar uneqebah, ka’asher zivah ’elohim noakh.
wyhy lSbet hymym wmy hmbwl hyw el harz and it came to pass after seven days, that the from-waters of the flood were upon the earth. vayhi leshib‘at hayamim, umei hamabul hayu ‘al ha’arez.
bSnt SS mawt Snh lxyy nx bxdS hSny bSbeh eSr ywm lxdS bywm hch nbqew kl meynt thwm rbh warbt hSmym nptxw in the six hundredth year of noah-rest's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of namespaces were opened. bishnat shesh me’ot shanah lekhaye noakh bakhodesh hasheni beshib‘ah ‘asar yom lakhodesh, bayom hazeh nibqe‘u kal ma‘yenot tehom rabah va’arubot hashamayim niftakhu.
wyhy hgSm el harz arbeym ywm warbeym lylh and the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights. vayhi hageshem ‘al ha’arez, ’arba‘im yom ve’arba‘im layelah.
bezm hywm hch ba nx wSm wxm wypt bny nx waSt nx wSlSt nSy bnyw atm al htbh in the selfsame day entered noah-rest, and shem-name, and ham-hot, and japheth-beautiful, children-betweens of noah-rest, and noah-rest's woman, and the three women of his children-betweens with them, into the ark; be‘ezem hayom hazeh ba noakh veshem vekham vayefet bene noakh, ve’eshet noakh usheloshet neshe banav ’itam ’el hatebah.
hmh wkl hxyh lmynh wkl hbhmh lmynh wkl hrmS hrmS el harz lmynhw wkl hewp lmynhw kl zpwr kl knp they, and every beast after his kind, and all the in-them-animal after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort. hemah vekhal hakhayah leminah vekhal habehemah leminah vekhal haremes haromes ‘al ha’arez leminehu, vekhal ha‘of leminehu kol zipor kal kanaf.
wybaw al nx al htbh Snym Snym mkl hbSr aSr bw rwx xyym and they went in unto noah-rest into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein is the breath of life. vayabo’u ’el noakh ’el hatebah, shenayim shenayim mikal habasar bo ruakh khayim.
whbaym ckr wnqbh mkl bSr baw kaSr zwh atw alhym wysgr yhwh bedw and they that went in, went in rememberer and pierced of all flesh, as to-no-these had direct him: and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah shut him in. vehaba’im zakhar uneqebah mikal basar ba’u ka’asher zivah ’oto ’elohim, vayisgor yhvh ba‘ado.
wyhy hmbwl arbeym ywm el harz wyrbw hmym wySaw at htbh wtrm mel harz and the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the from-waters increased, and conceived-of up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth. vayhi hamabul ’arba‘im yom ‘al ha’arez, vayirbu hamayim vayis’u hatebah vataram me‘al ha’arez.
wygbrw hmym wyrbw mad el harz wtlk htbh el pny hmym and the from-waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face-turns of the from-waters. vayigberu hamayim vayirbu me’od ‘al ha’arez, vatelekh hatebah ‘al penei hamayim.
whmym gbrw mad mad el harz wyksw kl hhrym hgbhym aSr txt kl hSmym and the from-waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that were under the whole namespaces, were covered. vehamayim gaberu me’od me’od ‘al ha’arez, vaykhusu kal heharim hagebohim ’asher takhat kal hashamayim.
xmS eSrh amh mlmelh gbrw hmym wyksw hhrym fifteen cubits upward did the from-waters prevail; and the mountains were covered. khamesh ‘esreh ’amah milma‘lah gaberu hamayim, vaykhusu heharim.
wygwe kl bSr hrmS el harz bewp wbbhmh wbxyh wbkl hSrz hSrz el harz wkl hadm and all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of in-them-animal, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man: vayigva‘ kal basar haromes ‘al ha’arez ba‘of ubabehemah ubakhayah ubekhal hasherez hashorez ‘al ha’arez, vekhol ha’adam.
kl aSr nSmt rwx xyym bapyw mkl aSr bxrbh mtw all in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was in the dry land, died. kol ’asher nishmat ruakh khayim be’apav mikol ’asher bekharabah metu.
wymx at kl hyqwm aSr el pny hadmh madm ed bhmh ed rmS wed ewp hSmym wymxw mn harz wySar ak nx waSr atw btbh and every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face-turns of the ground, both man, and in-them-animal, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the namespaces; and they were destroyed from the earth: and noah-rest only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark. vayimakh kal hayqum ’asher ‘al penei ha’adamah me’adam ‘ad behemah ‘ad remes ve‘ad ‘of hashamayim vayimakhu min ha’arez, vayisha’er ’akh noakh va’asher ’ito batebah.
wygbrw hmym el harz xmSym wmat ywm and the from-waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days. vayigberu hamayim ‘al ha’arez, khamishim ume’at yom.
wyckr alhym at nx wat kl hxyh wat kl hbhmh aSr atw btbh wyebr alhym rwx el harz wySkw hmym and to-no-these remembered noah-rest, and every living thing, and all the in-them-animal that was with him in the ark: and to-no-these made a wind to pass over the earth, and the from-waters assuaged; vayizkor ’elohim noakh ve’et kal hakhayah ve’et kal habehemah ’asher ’ito batebah, vaya‘aber ’elohim ruakh ‘al ha’arez vayashoku hamayim.
wyskrw meynt thwm warbt hSmym wykla hgSm mn hSmym the fountains also of the deep and the windows of namespaces were stopped, and the rain from namespaces was restrained; vayisakheru ma‘yenot tehom va’arubot hashamayim, vayikalei hageshem min hashamayim.
wySbw hmym mel harz hlwk wSwb wyxsrw hmym mqzh xmSym wmat ywm and the from-waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the from-waters were abated. vayashubu hamayim me‘al ha’arez halokh vashob, vayakhseru hamayim miqzeh khamishim ume’at yom.
wtnx htbh bxdS hSbyey bSbeh eSr ywm lxdS el hry arrT and the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of ararat-appeal. vatanakh hatebah bakhodesh hashebi‘i beshib‘ah ‘asar yom lakhodesh, ‘al harei ’ararat.
whmym hyw hlwk wxswr ed hxdS heSyry beSyry baxd lxdS nraw raSy hhrym and the from-waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen. vehamayim hayu halokh vekhasor ‘ad hakhodesh ha‘asiri, ba‘asiri be’ekhad lakhodesh nir’u rashei heharim.
wyhy mqz arbeym ywm wyptx nx at xlwn htbh aSr eSh and it came to pass at the end of forty days, that noah-rest opened the window of the ark which he had made: vayhi miqez ’arba‘im yom, vayiftakh noakh khalon hatebah ’asher ‘asah.
wySlx at herb wyza yzwa wSwb ed ybSt hmym mel harz and he sent forth a evening-raven, which went forth to and fro, until the from-waters were dried up from off the earth. vayshalakh ha‘oreb, vayezei yazo vashob ‘ad yeboshet hamayim me‘al ha’arez.
wySlx at hywnh matw lrawt hqlw hmym mel pny hadmh also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the from-waters were abated from off the face-turns of the ground; vayshalakh hayonah me’ito, lir’ot haqalu hamayim me‘al penei ha’adamah.
wla mzah hywnh mnwx lkp rglh wtSb alyw al htbh ky mym el pny kl harz wySlx ydw wyqxh wyba ath alyw al htbh and the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the from-waters were on the face-turns of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark. velo maze’ah hayonah manoakh lekhaf raglah vatashab ’elav ’el hatebah ki mayim ‘al penei khal ha’arez, vayishlakh yado vayiqakheha vayabei ’otah ’elav ’el hatebah.
wyxl ewd Sbet ymym axrym wysp Slx at hywnh mn htbh and he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark; vayakhel ‘od shib‘at yamim ’akherim, vayosef shalakh hayonah min hatebah.
wtba alyw hywnh let erb whnh elh cyt Trp bpyh wyde nx ky qlw hmym mel harz and the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off: so noah-rest hand-knew that the from-waters were abated from off the earth. vatabo ’elav hayonah le‘et ‘ereb vehineh ‘aleh zayit taraf befiha, vayeda‘ noakh ki qalu hamayim me‘al ha’arez.
wyyxl ewd Sbet ymym axrym wySlx at hywnh wla ysph Swb alyw ewd and he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more. vayiyakhel ‘od shib‘at yamim ’akherim, vayshalakh hayonah velo yasefah shub ’elav ‘od.
wyhy baxt wSS mawt Snh braSwn baxd lxdS xrbw hmym mel harz wysr nx at mksh htbh wyra whnh xrbw pny hadmh and it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the from-waters were dried up from off the earth: and noah-rest removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face-turns of the ground was dry. vayhi be’akhat veshesh me’ot shanah barishon be’ekhad lakhodesh kharebu hamayim me‘al ha’arez, vayasar noakh mikhseh hatebah vayar vehineh kharebu penei ha’adamah.
wbxdS hSny bSbeh weSrym ywm lxdS ybSh harz and in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried. ubakhodesh hasheni beshib‘ah ve‘esrim yom lakhodesh, yabeshah ha’arez.
wydbr alhym al nx lamr and to-no-these spake unto noah-rest, saying, vaydaber ’elohim ’el noakh lemor.
za mn htbh ath waStk wbnyk wnSy bnyk atk go forth of the ark, thou, and thy woman, and thy children-betweens, and thy children-betweens' women with thee. zei min hatebah, ’atah ve’ishtekha ubanekha uneshe banekha ’itakh.
kl hxyh aSr atk mkl bSr bewp wbbhmh wbkl hrmS hrmS el harz hwza hyza atk wSrzw barz wprw wrbw el harz bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl, and of in-them-animal, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth. kal hakhayah ’asher ’itekha mikal basar ba‘of ubabehemah ubekhal haremes haromes ‘al ha’arez hayzei ’itakh, vesharezu ba’arez ufaru verabu ‘al ha’arez.
wyza nx wbnyw waStw wnSy bnyw atw and noah-rest went forth, and his children-betweens, and his woman, and his children-betweens' women with him: vayeze noakh, ubanav ve’ishto uneshe banav ’ito.
kl hxyh kl hrmS wkl hewp kl rwmS el harz lmSpxtyhm yzaw mn htbh every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark. kal hakhayah kal haremes vekhal ha‘of kol romes ‘al ha’arez, lemishpekhotehem yaze’u min hatebah.
wybn nx mcbx lyhwh wyqx mkl hbhmh hThwrh wmkl hewp hThr wyel elt bmcbx and noah-rest between-between-builded an butcher-kitchen unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah; and took of every bright-climaxing beast, and of every bright-climaxing fowl, and rose on-ups on the butcher-kitchen. vayiben noakh mizbeakh yhvh, vayiqakh mikol habehemah hatehorah umikol ha‘of hatahor vaya‘al ‘olot bamizbeakh.
wyrx yhwh at ryx hnyxx wyamr yhwh al lbw la asp lqll ewd at hadmh bebwr hadm ky yzr lb hadm re mneryw wla asp ewd lhkwt at kl xy kaSr eSyty and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah smelled a smell fragrance; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said in his heart, i will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is bad from his youth; neither will i again hit any more every thing living, as i have done. vayarakh yhvh reakh hanikhoakh vayomer yhvh ’el libo lo ’osif leqalel ‘od ha’adamah ba‘abur ha’adam ki yezer leb ha’adam ra‘ mine‘urav, velo ’osif ‘od lehakot kal khay ka’asher ‘asiti.
ed kl ymy harz cre wqzyr wqr wxm wqyz wxrp wywm wlylh la ySbtw while the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night not cease. ‘od kal yemei ha’arez, zera‘ veqazir veqor vakhom veqayiz vakhoref veyom valaylah lo yishbotu.
wybrk alhym at nx wat bnyw wyamr lhm prw wrbw wmlaw at harz and to-no-these knee-fluffy-blessed noah-rest and his children-betweens, and said unto them, be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth. vaybarekh ’elohim noakh ve’et banav, vayomer lahem peru urebu umil’u ha’arez.
wmwrakm wxtkm yhyh el kl xyt harz wel kl ewp hSmym bkl aSr trmS hadmh wbkl dgy hym bydkm ntnw and the fear of you and the dread of you be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the ai-islandr, upon all that moveth upon the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered. umora’akhem vekhitekhem yihyeh ‘al kal khayat ha’arez ve‘al kal ‘of hashamayim, bekhol ’asher tirmos ha’adamah ubekhal degei hayam beyedkhem nitanu.
kl rmS aSr hwa xy lkm yhyh laklh kyrq eSb ntty lkm at kl every moving thing that liveth be meat for you; even as the green herb have i given you all things. kal remes ’asher hu khay lakhem yihyeh le’akhlah keyereq ‘eseb natati lakhem kol.
ak bSr bnpSw dmw la taklw and flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, ye not eat. ’akh basar benafsho damo lo tokhelu.
wak at dmkm lnpStykm adrS myd kl xyh adrSnw wmyd hadm myd ayS axyw adrS at npS hadm and surely your blood of your lives will i require; at the hand of every beast will i require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man's brother will i require the life of man. ve’akh dimkhem lenafshotekhem ’edrosh miyad kal khayah ’edreshenu, umiyad ha’adam miyad ’ish ’akhiv ’edrosh nefesh ha’adam.
Spk dm hadm badm dmw ySpk ky bzlm alhym eSh at hadm whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man his blood be shed: for in the image of to-no-these made he man. shofekh dam ha’adam ba’adam damo yishafekh, ki bezelem ’elohim ‘asah ha’adam.
watm prw wrbw Srzw barz wrbw bh and you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein. ve’atem peru urebu, shirzu ba’arez urebu bah.
wyamr alhym al nx wal bnyw atw lamr and to-no-these spake unto noah-rest, and to his children-betweens with him, saying, vayomer ’elohim ’el noakh ve’el banav ’ito lemor.
wany hnny mqym at bryty atkm wat crekm axrykm and i, behold, i establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you; va’ani hini meqim beriti ’itekhem, ve’et zar‘akhem ’akharekhem.
wat kl npS hxyh aSr atkm bewp bbhmh wbkl xyt harz atkm mkl yzay htbh lkl xyt harz and with every living creature that is with you, of the fowl, of the in-them-animal, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth. ve’et kal nefesh hakhayah ’asher ’itekhem ba‘of babehemah ubekhal khayat ha’arez ’itekhem, mikol yoze’ei hatebah lekhol khayat ha’arez.
whqmty at bryty atkm wla ykrt kl bSr ewd mmy hmbwl wla yhyh ewd mbwl lSxt harz and i will establish my covenant with you, neither all flesh be cut off any more by the from-waters of a flood; neither there any more be a flood to destroy the earth. vahaqimoti beriti ’itekhem velo yikaret kal basar ‘od mimei hamabul, velo yihyeh ‘od mabul leshakhet ha’arez.
wyamr alhym cat awt hbryt aSr any ntn byny wbynykm wbyn kl npS xyh aSr atkm ldrt ewlm and to-no-these said, this is the token of the covenant which i make between-bin me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations: vayomer ’elohim zot ’ot haberit ’asher ’ani noten beni ubenekhem uben kal nefesh khayah ’asher ’itekhem, ledorot ‘olam.
at qSty ntty benn whyth lawt bryt byny wbyn harz i do set my bow in the cloud, and it be for a token of a covenant between-bin me and the earth. qashti natati be‘anan, vehayetah le’ot berit beni uben ha’arez.
whyh benny enn el harz wnrath hqSt benn and it come to pass, when i bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow be seen in the cloud: vehayah be‘ani ‘anan ‘al ha’arez, venir’atah haqeshet be‘anan.
wckrty at bryty aSr byny wbynykm wbyn kl npS xyh bkl bSr wla yhyh ewd hmym lmbwl lSxt kl bSr and i will remember my covenant, which is between-bin me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the from-waters no more become a flood to destroy all flesh. vezakharti beriti ’asher beni ubenekhem uben kal nefesh khayah bekhal basar, velo yihyeh ‘od hamayim lemabul leshakhet kal basar.
whyth hqSt benn wraytyh lckr bryt ewlm byn alhym wbyn kl npS xyh bkl bSr aSr el harz and the bow be in the cloud; and i will look upon it, that i may remember the everlasting covenant between-bin to-no-these and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth. vehayetah haqeshet be‘anan, ure’itiha lizkor berit ‘olam ben ’elohim uben kal nefesh khayah bekhal basar ’asher ‘al ha’arez.
wyamr alhym al nx cat awt hbryt aSr hqmty byny wbyn kl bSr aSr el harz and to-no-these said unto noah-rest, this is the token of the covenant, which i have established between-bin me and all flesh that is upon the earth. vayomer ’elohim ’el noakh, zot ’ot haberit ’asher haqimoti beni uben kal basar ’asher ‘al ha’arez.
wyhyw bny nx hyzaym mn htbh Sm wxm wypt wxm hwa aby knen and children-betweens of noah-rest, that went forth of the ark, were shem-name, and ham-hot, and japheth-beautiful: and ham-hot is the father of canaan-mobile-trade. vayihyu bene noakh hayoze’im min hatebah shem vekham vayafet, vekham hu ’abi khena‘an.
SlSh alh bny nx wmalh npzh kl harz these are the three children-betweens of noah-rest: and of them was the whole earth overspread. sheloshah ’eleh bene noakh, ume’eleh nafezah khal ha’arez.
wyxl nx ayS hadmh wyTe krm and noah-rest began to be an manman, and he planted a vineyard: vayakhel noakh ’ish ha’adamah, vayita‘ karem.

wyra xm aby knen at erwt abyw wygd lSny axyw bxwz and ham-hot, the father of canaan-mobile-trade, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without. vayar kham ’abi khena‘an ‘ervat ’abiv, vayaged lishne ’ekhav bakhuz.
wyqx Sm wypt at hSmlh wySymw el Skm Snyhm wylkw axrnyt wyksw at erwt abyhm wpnyhm axrnyt werwt abyhm la raw and shem-name and japheth-beautiful took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their face-turns-turns were backward, and they saw not their father's nakedness. vayiqakh shem vayefet hasimlah vayasimu ‘al shekhem shenehem vayelekhu ’akhoranit vaykhasu ‘ervat ’abihem, ufenehem ’akhoranit ve‘ervat ’abihem lo ra’u.
wyyqz nx myynw wyde at aSr eSh lw bnw hqTn and noah-rest awoke from his wine-inherit, and hand-knew what his younger child-between had done unto him. vayiqez noakh miyeno, vayeda‘ ’asher ‘asah lo beno haqatan.
wyamr arwr knen ebd ebdym yhyh laxyw and he said, cursed be canaan-mobile-trade; a worker of workers he be unto his brethren. vayomer ’arur kena‘an, ‘ebed ‘abadim yihyeh le’ekhav.
wyamr brwk yhwh alhy Sm wyhy knen ebd lmw and he said, knee-fluffy-blessed be yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of shem-name; and canaan-mobile-trade be his worker. vayomer barukh yhvh ’elohei shem, vihi khena‘an ‘ebed lamo.
ypt alhym lypt wySkn bahly Sm wyhy knen ebd lmw to-no-these beautify japheth-beautiful, and he dwell in the tents of shem-name; and canaan-mobile-trade be his worker. yaft ’elohim leyefet veyishkon be’ahole shem, vihi khena‘an ‘ebed lamo.

bny ypt gmr wmgwg wmdy wywn wtbl wmSk wtyrs children-betweens of japheth-beautiful; gomer-final, and magog-from-roof, and madai-every, and javan-mud-greece, and tubal-world, and meshech-duration, and tiras-corn-swimming. benei yefet gomer umagog umaday veyavan vetubal, umeshekh vetiras.
wbny gmr aSknc wrypt wtgrmh and children-betweens of gomer-final; ashkenaz-fire-conference, and riphath-cowshed, and togarmah-produced. ubenei gomer, ’ashkanaz verifat vetogarmah.
wbny ywn alySh wtrSyS ktym wddnym and children-betweens of javan-mud-greece; elisha-towards-savesh-towards-kneading, and tarshish-aquamarine, kittim-stains, and dodanim-nipple-dudes. ubenei yavan ’elishah vetarshish, kitim vedodanim.

wbny kwS sba wxwylh wsbth wremh wsbtka wbny remh Sba wddn and children-betweens of cush-spindle; seba-grandpa, and havilah-sick, and sabta-grandma, and raamah-thunder-mane, and sabtecha: and children-betweens of raamah-thunder-mane; sheba-coming, and dedan-breast-discuss. ubenei khush seba vakhavilah vesabtah vera‘mah vesabtekha, ubenei ra‘mah sheba udedan.
wkwS yld at nmrd hwa hxl lhywt gbr barz and cush-spindle begat nimrod-rebellious: he began to be a mighty one in the earth. vekhush yalad nimrod, hu hekhel lihyot gibor ba’arez.
hwa hyh gbr zyd lpny yhwh el kn yamr knmrd gbwr zyd lpny yhwh he was a mighty hunter before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: wherefore it is said, even as nimrod-rebellious the mighty hunter before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. hu hayah gibor zayid lifnei yhvh, ‘al ken ye’amar kenimrod gibor zayid lifnei yhvh.
wthy raSyt mmlktw bbl wark wakd wklnh barz Sner and the beginning of his king-molochdom was babel-old, and erech-lasting-uruk, and accad-jug, and calneh-all-lodgings, in the land of shinar-youth. vatehi reshit mamlakhto babel ve’erekh ve’akad vekhalneh, be’erez shin‘ar.
mn harz hhwa yza aSwr wybn at nynwh wat rxbt eyr wat klx out of that land went forth asshur-beech, and between-between-builded nineveh-house, and the light-city rehob-wideoth-wide-area, and calah-out-of-date, min ha’arez hahiv yaza ’ashur, vayiben nineveh ve’et rekhobot ‘ir ve’et kalakh.
wat rsn byn nynwh wbyn klx hwa heyr hgdlh and resen-bridle between-bin nineveh-house and calah-out-of-date: the same is a great light-city. ve’et resen ben nineveh uben kalakh, hi ha‘ir hagedolah.

wat ptrsym wat kslxym aSr yzaw mSm plStym wat kptrym and pathrusim-solutions, and casluhim-as-releasedess, (out of whom came philistim-invaders,) and caphtor-button-solvedim-buttons. ve’et patrusim ve’et kaslukhim ’asher yaze’u misham pelishtim ve’et kaftorim.
wknen yld at zydn bkrw wat xt and canaan-mobile-trade begat sidon-side-by-side his first born, and heth-bold, ukhena‘an yalad zidon bekhoro ve’et khet.
wat hybwsy wat hamry wat hgrgSy and the jebusite-trampler, and the amorite-talker, and the girgasite-emotional, ve’et haybusi ve’et ha’emori ve’et hagirgashi.

wyhy gbwl hkneny mzydn bakh grrh ed ech bakh sdmh wemrh wadmh wzbym ed lSe and the border of the canaan-mobile-tradeites was from sidon-side-by-side, as thou comest to gera-strangerr-tow, unto gaza-courage-intense-goat; as thou goest, unto sodom-splint-blood, and gomorrah-sheaves, and admah-earth, and zeboim-swollen, even unto lasha-watch. vayhi gebul hakena‘ani mizidon bo’akhah gerarah ‘ad ‘azah, bo’akhah sedomah va‘amorah ve’admah uzeboyim ‘ad lasha‘.

bny Sm eylm waSwr warpkSd wlwd warm children-betweens of shem-name; elam-youth, and asshur-beech, and arpakhshad-breast, and lud-birth, and aram-high. benei shem ‘elam ve’ashur, ve’arpakhshad velud va’aram.

wlebr yld Sny bnym Sm haxd plg ky bymyw nplgh harz wSm axyw yqTn and unto eber-pass were born two children-betweens: the name of one was peleg-divided; for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother's name was joktan-little. ule‘eber yulad shenei banim, shem ha’ekhad peleg ki beyamav niflegah ha’arez veshem ’akhiv yaqetan.

wyhy kl harz Sph axt wdbrym axdym and the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech. vayhi khal ha’arez safah ’ekhat, udebarim ’akhadim.
wyhy bnsem mqdm wymzaw bqeh barz Sner wySbw Sm and it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of shinar-youth; and they dwelt there. vayhi benase‘am miqedem, vayimze’u biq‘ah be’erez shin‘ar vayeshebu sham.
wyamrw ayS al rehw hbh nlbnh lbnym wnSrph lSrph wthy lhm hlbnh labn whxmr hyh lhm lxmr and they said one to another, go to, let us make brick-l-between, and burn them thoroughly. and they had brick-l-between for father-child-stone, and slime had they for mortar. vayomeru ’ish ’el re‘ehu habah nilbenah lebenim venisrefah lisrefah, vatehi halebenah le’aben vehakhemar hayah lakhomer.
wyamrw hbh nbnh lnw eyr wmgdl wraSw bSmym wneSh lnw Sm pn npwz el pny kl harz and they said, go to, let us between-build us a light-city and a tower, whose top may reach unto namespaces; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face-turns of the whole earth. vayomeru habah nibneh lanu ‘ir umigdal verosho bashamayim vena‘aseh lanu shem, pen nafuz ‘al penei khal ha’arez.
wyrd yhwh lrat at heyr wat hmgdl aSr bnw bny hadm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah came down to see the light-city and the tower, which children-betweens of men between-between-builded. vayered yhvh lir’ot ha‘ir ve’et hamigdal, ’asher banu benei ha’adam.
wyamr yhwh hn em axd wSph axt lklm wch hxlm leSwt weth la ybzr mhm kl aSr ycmw leSwt and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said, behold, the with-mum-people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have initiated to do. vayomer yhvh hen ‘am ’ekhad vesafah ’akhat lekhulam vezeh hakhilam la‘asot, ve‘atah lo yibazer mehem kol ’asher yazemu la‘asot.
hbh nrdh wnblh Sm Sptm aSr la ySmew ayS Spt rehw go to, let us go down, and there wear-out their language, that they may not hear one another's speech. habah neredah venabelah sham sefatam, ’asher lo yishme‘u ’ish sefat re‘ehu.
wypz yhwh atm mSm el pny kl harz wyxdlw lbnt heyr so yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah scattered them abroad from thence upon the face-turns of all the earth: and they left off to between-build the light-city. vayafez yhvh ’otam misham ‘al penei khal ha’arez, vayakhdelu libnot ha‘ir.
el kn qra Smh bbl ky Sm bll yhwh Spt kl harz wmSm hpyzm yhwh el pny kl harz therefore is the name of it called babel-old; because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah did there wear out the language of all the earth: and from thence did yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah scatter them abroad upon the face-turns of all the earth. ‘al ken qara shemah babel ki sham balal yhvh sefat kal ha’arez, umisham hefizam yhvh ‘al penei kal ha’arez.
alh twldt Sm Sm bn mat Snh wywld at arpkSd Sntym axr hmbwl these are the generations of shem-name: shem was an hundred years old, and begat arpakhshad-breast two years after the flood: ’eleh toldot shem m ben me’at shanah vayoled ’arpakhshad, shenatayim ’akhar hamabul.
wyxy Sm axry hwlydw at arpkSd xmS mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and shem-name lived after he begat arpakhshad-breast five hundred years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi shem ’akharei holido ’arpakhshad khamesh me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
warpkSd xy xmS wSlSym Snh wywld at Slx and arpakhshad-breast lived five and thirty years, and begat salah-send: ve’arpakhshad khay khamesh usheloshim shanah, vayoled shalakh.
wyxy arpkSd axry hwlydw at Slx SlS Snym warbe mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and arpakhshad-breast lived after he begat salah-send four hundred and three years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi ’arpakhshad ’akharei holido shelakh shalosh shanim ve’arba‘ me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wSlx xy SlSym Snh wywld at ebr and salah-send lived thirty years, and begat eber-pass: veshelakh khay sheloshim shanah, vayoled ‘eber.
wyxy Slx axry hwlydw at ebr SlS Snym warbe mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and salah-send lived after he begat eber-pass four hundred and three years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi shelakh ’akharei holido ‘eber shalosh shanim ve’arba‘ me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyxy ebr arbe wSlSym Snh wywld at plg and eber-pass lived four and thirty years, and begat peleg-divided: vaykhi ‘eber ’arba‘ usheloshim shanah, vayoled paleg.
wyxy ebr axry hwlydw at plg SlSym Snh warbe mawt Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and eber-pass lived after he begat peleg-divided four hundred and thirty years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi ‘eber ’akharei holido peleg sheloshim shanah ve’arba‘ me’ot shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyxy plg SlSym Snh wywld at rew and peleg-divided lived thirty years, and begat reu-buddy: vaykhi feleg sheloshim shanah, vayoled re‘u.
wyxy plg axry hwlydw at rew tSe Snym wmatym Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and peleg-divided lived after he begat reu-buddy two hundred and nine years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi feleg ’akharei holido re‘u tesha‘ shanim umatayim shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyxy rew Stym wSlSym Snh wywld at Srwg and reu-buddy lived two and thirty years, and begat serug-immersed-moment: vaykhi re‘u shetayim usheloshim shanah, vayoled serug.
wyxy rew axry hwlydw at Srwg Sbe Snym wmatym Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and reu-buddy lived after he begat serug-immersed-moment two hundred and seven years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi re‘u ’akharei holido serug sheba‘ shanim umatayim shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyxy Srwg SlSym Snh wywld at nxwr and serug-immersed-moment lived thirty years, and begat nahor-snore: vaykhi serug sheloshim shanah, vayoled nakhor.
wyxy Srwg axry hwlydw at nxwr matym Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and serug-immersed-moment lived after he begat nahor-snore two hundred years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi serug ’akharei holido nakhor matayim shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyxy nxwr tSe weSrym Snh wywld at trx and nahor-snore lived nine and double-ten-twenty years, and begat terah-effort: vaykhi nakhor tesha‘ ve‘esrim shanah, vayoled tarakh.
wyxy nxwr axry hwlydw at trx tSe eSrh Snh wmat Snh wywld bnym wbnwt and nahor-snore lived after he begat terah-effort an hundred and nineteen years, and begat children-betweens and children-betweenesss. vaykhi nakhor ’akharei holido terakh tesha‘ ‘esreh shanah ume’at shanah, vayoled banim ubanot.
wyxy trx Sbeym Snh wywld at abrm at nxwr wat hrn and terah-effort lived seventy years, and begat abram-boner, nahor-snore, and haran-conceived-gladness. vaykhi terakh shib‘im shanah, vayoled ’abram nakhor ve’et haran.
walh twldt trx trx hwlyd at abrm at nxwr wat hrn whrn hwlyd at lwT now these are the generations of terah-effort: terah-effort begat abram-boner, nahor-snore, and haran-conceived-gladness; and haran-conceived-gladness begat lot-cover. ve’eleh toldot terakh terakh holid ’abram nakhor ve’et haran, veharan holid lot.
wymt hrn el pny trx abyw barz mwldtw bawr kSdym and haran-conceived-gladness died before-turns his father terah-effort in the land of his nativity, in ur-light of the kasidim-as-genies. vayamat haran ‘al penei terakh ’abiv, be’erez moladto be’ur kasdim.
wyqx abrm wnxwr lhm nSym Sm aSt abrm Sry wSm aSt nxwr mlkh bt hrn aby mlkh waby yskh and abram-boner and nahor-snore took them women: the name of abram-boner's woman was sarai-my-soakedness; and the name of nahor-snore's woman, milcah-queen, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of haran-conceived-gladness, the father of milcah-queen, and the father of iscah-lube-sum. vayiqakh ’abram venakhor lahem nashim, shem ’eshet ’abram saray veshem ’eshet nakhor milkah bat haran ’abi milkah va’abi yiskah.
wthy Sry eqrh ayn lh wld and sarai-my-soakedness was barren; she had no child. vatehi saray ‘aqarah, ’en lah valad.
