wyqx trx at abrm bnw wat lwT bn hrn bn bnw wat Sry kltw aSt abrm bnw wyzaw atm mawr kSdym llkt arzh knen wybaw ed xrn wySbw Sm and terah-effort took abram-boner his child-between, and lot-cover child-between of haran-conceived-gladness his child-between's child-between, and sarai-my-soakedness his daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching, his child-between abram-boner's woman; and they went forth with them from ur-light of the kasidim-as-genies, to go into the land of canaan-mobile-trade; and they came unto haran-conceived-gladness, and dwelt there. vayiqakh terakh ’abram beno ve’et lot ben haran ben beno ve’et saray kalato ’eshet ’abram beno, vayeze’u ’itam me’ur kasdim lalekhet ’arzah kena‘an vayabo’u ‘ad kharan vayeshebu sham.
wyhyw ymy trx xmS Snym wmatym Snh wymt trx bxrn and the days of terah-effort were two hundred and five years: and terah-effort died in haran-conceived-gladness. vayihyu yeme terakh khamesh shanim umatayim shanah, vayamat terakh bekharan.
wyamr yhwh al abrm lk lk marzk wmmwldtk wmbyt abyk al harz aSr arak now yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had said unto abram-boner, get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's daughter-house, unto a land that i will show thee: vayomer yhvh ’el ’abram lekh me’arzekha umimoladtekha umibet ’abikha, ’el ha’arez ’asher ’ar’eka.
waeSk lgwy gdwl wabrkk wagdlh Smk whyh brkh and i will make of thee a great nation, and i will knee-fluffy-bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou be a knee-fluffy-blessing: ve’e‘eskha lego gadol va’abarekhkha va’agadelah shemekha, vehyeh berakhah.
wabrkh mbrkyk wmqllk aar wnbrkw bk kl mSpxt hadmh and i will knee-fluffy-bless them that knee-fluffy-bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee all families of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed. va’abarakhah mebarekhekha umeqalelkha ’a’or, venibrekhu bekha kol mishpekhot ha’adamah.
wylk abrm kaSr dbr alyw yhwh wylk atw lwT wabrm bn xmS Snym wSbeym Snh bzatw mxrn so abram-boner departed, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had bee-spoken unto him; and lot-cover went with him: and abram-boner was seventy and five years old when he departed out of haran-conceived-gladness. vayelekh ’abram ka’asher diber ’elav yhvh vayelekh ’ito lot, ve’abram ben khamesh shanim veshib‘im shanah bezeto mekharan.
wyqx abrm at Sry aStw wat lwT bn axyw wat kl rkwSm aSr rkSw wat hnpS aSr eSw bxrn wyzaw llkt arzh knen wybaw arzh knen and abram-boner took sarai-my-soakedness his woman, and lot-cover his brother's child-between, and all their substance that they had added, and the beings that they had gotten in haran-conceived-gladness; and they went forth to go into the land of canaan-mobile-trade; and into the land of canaan-mobile-trade they came. vayiqakh ’abram saray ’ishto ve’et lot ben ’akhiv ve’et kal rekhusham ’asher rakhashu ve’et hanefesh ’asher ‘asu bekharan, vayeze’u lalekhet ’arzah kena‘an vayabo’u ’arzah kena‘an.
wyebr abrm barz ed mqwm Skm ed alwn mwrh whkneny ac barz and abram-boner passed through the land unto the place of sichem, unto the plain of moreh-teacher. and the canaan-mobile-tradeite was then in the land. vaya‘abor ’abram ba’arez ‘ad meqom shekhem ‘ad ’elon moreh, vehakena‘ani ’az ba’arez.
wyra yhwh al abrm wyamr lcrek atn at harz hcat wybn Sm mcbx lyhwh hnrah alyw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah appeared unto abram-boner, and said, unto thy seed will i give this land: and there between-between-builded he an butcher-kitchen unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, who appeared unto him. vayera yhvh ’el ’abram vayomer lezar‘akha ’eten ha’arez hazot, vayiben sham mizbeakh yhvh hanir’eh ’elav.
wyetq mSm hhrh mqdm lbyt al wyT ahlh byt al mym whey mqdm wybn Sm mcbx lyhwh wyqra bSm yhwh and he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of bethel-house-towards, and pitched his tent, having bethel-house-towards on the sea-west, and hai on the east: and there he between-between-builded an butcher-kitchen unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and called upon the name of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vaya‘teq misham haharah miqedem lebet ’el vayet ’aholoh, bet ’el miyam veha‘ay miqedem vayiben sham mizbeakh yhvh vayiqra beshem yhvh.
wyse abrm hlwk wnswe hngbh and abram-boner journeyed, going on still toward the south-dry. vayisa‘ ’abram halokh venasoa‘ hanegbah.
wyhy reb barz wyrd abrm mzrymh lgwr Sm ky kbd hreb barz and there was a famine in the land: and abram-boner went down into mizraim-narrows to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land. vayhi ra‘ab ba’arez, vayered ’abram mizraymah lagur sham ki khabed hara‘ab ba’arez.
wyhy kaSr hqryb lbwa mzrymh wyamr al Sry aStw hnh na ydety ky aSh ypt mrah at and it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into mizraim-narrows, that he said unto sarai-my-soakedness his woman, behold now, i hand-know that thou art a fair woman to look upon: vayhi ka’asher hiqrib labo mizrayemah, vayomer ’el saray ’ishto hineh na yada‘ti ki ’ishah yefat mar’eh ’at.
whyh ky yraw atk hmzrym wamrw aStw cat whrgw aty watk yxyw therefore it come to pass, when the mizraim-narrowsians see thee, that they say, this is his woman: and they will kill me, and they will save thee alive. vehayah ki yir’u ’otakh hamizrim ve’ameru ’ishto zot, veharegu ’oti ve’otakh yekhayu.
amry na axty at lmen yyTb ly bebwrk wxyth npSy bgllk say, i pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my being live because of thee. ’imri na ’akhoti ’at, lema‘an yitab li ba‘aburekh vekhayetah nafshi biglalekh.
wyhy kbwa abrm mzrymh wyraw hmzrym at haSh ky yph hwa mad and it came to pass, that, when abram-boner was come into mizraim-narrows, the mizraim-narrowsians beheld the woman that she was very fair. vayhi kebo ’abram mizrayemah, vayir’u hamizrim ha’ishah ki yafah hi me’od.
wyraw ath Sry preh wyhllw ath al preh wtqx haSh byt preh the princes also of pharaoh-big-house saw her, and commended her before-turns pharaoh-big-house: and the woman was taken into pharaoh-big-house's daughter-house. vayir’u ’otah sarei far‘oh vayhalu ’otah ’el par‘oh, vatuqakh ha’ishah bet par‘oh.
wlabrm hyTyb bebwrh wyhy lw zan wbqr wxmrym webdym wSpxt watnt wgmlym and he entreated abram-boner well for her sake: and he had sheep, and wall-oxen, and he asses, and workers, and maid-mothers, and she asses, and ripen-camels. ule’abram hetib ba‘aburah, vayhi zon ubaqar vakhamorim va‘abadim ushefakhot va’atonot ugemalim.
wynge yhwh at preh ngeym gdlym wat bytw el dbr Sry aSt abrm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah plagued pharaoh-big-house and his daughter-house with great plagues because of sarai-my-soakedness abram-boner's woman. vaynaga‘ yhvh par‘oh nega‘im gedolim ve’et beto, ‘al debar saray ’eshet ’abram.
wyqra preh labrm wyamr mh cat eSyt ly lmh la hgdt ly ky aStk hwa and pharaoh-big-house called abram-boner and said, what is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy woman? vayiqra far‘oh le’abram vayomer mah zot ‘asita li, lamah lo higadta li ki ’ishtekha hi
lmh amrt axty hwa waqx ath ly laSh weth hnh aStk qx wlk why saidst thou, she is my sister? so i might have taken her to me to woman: now therefore behold thy woman, take her, and go thy way. lamah ’amarta ’akhoti hi va’eqakh ’otah li le’ishah, ve‘atah hineh ’ishtekha qakh valekh.
wyzw elyw preh anSym wySlxw atw wat aStw wat kl aSr lw and pharaoh-big-house direct his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his woman, and all that he had. vayzav ‘alav par‘oh ’anashim, vayshalekhu ’oto ve’et ’ishto ve’et kal ’asher lo.
wyel abrm mmzrym hwa waStw wkl aSr lw wlwT emw hngbh and abram-boner went up out of mizraim-narrows, he, and his woman, and all that he had, and lot-cover with him, into the south-dry. vaya‘al ’abram mimizrayim hu ve’ishto vekhal ’asher lo velot ‘imo hanegbah.
wabrm kbd mad bmqnh bksp wbchb and abram-boner was very rich in in-them-animal, in silver, and in gold. ve’abram kabed me’od, bamiqneh bakesef ubazahab.
wylk lmseyw mngb wed byt al ed hmqwm aSr hyh Sm ahlh ahlw btxlh byn byt al wbyn hey and he went on his journeys from the south-dry even to bethel-house-towards, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between-bin bethel-house-towards and hai; vayelekh lemasa‘av minegeb ve‘ad bet ’el, ‘ad hamaqom ’asher hayah ’aholo batekhilah ben ’el uben ha‘ay.
al mqwm hmcbx aSr eSh Sm braSnh wyqra Sm abrm bSm yhwh unto the place of the butcher-kitchen, which he had make there at the first: and there abram-boner called on the name of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. ’el meqom hamizbeakh ’asher ‘asah sham barishonah, vayiqra sham ’abram beshem yhvh.
wgm llwT hhlk at abrm hyh zan wbqr wahlym and lot-cover also, which went with abram-boner, had flocks, and visit-cattles, and tents. vegam lelot haholekh ’et ’abram, hayah zon ubaqar ve’ohalim.
wla nSa atm harz lSbt yxdw ky hyh rkwSm rb wla yklw lSbt yxdw and the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together. velo nasa ’otam ha’arez lashebet yakhdav, ki hayah rekhusham rab velo yakhelu lashebet yakhdav.
wyhy ryb byn rey mqnh abrm wbyn rey mqnh lwT whkneny whprcy ac ySb barz and there was a strife between-bin the visit-cattlemen of abram-boner's in-them-animal and the visit-cattlemen of lot-cover's in-them-animal: and the canaan-mobile-tradeite and the perizzite-unwalled dwelled then in the land. vayhi rib ben ro‘ei miqneh ’abram uben ro‘ei miqneh lot, vehakena‘ani vehaperizi ’az yosheb ba’arez.
wyamr abrm al lwT al na thy mrybh byny wbynyk wbyn rey wbyn reyk ky anSym axym anxnw and abram-boner said unto lot-cover, let there be no strife, i pray thee, between-bin me and thee, and between-bin my visit-cattlemen and thy visit-cattlemen; for we be brethren. vayomer ’abram ’el lot ’al na tehi meribah beni ubenekha uben ro‘ay uben ro‘ekha, ki ’anashim ’akhim ’anakhenu.
hla kl harz lpnyk hprd na mely am hSmal waymnh wam hymyn waSmaylh is not the whole land before-turns thee? separate thyself, i pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then i will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then i will go to the left. halo khal ha’arez lefanekha hipared na me‘alay, ’im hasemol ve’eminah ve’im hayamin ve’asme’ilah.
wySa lwT at eynyw wyra at kl kkr hyrdn ky klh mSqh lpny Sxt yhwh at sdm wat emrh kgn yhwh karz mzrym bakh zer and lot-cover lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of jordan-its-going-down, that it was well watered every where, before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah destroyed sodom-splint-blood and gomorrah-sheaves, even as the garden of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, like the land of mizraim-narrows, as thou comest unto zoar-grief. vayisa lot ‘enav vayar kal kikar hayarden ki khulah mashqeh, lifnei shakhet yhvh sedom ve’et ‘amorah kegan yhvh ke’erez mizrayim bo’akhah zo‘ar.
wybxr lw lwT at kl kkr hyrdn wyse lwT mqdm wyprdw ayS mel axyw then lot-cover chose him all the plain of jordan-its-going-down; and lot-cover journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other. vayibkhar lo lot kal kikar hayarden vayisa‘ lot miqedem, vayiparedu ’ish me‘al ’akhiv.
abrm ySb barz knen wlwT ySb bery hkkr wyahl ed sdm abram-boner dwelled in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, and lot-cover dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent toward sodom-splint-blood. ’abram yashab be’erez kena‘an, velot yashab be‘arei hakikar vaye’ehal ‘ad sedom.
wanSy sdm reym wxTaym lyhwh mad and the men of sodom-splint-blood were wicked and fauters before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah exceedingly. ve’anshei sedom ra‘im vekhata’im, yhvh me’od.
wyhwh amr al abrm axry hprd lwT memw Sa na eynyk wrah mn hmqwm aSr ath Sm zpnh wngbh wqdmh wymh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto abram-boner, after that lot-cover was separated from him, lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art hide-northward, and south-dryward, and eastward, and sea-westward: yhvh ’amar ’el ’abram ’akharei hipared lot me‘imo sa na ‘enekha ure’eh min hamaqom ’asher ’atah sham, zafonah vanegbah vaqedemah vayamah.
ky at kl harz aSr ath rah lk atnnh wlcrek ed ewlm for all the land which thou seest, to thee will i give it, and to thy seed for ever. ki kal ha’arez ’asher ’atah ro’eh lekha ’etenenah, ulezar‘akha ‘ad ‘olam.
wSmty at crek kepr harz aSr am ywkl ayS lmnwt at epr harz gm crek ymnh and i will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then thy seed also be numbered. vesamti zar‘akha ka‘afar ha’arez, ’asher ’im yukhal ’ish limnot ‘afar ha’arez gam zar‘akha yimaneh.
qwm hthlk barz larkh wlrxbh ky lk atnnh arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for i will give it unto thee. qum hithalekh ba’arez le’arekah ulerakhebah, ki lekha ’etenenah.
wyahl abrm wyba wySb balny mmra aSr bxbrwn wybn Sm mcbx lyhwh then abram-boner removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of mamre-see-bitter, which is in hebron-friend-joy, and between-built there an butcher-kitchen unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vaye’ehal ’abram vayabo vayesheb be’elonei mamrei ’asher bekhebron, vayiben sham mizbeakh yhvh.
wyhy bymy amrpl mlk Sner arywk mlk alsr kdrlemr mlk eylm wtdel mlk gwym and it came to pass in the days of amraphel-falling-mother-shelf king-moloch of shinar-youth, arioch-gather-lion-smell king-moloch of ellasar-hazel, chedorlaomer-pot-sheave king-moloch of elam-youth, and tidal-throw king-moloch of nations; vayhi bimei ’amrafel melekh shin‘ar ’aryokh melekh ’elasar, kedarela‘omer melekh ‘elam vetid‘al melekh goyim.
eSw mlxmh at bre mlk sdm wat brSe mlk emrh Snab mlk admh wSmabr mlk zbyym zbwyym wmlk ble hya zer that these made war with bera-in-the-bad king-moloch of sodom-splint-blood, and with birscha-in-the-bad king-moloch of gomorrah-sheaves, shinab-changing-dad king-moloch of admah-earth, and shemeber-name-dick king-moloch of zeboiim-gazelles, and the king-moloch of bela-swallow, which is zoar-grief. ‘asu milkhamah ’et bera‘ melekh sedom ve’et birsha‘ melekh ‘amorah, shin’ab melekh ’admah veshem’eber melekh zeboyim umelekh bela‘ hi zo‘ar.
kl alh xbrw al emq hSdym hwa ym hmlx all these were joined together in the vale of siddim-demons, which is the salt sea. kal ’eleh khaberu ’el ‘emeq hasidim, hu yam hamelakh.
Stym eSrh Snh ebdw at kdrlemr wSlS eSrh Snh mrdw twelve years they worked for chedorlaomer-pot-sheave, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled. shetem ‘esreh shanah ‘abedu kedarela‘omer, ushelosh ‘esreh shanah maradu.
wbarbe eSrh Snh ba kdrlemr whmlkym aSr atw wykw at rpaym beStrt qrnym wat hcwcym bhm wat haymym bSwh qrytym and in the fourteenth year came chedorlaomer-pot-sheave, and the king-molochs that were with him, and smote the rephaim-ghosts in ashteroth-you-gave-fire karnaim-horn-rays, and the zuzim-moves in ham-hot, and the emim-horrors in shaveh-equal kiriathaim-cold-cities, ube’arba‘ ‘esreh shanah ba khedarela‘omer vehamelakhim ’asher ’ito vayaku refa’im be‘ashterot qarnayim ve’et hazuzim beham, ve’et ha’emim beshaveh qiryatayim.
wat hxry bhrrm Seyr ed ayl parn aSr el hmdbr and the hori-my-holete-holes-mountain in their mount seir-hair-style, unto elparan, which is by the place-of-word-desert. ve’et hakhori beharram se‘ir, ‘ad paran ’asher ‘al hamidbar.
wySbw wybaw al eyn mSpT hwa qdS wykw at kl Sdh hemlqy wgm at hamry hySb bxzzn tmr and they returned, and came to enmishpat-eye-well-of-referee, which is kadesh-dedicated-finished, and smote all the country of the amalek-labour-king-molochites, and also the amorite-talkers, that dwelt in hazezontamar-gravel-date. vayashubu vayabo’u ’el mishpat hi qadesh vayaku kal sedeh ha‘amaleqi, vegam ha’emori hayosheb bekhazon tamar.
wyza mlk sdm wmlk emrh wmlk admh wmlk zbyym zbwym wmlk ble hwa zer wyerkw atm mlxmh bemq hSdym and there went out the king-moloch of sodom-splint-blood, and the king-moloch of gomorrah-sheaves, and the king-moloch of admah-earth, and the king-moloch of zeboiim-gazelles, and the king-moloch of bela-swallow (the same is zoar-grief;) and they joined battle with them in the vale of siddim-demons; vayezei melekh sedom umelekh ‘amorah umelekh ’admah umelekh zeboyim zeboyim umelekh bela‘ hi zo‘ar, vaya‘arkhu ’itam milkhamah be‘emeq hasidim.
at kdrlemr mlk eylm wtdel mlk gwym wamrpl mlk Sner warywk mlk alsr arbeh mlkym at hxmSh with chedorlaomer-pot-sheave the king-moloch of elam-youth, and with tidal-throw king-moloch of nations, and amraphel-falling-mother-shelf king-moloch of shinar-youth, and arioch-gather-lion-smell king-moloch of ellasar-hazel; four king-molochs with five. ’et kedarela‘omer melekh ‘elam vetid‘al melekh goyim ve’amrafel melekh shin‘ar ve’aryokh melekh ’elasar, ’arba‘ah melakhim ’et hakhamishah.
wemq hSdym bart bart xmr wynsw mlk sdm wemrh wyplw Smh whnSarym hrh nsw and the vale of siddim-demons was full of slime pits; and the king-molochs of sodom-splint-blood and gomorrah-sheaves fled, and fell there; and they that remained fled to the mountain. ve‘emeq hasidim be’erot khemar vayanusu melekh sedom va‘amorah vayipelu shamah, vehanish’arim herah nasu.
wyqxw at kl rkS sdm wemrh wat kl aklm wylkw and they took all the goods of sodom-splint-blood and gomorrah-sheaves, and all their victuals, and went their way. vayiqkhu kal rekhush sedom va‘amorah ve’et kal ’akhelam vayelekhu.
wyqxw at lwT wat rkSw bn axy abrm wylkw whwa ySb bsdm and they took lot-cover, abram-boner's brother's child-between, who dwelt in sodom-splint-blood, and his goods, and departed. vayiqkhu lot ve’et rekhusho ben ’akhi ’abram vayelekhu, vehu yosheb bisdom.
wyba hplyT wygd labrm hebry whwa Skn balny mmra hamry axy aSkl waxy enr whm bely bryt abrm and there came one that had escaped, and told abram-boner the hebrew-cross-over; for he dwelt in the plain of mamre-see-bitter the amorite-talker, brother of eshcol-fire-all, and brother of aner-candle: and these were confederate with abram-boner. vayabo hapalit vayaged le’abram ha‘ibri, vehu shokhen be’elonei mamrei ha’emori ’akhi ’eshkol va’akhi ‘aner vehem ba‘alei berit ’abram.
wySme abrm ky nSbh axyw wyrq at xnykyw ylydy bytw Smnh eSr wSlS mawt wyrdp ed dn and when abram-boner heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his trained workers, born in his own daughter-house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto dan-discuss. vayishma‘ ’abram ki nishbah ’akhiv, vayareq khanikhav yelidei beto shemonah ‘asar ushelosh me’ot vayirdof ‘ad dan.
wyxlq elyhm lylh hwa webdyw wykm wyrdpm ed xwbh aSr mSmal ldmSq and he divided himself against them, he and his workers, by night, and smote them, and pursued them unto hobah-obligation, which is on the left hand of damascus-blood-bag. vayekhaleq ‘alehem laylah hu va‘abadav vayakem, vayirdefem ‘ad khobah ’asher misemol ledamaseq.
wySb at kl hrkS wgm at lwT axyw wrkSw hSyb wgm at hnSym wat hem and he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his brother lot-cover, and his goods, and the women also, and the with-mum-people. vayasheb kal harekhush, vegam lot ’akhiv urekhusho heshib vegam hanashim ve’et ha‘am.
wyza mlk sdm lqratw axry Swbw mhkwt at kdrlemr wat hmlkym aSr atw al emq Swh hwa emq hmlk and the king-moloch of sodom-splint-blood went out to until-witness him after his return from the slaughter of chedorlaomer-pot-sheave, and of the king-molochs that were with him, at the valley of shaveh-equal, which is the king-moloch's dale. vayezei melekh sedom liqrato ’akharei shubo mehakot la‘omer ve’et hamelakhim ’asher ’ito, ’el ‘emeq shaveh hu ‘emeq hamelekh.
wmlky zdq mlk Slm hwzya lxm wyyn whwa khn lal elywn and melchizedek-just-king-moloch king of salem-peace brought forth bread and wine-inherit: and he was the dimmer-server of the most high to-no-these. umalki zedeq melekh shalem hozi lekhem vayayin, vehu khohen le’el ‘elyon.
wybrkhw wyamr brwk abrm lal elywn qnh Smym warz and he knee-fluffy-blessed him, and said, knee-fluffy-blessed be abram-boner of the most high to-no-these, possessor of namespaces and earth: vaybarekhehu vayomar, barukh ’abram le’el ‘elyon qoneh shamayim va’arez.
wbrwk al elywn aSr mgn zryk bydk wytn lw meSr mkl and knee-fluffy-blessed be the most high to-no-these, which hath delivered thine father-adversaries into thy hand. and he gave him tithes of all. ubarukh ’el ‘elyon ’asher migen zarekha beyadekha, vayiten lo ma‘aser mikol.
wyamr mlk sdm al abrm tn ly hnpS whrkS qx lk and the king-moloch of sodom-splint-blood said unto abram-boner, give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself. vayomer melekh sedom ’el ’abram, ten li hanefesh veharekhush qakh lakh.
wyamr abrm al mlk sdm hrymty ydy al yhwh al elywn qnh Smym warz and abram-boner said to the king-moloch of sodom-splint-blood, i have lift up mine hand unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, the most high to-no-these, the possessor of namespaces and earth, vayomer ’abram ’el melekh sedom, harimoti yadi ’el yhvh ’el ‘elyon qoneh shamayim va’arez.
am mxwT wed Srwk nel wam aqx mkl aSr lk wla tamr any heSrty at abrm that i will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and that i will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, i have made abram-boner rich: ’im mikhut ve‘ad serokh na‘al ve’im ’eqakh mikal ’asher lakh, velo tomar ’ani he‘esharti ’abram.
bledy rq aSr aklw hnerym wxlq hanSym aSr hlkw aty enr aSkl wmmra hm yqxw xlqm save only that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men which went with me, aner-candle, eshcol-fire-all, and mamre-see-bitter; let them take their portion. bil‘aday raq ’asher ’akhelu hane‘arim vekheleq ha’anashim ’asher halekhu ’iti, ‘aner ’eshkol umamre hem yiqkhu khelqam.
axr hdbrym halh hyh dbr yhwh al abrm bmxch lamr al tyra abrm anky mgn lk Skrk hrbh mad after these things the bee-word of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah came unto abram-boner in a vision, saying, fear not, abram-boner: i am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward. ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh hayah debar yhvh ’el ’abram bamakhazeh lemor, ’al tira ’abram ’anokhi magen lakh sekharekha harbeh me’od.
wyamr abrm adny yhwh mh ttn ly wanky hwlk eryry wbn mSq byty hwa dmSq alyecr and abram-boner said, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these, what wilt thou give me, seeing i go childless, and the steward of my daughter-house is this eliezer-my-towards-helps of damascus-blood-bag? vayomer ’abram ’adonay yhvh mah titen li ve’anokhi holekh ‘ariri, uben mesheq beti hu dameseq ’eli‘ezer.
wyamr abrm hn ly la ntth cre whnh bn byty ywrS aty and abram-boner said, behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my daughter-house is mine heir. vayomer ’abram hen li lo natatah zara‘, vehineh ben beti yoresh ’oti.
whnh dbr yhwh alyw lamr la yyrSk ch ky am aSr yza mmeyk hwa yyrSk and, behold, the bee-word of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah came unto him, saying, this not be thine heir; and he that come forth out of thine own bowels be thine heir. vehineh debar yhvh ’elav lemor lo yirashekha zeh, ki ’im ’asher yezei mime‘ekha hu yirashekha.
wywza atw hxwzh wyamr hbT na hSmymh wspr hkwkbym am twkl lspr atm wyamr lw kh yhyh crek and he brought him forth abroad, and said, look now toward namespaces, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, so thy seed be. vayozei ’oto hakhuzah vayomer habet na hashamaymah usefor hakokhabim ’im tukhal lispor ’otam, vayomer lo koh yihyeh zar‘ekha.
whamn byhwh wyxSbh lw zdqh and he was coached by yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah; and he counted it to him for being right. vehe’emin yhvh, vayakhshebeha lo zedaqah.
wyamr alyw any yhwh aSr hwzatyk mawr kSdym ltt lk at harz hcat lrSth and he said unto him, i am yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah that brought thee out of ur-light of the kasidim-as-genies, to give thee this land to network it. vayomer ’elav, ’ani yhvh ’asher hozetikha me’ur kasdim latet lekha ha’arez hazot lerishtah.
wyamr adny yhwh bmh ade ky ayrSnh and he said, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these, whereby i hand-know that i network it? vayomar, ’adonay yhvh bamah ’eda‘ ki ’irashenah.
wyamr alyw qxh ly eglh mSlSt wec mSlSt wayl mSlS wtr wgwcl and he said unto him, take me an heifer of three years old, and a she intense-goat of three years old, and a ram-voiceless of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon. vayomer ’elav qekhah li ‘eglah meshuleshet ve‘ez meshuleshet ve’ayil meshulash, vetor vegozal.
wyqx lw at kl alh wybtr atm btwk wytn ayS btrw lqrat rehw wat hzpr la btr and he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: and the birds divided he not. vayiqakh lo kal ’eleh vaybater ’otam batavekh vayiten ’ish bitro liqrat re‘ehu, ve’et hazipor lo batar.
wyrd heyT el hpgrym wySb atm abrm and when the fowls came down upon the carcasses, abram-boner drove them away. vayered ha‘ayit ‘al hapegarim, vayasheb ’otam ’abram.
wyhy hSmS lbwa wtrdmh nplh el abrm whnh aymh xSkh gdlh nplt elyw and when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon abram-boner; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him. vayhi hashemesh labo vetardemah nafelah ‘al ’abram, vehineh ’emah khashekhah gedolah nofelet ‘alav.
wyamr labrm yde tde ky gr yhyh crek barz la lhm webdwm wenw atm arbe mawt Snh and he said unto abram-boner, hand-know of a surety that thy seed be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and work for them; and they afflict them four hundred years; vayomer le’abram yadoa‘ teda‘ ki ger yihyeh zar‘akha be’erez lo lahem va‘abadum ve‘inu ’otam, ’arba‘ me’ot shanah.
wgm at hgwy aSr yebdw dn anky waxry kn yzaw brkS gdwl and also that nation, whom they work for, will i decide: and afterward they come out with great substance. vegam hago ’asher ya‘abodu dan ’anokhi, ve’akhare khen yeze’u birkhush gadol.
wath tbwa al abtyk bSlwm tqbr bSybh Twbh and thou go to thy fathers in peace; thou be buried in a good old age. ve’atah tabo ’el ’abotekha beshalom, tiqaber besebah tobah.
wdwr rbyey ySwbw hnh ky la Slm ewn hamry ed hnh and in the fourth generation they come hither again: for the torment of the amorite-talkers is not yet full. vedor rebi‘i yashubu henah, ki lo shalem ‘avon ha’emori ‘ad henah.
wyhy hSmS bah welTh hyh whnh tnwr eSn wlpyd aS aSr ebr byn hgcrym halh and it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between-bin those pieces. vayhi hashemesh ba’ah va‘alatah hayah, vehineh tanur ‘ashan velapid ’esh ’asher ‘abar ben hagezarim ha’eleh.
bywm hhwa krt yhwh at abrm bryt lamr lcrek ntty at harz hcat mnhr mzrym ed hnhr hgdl nhr prt in the same day yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah made a covenant with abram-boner, saying, unto thy seed have i given this land, from the river of mizraim-narrows unto the great river, the river euphrates-cow: bayom hahu karat yhvh ’et ’abram berit lemor, lezar‘akha natati ha’arez hazot minehar mizrayim ‘ad hanahar hagadol nehar perat.
at hqyny wat hqncy wat hqdmny the kenite-nests-nest, and the kenizzites, and the kadmonites-anterior, haqeni ve’et haqenizi ve’et haqadmoni.
wat hxty wat hprcy wat hrpaym and the hittite-cuts-tusk, and the perizzite-unwalleds, and the rephaim-ghosts, ve’et hakhiti ve’et haperizi ve’et harefa’im.
wat hamry wat hkneny wat hgrgSy wat hybwsy and the amorite-talkers, and the canaan-mobile-tradeites, and the girgashites-emotional, and the jebusite-tramplers. ve’et ha’emori ve’et hakena‘ani ve’et hagirgashi ve’et haybusi.
wSry aSt abrm la yldh lw wlh Spxh mzryt wSmh hgr now sarai-my-soakedness abram-boner's woman conceived-of him no children-betweens: and she had an handmaid, an mizraim-narrowsian, whose name was hagar-migrate. vesaray ’eshet ’abram lo yaledah lo, velah shifkhah mizrit ushemah hagar.
wtamr Sry al abrm hnh na ezrny yhwh mldt ba na al Spxty awly abnh mmnh wySme abrm lqwl Sry and sarai-my-soakedness said unto abram-boner, behold now, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath restrained me from bearing: i pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that i may obtain children-betweens by her. and abram-boner hearkened to the voice of sarai-my-soakedness. vatomer saray ’el ’abram hineh na ‘azarani yhvh miledet bo na ’el shifkhati ’ulay ’ibaneh mimenah, vayishma‘ ’abram leqol saray.
wtqx Sry aSt abrm at hgr hmzryt Spxth mqz eSr Snym lSbt abrm barz knen wttn ath labrm aySh lw laSh and sarai-my-soakedness abram-boner's woman took hagar-migrate her maid the mizraim-narrowsian, after abram-boner had dwelt ten years in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, and gave her to her man abram-boner to be his woman. vatiqakh saray ’eshet ’abram hagar hamizrit shifkhatah miqez ‘eser shanim leshebet ’abram be’erez kena‘an, vatiten ’otah le’abram ’ishah lo le’ishah.
wyba al hgr wthr wtra ky hrth wtql gbrth beynyh and he went in unto hagar-migrate, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes. vayabo ’el hagar vatahar, vatere ki haratah vateqal gebirtah be‘eneha.
wtamr Sry al abrm xmsy elyk anky ntty Spxty bxyqk wtra ky hrth waql beynyh ySpT yhwh byny wbynyk and sarai-my-soakedness said unto abram-boner, my wrong be upon thee: i have given my maid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, i was despised in her eyes: yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah decide between-bin me and thee. vatomer saray ’el ’abram khamasi ‘alekha ’anokhi natati shifkhati bekheqekha vatere ki haratah va’eqal be‘eneha, yishpot yhvh beni ubenekha
wyamr abrm al Sry hnh Spxtk bydk eSy lh hTwb beynyk wtenh Sry wtbrx mpnyh and abram-boner said unto sarai-my-soakedness, behold, thy maid is in thine hand; do to her as it pleaseth thee. and when sarai-my-soakedness dealt hardly with her, she fled from her face-turns. vayomer ’abram ’el saray hineh shifkhatekh beyadekh ‘asi lah hatob be‘enayikh, vate‘aneha saray vatibrakh mipaneha.
wymzah mlak yhwh el eyn hmym bmdbr el heyn bdrk Swr and the angel-messanger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah found her by a fountain of from-waters in the place-of-word-desert, by the fountain in the way to shur-wall. vayimza’ah mal’akh yhvh ‘al ‘en hamayim bamidbar, ‘al ha‘ayin bederekh shur.
wyamr hgr Spxt Sry ay mch bat wanh tlky wtamr mpny Sry gbrty anky brxt and he said, hagar-migrate, sarai-my-soakedness's maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? and she said, i flee from the face-turns of my mistress sarai-my-soakedness. vayomar hagar shifkhat saray ’e mizeh bat ve’anah telekhi, vatomer mipenei saray gebirti ’anokhi borakhat.
wyamr lh mlak yhwh Swby al gbrtk whteny txt ydyh and the angel-messanger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto her, return to thy mistress, and submit thyself under her hands. vayomer lah mal’akh yhvh shubi ’el gebirtekh, vehit‘ani takhat yadeha.
wyamr lh mlak yhwh hrbh arbh at crek wla yspr mrb and the angel-messanger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto her, i will multiply thy seed exceedingly, that it not be numbered for multitude. vayomer lah mal’akh yhvh harbah ’arbeh zar‘ekh, velo yisafer merob.
wyamr lh mlak yhwh hnk hrh wyldt bn wqrat Smw ySmeal ky Sme yhwh al enyk and the angel-messanger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto her, behold, thou art with child and bear a child-between, and call his name ishmael-towards-hears; because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath heard thy affliction. vayomer lah mal’akh yhvh hinakh harah veyoladt ben, veqarat shemo yishma‘el ki shama‘ yhvh ’el ‘aneyekh.
whwa yhyh pra adm ydw bkl wyd kl bw wel pny kl axyw ySkn and he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man's hand against him; and he dwell in the presence of all his brethren. vehu yihyeh pere ’adam yado bakol veyad kol bo, ve‘al penei khal ’ekhav yishkon.
wtqra Sm yhwh hdbr alyh ath al ray ky amrh hgm hlm rayty axry ray and she called the name of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah that spake unto her, thou to-no-these seest me: for she said, have i also here looked after him that seeth me? vatiqra shem yhvh hadober ’eleha ’atah ’el ro’i, ki ’amerah hagam halom ra’iti ’akharei ro’i.
el kn qra lbar bar lxy ray hnh byn qdS wbyn brd wherefore the well was called roi-well-cheek-see-beer-welllahai; behold, it is between-bin kadesh-dedicated-finished and bered-hail. ‘al ken qara labe’er be’er lakhay ro’i, hineh ben qadesh uben bared.
wtld hgr labrm bn wyqra abrm Sm bnw aSr yldh hgr ySmeal and hagar-migrate conceived-of abram-boner a child-between: and abram-boner called his child-between's name, which hagar-migrate conceived-of, ishmael-towards-hears. vateled hagar le’abram ben, vayiqra ’abram shem beno ’asher yaledah hagar yishma‘el.
wabrm bn Smnym Snh wSS Snym bldt hgr at ySmeal labrm and abram-boner was fourscore and six years old, when hagar-migrate conceived-of ishmael-towards-hears to abram-boner. ve’abram ben shemonim shanah veshesh shanim, beledet hagar yishma‘el le’abram.
wyhy abrm bn tSeym Snh wtSe Snym wyra yhwh al abrm wyamr alyw any al Sdy hthlk lpny whyh tmym and when abram-boner was ninety years old and nine, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah appeared to abram-boner, and said unto him, i am the almighty to-no-these; walk before-turns me, and be thou perfect. vayhi ’abram ben tish‘im shanah vetesha‘ shanim, vayera yhvh ’el ’abram vayomer ’elav ’ani ’el shaday hithalekh lefanay vehyeh tamim.
watnh bryty byny wbynk warbh awtk bmad mad and i will make my covenant between-bin me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly. ve’etenah beriti beni ubenekha, ve’arbeh ’otkha bim’od me’od.
wypl abrm el pnyw wydbr atw alhym lamr and abram-boner fell on his face-turns: and to-no-these talked with him, saying, vayipol ’abram ‘al panav, vaydaber ’ito ’elohim lemor.
any hnh bryty atk whyyt lab hmwn gwym as for me, behold, my covenant is with thee, and thou be a father of many nations. ’ani hineh beriti ’itakh, vehayita le’ab hamon goyim.
wla yqra ewd at Smk abrm whyh Smk abrhm ky ab hmwn gwym nttyk neither thy name any more be called abram-boner, and thy name be abraham-their-dick; for a father of many nations have i made thee. velo yiqarei ‘od shimkha ’abram, vehayah shimkha ’abraham ki ’ab hamon goyim netatikha.
whprty atk bmad mad wnttyk lgwym wmlkym mmk yzaw and i will make thee exceeding fruitful, and i will make nations of thee, and king-molochs come out of thee. vehifreti ’otekha bim’od me’od unetatikha legoyim, umelakhim mimekha yeze’u.
whqmty at bryty byny wbynk wbyn crek axryk ldrtm lbryt ewlm lhywt lk lalhym wlcrek axryk and i will establish my covenant between-bin me and thee and thy seed after thee in their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a to-no-these unto thee, and to thy seed after thee. vahaqimoti beriti beni ubenekha uben zar‘akha ’akharekha ledorotam librit ‘olam, lihyot lekha lelohim ulezar‘akha ’akharekha.
wntty lk wlcrek axryk at arz mgryk at kl arz knen laxct ewlm whyyty lhm lalhym and i will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land wherein thou art a stranger, all the land of canaan-mobile-trade, for an everlasting possession; and i will be their to-no-these. venatati lekha ulezar‘akha ’akharekha ’erez megurekha kal ’erez kena‘an la’akhuzat ‘olam, vehayiti lahem lelohim.
wyamr alhym al abrhm wath at bryty tSmr ath wcrek axryk ldrtm and to-no-these said unto abraham-their-dick, thou keep my covenant therefore, thou, and thy seed after thee in their generations. vayomer ’elohim ’el ’abraham ve’atah beriti tishmor, ’atah vezar‘akha ’akharekha ledorotam.
cat bryty aSr tSmrw byny wbynykm wbyn crek axryk hmwl lkm kl ckr this is my covenant, which ye keep, between-bin me and you and thy seed after thee; every man child among you be scribe-circumcised. zot beriti ’asher tishmeru beni ubenekhem uben zar‘akha ’akharekha, himol lakhem kal zakhar.
wnmltm at bSr erltkm whyh lawt bryt byny wbynykm and ye scribe-circumcise the flesh of your foreskin; and it be a token of the covenant betwixt-bin me and you. unemaltem besar ‘arelatkhem, vehayah le’ot berit beni ubenekhem.
wbn Smnt ymym ymwl lkm kl ckr ldrtykm ylyd byt wmqnt ksp mkl bn nkr aSr la mcrek hwa and he that is eight days old be scribe-circumcised among you, every man child in your generations, he that is born in the daughter-house, or bought with money of any stranger, which is not of thy seed. uben shemonat yamim yimol lakhem kal zakhar ledorotekhem, yelid bayit umiqnat kesef mikol ben nekhar ’asher lo mizar‘akha hu.
hmwl ymwl ylyd bytk wmqnt kspk whyth bryty bbSrkm lbryt ewlm he that is born in thy daughter-house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be scribe-circumcised: and my covenant be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant. himol yimol yelid betekha umiqnat kaspekha, vehayetah beriti bibsarkhem librit ‘olam.
werl ckr aSr la ymwl at bSr erltw wnkrth hnpS hhwa memyh at bryty hpr and the foreskinned man child whose flesh of his foreskin is not scribe-circumcised, that being be cut off from his with-mum-people; he hath broken my covenant. ve‘arel zakhar ’asher lo yimol besar ‘arelato venikhretah hanefesh hahiv me‘ameha, beriti hefar.
wyamr alhym al abrhm Sry aStk la tqra at Smh Sry ky Srh Smh and to-no-these said unto abraham-their-dick, as for sarai-my-soakedness thy woman, no call her name sarai-my-soakedness, and sarah-her-soakedness her name be. vayomer ’elohim ’el ’abraham saray ’ishtekha lo tiqra shemah saray, ki sarah shemah.
wbrkty ath wgm ntty mmnh lk bn wbrktyh whyth lgwym mlky emym mmnh yhyw and i will knee-fluffy-bless her, and give thee a child-between also of her: yea, i will knee-fluffy-bless her, and she be a mother of nations; king-molochs of with-mum-people be of her. uberakhti ’otah vegam natati mimenah lekha ben, uberakhtiha vehayetah legoyim malkhei ‘amim mimenah yihyu.
wypl abrhm el pnyw wyzxq wyamr blbw hlbn mah Snh ywld wam Srh hbt tSeym Snh tld then abraham-their-dick fell upon his face-turns, and laughed, and said in his heart, a child be born unto him that is an hundred years old? and sarah-her-soakedness, that is ninety years old, bear? vayipol ’abraham ‘al panav vayizkhaq, vayomer belibo haleben me’ah shanah yivaled ve’im sarah habat tish‘im shanah teled.
wyamr abrhm al halhym lw ySmeal yxyh lpnyk and abraham-their-dick said unto to-no-these, o that ishmael-towards-hears might live before-turns thee! vayomer ’abraham ’el ha’elohim, lu yishma‘el yikhyeh lefanekha.
wyamr alhym abl Srh aStk yldt lk bn wqrat at Smw yzxq whqmty at bryty atw lbryt ewlm lcrew axryw and to-no-these said, sarah-her-soakedness thy woman bear thee a child-between indeed; and thou call his name isaac-laughter: and i will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him. vayomer ’elohim ’abal sarah ’ishtekha yoledet lekha ben veqarata shemo yizkhaq, vahaqimoti beriti ’ito librit ‘olam lezar‘o ’akharav.
wlySmeal Smetyk hnh brkty atw whpryty atw whrbyty atw bmad mad Snym eSr nSyam ywlyd wnttyw lgwy gdwl and as for ishmael-towards-hears, i have heard thee: behold, i have knee-fluffy-blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes he beget, and i will make him a great nation. uleyishma‘el shema‘tikha hineh berakhti ’oto vehifreti ’oto vehirbeti ’oto bim’od me’od, shenem ‘asar nesi’im yolid unetativ lego gadol.
wat bryty aqym at yzxq aSr tld lk Srh lmwed hch bSnh haxrt and my covenant will i establish with isaac-laughter, which sarah-her-soakedness bear unto thee at this set time in the next year. ve’et beriti ’aqim ’et yizkhaq, ’asher teled lekha sarah lamo‘ed hazeh bashanah ha’akheret.
wykl ldbr atw wyel alhym mel abrhm and he left off talking with him, and to-no-these went up from abraham-their-dick. vaykhal ledaber ’ito, vaya‘al ’elohim me‘al ’abraham.
wyqx abrhm at ySmeal bnw wat kl ylydy bytw wat kl mqnt kspw kl ckr banSy byt abrhm wyml at bSr erltm bezm hywm hch kaSr dbr atw alhym and abraham-their-dick took ishmael-towards-hears his child-between, and all that were born in his daughter-house, and all that were bought with his money, every rememberer among the men of abraham-their-dick's daughter-house; and scribe-circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the selfsame day, as to-no-these had said unto him. vayiqakh ’abraham yishma‘el beno ve’et kal yelidei beto ve’et kal miqnat kaspo kal zakhar be’anshei bet ’abraham, vayamal besar ‘arelatam be‘ezem hayom hazeh ka’asher diber ’ito ’elohim.
wabrhm bn tSeym wtSe Snh bhmlw bSr erltw and abraham-their-dick was ninety years old and nine, when he was scribe-circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. ve’abraham ben tish‘im vatesha‘ shanah, behimolo besar ‘arelato.
wySmeal bnw bn SlS eSrh Snh bhmlw at bSr erltw and ishmael-towards-hears his child-between was thirteen years old, when he was scribe-circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin. veyishma‘el beno ben shelosh ‘esreh shanah, behimolo besar ‘arelato.
bezm hywm hch nmwl abrhm wySmeal bnw in the selfsame day was abraham-their-dick scribe-circumcised, and ishmael-towards-hears his child-between. be‘ezem hayom hazeh nimol ’abraham, veyishma‘el beno.
wkl anSy bytw ylyd byt wmqnt ksp mat bn nkr nmlw atw and all the men of his daughter-house, born in the daughter-house, and bought with money of the stranger, were scribe-circumcised with him. vekhal ’anshei beto yelid bayit umiqnat kesef me’et ben nekhar, nimolu ’ito.
wyra alyw yhwh balny mmra whwa ySb ptx hahl kxm hywm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah appeared unto him in the plains of mamre-see-bitter: and he sat in the tent opening in the heat of the day; vayera ’elav yhvh be’elonei mamre, vehu yosheb petakh ha’ohel kekhom hayom.
wySa eynyw wyra whnh SlSh anSym nzbym elyw wyra wyrz lqratm mptx hahl wyStxw arzh and he lift up his eyes and looked, and, lo, three men stood by him: and when he saw them, he ran to until-witness them from the tent opening, and bowed himself toward the ground, vayisa ‘enav vayar vehineh sheloshah ’anashim nizabim ‘alav, vayar vayaraz liqratam mipetakh ha’ohel vayishtakhu ’arezah.
wyamr adny am na mzaty xn beynyk al na tebr mel ebdk and said, my yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, if now i have found favor in thy sight, pass not away, i pray thee, from thy worker: vayomar, ’adonay ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha ’al na ta‘abor me‘al ‘abdekha.
yqx na meT mym wrxzw rglykm whSenw txt hez let a little from-waters, i pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree: yuqakh na me‘at mayim verakhazu raglekhem, vehisha‘anu takhat ha‘ez.
waqxh pt lxm wsedw lbkm axr tebrw ky el kn ebrtm el ebdkm wyamrw kn teSh kaSr dbrt and i will fetch a morsel of bread, and comfort ye your hearts; after that ye pass on: for therefore are ye come to your worker. and they said, so do, as thou hast said. ve’eqkhah fat lekhem vesa‘adu libekhem ’akhar ta‘aboru ki ‘al ken ‘abartem ‘al ‘abdekhem, vayomeru ken ta‘aseh ka’asher dibarta.
wymhr abrhm hahlh al Srh wyamr mhry SlS saym qmx slt lwSy weSy egwt and abraham-their-dick hastened into the tent unto sarah-her-soakedness, and said, make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes upon the hearth. vaymaher ’abraham ha’ohelah ’el sarah, vayomer mahari shelosh se’im qemakh solet lushi va‘asi ‘ugot.
wal hbqr rz abrhm wyqx bn bqr rk wTwb wytn al hner wymhr leSwt atw and abraham-their-dick ran unto the visit-cattle, and fetched a calf tender and good, and gave it unto a young man; and he hasted to dress it. ve’el habaqar raz ’abraham, vayiqakh ben baqar rakh vatob vayiten ’el hana‘ar vaymaher la‘asot ’oto.
wyqx xmah wxlb wbn hbqr aSr eSh wytn lpnyhm whwa emd elyhm txt hez wyaklw and he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before-turns them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they did eat. vayiqakh khem’ah vekhalab uben habaqar ’asher ‘asah vayiten lifnehem, vehu ‘omed ‘alehem takhat ha‘ez vayokhelu.
wyamrw alyw ayh Srh aStk wyamr hnh bahl and they said unto him, where is sarah-her-soakedness thy woman? and he said, behold, in the tent. vayomeru ’elav ’ayeh sarah ’ishtekha, vayomer hineh ba’ohel.
wyamr Swb aSwb alyk ket xyh whnh bn lSrh aStk wSrh Smet ptx hahl whwa axryw and he said, i will certainly return unto thee according to the time of life; and, lo, sarah-her-soakedness thy woman have a child-between. and sarah-her-soakedness heard it in the tent opening, which was behind him. vayomer shob ’ashub ’elekha ka‘et khayah vehineh ben lesarah ’ishtekha, vesarah shoma‘at petakh ha’ohel vehu ’akharav.
wabrhm wSrh cqnym baym bymym xdl lhywt lSrh arx knSym now abraham-their-dick and sarah-her-soakedness were old and well stricken in age; and it ceased to be with sarah-her-soakedness after the manner of women. ve’abraham vesarah zeqenim ba’im bayamim, khadal lihyot lesarah ’orakh kanashim.
wtzxq Srh bqrbh lamr axry blty hyth ly ednh wadny cqn therefore sarah-her-soakedness laughed within herself, saying, after i am waxed old i have pleasure, my base-lord being old also? vatizkhaq sarah beqirbah lemor, ’akharei beloti hayetah li ‘ednah vadoni zaqen.
wyamr yhwh al abrhm lmh ch zxqh Srh lamr hap amnm ald wany cqnty and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto abraham-their-dick, wherefore did sarah-her-soakedness laugh, saying, i of a surety bear a child, which am old? vayomer yhvh ’el ’abraham, lamah zeh zakhaqah sarah lemor ha’af ’umnam ’eled va’ani zaqanti.
hypla myhwh dbr lmwed aSwb alyk ket xyh wlSrh bn is any thing too hard for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah? at the time appointed i will return unto thee, according to the time of life, and sarah-her-soakedness have a child-between. hayipalei yhvh dabar, lamo‘ed ’ashub ’elekha ka‘et khayah ulesarah ben.
wtkxS Srh lamr la zxqty ky yrah wyamr la ky zxqt then sarah-her-soakedness denied, saying, i laughed not; for she was afraid. and he said, nay; and thou didst laugh. vatekhakhesh sarah lemor lo zakhaqti ki yare’ah, vayomer lo ki zakhaqet.
wyqmw mSm hanSym wySqpw el pny sdm wabrhm hlk emm lSlxm and the men rose up from thence, and looked toward sodom-splint-blood: and abraham-their-dick went with them to bring them on the way. vayaqumu misham ha’anashim vayashqifu penei sedom, ve’abraham holekh ‘imam leshalekham.
wyhwh amr hmksh any mabrhm aSr any eSh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said, i hide from abraham-their-dick that thing which i do; yhvh ’amar, hamkhaseh ’ani me’abraham ’asher ’ani ‘oseh.
wabrhm hyw yhyh lgwy gdwl wezwm wnbrkw bw kl gwyy harz seeing that abraham-their-dick surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed in him? ve’abraham hayo yihyeh lego gadol ve‘azum, venibrekhu bo kol goyei ha’arez.
ky ydetyw lmen aSr yzwh at bnyw wat bytw axryw wSmrw drk yhwh leSwt zdqh wmSpT lmen hbya yhwh el abrhm at aSr dbr elyw for i hand-know him, that he will direct his children-betweens and his daughter-household after him, and they keep the way of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, to do being right and decision-grammar; that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah may bring upon abraham-their-dick that which he hath bee-spoken of him. ki yeda‘tiv lema‘an ’asher yezaveh banav ve’et beto ’akharav veshameru derekh yhvh la‘asot zedaqah umishpat, lema‘an habi yhvh ‘al ’abraham ’asher diber ‘alav.
wyamr yhwh ceqt sdm wemrh ky rbh wxTatm ky kbdh mad and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said, because the cry of sodom-splint-blood and gomorrah-sheaves is great, and because their miss is very grievous; vayomer yhvh za‘aqat sedom va‘amorah ki rabah, vekhatatam ki khabedah me’od.
ardh na warah hkzeqth hbah aly eSw klh wam la adeh i will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto me; and if not, i will hand-know. ’eradah na ve’er’eh hakeza‘aqatah haba’ah ’elay ‘asu kalah, ve’im lo ’eda‘ah.
wypnw mSm hanSym wylkw sdmh wabrhm ewdnw emd lpny yhwh and the men turned their face-turns-turns from thence, and went toward sodom-splint-blood: and abraham-their-dick stood yet before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vayifnu misham ha’anashim vayelekhu sedomah, ve’abraham ‘odenu ‘omed lifnei yhvh.
wygS abrhm wyamr hap tsph zdyq em rSe and abraham-their-dick drew near, and said, wilt thou also destroy the just with the wicked? vayigash ’abraham vayomar, ha’af tispeh zadiq ‘im rasha‘.
awly yS xmSym zdyqm btwk heyr hap tsph wla tSa lmqwm lmen xmSym hzdyqm aSr bqrbh peradventure there be fifty just within the light-city: wilt thou also destroy and not spare the place for the fifty just that are therein? ’ulay yesh khamishim zadiqim betokh ha‘ir, ha’af tispeh velo tisa lamaqom lema‘an khamishim hazadiqim ’asher beqirbah.
xllh lk meSt kdbr hch lhmyt zdyq em rSe whyh kzdyq krSe xllh lk hSpT kl harz la yeSh mSpT that be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the just with the wicked: and that the just should be as the wicked, that be far from thee: not the decide of all the earth do right? khalilah lekha me‘asot kadabar hazeh lehamit zadiq ‘im rasha‘ vehayah khazadiq karasha‘, khalilah lakh hashofet kal ha’arez lo ya‘aseh mishpat.
wyamr yhwh am amza bsdm xmSym zdyqm btwk heyr wnSaty lkl hmqwm bebwrm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said, if i find in sodom-splint-blood fifty just within the light-city, then i will spare all the place for their sakes. vayomer yhvh ’im ’emza bisdom khamishim zadiqim betokh ha‘ir, venasati lekhal hamaqom ba‘aburam.
wyen abrhm wyamr hnh na hwalty ldbr al adny wanky epr wapr and abraham-their-dick answered and said, behold now, i have taken upon me to speak unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, which am and dust and ashes: vaya‘an ’abraham vayomar, hineh na ho’alti ledaber ’el ’adonay ve’anokhi ‘afar va’efer.
awly yxsrwn xmSym hzdyqm xmSh htSxyt bxmSh at kl heyr wyamr la aSxyt am amza Sm arbeym wxmSh peradventure there lack five of the fifty just: wilt thou destroy all the light-city for lack of five? and he said, if i find there forty and five, i will not destroy it. ’ulay yakhserun khamishim hazadiqim khamishah hatashkhit bakhamishah kal ha‘ir, vayomer lo ’ashkhit ’im ’emza sham ’arba‘im vakhamishah.
wysp ewd ldbr alyw wyamr awly ymzawn Sm arbeym wyamr la aeSh bebwr harbeym and he spake unto him yet again, and said, peradventure there be forty found there. and he said, i will not do it for forty's sake. vayosef ‘od ledaber ’elav vayomar ’ulay yimaze’un sham ’arba‘im, vayomer lo ’e‘eseh ba‘abur ha’arba‘im.
wyamr al na yxr ladny wadbrh awly ymzawn Sm SlSym wyamr la aeSh am amza Sm SlSym and he said unto him, oh let not yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah be angry, and i will speak: peradventure there thirty be found there. and he said, i will not do it, if i find thirty there. vayomer ’al na yikhar ladonay va’adaberah ’ulay yimaze’un sham sheloshim, vayomer lo ’e‘eseh ’im ’emza sham sheloshim.
wyamr hnh na hwalty ldbr al adny awly ymzawn Sm eSrym wyamr la aSxyt bebwr heSrym and he said, behold now, i have taken upon me to speak unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: peradventure there be double-ten-twenty found there. and he said, i will not destroy it for double-ten-twenty's sake. vayomer hineh na ho’alti ledaber ’el ’adonay ’ulay yimaze’un sham ‘esrim, vayomer lo ’ashkhit ba‘abur ha‘esrim.
wyamr al na yxr ladny wadbrh ak hpem awly ymzawn Sm eSrh wyamr la aSxyt bebwr heSrh and he said, oh let not yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah be angry, and i will speak yet and this once: peradventure ten be found there. and he said, i will not destroy it for ten's sake. vayomer ’al na yikhar ladonay va’adaberah ’akh hapa‘am ’ulay yimaze’un sham ‘asarah, vayomer lo ’ashkhit ba‘abur ha‘asarah.
wylk yhwh kaSr klh ldbr al abrhm wabrhm Sb lmqmw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah went his way, as soon as he had left communing with abraham-their-dick: and abraham-their-dick returned unto his place. vayelekh yhvh ka’asher kilah ledaber ’el ’abraham, ve’abraham shab limqomo.
wybaw Sny hmlakym sdmh berb wlwT ySb bSer sdm wyra lwT wyqm lqratm wyStxw apym arzh and there came two angel-messangers to sodom-splint-blood at even; and lot-cover sat in the hair-gate of sodom-splint-blood: and lot-cover seeing them rose up to until-witness them; and he bowed himself with his face-turns toward the ground; vayabo’u shenei hamal’akhim sedomah ba‘ereb velot yosheb besha‘ar sedom, vayar lot vayaqam liqratam vayishtakhu ’apayim ’arezah.
wyamr hnh na adny swrw na al byt ebdkm wlynw wrxzw rglykm whSkmtm whlktm ldrkkm wyamrw la ky brxwb nlyn and he said, behold now, my base-lords, turn in, i pray you, into your worker's daughter-house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye rise up early, and go on your ways. and they said, nay; and we will abide in the street all night. vayomer hineh na ’adonay suru na ’el bet ‘abdekhem velinu verakhazu raglekhem vehishkamtem vahalakhtem ledarkekhem, vayomeru lo ki barekhob nalin.
wypzr bm mad wysrw alyw wybaw al bytw wyeS lhm mSth wmzwt aph wyaklw and he pressed upon them greatly; and they turned in unto him, and entered into his daughter-house; and he made them a until-conception, and did bake lit-mazat, and they did eat. vayifzar bam me’od vayasuru ’elav vayabo’u ’el beto, vaya‘as lahem mishteh umazot ’afah vayokhelu.
Trm ySkbw wanSy heyr anSy sdm nsbw el hbyt mner wed cqn kl hem mqzh and before-turns they lay down, the men of the light-city, even the men of sodom-splint-blood, compassed the daughter-house round, both old and young, all the with-mum-people from every quarter: terem yishkabu ve’anshei ha‘ir ’anshei sedom nasabu ‘al habayit mina‘ar ve‘ad zaqen, kal ha‘am miqazeh.
wyqraw al lwT wyamrw lw ayh hanSym aSr baw alyk hlylh hwzyam alynw wndeh atm and they called unto lot-cover, and said unto him, where are the men which came in to thee this night? bring them out unto us, that we may hand-know them. vayiqre’u ’el lot vayomeru lo ’ayeh ha’anashim ’asher ba’u ’elekha halayelah, hozi’em ’elenu venede‘ah ’otam.
wyza alhm lwT hptxh whdlt sgr axryw and lot-cover went out at the opening unto them, and shut the opening after him, vayezei ’alehem lot hapetkhah, vehadelet sagar ’akharav.
wyamr al na axy trew and said, i pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly. vayomar, ’al na ’akhay tare‘u.
hnh na ly Sty bnwt aSr la ydew ayS awzyah na athn alykm weSw lhn kTwb beynykm rq lanSym hal al teSw dbr ky el kn baw bzl qrty behold now, i have two pierced children-betweens-bin which have not hand-known man; let me, i pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes: only unto these men do nothing; for therefore came they under the shadow of my roof. hineh na li shetei banot ’asher lo yade‘u ’ish ’ozi’ah na ’ethen ’alekhem va‘asu lahen katob be‘enekhem, raq la’anashim ha’el ’al ta‘asu dabar ki ‘al ken ba’u bezel qorati.
wyamrw gS hlah wyamrw haxd ba lgwr wySpT SpwT eth nre lk mhm wypzrw bayS blwT mad wygSw lSbr hdlt and they said, stand back. and they said again, this one fellow came in to sojourn, and he will needs be a decide: now will we deal worse with thee, than with them. and they pressed sore upon the man, even lot-cover, and came near to break the opening. vayomeru gesh hale’ah vayomeru ha’ekhad ba lagur vayishpot shafot ‘atah nara‘ lekha mehem, vayifzeru ba’ish belot me’od vayigeshu lishbor hadalet.
wySlxw hanSym at ydm wybyaw at lwT alyhm hbyth wat hdlt sgrw and the men put forth their hand, and pulled lot-cover into the daughter-house to them, and shut to the opening. vayishlekhu ha’anashim yadam vayabi’u lot ’alehem habayetah, ve’et hadelet sagaru.
wat hanSym aSr ptx hbyt hkw bsnwrym mqTn wed gdwl wylaw lmza hptx and they smote the men that were at the opening of the daughter-house with blindness, both small and great: so that they wearied themselves to find the opening. ve’et ha’anashim ’asher petakh habayit hiku basanverim miqaton ve‘ad gadol, vayil’u limzo hapatakh.
wyamrw hanSym al lwT ed my lk ph xtn wbnyk wbntyk wkl aSr lk beyr hwza mn hmqwm and the men said unto lot-cover, hast thou here any besides? child-between in teaching, and thy children-betweens, and thy children-betweenesss, and whatsoever thou hast in the light-city, bring them out of this place: vayomeru ha’anashim ’el lot ‘od mi lekha foh khatan ubanekha ubenotekha vekhol ’asher lekha ba‘ir, hozei min hamaqom.
ky mSxtym anxnw at hmqwm hch ky gdlh zeqtm at pny yhwh wySlxnw yhwh lSxth for we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxen great before-turns the face-turns of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath sent us to destroy it. ki mashkhitim ’anakhnu hamaqom hazeh, ki gadelah za‘aqatam ’et penei yhvh vayshalekhenu yhvh leshakhatah.
wyza lwT wydbr al xtnyw lqxy bntyw wyamr qwmw zaw mn hmqwm hch ky mSxyt yhwh at heyr wyhy kmzxq beyny xtnyw and lot-cover went out, and spake unto his children-betweens-in-teaching, which married his children-betweenesss, and said, up, get you out of this place; for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah will destroy this light-city. and he seemed as one that mocked unto his children-betweens-in-teaching. vayezei lot vaydaber ’el khatanav loqekhei benotav vayomer qumu ze’u min hamaqom hazeh ki mashkhit yhvh ha‘ir, vayhi khimzakheq be‘enei khatanav.
wkmw hSxr elh wyayzw hmlakym blwT lamr qwm qx at aStk wat Sty bntyk hnmzat pn tsph bewn heyr and when the morning arose, then the angel-messangers hastened lot-cover, saying, arise, take thy woman, and thy two children-betweenesss, which are here; lest thou be consumed in the torment of the light-city. ukhemo hashakhar ‘alah vaya’izu hamal’akhim belot lemor, qum qakh ’ishtekha ve’et shetei benotekha hanimza’ot pen tisafeh ba‘avon ha‘ir.
wytmhmh wyxcqw hanSym bydw wbyd aStw wbyd Sty bntyw bxmlt yhwh elyw wyzahw wynxhw mxwz leyr and while he lingered, the men laid hold upon his hand, and upon the hand of his woman, and upon the hand of his two children-betweenesss; yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah being merciful unto him: and they brought him forth, and set him without the light-city. vayitmahmah vayakhaziqu ha’anashim beyado ubeyad ’ishto ubeyad shetei benotav bekhemlat yhvh ‘alav, vayozi’uhu vayanikhuhu mikhuz la‘ir.
wyhy khwzyam atm hxwzh wyamr hmlT el npSk al tbyT axryk wal temd bkl hkkr hhrh hmlT pn tsph and it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that he said, escape for thy life; look not behind thee, neither stay thou in all the plain; escape to the mountain, lest thou be consumed. vayhi khehozi’am ’otam hakhuzah vayomer himalet ‘al nafshekha ’al tabit ’akharekha ve’al ta‘amod bekhal hakikar, haharah himalet pen tisafeh.
wyamr lwT alhm al na adny and lot-cover said unto them, oh, not so, my base-lord: vayomer lot ’alehem, ’al na ’adonay.
hnh na mza ebdk xn beynyk wtgdl xsdk aSr eSyt emdy lhxywt at npSy wanky la awkl lhmlT hhrh pn tdbqny hreh wmty behold now, thy worker hath found attractiveness in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast showed unto me in saving my life; and i cannot escape to the mountain, lest some bad take me, and i die: hineh na maza ‘abdekha khen be‘enekha vatagdel khasdekha ’asher ‘asita ‘imadi lehakhayot nafshi, ve’anokhi lo ’ukhal lehimalet haharah pen tidbaqani hara‘ah vamati.
hnh na heyr hcat qrbh lnws Smh whya mzer amlTh na Smh hla mzer hwa wtxy npSy behold now, this light-city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one: oh, let me escape thither, (is it not a little one?) and my being live. hineh na ha‘ir hazot qerobah lanus shamah vehi miz‘ar, ’imaletah na shamah halo miz‘ar hi utekhi nafshi.
wyamr alyw hnh nSaty pnyk gm ldbr hch lblty hpky at heyr aSr dbrt and he said unto him, see, i have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that i will not overthrow this light-city, for the which thou hast bee-spoken. vayomer ’elav hineh nasati fanekha gam ladabar hazeh, lebilti hafeki ha‘ir ’asher dibarta.
mhr hmlT Smh ky la awkl leSwt dbr ed bak Smh el kn qra Sm heyr zwer haste thee, escape thither; for i cannot do anything till thou be come thither. therefore the name of the light-city was called zoar-grief. maher himalet shamah ki lo ’ukhal la‘asot dabar ‘ad bo’akha shamah, ‘al ken qara shem ha‘ir zo‘ar.
hSmS yza el harz wlwT ba zerh the sun was risen upon the earth when lot-cover entered into zoar-grief. hashemesh yaza ‘al ha’arez, velot ba zo‘arah.
wyhwh hmTyr el sdm wel emrh gpryt waS mat yhwh mn hSmym then yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah rained upon sodom-splint-blood and upon gomorrah-sheaves brimstone and fire from yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah out of namespaces; yhvh himtir ‘al sedom ve‘al ‘amorah gaferit va’esh, me’et yhvh min hashamayim.
wyhpk at herym hal wat kl hkkr wat kl ySby herym wzmx hadmh and he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground. vayahafokh he‘arim ha’el ve’et kal hakikar, ve’et kal yoshebei he‘arim vezemakh ha’adamah.
wtbT aStw maxryw wthy nzyb mlx and his woman looked back from behind him, and she became a page-column-erection of salt. vatabet ’ishto me’akharav, vatehi nezib melakh.
wySkm abrhm bbqr al hmqwm aSr emd Sm at pny yhwh and abraham-their-dick gat up early in the morning to the place where he stood before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: vayashkem ’abraham baboqer, ’el hamaqom ’asher ‘amad penei yhvh.
wySqp el pny sdm wemrh wel kl pny arz hkkr wyra whnh elh qyTr harz kqyTr hkbSn and he looked toward sodom-splint-blood and gomorrah-sheaves, and toward all the land of the plain, and beheld, and, lo, the smoke of the country went up as the smoke of a furnace. vayashqef ‘al penei sedom va‘amorah ve‘al kal ’erez hakikar, vayar vehineh ‘alah qitor ha’arez keqitor hakibshan.
wyhy bSxt alhym at ery hkkr wyckr alhym at abrhm wySlx at lwT mtwk hhpkh bhpk at herym aSr ySb bhn lwT and it came to pass, when to-no-these destroyed the cities of the plain, that to-no-these remembered abraham-their-dick, and sent lot-cover out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in the which lot-cover dwelt. vayhi beshakhet ’elohim ‘arei hakikar vayizkor ’elohim ’abraham, vayshalakh lot mitokh hahafekhah bahafokh he‘arim ’asher yashab bahen lot.
wyel lwT mzwer wySb bhr wSty bntyw emw ky yra lSbt bzwer wySb bmerh hwa wSty bntyw and lot-cover went up out of zoar-grief, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two children-betweenesss with him; for he feared to dwell in zoar-grief: and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two children-betweenesss. vaya‘al lot mizo‘ar vayesheb bahar ushetei benotav ‘imo ki yarei lashebet bezo‘ar, vayesheb bame‘arah hu ushetei benotav.
wtamr hbkyrh al hzeyrh abynw cqn wayS ayn barz lbwa elynw kdrk kl harz and the firstborn said unto the younger, our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth: vatomer habekhirah ’el haze‘irah ’abinu zaqen, ve’ish ’en ba’arez labo ‘alenu kederekh kal ha’arez.
lkh nSqh at abynw yyn wnSkbh emw wnxyh mabynw cre come, let us make our father drink wine-inherit, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father. lekhah nashqeh ’abinu yayin venishkebah ‘imo, unekhayeh me’abinu zara‘.
wtSqyn at abyhn yyn blylh hwa wtba hbkyrh wtSkb at abyh wla yde bSkbh wbqwmh and they made their father drink wine-inherit that night: and the firstborn went in, and lay with her father; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose. vatashqena ’abihen yayin balaylah hu, vatabo habekhirah vatishkab ’et ’abiha velo yada‘ beshikhbah ubequmah
wyhy mmxrt wtamr hbkyrh al hzeyrh hn Skbty amS at aby nSqnw yyn gm hlylh wbay Skby emw wnxyh mabynw cre and it came to pass on the morrow, that the firstborn said unto the younger, behold, i lay yesternight with my father: let us make him drink wine-inherit this night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father. vayhi mimakhorat vatomer habekhirah ’el haze‘irah hen shakhabti ’emesh ’et ’abi, nashqenu yayin gam halaylah ubo’i shikhbi ‘imo unekhayeh me’abinu zara‘.
wtSqyn gm blylh hhwa at abyhn yyn wtqm hzeyrh wtSkb emw wla yde bSkbh wbqmh and they made their father drink wine-inherit that night also: and the younger arose, and lay with him; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose. vatashqena gam balaylah hahu ’abihen yayin, vataqam haze‘irah vatishkab ‘imo velo yada‘ beshikhbah ubequmah.
wthryn Sty bnwt lwT mabyhn thus were both children-betweenesss of lot-cover with child by their father. vataharena shetei benot lot me’abihen.
wtld hbkyrh bn wtqra Smw mwab hwa aby mwab ed hywm and the first born conceived-of a child-between, and called his name moab-from-father: the same is the father of the moab-from-fatherites unto this day. vateled habekhirah ben vatiqra shemo mo’ab, hu ’abi mo’ab ‘ad hayom.
whzeyrh gm hwa yldh bn wtqra Smw bn emy hwa aby bny emwn ed hywm and the younger, she also conceived-of a child-between, and called his name me-between-with: the same is the father of children-betweens of ammon-with unto this day. vehaze‘irah gam hi yaledah ben vatiqra shemo ‘ami, hu ’abi bene ‘amon ‘ad hayom.
wyse mSm abrhm arzh hngb wySb byn qdS wbyn Swr wygr bgrr and abraham-their-dick journeyed from thence toward the south-dry country, and dwelled between-bin kadesh-dedicated-finished and shur-wall, and sojourned in gera-strangerr-tow. vayisa‘ misham ’abraham ’arzah hanegeb vayesheb ben qadesh uben shur, vayagar bigrar.
wyamr abrhm al Srh aStw axty hwa wySlx abymlk mlk grr wyqx at Srh and abraham-their-dick said of sarah-her-soakedness his woman, she is my sister: and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch king of gera-strangerr-tow sent, and took sarah-her-soakedness. vayomer ’abraham ’el sarah ’ishto ’akhoti hi vayishlakh ’abimelekh melekh gerar vayiqakh sarah.
wyba alhym al abymlk bxlwm hlylh wyamr lw hnk mt el haSh aSr lqxt whwa belt bel and to-no-these came to abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch in a dream by night, and said to him, behold, thou art and a dead man, for the woman which thou hast taken; for she is a man's woman. vayabo ’elohim ’el ’abimelekh bakhalom halayelah, vayomer lo hinekha met ‘al ha’ishah ’asher laqakhta vehiv be‘ulat ba‘al.
wabymlk la qrb alyh wyamr adny hgwy gm zdyq thrg and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch had not come near her: and he said, my base-lord, wilt thou slay also a just nation? va’abimelekh lo qarab ’eleha, vayomar ’adonay hago gam zadiq taharog.
hla hwa amr ly axty hwa whya gm hwa amrh axy hwa btm lbby wbnqyn kpy eSyty cat said he not unto me, she is my sister? and she, even she herself said, he is my brother: in the integrity of my heart and innocency of my hands have i done this. halo hu ’amar li ’akhoti hi vehi gam hi ’amerah ’akhi hu, betam lebabi ubeniqyon kapay ‘asiti zot.
wyamr alyw halhym bxlm gm anky ydety ky btm lbbk eSyt cat waxSk gm anky awtk mxTw ly el kn la nttyk lnge alyh and to-no-these said unto him in a dream, yea, i hand-know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for i also withheld thee from missing against me: therefore suffered i thee not to touch her. vayomer ’elav ha’elohim bakhalom gam ’anokhi yada‘ti ki betam lebabekha ‘asita zot va’ekhsokh gam ’anokhi ’otkha mekhato li, ‘al ken lo netatikha lingoa‘ ’eleha.
weth hSb aSt hayS ky nbya hwa wytpll bedk wxyh wam aynk mSyb de ky mwt tmwt ath wkl aSr lk now therefore restore the man his woman; for he is a bringer, and he pray for thee, and thou live: and if thou restore her not, hand-know thou that thou surely die, thou, and all that are thine. ve‘atah hasheb ’eshet ha’ish ki nabi hu veyitpalel ba‘adkha vekhyeh, ve’im ’enekha meshib da‘ ki mot tamut ’atah vekhal ’asher lakh.
wySkm abymlk bbqr wyqra lkl ebdyw wydbr at kl hdbrym halh bacnyhm wyyraw hanSym mad therefore abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch rose early in the morning, and called all his workers, and told all these things in their ears: and the men were sore afraid. vayashkem ’abimelekh baboqer vayiqra lekhal ‘abadav vaydaber kal hadebarim ha’eleh be’azenehem, vayire’u ha’anashim me’od.
wyqra abymlk labrhm wyamr lw mh eSyt lnw wmh xTaty lk ky hbat ely wel mmlkty xTah gdlh meSym aSr la yeSw eSyt emdy then abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch called abraham-their-dick, and said unto him, what hast thou done unto us? and what have i offended thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my king-molochdom a great miss? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done. vayiqra ’abimelekh le’abraham vayomer lo meh ‘asita lanu umeh khatati lakh ki hebeta ‘alay ve‘al mamlakhti khata’ah gedolah, ma‘asim ’asher lo ye‘asu ‘asita ‘imadi.
wyamr abymlk al abrhm mh rayt ky eSyt at hdbr hch and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch said unto abraham-their-dick, what sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing? vayomer ’abimelekh ’el ’abraham, mah ra’ita ki ‘asita hadabar hazeh.
wyamr abrhm ky amrty rq ayn yrat alhym bmqwm hch whrgwny el dbr aSty and abraham-their-dick said, because i thought, surely the fear of to-no-these is not in this place; and they will slay me for my woman's sake. vayomer ’abraham ki ’amarti raq ’en yir’at ’elohim bamaqom hazeh, vaharaguni ‘al debar ’ishti.
wgm amnh axty bt aby hwa ak la bt amy wthy ly laSh and yet indeed she is my sister; she is the daughter-hoof-bat-child of my father, and not the daughter-hoof-bat-child of my mother; and she became my woman. vegam ’amenah ’akhoti bat ’abi hi ’akh lo bat ’imi, vatehi li le’ishah.
wyhy kaSr htew aty alhym mbyt aby wamr lh ch xsdk aSr teSy emdy al kl hmqwm aSr nbwa Smh amry ly axy hwa and it came to pass, when to-no-these caused me to wander from my father's daughter-house, that i said unto her, this is thy kindness which thou show unto me; at every place whither we come, say of me, he is my brother. vayhi ka’asher hit‘u ’oti ’elohim mibet ’abi va’omar lah zeh khasdekh ’asher ta‘asi ‘imadi, ’el kal hamaqom ’asher nabo shamah ’imri li ’akhi hu.
wyqx abymlk zan wbqr webdym wSpxt wytn labrhm wySb lw at Srh aStw and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch took sheep, and wall-oxen, and workers, and familiars, and gave them unto abraham-their-dick, and restored him sarah-her-soakedness his woman. vayiqakh ’abimelekh zon ubaqar va‘abadim ushefakhot vayiten le’abraham, vayasheb lo sarah ’ishto.
wyamr abymlk hnh arzy lpnyk bTwb beynyk Sb and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch said, behold, my land is before-turns thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee. vayomer ’abimelekh hineh ’arzi lefanekha, batob be‘enekha sheb.
wlSrh amr hnh ntty alp ksp laxyk hnh hwa lk kswt eynym lkl aSr atk wat kl wnkxt and unto sarah-her-soakedness he said, behold, i have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver: behold, he is to thee a covering of the eyes, unto all that are with thee, and with all other: thus she was reproved. ulesarah ’amar hineh natati ’elef kesef le’akhikh hineh hu lakh kesut ‘enayim lekhol ’asher ’itakh, ve’et kol venokhakhat.
wytpll abrhm al halhym wyrpa alhym at abymlk wat aStw wamhtyw wyldw so abraham-their-dick prayed unto to-no-these: and to-no-these healed abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch, and his woman, and his maid-mothers; and they conceived-of children. vayitpalel ’abraham ’el ha’elohim, vayirpa ’elohim ’abimelekh ve’et ’ishto ve’amhotav vayeledu.
ky ezr ezr yhwh bed kl rxm lbyt abymlk el dbr Srh aSt abrhm for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had fast closed up all the wombs of the daughter-house of abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch, because of sarah-her-soakedness abraham-their-dick's woman. ki ‘azor ‘azar yhvh kal rekhem lebet ’abimelekh, ‘al debar sarah ’eshet ’abraham.
wyhwh pqd at Srh kaSr amr wyeS yhwh lSrh kaSr dbr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah visited sarah-her-soakedness as he had said, and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah did unto sarah-her-soakedness as he had bee-spoken. yhvh paqad sarah ka’asher ’amar, vaya‘as yhvh lesarah ka’asher diber.
wthr wtld Srh labrhm bn lcqnyw lmwed aSr dbr atw alhym for sarah-her-soakedness conceived, and conceived-of abraham-their-dick a child-between in his old age, at the set time of which to-no-these had bee-spoken to him. vatahar vateled sarah le’abraham ben lizqunav, lamo‘ed ’asher diber ’oto ’elohim.
wyqra abrhm at Sm bnw hnwld lw aSr yldh lw Srh yzxq and abraham-their-dick called the name of his child-between that was born unto him, whom sarah-her-soakedness conceived-of to him, isaac-laughter. vayiqra ’abraham shem beno hanolad lo ’asher yaledah lo sarah yizkhaq.
wyml abrhm at yzxq bnw bn Smnt ymym kaSr zwh atw alhym and abraham-their-dick scribe-circumcised his child-between isaac-laughter being eight days old, as to-no-these had direct him. vayamal ’abraham yizkhaq beno ben shemonat yamim, ka’asher zivah ’oto ’elohim.
wabrhm bn mat Snh bhwld lw at yzxq bnw and abraham-their-dick was an hundred years old, when his child-between isaac-laughter was born unto him. ve’abraham ben me’at shanah, behivaled lo yizkhaq beno.
wtamr Srh zxq eSh ly alhym kl hSme yzxq ly and sarah-her-soakedness said, to-no-these hath made me to laugh, so that all that hear will laugh with me. vatomer sarah zekhoq ‘asah li ’elohim, kal hashomea‘ yizkhaq li.
wtamr my mll labrhm hynyqh bnym Srh ky yldty bn lcqnyw and she said, who would have said unto abraham-their-dick, that sarah-her-soakedness should have given children-betweens suck? for i have born him a child-between in his old age. vatomer mi milel le’abraham heniqah banim sarah, ki yaladti ben lizqunav.
wygdl hyld wygml wyeS abrhm mSth gdwl bywm hgml at yzxq and child grew, and was weaned: and abraham-their-dick made a great until-conception the same day that isaac-laughter was weaned. vayigdal hayeled vayigamal, vaya‘as ’abraham mishteh gadol beyom higamel yizkhaq.
wtra Srh at bn hgr hmzryt aSr yldh labrhm mzxq and sarah-her-soakedness saw child-between of hagar-migrate the mizraim-narrowsian, which she had born unto abraham-their-dick, mocking. vatere sarah ben hagar hamizrit ’asher yaledah le’abraham mezakheq.
wtamr labrhm grS hamh hcat wat bnh ky la yyrS bn hamh hcat em bny em yzxq wherefore she said unto abraham-their-dick, cast out this bondwoman and her child-between: for child-between of this bondwoman not be heir with my child-between, even with isaac-laughter. vatomer le’abraham garesh ha’amah hazot ve’et benah, ki lo yirash ben ha’amah hazot ‘im beni ‘im yizkhaq.
wyre hdbr mad beyny abrhm el awdt bnw and the thing was very grievous in abraham-their-dick's sight because of his child-between. vayera‘ hadabar me’od be‘enei ’abraham, ‘al ’odot beno.
wyamr alhym al abrhm al yre beynyk el hner wel amtk kl aSr tamr alyk Srh Sme bqlh ky byzxq yqra lk cre and to-no-these said unto abraham-their-dick, let it not be grievous in thy sight because of the lad, and because of thy bondwoman; in all that sarah-her-soakedness hath said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in isaac-laughter thy seed be called. vayomer ’elohim ’el ’abraham ’al yera‘ be‘enekha ‘al hana‘ar ve‘al ’amatekha kol ’asher tomar ’elekha sarah shema‘ beqolah, ki beyizkhaq yiqarei lekha zara‘.
wgm at bn hamh lgwy aSymnw ky crek hwa and also of child-between of the bondwoman will i make a nation, because he is thy seed. vegam ben ha’amah lego ’asimenu, ki zar‘akha hu.
wySkm abrhm bbqr wyqx lxm wxmt mym wytn al hgr Sm el Skmh wat hyld wySlxh wtlk wtte bmdbr bar Sbe and abraham-their-dick rose up early in the morning, and took bread, and a bottle of from-waters, and gave it unto hagar-migrate, putting it on her shoulder, and child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wandered in the place-of-word-desert of beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear. vayashkem ’abraham baboqer vayiqakh lekhem vekhemat mayim vayiten ’el hagar sam ‘al shikhmah ve’et hayeled vayshalekheha, vatelekh vateta‘ bemidbar be’er shaba‘.
wyklw hmym mn hxmt wtSlk at hyld txt axd hSyxm and the from-waters was spent in the bottle, and she cast child under one of the shrubs. vayikhlu hamayim min hakhemet, vatashlekh hayeled takhat ’akhad hasikhim.
wtlk wtSb lh mngd hrxq kmTxwy qSt ky amrh al arah bmwt hyld wtSb mngd wtSa at qlh wtbk and she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off, as it were a bow shot: for she said, let me not see the death of child. and she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept. vatelekh vatesheb lah mineged harkheq kimtakhavei qeshet ki ’amerah ’al ’er’eh bemot hayaled, vatesheb mineged vatisa qolah vatebek.
wySme alhym at qwl hner wyqra mlak alhym al hgr mn hSmym wyamr lh mh lk hgr al tyray ky Sme alhym al qwl hner baSr hwa Sm and to-no-these heard the voice of the lad; and the angel-messanger of to-no-these called to hagar-migrate out of namespaces, and said unto her, what ai-islandleth thee, hagar-migrate? fear not; for to-no-these hath heard the voice of the lad where he is. vayishma‘ ’elohim qol hana‘ar vayiqra mal’akh ’elohim ’el hagar min hashamayim vayomer lah mah lakh hagar, ’al tire’i ki shama‘ ’elohim ’el qol hana‘ar ba’asher hu sham.
qwmy Say at hner whxcyqy at ydk bw ky lgwy gdwl aSymnw arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for i will make him a great nation. qumi se’i hana‘ar vehakhaziqi yadekh bo, ki lego gadol ’asimenu.
wypqx alhym at eynyh wtra bar mym wtlk wtmla at hxmt mym wtSq at hner and to-no-these opened her eyes, and she saw a well of from-waters; and she went, and filled the bottle with from-waters, and gave the lad drink. vayifqakh ’elohim ‘eneha vatere be’er mayim, vatelekh vatemalei hakhemet mayim vatashq hana‘ar.
wyhy alhym at hner wygdl wySb bmdbr wyhy rbh qSt and to-no-these was with the lad; and he grew, and dwelt in the place-of-word-desert, and became an archer. vayhi ’elohim ’et hana‘ar vayigdal, vayesheb bamidbar vayhi robeh qashat.
wySb bmdbr parn wtqx lw amw aSh marz mzrym and he dwelt in the place-of-word-desert of paran-magnificence: and his mother took him a woman out of the land of mizraim-narrows. vayesheb bemidbar paran, vatiqakh lo ’imo ’ishah me’erez mizrayim.
wyhy bet hhwa wyamr abymlk wpykl Sr zbaw al abrhm lamr alhym emk bkl aSr ath eSh and it came to pass at that time, that abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch and phichol-mouth-of-all the chief captain of his troop-cluster spake unto abraham-their-dick, saying, to-no-these is with thee in all that thou doest: vayhi ba‘et hahiv vayomer ’abimelekh ufikhol sar zeba’o ’el ’abraham lemor, ’elohim ‘imekha bekhol ’asher ’atah ‘oseh.
weth hSbeh ly balhym hnh am tSqr ly wlnyny wlnkdy kxsd aSr eSyty emk teSh emdy wem harz aSr grth bh now therefore swear unto me here by to-no-these that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my child-between, nor with my child-between's child-between: and according to the kindness that i have done unto thee, thou do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned. ve‘atah hishabe‘ah li belohim henah ’im tishqor li ulenini ulenekhdi, kakhesed ’asher ‘asiti ‘imekha ta‘aseh ‘imadi ve‘im ha’arez ’asher gartah bah.
wyamr abrhm anky aSbe and abraham-their-dick said, i will swear. vayomer ’abraham ’anokhi ’ishabea‘.
whwkx abrhm at abymlk el adwt bar hmym aSr gclw ebdy abymlk and abraham-their-dick reproved abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch because of a well of from-waters, which abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch's workers had violently taken away. vehokhiakh ’abraham ’abimelekh, ’odot be’er hamayim ’asher gazelu ‘abdei ’abimelekh.
wyamr abymlk la ydety my eSh at hdbr hch wgm ath la hgdt ly wgm anky la Smety blty hywm and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch said, i wot not who hath done this thing; neither didst thou tell me, neither yet heard i of it, and to day. vayomer ’abimelekh lo yada‘ti mi ‘asah hadabar hazeh, vegam ’atah lo higadta li vegam ’anokhi lo shama‘ti bilti hayom.
wyqx abrhm zan wbqr wytn labymlk wykrtw Snyhm bryt and abraham-their-dick took sheep and wall-oxen, and gave them unto abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch; and both of them made a covenant. vayiqakh ’abraham zon ubaqar vayiten la’abimelekh, vayikhretu shenehem berit.
wyzb abrhm at Sbe kbSt hzan lbdhn and abraham-their-dick set seven ewe lambs of the flock by themselves. vayazeb ’abraham sheba‘ kibsot hazon lebadehen.
wyamr abymlk al abrhm mh hnh Sbe kbSt halh aSr hzbt lbdnh and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch said unto abraham-their-dick, what mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set by themselves? vayomer ’abimelekh ’el ’abraham, mah henah sheba‘ kebasot ha’eleh ’asher hizabta lebadanah.
wyamr ky at Sbe kbSt tqx mydy bebwr thyh ly ledh ky xprty at hbar hcat and he said, for these seven ewe lambs thou take of my hand, that they may be a witness unto me, that i have digged this well. vayomer ki sheba‘ kebasot tiqakh miyadi, ba‘abur tihyeh li le‘edah ki khafarti habe’er hazot.
el kn qra lmqwm hhwa bar Sbe ky Sm nSbew Snyhm wherefore he called that place beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear; because there they sware both of them. ‘al ken qara lamaqom hahu be’er shaba‘, ki sham nishbe‘u shenehem.
wykrtw bryt bbar Sbe wyqm abymlk wpykl Sr zbaw wySbw al arz plStym thus they made a covenant at beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear: then abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch rose up, and phichol-mouth-of-all the chief captain of his troop-cluster, and they returned into the land of the philistines-griever. vayikhretu berit bib’er shaba‘, vayaqam ’abimelekh ufikhol sar zeba’o vayashubu ’el ’erez pelishtim.
