wyTe aSl bbar Sbe wyqra Sm bSm yhwh al ewlm and abraham-their-dick planted a grove in beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear, and called there on the name of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, the everlasting to-no-these. vayita‘ ’eshel bib’er shaba‘, vayiqra sham beshem yhvh ’el ‘olam.
wygr abrhm barz plStym ymym rbym and abraham-their-dick sojourned in the philistines-griever' land many days. vayagar ’abraham be’erez pelishtim yamim rabim.
wyhy axr hdbrym halh whalhym nsh at abrhm wyamr alyw abrhm wyamr hnny and it came to pass after these things, that to-no-these did tempt abraham-their-dick, and said unto him, abraham-their-dick: and he said, behold, here i am. vayhi ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh veha’elohim nisah ’abraham, vayomer ’elav ’abraham vayomer hineni.
wyamr qx na at bnk at yxydk aSr ahbt at yzxq wlk lk al arz hmryh whelhw Sm lelh el axd hhrym aSr amr alyk and he said, take now thy child-between, thine only child-between isaac-laughter, whom thou lovest, and get thee into the land of moriah-bitter-teacher; and inward him there for a on-up upon one of the mountains which i will tell thee of. vayomer qakh na binkha yekhidekha ’asher ’ahabta yizkhaq velekh ’el ’erez hamoriyah, veha‘alehu sham le‘olah ‘al ’akhad heharim ’asher ’omar ’elekha.
wySkm abrhm bbqr wyxbS at xmrw wyqx at Sny neryw atw wat yzxq bnw wybqe ezy elh wyqm wylk al hmqwm aSr amr lw halhym and abraham-their-dick rose up early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his young men with him, and isaac-laughter his child-between, and clave the wood for the on-up, and rose up, and went unto the place of which to-no-these had told him. vayashkem ’abraham baboqer vayakhabosh khamoro vayiqakh shenei ne‘arav ’ito ve’et yizkhaq beno, vaybaqa‘ ‘azei ‘olah vayaqam vayelekh ’el hamaqom ’asher ’amar lo ha’elohim.
bywm hSlySy wySa abrhm at eynyw wyra at hmqwm mrxq then on the third day abraham-their-dick lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off. bayom hashelishi vayisa ’abraham ‘enav vayar hamaqom merakhoq.
wyamr abrhm al neryw Sbw lkm ph em hxmwr wany whner nlkh ed kh wnStxwh wnSwbh alykm and abraham-their-dick said unto his young men, abide ye here with the ass; and i and the lad will go yonder and partake-shatakh, and come again to you. vayomer ’abraham ’el ne‘arav shebu poh ‘im hakhamor va’ani vehana‘ar nelekhah ‘ad koh, venishtakhaveh venashubah ’alekhem.
wyqx abrhm at ezy helh wySm el yzxq bnw wyqx bydw at haS wat hmaklt wylkw Snyhm yxdw and abraham-their-dick took the wood of the on-up, and laid it upon isaac-laughter his child-between; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife; and they went both of them together. vayiqakh ’abraham ‘azei ha‘olah vayasem ‘al yizkhaq beno vayiqakh beyado ha’esh ve’et hama’akhelet, vayelekhu shenehem yakhdav.
wyamr yzxq al abrhm abyw wyamr aby wyamr hnny bny wyamr hnh haS whezym wayh hSh lelh and isaac-laughter spake unto abraham-their-dick his father, and said, my father: and he said, here am i, my child-between. and he said, behold the fire and the wood: and where is the lamb for a on-up? vayomer yizkhaq ’el ’abraham ’abiv vayomer ’abi vayomer hineni beni, vayomer hineh ha’esh veha‘ezim ve’ayeh haseh le‘olah.
wyamr abrhm alhym yrah lw hSh lelh bny wylkw Snyhm yxdw and abraham-their-dick said, my child-between, to-no-these will provide himself a lamb for a on-up: so they went both of them together. vayomer ’abraham ’elohim yir’eh lo haseh le‘olah beni, vayelekhu shenehem yakhdav.
wybaw al hmqwm aSr amr lw halhym wybn Sm abrhm at hmcbx wyerk at hezym wyeqd at yzxq bnw wySm atw el hmcbx mmel lezym and they came to the stand-up-place which to-no-these had told him of; and abraham-their-dick between-built an butcher-kitchen there, and laid the wood in order, and bound isaac-laughter his child-between, and laid him on the butcher-kitchen upon the wood. vayabo’u ’el hamaqom ’asher ’amar lo ha’elohim vayiben sham ’abraham hamizbeakh vaya‘arokh ha‘ezim, vaya‘aqod yizkhaq beno vayasem ’oto ‘al hamizbeakh mima‘al la‘ezim.
wySlx abrhm at ydw wyqx at hmaklt lSxT at bnw and abraham-their-dick stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his child-between. vayishlakh ’abraham yado vayiqakh hama’akhelet, lishkhot beno.
wyqra alyw mlak yhwh mn hSmym wyamr abrhm abrhm wyamr hnny and the angel-messanger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah called unto him out of namespaces, and said, abraham-their-dick, abraham-their-dick: and he said, here am i. vayiqra ’elav mal’akh yhvh min hashamayim vayomer ’abraham ’abraham, vayomer hineni.
wyamr al tSlx ydk al hner wal teS lw mawmh ky eth ydety ky yra alhym ath wla xSkt at bnk at yxydk mmny and he said, lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing unto him: for now i hand-know that thou fearest to-no-these, seeing thou hast not withheld thy child-between, thine only child-between from me. vayomer ’al tishlakh yadekha ’el hana‘ar ve’al ta‘as lo me’umah, ki ‘atah yada‘ti ki yerei ’elohim ’atah velo khasakhta binkha yekhidekha mimeni.
wySa abrhm at eynyw wyra whnh ayl axr naxc bsbk bqrnyw wylk abrhm wyqx at hayl wyelhw lelh txt bnw and abraham-their-dick lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold behind him a ram-voiceless caught in a thicket by his horn-rays: and abraham-their-dick went and took the ram-voiceless, and inwarded him up for a on-up in the stead of his child-between. vayisa ’abraham ‘enav vayar vehineh ’ayil ’akhar ne’ekhaz basebakh beqarnav, vayelekh ’abraham vayiqakh ha’ayil vaya‘alehu le‘olah takhat beno.
wyqra abrhm Sm hmqwm hhwa yhwh yrah aSr yamr hywm bhr yhwh yrah and abraham-their-dick called the name of that place yhwh-aeiou-ohyeahjireh: as it is said to this day, in the mount of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah it be seen. vayiqra ’abraham shem hamaqom hahu yhvh yir’eh, ’asher ye’amer hayom behar yhvh yera’eh.
wyqra mlak yhwh al abrhm Snyt mn hSmym and the angel-messanger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah called unto abraham-their-dick out of namespaces the second time, vayiqra mal’akh yhvh ’el ’abraham, shenit min hashamayim.
wyamr by nSbety nam yhwh ky yen aSr eSyt at hdbr hch wla xSkt at bnk at yxydk and said, by myself have i sworn, saith yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy child-between, thine only child-between: vayomer bi nishba‘ti ne’um yhvh, ki ya‘an ’asher ‘asita hadabar hazeh velo khasakhta binkha yekhidekha.
ky brk abrkk whrbh arbh at crek kkwkby hSmym wkxwl aSr el Spt hym wyrS crek at Ser aybyw that in knee-fluffy-blessing i will knee-fluffy-bless thee, and in multiplying i will multiply thy seed as the stars of the namespaces, and as the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thy seed possess the hair-gate of his father-adversaries; ki barekh ’abarekhkha veharbah ’arbeh zar‘akha kekhokhbei hashamayim vekhakhol ’asher ‘al sefat hayam, veyirash zar‘akha sha‘ar ’oyebav.
whtbrkw bcrek kl gwyy harz eqb aSr Smet bqly and in thy seed all the nations of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed; because thou hast heard my voice. vehitbarakhu bezar‘akha kol goyei ha’arez, ‘eqeb ’asher shama‘ta beqoli.
wySb abrhm al neryw wyqmw wylkw yxdw al bar Sbe wySb abrhm bbar Sbe so abraham-their-dick returned unto his young men, and they rose up and went together to beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear; and abraham-their-dick dwelt at beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear. vayashab ’abraham ’el ne‘arav vayaqumu vayelekhu yakhdav ’el shaba‘, vayesheb ’abraham bib’er shaba‘.
wyhy axry hdbrym halh wygd labrhm lamr hnh yldh mlkh gm hwa bnym lnxwr axyk and it came to pass after these things, that it was told abraham-their-dick, saying, behold, milcah-queen, she hath also born children-betweens unto thy brother nahor-snore; vayhi ’akharei hadebarim ha’eleh vayugad le’abraham lemor, hineh yaledah milkah gam hi banim lenakhor ’akhikha.
at ewz bkrw wat bwc axyw wat qmwal aby arm huz-advice his firstborn, and buz-scorn his brother, and kemuel-get-up-towards the father of aram-high, ‘uz bekhoro ve’et buz ’akhiv, ve’et qemu’el ’abi ’aram.
wat kSd wat xcw wat pldS wat ydlp wat btwal and chesed-as-a-demon, and hazo-predict, and pildash-fiery-iron, and jidlaph-leak, and bethuel-his-house-towards. ve’et kesed ve’et khazo ve’et pildash ve’et yidlaf, ve’et betu’el.
wbtwal yld at rbqh Smnh alh yldh mlkh lnxwr axy abrhm and bethuel-his-house-towards begat rebekah-stall: these eight milcah-queen did bear to nahor-snore, abraham-their-dick's brother. ubetu’el yalad ribqah, shemonah ’eleh yaledah milkah lenakhor ’akhi ’abraham.
wpylgSw wSmh rawmh wtld gm hwa at Tbx wat gxm wat txS wat mekh and his concubine, whose name was reumah, she conceived-of also tebah-slaughter, and gaham-whim, and tahash-hurry, and maachah-from-acre. ufilagsho ushemah re’umah, vateled gam hi tebakh ve’et gakham ve’et takhash ve’et ma‘akhah.
wyhyw xyy Srh mah Snh weSrym Snh wSbe Snym Sny xyy Srh and sarah-her-soakedness was an hundred and seven and double-ten-twenty years old: these were the years of the life of sarah-her-soakedness. vayihyu khayei sarah me’ah shanah ve‘esrim shanah vesheba‘ shanim, shenei khayei sarah.
wtmt Srh bqryt arbe hwa xbrwn barz knen wyba abrhm lspd lSrh wlbkth and sarah-her-soakedness died in kirjatharba-light-city-of-four; the same is hebron-friend-joy in the land of canaan-mobile-trade: and abraham-their-dick came to mourn for sarah-her-soakedness, and to weep for her. vatamat sarah beqiryat ’arba‘ hi khebron be’erez kena‘an, vayabo ’abraham lispod lesarah velibkotah.
wyqm abrhm mel pny mtw wydbr al bny xt lamr and abraham-their-dick stood up from before-turns his dead, and spake unto children-betweens of heth-bold, saying, vayaqam ’abraham me‘al penei meto, vaydaber ’el bene khet lemor.
gr wtwSb anky emkm tnw ly axct qbr emkm waqbrh mty mlpny i am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a buryingplace with you, that i may bury my dead out of my sight. ger vetoshab ’anokhi ‘imakhem, tenu li ’akhuzat qeber ‘imakhem ve’eqberah meti milefanay.
wyenw bny xt at abrhm lamr lw and children-betweens of heth-bold answered abraham-their-dick, saying unto him, vaya‘anu bene khet ’abraham lemor lo.
Smenw adny nSya alhym ath btwknw bmbxr qbrynw qbr at mtk ayS mmnw at qbrw la yklh mmk mqbr mtk hear us, my base-lord: thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us withhold from thee his sepulchre, and that thou mayest bury thy dead. shema‘enu ’adoni nesi ’elohim ’atah betokhenu bemibkhar qebarenu qebor metekha, mimenu qibro lo yikhleh mimekha miqebor metekha.
wyqm abrhm wyStxw lem harz lbny xt and abraham-their-dick stood up, and bowed himself to the with-mum-people of the land, even to children-betweens of heth-bold. vayaqam ’abraham vayishtakhu le‘am ha’arez libne khet.
wydbr atm lamr am yS at npSkm lqbr at mty mlpny Smewny wpgew ly beprwn bn zxr and he communed with them, saying, if it be your mind that i should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and entreat for me to ephron-pencil child-between of zohar-bleach, vaydaber ’itam lemor, ’im yesh nafshekhem liqbor meti milefanay shema‘uni ufig‘u li be‘efron ben zokhar.
wytn ly at mert hmkplh aSr lw aSr bqzh Sdhw bksp mla ytnnh ly btwkkm laxct qbr that he may give me the cave of machpelah-copy-product, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he give it me for a possession of a buryingplace amongst you. veyiten li me‘arat hamakhpelah ’asher lo ’asher biqzeh sadehu, bekhesef malei yitenenah li betokhkhem la’akhuzat qaber.
weprwn ySb btwk bny xt wyen eprwn hxty at abrhm bacny bny xt lkl bay Ser eyrw lamr and ephron-pencil dwelt among children-betweens of heth-bold: and ephron-pencil the hittite-cut answered abraham-their-dick in the audience of children-betweens of heth-bold, even of all that went in at the hair-gate of his light-city, saying, ve‘efron yosheb betokh bene khet, vaya‘an ‘efron hakhiti ’abraham be’azenei bene khet lekhol ba’ei sha‘ar ‘iro lemor.
la adny Smeny hSdh ntty lk whmerh aSr bw lk nttyh leyny bny emy nttyh lk qbr mtk nay, my base-lord, hear me: the field give i thee, and the cave that is therein, i give it thee; in the presence of children-betweens of my with-mum-people give i it thee: bury thy dead. lo ’adoni shema‘eni hasadeh natati lakh vehame‘arah ’asher bo lekha netatiha, le‘enei bene ‘ami netatiha lakh qebor metekha.
wyStxw abrhm lpny em harz and abraham-their-dick bowed down himself before-turns the with-mum-people of the land. vayishtakhu ’abraham lifnei ‘am ha’arez.
wydbr al eprwn bacny em harz lamr ak am ath lw Smeny ntty ksp hSdh qx mmny waqbrh at mty Smh and he spake unto ephron-pencil in the audience of the with-mum-people of the land, saying, and if thou wilt give it, i pray thee, hear me: i will give thee money for the field; take it of me, and i will bury my dead there. vaydaber ’el ‘efron be’azenei ‘am ha’arez lemor ’akh ’im ’atah lu shema‘eni, natati kesef hasadeh qakh mimeni ve’eqberah meti shamah.
wyen eprwn at abrhm lamr lw and ephron-pencil answered abraham-their-dick, saying unto him, vaya‘an ‘efron ’abraham lemor lo.
adny Smeny arz arbe mat Sql ksp byny wbynk mh hwa wat mtk qbr my base-lord, hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundred shekel-lights of silver; what is that betwixt-bin me and thee? bury therefore thy dead. ’adoni shema‘eni ’erez ’arba‘ me’ot sheqel kesef beni ubenekha mah hi ve’et metekha qebor.
wySme abrhm al eprwn wySql abrhm leprn at hksp aSr dbr bacny bny xt arbe mawt Sql ksp ebr lsxr and abraham-their-dick hearkened unto ephron-pencil; and abraham-their-dick weighed to ephron-pencil the silver, which he had named in the audience of children-betweens of heth-bold, four hundred shekel-lights of silver, current money with the merchant. vayishma‘ ’abraham ’el ‘efron vayishqol ’abraham le‘efron hakesef ’asher diber be’azenei bene khet, ’arba‘ me’ot sheqel kesef ‘ober lasokher.
wyqm Sdh eprwn aSr bmkplh aSr lpny mmra hSdh whmerh aSr bw wkl hez aSr bSdh aSr bkl gblw sbyb and the field of ephron-pencil which was in machpelah-copy-product, which was before-turns mamre-see-bitter, the field, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the borders round about, were made sure vayaqam sedeh ‘efron ’asher bamakhpelah ’asher lifnei mamre, hasadeh vehame‘arah ’asher bo vekhal ha‘ez ’asher basadeh ’asher bekhal gebulo sabib.
labrhm lmqnh leyny bny xt bkl bay Ser eyrw unto abraham-their-dick for a possession in the presence of children-betweens of heth-bold, before-turns all that went in at the hair-gate of his light-city. le’abraham lemiqnah le‘enei bene khet, bekhol ba’ei sha‘ar ‘iro.
waxry kn qbr abrhm at Srh aStw al mert Sdh hmkplh el pny mmra hwa xbrwn barz knen and after this, abraham-their-dick buried sarah-her-soakedness his woman in the cave of the field of machpelah-copy-product before-turns mamre-see-bitter: the same is hebron-friend-joy in the land of canaan-mobile-trade. ve’akhare khen qabar ’abraham sarah ’ishto ’el me‘arat sedeh hamakhpelah ‘al penei mamrei hi khebron, be’erez kena‘an.
wyqm hSdh whmerh aSr bw labrhm laxct qbr mat bny xt and the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto abraham-their-dick for a possession of a buryingplace by children-betweens of heth-bold. vayaqam hasadeh vehame‘arah ’asher bo le’abraham la’akhuzat qaber, me’et bene khet.
wabrhm cqn ba bymym wyhwh brk at abrhm bkl and abraham-their-dick was old, and well stricken in age: and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had knee-fluffy-blessed abraham-their-dick in all things. ve’abraham zaqen ba bayamim, yhvh berakh ’abraham bakol.
wyamr abrhm al ebdw cqn bytw hmSl bkl aSr lw Sym na ydk txt yrky and abraham-their-dick said unto his eldest worker of his daughter-house, that ruled over all that he had, put, i pray thee, thy hand under my thigh: vayomer ’abraham ’el ‘abdo zeqan beto hamoshel bekhal ’asher lo, sim na yadekha takhat yerekhi.
waSbyek byhwh alhy hSmym walhy harz aSr la tqx aSh lbny mbnwt hkneny aSr anky ywSb bqrbw and i will make thee swear by yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, the to-no-these of namespaces, and the to-no-these of the earth, that no take a woman unto my child-between of children-betweenesss of the canaan-mobile-tradeites, among whom i dwell: ve’ashbi‘akha yhvh ’elohei hashamayim velohei ha’arez, ’asher lo tiqakh ’ishah libni mibenot hakena‘ani ’asher ’anokhi yosheb beqirbo.
ky al arzy wal mwldty tlk wlqxt aSh lbny lyzxq and thou go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a woman unto my child-between isaac-laughter. ki ’el ’arzi ve’el moladti telekh, velaqakhta ’ishah libni leyizkhaq.
wyamr alyw hebd awly la tabh haSh llkt axry al harz hcat hhSb aSyb at bnk al harz aSr yzat mSm and the worker said unto him, peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must i needs bring thy child-between again unto the land from whence thou camest? vayomer ’elav ha‘ebed ’ulay lo tobeh ha’ishah lalekhet ’akharay ’el ha’arez hazot, hehasheb ’ashib binkha ’el ha’arez ’asher yazata misham.
wyamr alyw abrhm hSmr lk pn tSyb at bny Smh and abraham-their-dick said unto him, beware thou that thou bring not my child-between thither again. vayomer ’elav ’abraham, hishamer pen tashib beni shamah.
yhwh alhy hSmym aSr lqxny mbyt aby wmarz mwldty waSr dbr ly waSr nSbe ly lamr lcrek atn at harz hcat hwa ySlx mlakw lpnyk wlqxt aSh lbny mSm yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of namespaces, which took me from my father's daughter-house, and from the land of my kindred, and which spake unto me, and that sware unto me, saying, unto thy seed will i give this land; he send his angel-messanger before-turns thee, and thou take a woman unto my child-between from thence. yhvh ’elohei hashamayim ’asher leqakhani mibet ’abi ume’erez moladti va’asher diber li va’asher nishba‘ li lemor lezar‘akha ’eten ha’arez hazot, hu yishlakh mal’akho lefanekha velaqakhta ’ishah libni misham.
wam la tabh haSh llkt axryk wnqyt mSbety cat rq at bny la tSb Smh and if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou be clear from this my toward-oath: only bring not my child-between thither again. ve’im lo tobeh ha’ishah lalekhet ’akharekha veniqita mishebu‘ati zot, raq beni lo tasheb shamah.
wySm hebd at ydw txt yrk abrhm adnyw wySbe lw el hdbr hch and the worker put his hand under the thigh of abraham-their-dick his master, and sware to him concerning that matter. vayasem ha‘ebed yado takhat yerekh ’abraham ’adonav, vayishaba‘ lo ‘al hadabar hazeh.
wyqx hebd eSrh gmlym mgmly adnyw wylk wkl Twb adnyw bydw wyqm wylk al arm nhrym al eyr nxwr and the worker took ten ripen-camels of the ripen-camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master were in his hand: and he arose, and went to aramnaharim-high-rivers, unto the light-city of nahor-snore. vayiqakh ha‘ebed ‘asarah gemalim migemalei ’adonav vayelekh vekhal tub ’adonav beyado, vayaqam vayelekh ’el naharayim ’el ‘ir nakhor.
wybrk hgmlym mxwz leyr al bar hmym let erb let zat hSabt and he made his ripen-camels to kneel down without the light-city by a well of from-waters at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out to draw from-waters. vayabrekh hagemalim mikhuz la‘ir ’el be’er hamayim, le‘et ‘ereb le‘et zet hasho’abot.
wyamr yhwh alhy adny abrhm hqrh na lpny hywm weSh xsd em adny abrhm and he said yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of my master abraham-their-dick, i pray thee, send me good speed this day, and show kindness unto my master abraham-their-dick. vayomar yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham haqreh na lefanay hayom, va‘aseh khesed ‘im ’adoni ’abraham.
hnh anky nzb el eyn hmym wbnwt anSy heyr yzat lSab mym behold, i stand here by the well of from-waters; and children-betweenesss of the men of the light-city come out to draw from-waters: hineh ’anokhi nizab ‘al ‘en hamayim, ubenot ’anshei ha‘ir yoze’ot lish’ob mayim.
whyh hner aSr amr alyh hTy na kdk waSth wamrh Sth wgm gmlyk aSqh ath hkxt lebdk lyzxq wbh ade ky eSyt xsd em adny and let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom i say, let down thy pitcher, i pray thee, that i may drink; and she say, drink, and i will give thy ripen-camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy worker isaac-laughter; and thereby i hand-know that thou hast showed kindness unto my master. vehayah hana‘ara ’asher ’omar ’eleha hati na khadekh ve’eshteh ve’amerah sheteh vegam gemalekha ’ashqeh, ’otah hokhakhta le‘abdekha leyizkhaq ubah ’eda‘ ki ‘asita khesed ‘im ’adoni.
wyhy hwa Trm klh ldbr whnh rbqh yzat aSr yldh lbtwal bn mlkh aSt nxwr axy abrhm wkdh el Skmh and it came to pass, before-turns he had done speaking, that, behold, rebekah-stall came out, who was born to bethuel-his-house-towards, child-between of milcah-queen, the woman of nahor-snore, abraham-their-dick's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder. vayhi hu terem kilah ledaber vehineh ribqah yozet ’asher yuledah libtu’el ben milkah ’eshet nakhor ’akhi ’abraham, vekhadah ‘al shikhmah.
whner Tbt mrah mad btwlh wayS la ydeh wtrd heynh wtmla kdh wtel and the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man hand-known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up. vehana‘ara tobat mar’eh me’od betulah ve’ish lo yeda‘ah, vatered ha‘aynah vatemalei khadah vata‘al.
wyrz hebd lqrath wyamr hgmyayny na meT mym mkdk and the worker ran to until-witness her, and said, let me, i pray thee, drink a little from-waters of thy pitcher. vayaraz ha‘ebed liqratah, vayomer hagmi’ini na me‘at mayim mikadekh.
wtamr Sth adny wtmhr wtrd kdh el ydh wtSqhw and she said, drink, my base-lord: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink. vatomer sheteh ’adoni, vatemaher vatored kadah ‘al yadah vatashqehu.
wtkl lhSqtw wtamr gm lgmlyk aSab ed am klw lStt and when she had done giving him drink, she said, i will draw from-waters for thy ripen-camels also, until they have done drinking. vatekhal lehashqoto, vatomer gam ligmalekha ’esh’ab ‘ad ’im kilu lishtot.
wtmhr wter kdh al hSqt wtrz ewd al hbar lSab wtSab lkl gmlyw and she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw from-waters, and drew for all his ripen-camels. vatemaher vate‘ar kadah ’el hashoqet vataraz ‘od ’el habe’er lish’ob, vatish’ab lekhal gemalav.
whayS mStah lh mxryS ldet hhzlyx yhwh drkw am la and the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had made his journey prosperous or not. veha’ish mishta’eh lah, makharish lada‘at hahizliakh yhvh darko ’im lo.
wyhy kaSr klw hgmlym lStwt wyqx hayS ncm chb bqe mSqlw wSny zmydym el ydyh eSrh chb mSqlm and it came to pass, as the ripen-camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel-light weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekel-lights weight of gold; vayhi ka’asher kilu hagemalim lishtot vayiqakh ha’ish nezem zahab beqa‘ mishqalo, ushenei zemidim ‘al yadeha ‘asarah zahab mishqalam.
wyamr bt my at hgydy na ly hyS byt abyk mqwm lnw llyn and said, whose daughter-hoof-bat-child art thou? tell me, i pray thee: is there room in thy father's daughter-house for us to lodge in? vayomer bat mi ’at hagidi na li, hayesh bet ’abikh maqom lanu lalin.
wtamr alyw bt btwal anky bn mlkh aSr yldh lnxwr and she said unto him, i am the daughter-hoof-bat-child of bethuel-his-house-towards child-between of milcah-queen, which she conceived-of unto nahor-snore. vatomer ’elav bat betu’el ’anokhi, ben milkah ’asher yaledah lenakhor.
wtamr alyw gm tbn gm mspwa rb emnw gm mqwm llwn she said moreover unto him, we have both straw-t-between and provender enough, and room to lodge in. vatomer ’elav gam teben gam mispo rab ‘imanu, gam maqom lalun.
wyqd hayS wyStxw lyhwh and the man bowed down his head, and partook-shatakh yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vayiqod ha’ish vayishtakhu yhvh.
wyamr brwk yhwh alhy adny abrhm aSr la ecb xsdw wamtw mem adny anky bdrk nxny yhwh byt axy adny and he said, knee-fluffy-blessed be yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of my master abraham-their-dick, who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: i being in the way, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah led me to the daughter-house of my master's brethren. vayomer barukh yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham ’asher lo ‘azab khasdo va’amito me‘im ’adoni, ’anokhi baderekh nakhani yhvh bet ’akhei ’adoni.
wtrz hner wtgd lbyt amh kdbrym halh and the damsel ran, and told them of her mother's daughter-house these things. vataraz hana‘ara vataged lebet ’imah, kadebarim ha’eleh.
wlrbqh ax wSmw lbn wyrz lbn al hayS hxwzh al heyn and rebekah-stall had a brother, and his name was laban-white: and laban-white ran out unto the man, unto the well. uleribqah ’akh ushemo laban, vayaraz laban ’el ha’ish hakhuzah ’el ha‘ayin.
wyhy krat at hncm wat hzmdym el ydy axtw wkSmew at dbry rbqh axtw lamr kh dbr aly hayS wyba al hayS whnh emd el hgmlym el heyn and it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the bee-words of rebekah-stall his sister, saying, thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the ripen-camels at the well. vayhi kir’ot hanezem ve’et hazemidim ‘al yedei ’akhoto ukheshame‘o dibrei ribqah ’akhoto lemor koh diber ’elay ha’ish, vayabo ’el ha’ish vehineh ‘omed ‘al hagemalim ‘al ha‘ayin.
wyamr bwa brwk yhwh lmh temd bxwz wanky pnyty hbyt wmqwm lgmlym and he said, come in, thou knee-fluffy-blessed of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah; wherefore standest thou without? for i have prepared the daughter-house, and room for the ripen-camels. vayomer bo berukh yhvh, lamah ta‘amod bakhuz ve’anokhi piniti habayit umaqom lagemalim.
wyba hayS hbyth wyptx hgmlym wytn tbn wmspwa lgmlym wmym lrxz rglyw wrgly hanSym aSr atw and the man came into the daughter-house: and he ungirded his ripen-camels, and gave straw-t-between and provender for the ripen-camels, and from-waters to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him. vayabo ha’ish habaytah vayfatakh hagemalim, vayiten teben umispo lagemalim umayim lirkhoz raglav veraglei ha’anashim ’asher ’ito.
wyySm wywSm lpnyw lakl wyamr la akl ed am dbrty dbry wyamr dbr and there was set meat before-turns him to eat: and he said, i will not eat, until i have told mine errand. and he said, speak on. vayusam lefanav le’ekhol vayomer lo ’okhal ‘ad ’im dibarti debaray, vayomer daber.
wyamr ebd abrhm anky and he said, i am abraham-their-dick's worker. vayomar, ‘ebed ’abraham ’anokhi.
wyhwh brk at adny mad wygdl wytn lw zan wbqr wksp wchb webdm wSpxt wgmlym wxmrym and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath knee-fluffy-blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and visit-cattles, and silver, and gold, and workers, and maid-mothers, and ripen-camels, and asses. yhvh berakh ’adoni me’od vayigdal, vayiten lo zon ubaqar vekhesef vezahab va‘abadim ushefakhot ugemalim vakhamorim.
wtld Srh aSt adny bn ladny axry cqnth wytn lw at kl aSr lw and sarah-her-soakedness my master's woman conceived-of a child-between to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath. vateled sarah ’eshet ’adoni ben ladoni ’akharei ziqnatah, vayiten lo kal ’asher lo.
wySbeny adny lamr la tqx aSh lbny mbnwt hkneny aSr anky ySb barzw and my master made me swear, saying, no take a woman to my child-between of children-betweenesss of the canaan-mobile-tradeites, in whose land i dwell: vayashbi‘eni ’adoni lemor, lo tiqakh ’ishah libni mibenot hakena‘ani ’asher ’anokhi yosheb be’arzo.
am la al byt aby tlk wal mSpxty wlqxt aSh lbny and thou go unto my father's daughter-house, and to my kindred, and take a woman unto my child-between. ’im lo ’el bet ’abi telekh ve’el mishpakhti, velaqakhta ’ishah libni.
wamr al adny aly la tlk haSh axry and i said unto my master, peradventure the woman will not follow me. va’omar ’el ’adoni, ’ulay lo telekh ha’ishah ’akharay.
wyamr aly yhwh aSr hthlkty lpnyw ySlx mlakw atk whzlyx drkk wlqxt aSh lbny mmSpxty wmbyt aby and he said unto me, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, before-turns whom i walk, will send his angel-messanger with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou take a woman for my child-between of my kindred, and of my father's daughter-house: vayomer ’elay, yhvh ’asher hithalakhti lefanav yishlakh mal’akho ’itakh vehizliakh darkekha velaqakhta ’ishah libni mimishpakhti umibet ’abi.
ac tnqh malty ky tbwa al mSpxty wam la ytnw lk whyyt nqy malty then thou be clear from this my toward-oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou be clear from my toward-oath. ’az tinaqeh me’alati ki tabo ’el mishpakhti, ve’im lo yitenu lakh vehayita naqi me’alati.
waba hywm al heyn wamr yhwh alhy adny abrhm am ySk na mzlyx drky aSr anky hlk elyh and i came this day unto the well, and said, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of my master abraham-their-dick, if now thou do prosper my way which i go: va’abo hayom ’el ha‘ayin, va’omar yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham ’im yeshkha na mazliakh darki ’asher ’anokhi holekh ‘aleha.
hnh anky nzb el eyn hmym whyh helmh hyzat lSab wamrty alyh hSqyny na meT mym mkdk behold, i stand by the well of from-waters; and it come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw from-waters, and i say to her, give me, i pray thee, a little from-waters of thy pitcher to drink; hineh ’anokhi nizab ‘al ‘en hamayim, vehayah ha‘almah hayozet lish’ob ve’amarti ’eleha hashqini na me‘at mayim mikadekh.
wamrh aly gm ath Sth wgm lgmlyk aSab hwa haSh aSr hkyx yhwh lbn adny and she say to me, both drink thou, and i will also draw for thy ripen-camels: let the same be the woman whom yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath appointed out for my master's child-between. ve’amerah ’elay gam ’atah sheteh vegam ligmalekha ’esh’ab, hi ha’ishah ’asher hokhiakh yhvh leben ’adoni.
any Trm aklh ldbr al lby whnh rbqh yzat wkdh el Skmh wtrd heynh wtSab wamr alyh hSqyny na and before-turns i had done speaking in mine heart, behold, rebekah-stall came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew from-waters: and i said unto her, let me drink, i pray thee. ’ani terem ’akhaleh ledaber ’el libi vehineh ribqah yozet vekhadah ‘al shikhmah vatered ha‘aynah vatish’ab, va’omar ’eleha hashqini na.
wtmhr wtwrd kdh melyh wtamr Sth wgm gmlyk aSqh waSt wgm hgmlym hSqth and she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, drink, and i will give thy ripen-camels drink also: so i drank, and she made the ripen-camels drink also. vatemaher vatored kadah me‘aleha vatomer sheteh vegam gemalekha ’ashqeh, va’eshet vegam hagemalim hishqatah.
waSal ath wamr bt my at wtamr bt btwal bn nxwr aSr yldh lw mlkh waSm hncm el aph whzmydym el ydyh and i asked her, and said, whose daughter-hoof-bat-child art thou? and she said, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of bethuel-his-house-towards, nahor-snore's child-between, whom milcah-queen conceived-of unto him: and i put the earring upon her face-turns, and the bracelets upon her hands. va’esh’al ’otah va’omar bat mi ’at vatomer bat betu’el ben nakhor ’asher yaledah lo milkah, va’asim hanezem ‘al ’apah vehazemidim ‘al yadeha.
waqd waStxwh lyhwh wabrk at yhwh alhy adny abrhm aSr hnxny bdrk amt lqxt at bt axy adny lbnw and i bowed down my head, and partook-shatakh yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and knee-fluffy-blessed yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of my master abraham-their-dick, which had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter-hoof-bat-child unto his child-between. va’eqod va’eshtakhaveh yhvh, va’abarekh yhvh ’elohei ’adoni ’abraham ’asher hinkhani bederekh ’emet laqakhat bat ’akhi ’adoni libno.
weth am ySkm eSym xsd wamt at adny hgydw ly wam la hgydw ly wapnh el ymyn aw el Smal and now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that i may turn to the right hand, or to the left. ve‘atah ’im yeshkhem ‘osim khesed ve’emet ’et ’adoni hagidu li, ve’im lo hagidu li ve’efneh ‘al yamin ’o ‘al semol.
wyen lbn wbtwal wyamrw myhwh yza hdbr la nwkl dbr alyk re aw Twb then laban-white and bethuel-his-house-towards answered and said, the thing proceedeth from yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good. vaya‘an laban ubetu’el vayomeru yhvh yaza hadabar, lo nukhal daber ’elekha ra‘ ’o tob.
hnh rbqh lpnyk qx wlk wthy aSh lbn adnyk kaSr dbr yhwh behold, rebekah-stall is before-turns thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's child-between's woman, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath bee-spoken. hineh ribqah lefanekha qakh valekh, utehi ’ishah leben ’adonekha ka’asher diber yhvh.
wyhy kaSr Sme ebd abrhm at dbryhm wyStxw arzh lyhwh and it came to pass, that, when abraham-their-dick's worker heard their bee-words, he partook-shatakh yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, bowing himself to the earth. vayhi ka’asher shama‘ ‘ebed ’abraham dibrehem, vayishtakhu ’arzah yhvh.
wywza hebd kly ksp wkly chb wbgdym wytn lrbqh wmgdnt ntn laxyh wlamh and the worker brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to rebekah-stall: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things. vayozei ha‘ebed kele khesef ukhelei zahab ubegadim vayiten leribqah, umigdanot natan le’akhiha ule’imah.
wyaklw wyStw hwa whanSym aSr emw wylynw wyqwmw bbqr wyamr Slxny ladny and they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, send me away unto my master. vayokhelu vayishtu hu veha’anashim ’asher ‘imo vayalinu, vayaqumu baboqer vayomer shalekhuni ladoni.
wyamr axyh wamh tSb hner atnw ymym aw eSwr axr tlk and her brother and her mother said, let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she go. vayomer ’akhiha ve’imah tesheb hana‘ara ’itanu yamim ’o ‘asor, ’akhar telekh.
wyamr alhm al taxrw aty wyhwh hzlyx drky Slxwny walkh ladny and he said unto them, here-hinder me not, seeing yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath prospered my way; send me away that i may go to my master. vayomer ’alehem ’al te’akharu ’oti yhvh hizliakh darki, shalekhuni ve’elekhah ladoni.
wyamrw nqra lner wnSalh at pyh and they said, we will call the damsel, and inquire at her mouth. vayomeru niqra lana‘ara, venish’alah ’et piha.
wyqraw lrbqh wyamrw alyh htlky em hayS hch wtamr alk and they called rebekah-stall, and said unto her, wilt thou go with this man? and she said, i will go. vayiqre’u leribqah vayomeru ’eleha hatelekhi ‘im ha’ish hazeh, vatomer ’elekh.
wySlxw at rbqh axtm wat mnqth wat ebd abrhm wat anSyw and they sent away rebekah-stall their sister, and her nurse, and abraham-their-dick's worker, and his men. vayshalekhu ribqah ’akhotam ve’et meniqtah, ve’et ‘ebed ’abraham ve’et ’anashav.
wybrkw at rbqh wyamrw lh axtnw at hyy lalpy rbbh wyyrS crek at Ser Snayw and they knee-fluffy-blessed rebekah-stall, and said unto her, thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the hair-gate of those which hate them. vaybarakhu ribqah vayomeru lah ’akhotenu ’at hayi le’alfei rebabah, veyirash zar‘ekh sha‘ar sone’av.
wtqm rbqh wnertyh wtrkbnh el hgmlym wtlknh axry hayS wyqx hebd at rbqh wylk and rebekah-stall arose, and her damsels, and they pene upon the ripen-camels, and followed the man: and the worker took rebekah-stall, and went his way. vataqam ribqah vena‘aroteha vatirkabnah ‘al hagemalim vatelakhnah ’akharei ha’ish, vayiqakh ha‘ebed ribqah vayelakh.
wyzxq ba mbwa bar lxy ray whwa ywSb barz hngb and isaac-laughter came from the way of the well lahairoi-i-see-to-my-life; for he dwelt in the south-dry country. veyizkhaq ba mibo be’er lakhay ro’i, vehu yosheb be’erez hanegeb.
wyza yzxq lSwx bSdh lpnwt erb wySa eynyw wyra whnh gmlym baym and isaac-laughter went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the ripen-camels were coming. vayezei yizkhaq lasuakh basadeh lifnot ‘areb, vayisa ‘enav vayar vehineh gemalim ba’im.
wtSa rbqh at eynyh wtra at yzxq wtpl mel hgml and rebekah-stall lifted up her eyes, and when she saw isaac-laughter, she lighted off the ripen-camel. vatisa ribqah ‘eneha vatere yizkhaq, vatipol me‘al hagamal.
wtamr al hebd my hayS hlch hhlk bSdh lqratnw wyamr hebd hwa adny wtqx hzeyp wttks for she had said unto the worker, what man is this that walketh in the field to until-witness us? and the worker had said, it is my master: therefore she took a breaker, and covered herself. vatomer ’el ha‘ebed mi ha’ish halazeh haholekh basadeh liqratenu vayomer ha‘ebed hu ’adoni, vatiqakh haza‘if vatitkas.
wyspr hebd lyzxq at kl hdbrym aSr eSh and the worker told isaac-laughter all things that he had done. vaysaper ha‘ebed leyizkhaq, kal hadebarim ’asher ‘asah.
wybah yzxq hahlh Srh amw wyqx at rbqh wthy lw laSh wyahbh wynxm yzxq axry amw and isaac-laughter brought her into his mother sarah-her-soakedness's tent, and took rebekah-stall, and she became his woman; and he loved her: and isaac-laughter was comforted after his mother's death. vaybi’eha yizkhaq ha’ohelah sarah ’imo vayiqakh ribqah vatehi lo le’ishah vaye’ehabeha, vayinakhem yizkhaq ’akharei ’imo.
wysp abrhm wyqx aSh wSmh qTwrh then again abraham-their-dick took a woman, and her name was keturah-complain. vayosef ’abraham vayiqakh ’ishah ushemah qeturah.
wtld lw at cmrn wat yqSn wat mdn wat mdyn wat ySbq wat Swx and she conceived-of him zimran-their-singer, and jokshan-straw-t-between, and medan-place-of-discussion, and midian-place-of-discussed-teaching, and ishbak-kiss, and shuah-talk. vateled lo ’et zimran ve’et yaqeshan ve’et medan ve’et midyan, ve’et yishbaq ve’et shuakh.
wyqSn yld at Sba wat ddn wbny ddn hyw aSwrm wlTwSym wlamym and jokshan-straw-t-between begat sheba-coming, and dedan-breast-discuss. and children-betweens of dedan-breast-discuss were asshur-beechim, and letushim-glitter, and leummim-to-mums. veyaqeshan yalad sheba ve’et dedan, ubenei dedan hayu ’ashurim uletushim ule’umim.
wbny mdyn eyph wepr wxnk wabyde waldeh kl alh bny qTwrh and children-betweens of midian-place-of-discussed-teaching; ephah-tired, and epher-dust, and hanoch-educated, and abidah-my-dad-knowledge, and eldaah-towards-knows. all these were children-betweens of keturah-complain. ubenei midyan ‘efah va‘efer vakhanokh va’abida‘ ve’elda‘ah, kal ’eleh benei qeturah.
wytn abrhm at kl aSr lw lyzxq and abraham-their-dick gave all that he had unto isaac-laughter. vayiten ’abraham kal ’asher lo leyizkhaq.
wlbny hpylgSym aSr labrhm ntn abrhm mtnt wySlxm mel yzxq bnw bewdnw xy qdmh al arz qdm and unto children-betweens of the concubines, which abraham-their-dick had, abraham-their-dick gave gifts, and sent them away from isaac-laughter his child-between, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country. velibnei hapilagshim ’asher le’abraham natan ’abraham matanot, vayshalekhem me‘al yizkhaq beno be‘odenu khay qedemah ’el ’erez qedem.
walh ymy Sny xyy abrhm aSr xy mat Snh wSbeym Snh wxmS Snym and these are the days of the years of abraham-their-dick's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years. ve’eleh yemei shene khayei ’abraham ’asher khay, me’at shanah veshib‘im shanah vekhamesh shanim.
wygwe wymt abrhm bSybh Twbh cqn wSbe wyasp al emyw then abraham-their-dick gave up the breath-spirit, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was added to his with-mum-people. vayigva‘ vayamat ’abraham besebah tobah zaqen vesabea‘, vaye’asef ’el ‘amav.
wyqbrw atw yzxq wySmeal bnyw al mert hmkplh al Sdh eprn bn zxr hxty aSr el pny mmra and his children-betweens isaac-laughter and ishmael-towards-hears buried him in the cave of machpelah-copy-product, in the field of ephron-pencil child-between of zohar-bleach the hittite-cut, which is before-turns mamre-see-bitter; vayiqberu ’oto yizkhaq veyishma‘el banav ’el me‘arat hamakhpelah, ’el sedeh ‘efron ben zokhar hakhiti ’asher ‘al penei mamre.
hSdh aSr qnh abrhm mat bny xt Smh qbr abrhm wSrh aStw the field which abraham-their-dick purchased of children-betweens of heth-bold: there was abraham-their-dick buried, and sarah-her-soakedness his woman. hasadeh ’asher qanah ’abraham me’et bene khet, shamah qubar ’abraham vesarah ’ishto.
wyhy axry mwt abrhm wybrk alhym at yzxq bnw wySb yzxq em bar lxy ray and it came to pass after the death of abraham-their-dick, that to-no-these knee-fluffy-blessed his child-between isaac-laughter; and isaac-laughter dwelt by the well lahairoi-i-see-to-my-life. vayhi ’akharei mot ’abraham vaybarekh ’elohim yizkhaq beno, vayesheb yizkhaq ‘im ro’i.
walh tldt ySmeal bn abrhm aSr yldh hgr hmzryt Spxt Srh labrhm now these are the generations of ishmael-towards-hears, abraham-their-dick's child-between, whom hagar-migrate the mizraim-narrowsian, sarah-her-soakedness's handmaid, conceived-of unto abraham-their-dick: ve’eleh toledot yishma‘el ben ’abraham, ’asher yaledah hagar hamizrit shifkhat sarah le’abraham.
walh Smwt bny ySmeal bSmtm ltwldtm bkr ySmeal nbyt wqdr wadbal wmbSm and these are the names of children-betweens of ishmael-towards-hears, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of ishmael-towards-hears, nebajoth-lets-house; and kedar-pottery, and towards-slander, and mibsam-fragrance, ve’eleh shemot benei yishma‘el bishmotam letoldotam, bekhor yishma‘el nebayot veqedar ve’adbe’el umibsam.
wmSme wdwmh wmSa and mishma-from-hearing, and dumah-similar, and massa-load, umishma‘ vedumah umasa.
xdd wtyma yTwr npyS wqdmh hadad-thunder-sharpen, and tema-right, jetur-column, naphish-mental, and kedemah-progress: khadad vetema yetur nafish vaqedemah.
alh hm bny ySmeal walh Smtm bxzryhm wbTyrtm Snym eSr nSyam lamtm these are children-betweens of ishmael-towards-hears, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations. eleh hem benei yishma‘el ve’eleh shemotam bekhazrehem ubetirotam, shenem ‘asar nesi’im le’umotam.
walh Sny xyy ySmeal mat Snh wSlSym Snh wSbe Snym wygwe wymt wyasp al emyw and these are the years of the life of ishmael-towards-hears, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the breath-spirit and died; and was added unto his with-mum-people. ve’eleh shenei khayei yishma‘el me’at shanah usheloshim shanah vesheba‘ shanim, vayigva‘ vayamat vaye’asef ’el ‘amav.
wySknw mxwylh ed Swr aSr el pny mzrym bakh aSwrh el pny kl axyw npl and they dwelt from havilah-sick unto shur-wall, that is before-turns mizraim-narrows, as thou goest toward assyria-beech-tree: and he died in the presence of all his brethren. vayishkenu mekhavilah ‘ad shur ’asher ‘al penei mizrayim bo’akhah ’ashurah, ‘al penei khal ’ekhav nafal.
walh twldt yzxq bn abrhm abrhm hwlyd at yzxq and these are the generations of isaac-laughter, abraham-their-dick's child-between: abraham-their-dick begat isaac-laughter: ve’eleh toldot yizkhaq ben ’abraham, ’abraham holid yizkhaq.
wyhy yzxq bn arbeym Snh bqxtw at rbqh bt btwal harmy mpdn arm axwt lbn harmy lw laSh and isaac-laughter was forty years old when he took rebekah-stall to woman, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of bethuel-his-house-towards the arami-high of padanaram-redeemed-stack, the sister to laban-white the arami-high. vayhi yizkhaq ben ’arba‘im shanah beqakhto ribqah bat betu’el ha’arami mipadan ’aram, ’akhot laban ha’arami lo le’ishah.
wyetr yzxq lyhwh lnkx aStw ky eqrh hwa wyetr lw yhwh wthr rbqh aStw and isaac-laughter entreated yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah for his woman, because she was barren: and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was entreated of him, and rebekah-stall his woman conceived. vaye‘tar yizkhaq yhvh lenokhakh ’ishto ki ‘aqarah hi vaye‘ater lo yhvh vatahar ribqah ’ishto.
wytrzzw hbnym bqrbh wtamr am kn lmh ch anky wtlk ldrS at yhwh and children-betweens struggled together within her; and she said, if it be so, why am i thus? and she went to inquire of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vayitrozazu habanim beqirbah vatomer ’im ken lamah zeh ’anokhi, vatelekh lidrosh ’et yhvh.
wyamr yhwh lh Sny gyym gwym bbTnk wSny lamym mmeyk yprdw wlam mlam yamz wrb yebd zeyr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto her, two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of with-mum-people be separated from thy bowels; and the one with-mum-people be stronger than the other with-mum-people; and the elder work for the younger. vayomer yhvh lah shenei goyim bebitnekh ushenei le’umim mime‘ayikh yiparedu, ule’om mil’om ye’emaz verab ya‘abod za‘ir.
wymlaw ymyh lldt whnh twmm bbTnh and when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb. vayimle’u yameha laledet, vehineh tomim bebitnah.
wyza hraSwn admwny klw kadrt Ser wyqraw Smw eSw and the first came out red, all over like an gate-hairy garment; and they called his name esau-do. vayezei harishon ’admoni kulo ke’aderet se‘ar, vayiqre’u shemo ‘esav.
waxry kn yza axyw wydw axct beqb eSw wyqra Smw yeqb wyzxq bn SSym Snh bldt atm and after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on esau-do's heel; and his name was called jacob-backstreet: and isaac-laughter was threescore years old when she conceived-of them. ve’akhare khen yaza ’akhiv veyado ’okhezet ba‘aqeb ‘esav vayiqra shemo ya‘aqob, veyizkhaq ben shishim shanah beledet ’otam.
wygdlw hnerym wyhy eSw ayS yde zyd ayS Sdh wyeqb ayS tm ySb ahlym and the boys grew: and esau-do was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and jacob-backstreet was a plain man, dwelling in tents. vayigdelu hane‘arim vayhi ‘esav ’ish yodea‘ zayid ’ish sadeh, veya‘aqob ’ish tam yosheb ’ohalim.
wyahb yzxq at eSw ky zyd bpyw wrbqh ahbt at yeqb and isaac-laughter loved esau-do, because he did eat of his venison: and rebekah-stall loved jacob-backstreet. vaye’ehab yizkhaq ‘esav ki zayid befiv, veribqah ’ohebet ya‘aqob.
wycd yeqb ncyd wyba eSw mn hSdh whwa eyp and jacob-backstreet sod pottage: and esau-do came from the field, and he was faint: vayazed ya‘aqob nazid, vayabo ‘esav min hasadeh vehu ‘ayef.
wyamr eSw al yeqb hleyTny na mn hadm hadm hch ky eyp anky el kn qra Smw adwm and esau-do said to jacob-backstreet, feed me, i pray thee, with that same red pottage; for i am faint: therefore was his name called edom-man. vayomer ‘esav ’el ya‘aqob hal‘iteni na min ha’adom ha’adom hazeh ki ‘ayef ’anokhi, ‘al ken qara shemo ’edom.
wyamr yeqb mkrh kywm at bkrtk ly and jacob-backstreet said, sell me this day thy birthright. vayomer ya‘aqob, mikhrah khayom bekhoratekha li.
wyamr eSw hnh anky hwlk lmwt wlmh ch ly bkrh and esau-do said, behold, i am at the point to die: and what profit this birthright do to me? vayomer ‘esav hineh ’anokhi holekh lamut, velamah zeh li bekhorah.
wyamr yeqb hSbeh ly kywm wySbe lw wymkr at bkrtw lyeqb and jacob-backstreet said, swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto jacob-backstreet. vayomer ya‘aqob hishabe‘ah li kayom vayishaba‘ lo, vayimkor bekhorato leya‘aqob.
wyeqb ntn leSw lxm wncyd edSym wyakl wySt wyqm wylk wybc eSw at hbkrh then jacob-backstreet gave esau-do bread and pottage of lentils; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus esau-do despised his birthright. veya‘aqob natan le‘esav lekhem unezid ‘adashim vayokhal vayeshet vayaqam vayelakh, vayibez ‘esav habekhorah.
wyhy reb barz mlbd hreb hraSwn aSr hyh bymy abrhm wylk yzxq al abymlk mlk plStym grrh and there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of abraham-their-dick. and isaac-laughter went unto abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch king of the philistines-griever unto gera-strangerr-tow. vayhi ra‘ab ba’arez milebad hara‘ab harishon ’asher hayah bimei ’abraham, vayelekh yizkhaq ’el ’abimelekh melekh pelishtim gerarah.
wyra alyw yhwh wyamr al trd mzrymh Skn barz aSr amr alyk and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah appeared unto him, and said, go not down into mizraim-narrows; dwell in the land which i tell thee of: vayera ’elav yhvh vayomer ’al tered mizrayemah, shekhon ba’arez ’asher ’omar ’elekha.
gwr barz hcat wahyh emk wabrkk ky lk wlcrek atn at kl harzt hal whqmty at hSbeh aSr nSbety labrhm abyk sojourn in this land, and i will be with thee, and will knee-fluffy-bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, i will give all these countries, and i will perform the toward-oath which i sware unto abraham-their-dick thy father; gur ba’arez hazot ve’ehyeh ‘imekha va’abarekheka, ki lekha ulezar‘akha ’eten kal ha’arazot ha’el vahaqimoti hashebu‘ah ’asher nishba‘ti le’abraham ’abikha.
whrbyty at crek kkwkby hSmym wntty lcrek at kl harzt hal whtbrkw bcrek kl gwyy harz and i will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of namespaces, and will give unto thy seed all these countries; and in thy seed all the nations of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed; vehirbeti zar‘akha kekhokhbei hashamayim venatati lezar‘akha kal ha’arazot ha’el, vehitbarakhu bezar‘akha kol goyei ha’arez.
eqb aSr Sme abrhm bqly wySmr mSmrty mzwty xqwty wtwrty because that abraham-their-dick obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my directives, my statutes, and my teachings. ‘eqeb ’asher shama‘ ’abraham beqoli, vayishmor mishmarti mizvotay khuqotay vetorotay.
wySb yzxq bgrr and isaac-laughter dwelt in gera-strangerr-tow: vayesheb yizkhaq bigrar.
wySalw anSy hmqwm laStw wyamr axty hwa ky yra lamr aSty pn yhrgny anSy hmqwm el rbqh ky Twbt mrah hya and the men of the place asked him of his woman; and he said, she is my sister: for he feared to say, she is my woman; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for rebekah-stall; because she was fair to look upon. vayish’alu ’anshei hamaqom le’ishto vayomer ’akhoti hi ki yarei lemor ’ishti pen yaharguni ’anshei hamaqom ‘al ribqah ki tobat mar’eh hi.
wyhy ky arkw lw Sm hymym wySqp abymlk mlk plStym bed hxlwn wyra whnh yzxq mzxq at rbqh aStw and it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch king of the philistines-griever looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, isaac-laughter was sporting with rebekah-stall his woman. vayhi ki ’arekhu lo sham hayamim vayashqef ’abimelekh melekh pelishtim be‘ad hakhalon, vayar vehineh yizkhaq mezakheq ribqah ’ishto.
wyqra abymlk lyzxq wyamr ak hnh aStk hwa wayk amrt axty hwa wyamr alyw yzxq ky amrty pn amwt elyh and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch called isaac-laughter, and said, behold, of a surety she is thy woman; and how saidst thou, she is my sister? and isaac-laughter said unto him, because i said, lest i die for her. vayiqra ’abimelekh leyizkhaq vayomer ’akh hineh ’ishtekha hi ve’ekh ’amarta ’akhoti hi vayomer ’elav yizkhaq ki ’amarti pen ’amut ‘aleha.
wyamr abymlk mh cat eSyt lnw kmeT Skb axd hem at aStk whbat elynw aSm and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch said, what is this thou hast done unto us? one of the with-mum-people might lightly have lien with thy woman, and thou shouldest have brought guiltiness upon us. vayomer ’abimelekh mah zot ‘asita lanu, kim‘at shakhab ’akhad ha‘am ’et ’ishtekha vehebeta ‘alenu ’asham.
wyzw abymlk at kl hem lamr hnge bayS hch wbaStw mwt ywmt and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch charged all his with-mum-people, saying, he that toucheth this man or his woman surely be put to death. vayzav ’abimelekh kal ha‘am lemor, hanogea‘ ba’ish hazeh ube’ishto mot yumat.
wycre yzxq barz hhwa wymza bSnh hhwa mah Serym wybrkhw yhwh then isaac-laughter sowed in that land, and received in the same year an hundredfold: and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah knee-fluffy-blessed him. vayizra‘ yizkhaq ba’arez hahiv vayimza bashanah hahiv me’ah she‘arim, vaybarakhehu yhvh.
wygdl hayS wylk hlwk wgdl ed ky gdl mad and the man waxed great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great: vayigdal ha’ish, vayelekh halokh vegadel ‘ad ki gadal me’od.
wyhy lw mqnh zan wmqnh bqr webdh rbh wyqnaw atw plStym for he had possession of flocks, and possession of visit-cattles, and great store of workers: and the philistines-griever envied him. vayhi miqneh zon umiqneh baqar va‘abudah rabah, vayqan’u ’oto pelishtim.
wkl hbart aSr xprw ebdy abyw bymy abrhm abyw stmwm plStym wymlawm epr for all the wells which his father's workers had digged in the days of abraham-their-dick his father, the philistines-griever had stopped them, and filled them with earth. vekhal habe’erot ’asher khaferu ‘abdei ’abiv bimei ’abraham ’abiv, sitemum pelishtim vaymal’um ‘afar.
wyamr abymlk al yzxq lk memnw ky ezmt mmnw mad and abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch said unto isaac-laughter, go from us; for thou art much mightier than we. vayomer ’abimelekh ’el yizkhaq, lekh me‘imanu ki ‘azamta mimenu me’od.
wylk mSm yzxq wyxn bnxl grr wySb Sm and isaac-laughter departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of gera-strangerr-tow, and dwelt there. vayelekh misham yizkhaq, vayikhan benakhal gerar vayesheb sham.
wySb yzxq wyxpr at bart hmym aSr xprw bymy abrhm abyw wystmwm plStym axry mwt abrhm wyqra lhn Smwt kSmt aSr qra lhn abyw and isaac-laughter digged again the wells of from-waters, which they had digged in the days of abraham-their-dick his father; for the philistines-griever had stopped them after the death of abraham-their-dick: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them. vayashab yizkhaq vayakhpor be’erot hamayim ’asher khaferu bimei ’abraham ’abiv vaysatemum pelishtim ’akharei mot ’abraham, vayiqra lahen shemot kashemot ’asher qara lahen ’abiv.
wyxprw ebdy yzxq bnxl wymzaw Sm bar mym xyym and isaac-laughter's workers digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing from-waters. vayakhperu ‘abde yizkhaq banakhal, vayimze’u sham be’er mayim khayim.
wyrybw rey grr em rey yzxq lamr lnw hmym wyqra Sm hbar eSq ky hteSqw emw and the visit-cattlemen of gera-strangerr-tow did strive with isaac-laughter's visit-cattlemen, saying, the from-waters is ours: and he called the name of the well esek; because they strove with him. vayaribu ro‘ei gerar ‘im ro‘ei yizkhaq lemor lanu hamayim, vayiqra shem habe’er ‘eseq ki hit‘asequ ‘imo.
wyxprw bar axrt wyrybw gm elyh wyqra Smh STnh and they digged another well, and strove for that also: and he called the name of it sitnah. vayakhperu be’er ’akheret vayaribu gam ‘aleha, vayiqra shemah sitnah.
wyetq mSm wyxpr bar axrt wla rbw elyh wyqra Smh rxbwt wyamr ky eth hrxyb yhwh lnw wprynw barz and he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the name of it rehob-wideoth-wide-area; and he said, for now yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath made room for us, and we be fruitful in the land. vaya‘teq misham vayakhpor be’er ’akheret velo rabu ‘aleha, vayiqra shemah rekhobot vayomer ki ‘atah hirkhib yhvh lanu ufarinu ba’arez.
wyel mSm bar Sbe and he went up from thence to beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear. vaya‘al misham be’er shaba‘.
wyra alyw yhwh blylh hhwa wyamr anky alhy abrhm abyk al tyra ky atk anky wbrktyk whrbyty at crek bebwr abrhm ebdy and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah appeared unto him the same night, and said, i am the to-no-these of abraham-their-dick thy father: fear not, for i am with thee, and will knee-fluffy-bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my worker abraham-their-dick's sake. vayera ’elav yhvh balaylah hahu vayomer ’anokhi ’elohei ’abraham ’abikha, ’al tira ki ’itekha ’anokhi uberakhtikha vehirbeti zar‘akha ba‘abur ’abraham ‘abdi.
wybn Sm mcbx wyqra bSm yhwh wyT Sm ahlw wykrw Sm ebdy yzxq bar and he between-between-builded an butcher-kitchen there, and called upon the name of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and pitched his tent there: and there isaac-laughter's workers digged a well. vayiben sham mizbeakh vayiqra beshem yhvh vayet sham ’aholo, vayikhru sham ‘abde yizkhaq be’er.
wabymlk hlk alyw mgrr waxct mrehw wpykl Sr zbaw then abimelech-my-dad-king-moloch went to him from gera-strangerr-tow, and ahuzzath-held-on one of his friends, and phichol-mouth-of-all the chief captain of his army. va’abimelekh halakh ’elav migerar, va’akhuzat mere‘ehu ufikhol sar zeba’o.
wyamr alhm yzxq mdwe batm aly watm Snatm aty wtSlxwny matkm and isaac-laughter said unto them, wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you? vayomer ’alehem yizkhaq madua‘ batem ’elay, ve’atem senetem ’oti vateshalekhuni me’itekhem.
wyamrw raw raynw ky hyh yhwh emk wnamr thy na alh bynwtynw bynynw wbynk wnkrth bryt emk and they said, we saw certainly that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was with thee: and we said, let there be now an toward-oath betwixt-bin us, even betwixt-bin us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee; vayomeru ra’o ra’inu ki hayah yhvh ‘imakh vanomer tehi na ’alah benotenu benenu ubenekha, venikhretah berit ‘imakh.
am teSh emnw reh kaSr la ngenwk wkaSr eSynw emk rq Twb wnSlxk bSlwm ath eth brwk yhwh that thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing and good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the knee-fluffy-blessed of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. ’im ta‘aseh ‘imanu ra‘ah ka’asher lo nega‘anukha vekha’asher ‘asinu ‘imekha raq tob vaneshalekhakha beshalom, ’atah ‘atah berukh yhvh.
wyeS lhm mSth wyaklw wyStw and he made them a until-conception, and they did eat and drink. vaya‘as lahem mishteh vayokhelu vayishtu.
wySkymw bbqr wySbew ayS laxyw wySlxm yzxq wylkw matw bSlwm and they rose up betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: and isaac-laughter sent them away, and they departed from him in peace. vayashkimu baboqer vayishabe‘u ’ish le’akhiv, vayshalekhem yizkhaq vayelekhu me’ito beshalom.
wyhy bywm hhwa wybaw ebdy yzxq wygdw lw el adwt hbar aSr xprw wyamrw lw mzanw mym and it came to pass the same day, that isaac-laughter's workers came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him, we have found from-waters. vayhi bayom hahu vayabo’u ‘abdei yizkhaq vayagidu lo ‘al ’odot habe’er ’asher khafaru, vayomeru lo mazanu mayim.
wyqra ath Sbeh el kn Sm heyr bar Sbe ed hywm hch and he called it sheba-comingh: therefore the name of the light-city is beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear unto this day. vayiqra ’otah shib‘ah, ‘al ken shem ha‘ir sheba‘ ‘ad hayom hazeh.
wyhy eSw bn arbeym Snh wyqx aSh at yhwdyt bt bary hxty wat bSmt bt ayln hxty and esau-do was forty years old when he took to woman judith-handy-know the daughter-hoof-bat-child of beer-welli-my-well the hittite-cut, and bashemath-perfumery the daughter-hoof-bat-child of elon-tree the hittite-cut: vayhi ‘esav ben ’arba‘im shanah vayiqakh ’ishah yehudit bat be’eri hakhiti, ve’et basemat bat ’elon hakhiti.
wthyyn mrt rwx lyzxq wlrbqh which were a grief of mind unto isaac-laughter and to rebekah-stall. vatihyena morat ruakh, leyizkhaq uleribqah.
wyhy ky cqn yzxq wtkhyn eynyw mrat wyqra at eSw bnw hgdl wyamr alyw bny wyamr alyw hnny and it came to pass, that when isaac-laughter was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called esau-do his eldest child-between, and said unto him, my child-between: and he said unto him, behold, here am i. vayhi ki zaqen yizkhaq vatikhhena ‘enav mere’ot, vayiqra ‘esav beno hagadol vayomer ’elav beni vayomer ’elav hineni.
wyamr hnh na cqnty la ydety ywm mwty and he said, behold now, i am old, i hand-know not the day of my death: vayomer hineh na zaqanti, lo yada‘ti yom moti.
weth Sa na klyk tlyk wqStk wza hSdh wzwdh ly zydh zyd now therefore take, i pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison; ve‘atah sa na khelekha telyekha veqashtekha, vezei hasadeh vezudah li zayid.
weSh ly mTemym kaSr ahbty whbyah ly waklh bebwr tbrkk npSy bTrm amwt and make me savory meat, such as i love, and bring it to me, that i may eat; that my being may knee-fluffy-bless thee before-turns i die. va‘aseh li mat‘amim ka’asher ’ahabti vehabi’ah li ve’okhelah, ba‘abur tebarekhkha nafshi beterem ’amut.
wrbqh Smet bdbr yzxq al eSw bnw wylk eSw hSdh lzwd zyd lhbya and rebekah-stall heard when isaac-laughter spake to esau-do his child-between. and esau-do went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it. veribqah shoma‘at bedaber yizkhaq ’el ‘esav beno, vayelekh ‘esav hasadeh lazud zayid lehabi.
wrbqh amrh al yeqb bnh lamr hnh Smety at abyk mdbr al eSw axyk lamr and rebekah-stall spake unto jacob-backstreet her child-between, saying, behold, i heard thy father speak unto esau-do thy brother, saying, veribqah ’amerah ’el ya‘aqob benah lemor, hineh shama‘ti ’abikha medaber ’el ‘esav ’akhikha lemor.
hbyah ly zyd weSh ly mTemym waklh wabrkkh lpny yhwh lpny mwty bring me venison, and make me savory meat, that i may eat, and knee-fluffy-bless thee before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah before-turns my death. habi’ah li zayid va‘aseh li mat‘amim ve’okhelah, va’abarekhkhah lifnei yhvh lifnei moti.
weth bny Sme bqly laSr any mzwh atk now therefore, my child-between, obey my voice according to that which i direct thee. ve‘atah beni shema‘ beqoli, la’asher ’ani mezavah ’otakh.
lk na al hzan wqx ly mSm Sny gdyy ecym Tbym waeSh atm mTemym labyk kaSr ahb go now to the flock, and fetch me from thence two good kids of the intense-goats; and i will make them savory meat for thy father, such as he loveth: lekh na ’el hazon veqakh li misham shenei gedayei ‘izim tobim, ve’e‘eseh ’otam mat‘amim le’abikha ka’asher ’aheb.
whbat labyk wakl bebr aSr ybrkk lpny mwtw and thou bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may knee-fluffy-bless thee before-turns his death. vehebeta le’abikha ve’akhal, ba‘abur yebarekhkha lifnei moto.
wyamr yeqb al rbqh amw hn eSw axy ayS Ser wanky ayS xlq and jacob-backstreet said to rebekah-stall his mother, behold, esau-do my brother is a gate-hairy man, and i am a smooth man: vayomer ya‘aqob ’el ribqah ’imo, hen ‘esav ’akhi ’ish sa‘ir ve’anokhi ’ish khalaq.
awly ymSny aby whyyty beynyw kmtete whbaty ely qllh wla brkh my father peradventure will feel me, and i seem to him as a deceiver; and i bring a curse upon me, and not a knee-fluffy-blessing. ’ulay yemusheni ’abi vehayiti be‘enav kimta‘tea‘, vehebeti ‘alay qelalah velo berakhah.
wtamr lw amw ely qlltk bny ak Sme bqly wlk qx ly and his mother said unto him, upon me be thy curse, my child-between: only obey my voice, and go fetch me them. vatomer lo ’imo ‘alay qilatekha beni, ’akh shema‘ beqoli velekh qakh li.
wylk wyqx wyba lamw wteS amw mTemym kaSr ahb abyw and he went, and fetched, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savory meat, such as his father loved. vayelekh vayiqakh vayabei le’imo, vata‘as ’imo mat‘amim ka’asher ’aheb ’abiv.
wtqx rbqh at bgdy eSw bnh hgdl hxmdt aSr ath bbyt wtlbS at yeqb bnh hqTn and rebekah-stall took goodly raiment of her eldest child-between esau-do, which were with her in the daughter-house, and put them upon jacob-backstreet her younger child-between: vatiqakh ribqah bigdei ‘esav benah hagadol hakhamudot ’asher ’itah babayit, vatalbesh ya‘aqob benah haqatan.
wat ert gdyy hecym hlbySh el ydyw wel xlqt zwaryw and she put the light-skins of the kids of the intense-goats upon his hands, and upon the smooth of his neck: ve’et ‘orot gedayei ha‘izim hilbishah ‘al yadav, ve‘al khelqat zavarav.
wttn at hmTemym wat hlxm aSr eSth byd yeqb bnh and she gave the savory meat and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her child-between jacob-backstreet. vatiten hamat‘amim ve’et halekhem ’asher ‘asatah, beyad ya‘aqob benah.
wyba al abyw wyamr aby wyamr hnny my ath bny and he came unto his father, and said, my father: and he said, here am i; who art thou, my child-between? vayabo ’el ’abiv vayomer ’abi, vayomer hineni mi ’atah beni.
wyamr yeqb al abyw anky eSw bkrk eSyty kaSr dbrt aly qwm na Sbh waklh mzydy bebwr tbrkny npSk and jacob-backstreet said unto his father, i am esau-do thy first born; i have done according as thou badest me: arise, i pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy being may knee-fluffy-bless me. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el ’abiv ’anokhi ‘esav bekhorekha ‘asiti ka’asher dibarta ’elay, qum na shebah ve’akhelah mizedi ba‘abur tebarakhani nafshekha.
wyamr yzxq al bnw mh ch mhrt lmza bny wyamr ky hqrh yhwh alhyk lpny and isaac-laughter said unto his child-between, how is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my child-between? and he said, because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these brought it to me. vayomer yizkhaq ’el beno mah zeh miharta limzo beni, vayomer ki hiqrah yhvh ’elohekha lefanay.
wyamr yzxq al yeqb gSh na wamSk bny hath ch bny eSw am la and isaac-laughter said unto jacob-backstreet, come near, i pray thee, that i may feel thee, my child-between, whether thou be my very child-between esau-do or not. vayomer yizkhaq ’el ya‘aqob geshah na va’amushkha beni, ha’atah zeh beni ‘esav ’im lo.
wygS yeqb al yzxq abyw wymShw wyamr hql qwl yeqb whydym ydy eSw and jacob-backstreet went near unto isaac-laughter his father; and he felt him, and said, the voice is jacob-backstreet's voice, and the hands are the hands of esau-do. vayigash ya‘aqob ’el yizkhaq ’abiv vaymushehu, vayomer haqol qol ya‘aqob vehayadayim yedei ‘esav.
wla hkyrw ky hyw ydyw kydy eSw axyw Sert wybrkhw and he discerned him not, because his hands were gate-hairy, as his brother esau-do's hands: so he knee-fluffy-blessed him. velo hikiro ki hayu yadav kidei ‘esav ’akhiv se‘irot, vaybarekhehu.
wyamr ath ch bny eSw wyamr any and he said, art thou my very child-between esau-do? and he said, i am. vayomer ’atah zeh beni ‘esav, vayomer ’ani.
wyamr hgSh ly waklh mzyd bny lmen tbrkk npSy wygS lw wyakl wyba lw yyn wySt and he said, bring it near to me, and i will eat of my child-between's venison, that my being may knee-fluffy-bless thee. and he brought it near to him, and he did eat: and he brought him wine-inherit and he drank. vayomer hagishah li ve’okhelah mized beni lema‘an tebarekhkha nafshi, vayagesh lo vayokhal vayabei lo yayin vayeshet.
wyamr alyw yzxq abyw gSh na wSqh ly bny and his father isaac-laughter said unto him, come near now, and kiss me, my child-between. vayomer ’elav yizkhaq ’abiv, geshah na usheqah li beni.
wygS wySq lw wyrx at ryx bgdyw wybrkhw wyamr rah ryx bny kryx Sdh aSr brkw yhwh and he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and knee-fluffy-blessed him, and said, see, the smell of my child-between is as the smell of a field which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath knee-fluffy-blessed: vayigash vayishaq lo vayarakh reakh begadav vaybarakhehu, vayomer re’eh reakh beni kereakh sadeh ’asher berakho yhvh.
wytn lk halhym mTl hSmym wmSmny harz wrb dgn wtyrS therefore to-no-these give thee of the dew of namespaces, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn-swimming and wine-inherit: veyiten lekha ha’elohim mital hashamayim umishmanei ha’arez, verob dagan vetirosh.
yebdwk emym wyStxw wyStxww lk lamym hwh gbyr laxyk wyStxww lk bny amk arryk arwr wmbrkyk brwk let with-mum-people work for thee, and nations bow down to thee: be base-lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother's children-betweens bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and knee-fluffy-blessed be he that knee-fluffy-blesseth thee. ya‘abdukha ‘amim veyishtakhavu lekha le’umim heveh gebir le’akhekha veyishtakhavu lekha benei ’imekha, ’orerekha ’arur umebarakhekha barukh.
wyhy kaSr klh yzxq lbrk at yeqb wyhy ak yza yza yeqb mat pny yzxq abyw weSw axyw ba mzydw and it came to pass, as soon as isaac-laughter had made an end of knee-fluffy-blessing jacob-backstreet, and jacob-backstreet was yet scarce gone out from the presence of isaac-laughter his father, that esau-do his brother came in from his hunting. vayhi ka’asher kilah yizkhaq lebarekh ya‘aqob vayhi yazo yaza ya‘aqob me’et penei yizkhaq ’abiv, ve‘esav ’akhiv ba mizedo.
wyeS gm hwa mTemym wyba labyw wyamr labyw yqm aby wyakl mzyd bnw bebwr tbrkny npSk and he also had made savory meat, and brought it unto his father, and said unto his father, let my father arise, and eat of his child-between's venison, that thy being may knee-fluffy-bless me. vaya‘as gam hu mat‘amim vayabei le’abiv, vayomer le’abiv yaqum ’abi veyokhal mized beno ba‘abur tebarakhani nafshekha.
wyamr lw yzxq abyw my ath wyamr any bnk bkrk eSw and isaac-laughter his father said unto him, who art thou? and he said, i am thy child-between, thy firstborn esau-do. vayomer lo yizkhaq ’abiv mi ’atah, vayomer ’ani binkha bekhorekha ‘esav.
wyxrd yzxq xrdh gdlh ed mad wyamr my apwa hwa hzd zyd wyba ly wakl mkl bTrm tbwa wabrkhw gm brwk yhyh and isaac-laughter trembled very exceedingly, and said, who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and i have eaten of all before-turns thou camest, and have knee-fluffy-blessed him? yea, and he be knee-fluffy-blessed. vayekherad yizkhaq kharadah gedolah ‘ad me’od vayomer mi ’efo hu hazad zayid vayabei li va’okhal mikol beterem tabo va’abarakhehu, gam barukh yihyeh.
kSme eSw at dbry abyw wyzeq zeqh gdlh wmrh ed mad wyamr labyw brkny gm any aby and when esau-do heard the bee-words of his father, he cried with a great and exceeding bitter cry, and said unto his father, knee-fluffy-bless me, even me also, o my father. kishmoa‘ ‘esav dibrei ’abiv vayiz‘aq ze‘aqah gedolah umarah ‘ad me’od, vayomer le’abiv barakheni gam ’ani ’abi.
wyamr ba axyk bmrmh wyqx brktk and he said, thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy knee-fluffy-blessing. vayomer ba ’akhikha bemirmah, vayiqakh birkhatekha.
wyamr hky qra Smw yeqb wyeqbny ch pemym at bkrty lqx whnh eth lqx brkty wyamr hla azlt ly brkh and he said, is not he rightly named jacob-backstreet? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my knee-fluffy-blessing. and he said, hast thou not reserved a knee-fluffy-blessing for me? vayomer hakhi qara shemo ya‘aqob vaya‘qebeni zeh fa‘amayim bekhorati laqakh vehineh ‘atah laqakh birkhati, vayomar halo ’azalta li berakhah.
wyen yzxq wyamr leSw hn gbyr Smtyw lk wat kl axyw ntty lw lebdym wdgn wtyrS smktyw wlkh apwa mh aeSh bny and isaac-laughter answered and said unto esau-do, behold, i have made him thy base-lord, and all his brethren have i given to him for workers; and with corn-swimming and wine-inherit have i sustained him: and what i do now unto thee, my child-between? vaya‘an yizkhaq vayomer le‘esav hen gebir samtiv lakh ve’et kal ’ekhav natati lo la‘abadim vedagan vetirosh semakhtiv, ulekhah ’efo mah ’e‘eseh beni.
wyamr eSw al abyw hbrkh axt hwa lk aby brkny gm any aby wySa eSw qlw wybk and esau-do said unto his father, hast thou and one knee-fluffy-blessing, my father? knee-fluffy-bless me, even me also, o my father. and esau-do lifted up his voice, and wept. vayomer ‘esav ’el ’abiv habrakhah ’akhat hi lekha ’abi barakheni gam ’ani ’abi, vayisa ‘esav qolo vayebek.
wyen yzxq abyw wyamr alyw hnh mSmny harz yhyh mwSbk wmTl hSmym mel and isaac-laughter his father answered and said unto him, behold, thy dwelling be the fatness of the earth, and of the dew of namespaces from above; vaya‘an yizkhaq ’abiv vayomer ’elav, hineh mishmanei ha’arez yihyeh moshabekha umital hashamayim me‘al.
wel xrbk txyh wat axyk tebd whyh kaSr tryd wprqt elw mel zwark and by thy sword thou live, and work for thy brother; and it come to pass when thou have the dominion, that thou break his yoke from off thy neck. ve‘al kharbekha tikhyeh ve’et ’akhikha ta‘abod, vehayah ka’asher tarid ufaraqta ‘ulo me‘al zavarekha.
wySTm eSw at yeqb el hbrkh aSr brkw abyw wyamr eSw blbw yqrbw ymy abl aby wahrgh at yeqb axy and esau-do hated jacob-backstreet because of the knee-fluffy-blessing wherewith his father knee-fluffy-blessed him: and esau-do said in his heart, the days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will i slay my brother jacob-backstreet. vayistom ‘esav ya‘aqob ‘al haberakhah ’asher berakho ’abiv, vayomer ‘esav belibo yiqrebu yemei ’ebel ’abi ve’ahargah ya‘aqob ’akhi.
wygd lrbqh at dbry eSw bnh hgdl wtSlx wtqra lyeqb bnh hqTn wtamr alyw hnh eSw axyk mtnxm lk lhrgk and these bee-words of esau-do her elder child-between were told to rebekah-stall: and she sent and called jacob-backstreet her younger child-between, and said unto him, behold, thy brother esau-do, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee. vayugad leribqah dibrei ‘esav benah hagadol, vatishlakh vatiqra leya‘aqob benah haqatan vatomer ’elav hineh ‘esav ’akhikha mitnakhem lekha leharegekha.
weth bny Sme bqly wqwm brx lk al lbn axy xrnh now therefore, my child-between, obey my voice; arise, flee thou to laban-white my brother to haran-conceived-gladness; ve‘atah beni shema‘ beqoli, vequm berakh ’el laban ’akhi kharanah.
wySbt emw ymym axdym ed aSr tSwb xmt axyk and tarry with him a few days, until thy brother's fury turn away; veyashabta ‘imo yamim ’akhadim, ‘ad ’asher tashub khamat ’akhikha.
ed Swb ap axyk mmk wSkx at aSr eSyt lw wSlxty wlqxtyk mSm lmh aSkl gm Snykm ywm axd until thy brother's nose-anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then i will send, and fetch thee from thence: why should i be deprived also of you both in one day? ‘ad shub ’af ’akhikha mimekha veshakhakh ’asher ‘asita lo veshalakhti uleqakhtikha misham, lamah ’eshkal gam shenekhem yom ’ekhad.
wtamr rbqh al yzxq qzty bxyy mpny bnwt xt am lqx yeqb aSh mbnwt xt kalh mbnwt harz lmh ly xyym and rebekah-stall said to isaac-laughter, i am weary of my life because of children-betweenesss of heth-bold: if jacob-backstreet take a woman of children-betweenesss of heth-bold, such as these which are of children-betweenesss of the land, what good my life do me? vatomer ribqah ’el yizkhaq qazti bekhayay mipenei benot khet, ’im loqeakh ya‘aqob ’ishah mibenot khet ka’eleh mibenot ha’arez lamah li khayim.
wyqra yzxq al yeqb wybrk atw wyzwhw wyamr lw la tqx aSh mbnwt knen and isaac-laughter called jacob-backstreet, and knee-fluffy-blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, no take a woman of children-betweenesss of canaan-mobile-trade. vayiqra yizkhaq ’el ya‘aqob vaybarekh ’oto, vayzavehu vayomer lo lo tiqakh ’ishah mibenot kena‘an.
qwm lk pdnh arm byth btwal aby amk wqx lk mSm aSh mbnwt lbn axy amk arise, go to padanaram-redeemed-stack, to the daughter-house of bethuel-his-house-towards thy mother's father; and take thee a woman from thence of children-betweenesss of laban-white thy mother's brother. qum lekh ’aram betah betu’el ’abi ’imekha, veqakh lekha misham ’ishah mibenot laban ’akhi ’imekha.
wal Sdy ybrk atk wyprk wyrbk whyyt lqhl emym and to-no-these almighty knee-fluffy-bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of with-mum-people; ve’el shaday yebarekh ’otekha veyafrekha veyarbekha, vehayita liqhal ‘amim.
wytn lk at brkt abrhm lk wlcrek atk lrStk at arz mgryk aSr ntn alhym labrhm and give thee the knee-fluffy-blessing of abraham-their-dick, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which to-no-these gave unto abraham-their-dick. veyiten lekha birkat ’abraham lekha ulezar‘akha ’itakh, lerishtekha ’erez megurekha ’asher natan ’elohim le’abraham.
wySlx yzxq at yeqb wylk pdnh arm al lbn bn btwal harmy axy rbqh am yeqb weSw and isaac-laughter sent away jacob-backstreet: and he went to padanaram-redeemed-stack unto laban-white, child-between of bethuel-his-house-towards the arami-high, the brother of rebekah-stall, jacob-backstreet's and esau-do's mother. vayishlakh yizkhaq ya‘aqob vayelekh ’aram, ’el laban ben betu’el ha’arami ’akhi ribqah ’em ya‘aqob ve‘esav.
wyra eSw ky brk yzxq at yeqb wSlx atw pdnh arm lqxt lw mSm aSh bbrkw atw wyzw elyw lamr la tqx aSh mbnwt knen when esau-do saw that isaac-laughter had knee-fluffy-blessed jacob-backstreet, and sent him away to padanaram-redeemed-stack, to take him a woman from thence; and that as he knee-fluffy-blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, no take a woman of children-betweenesss of canaan-mobile-trade; vayar ‘esav ki berakh yizkhaq ya‘aqob veshilakh ’oto ’aram laqakhat lo misham ’ishah, bebarakho ’oto vayzav ‘alav lemor lo tiqakh ’ishah mibenot kena‘an.
wySme yeqb al abyw wal amw wylk pdnh arm and that jacob-backstreet obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to padanaram-redeemed-stack; vayishma‘ ya‘aqob ’abiv ve’el ’imo, vayelekh ’aram.
wyra eSw ky rewt bnwt knen beyny yzxq abyw and esau-do seeing that children-betweenesss of canaan-mobile-trade pleased not isaac-laughter his father; vayar ‘esav ki ra‘ot benot kena‘an, be‘enei yizkhaq ’abiv.
wylk eSw al ySmeal wyqx at mxlt bt ySmeal bn abrhm axwt nbywt el nSyw lw laSh then went esau-do unto ishmael-towards-hears, and took unto the women which he had mahalath the daughter-hoof-bat-child of ishmael-towards-hears abraham-their-dick's child-between, the sister of nebajoth-lets-house, to be his woman. vayelekh ‘esav ’el yishma‘el, vayiqakh makhalat bat yishma‘el ben ’abraham ’akhot nebayot ‘al nashav lo le’ishah.
wyza yeqb mbar Sbe wylk xrnh and jacob-backstreet went out from beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear, and went toward haran-conceived-gladness. vayezei ya‘aqob mibe’er shaba‘, vayelekh kharanah.
wypge bmqwm wyln Sm ky ba hSmS wyqx mabny hmqwm wySm mraStyw wySkb bmqwm hhwa and he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep. vayifga‘ bamaqom vayalen sham ki ba hashemesh vayiqakh me’abnei hamaqom vayasem mera’ashotav, vayishkab bamaqom hahu.
wyxlm whnh slm mzb arzh wraSw mgye hSmymh whnh mlaky alhym elym wyrdym bw and he dreamed, and behold a dabble-helix set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to namespaces: and behold the angel-messangers of to-no-these ascending and descending on it. vayakhalom vehineh sulam muzab ’arzah verosho magia‘ hashamayemah, vehineh mal’akhei ’elohim ‘olim veyoredim bo.
whnh yhwh nzb elyw wyamr any yhwh alhy abrhm abyk walhy yzxq harz aSr ath Skb elyh lk atnnh wlcrek and, behold, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah stood above it, and said, i am yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of abraham-their-dick thy father, and the to-no-these of isaac-laughter: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will i give it, and to thy seed; vehineh yhvh nizab ‘alav vayomar ’ani yhvh ’elohei ’abraham ’abikha velohei yizkhaq, ha’arez ’asher ’atah shokheb ‘aleha lekha ’etenenah ulezar‘ekha.
whyh crek kepr harz wprzt ymh wqdmh wzpnh wngbh wnbrkw bk kl mSpxt hadmh wbcrek and thy seed be as the dust of the earth, and thou spread abroad to the sea-west, and to the east, and to the hide-north, and to the south-dry: and in thee and in thy seed all the families of the earth be knee-fluffy-blessed. vehayah zar‘akha ka‘afar ha’arez ufarazta yamah vaqedemah vezafonah vanegbah, venibrakhu bekha kal mishpekhot ha’adamah ubezar‘ekha.
whnh anky emk wSmrtyk bkl aSr tlk whSbtyk al hadmh hcat ky la aecbk ed aSr am eSyty at aSr dbrty lk and, behold, i am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for i will not leave thee, until i have done that which i have bee-spoken to thee of. vehineh ’anokhi ‘imakh ushemartikha bekhol ’asher telekh vahashibotikha ’el ha’adamah hazot, ki lo ’e‘ezabekha ‘ad ’asher ‘asiti ’asher dibarti lakh.
wyyqz yeqb mSntw wyamr akn yS yhwh bmqwm hch wanky la ydety and jacob-backstreet awaked out of his sleep, and he said, surely yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah is in this place; and i hand-knew it not. vayiqaz ya‘aqob mishenato vayomer ’akhen yesh yhvh bamaqom hazeh, ve’anokhi lo yada‘eti.
wyyra wyamr mh nwra hmqwm hch ayn ch ky am byt alhym wch Ser hSmym and he was afraid, and said, how dreadful is this place! this is none other and the daughter-house of to-no-these, and this is the hair-gate of namespaces. vayira vayomar mah nora hamaqom hazeh, ’en zeh ki ’im bet ’elohim vezeh sha‘ar hashamayim.
wySkm yeqb bbqr wyqx at habn aSr Sm mraStyw wySm ath mzbh wyzq Smn el raSh and jacob-backstreet rose up early in the morning, and took the father-child-stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a column-stand, and poured name-from-oil upon the head of it. vayashkem ya‘aqob baboqer vayiqakh ha’eben ’asher sam mera’ashotav vayasem ’otah mazebah, vayizoq shemen ‘al roshah.
wyqra at Sm hmqwm hhwa byt al wawlm lwc Sm heyr lraSnh and he called the name of that place bethel-house-towards: and the name of that light-city was called luz-hazel at the first. vayiqra shem hamaqom hahu ’el, ve’ulam luz shem ha‘ir larishonah.
