wydr yeqb ndr lamr am yhyh alhym emdy wSmrny bdrk hch aSr anky hwlk wntn ly lxm lakl wbgd llbS and jacob-backstreet vowed a vow, saying, if to-no-these will be with me, and will keep me in this way that i go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on, vayidar ya‘aqob neder lemor, ’im yihyeh ’elohim ‘imadi ushemarani baderekh hazeh ’asher ’anokhi holekh venatan li lekhem le’ekhol ubeged lilbosh.
wSbty bSlwm al byt aby whyh yhwh ly lalhym so that i come again to my father's daughter-house in peace; then yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah be my to-no-these: veshabti beshalom ’el bet ’abi, vehayah yhvh li lelohim.
whabn hcat aSr Smty mzbh yhyh byt alhym wkl aSr ttn ly eSr aeSrnw lk and this father-child-stone, which i have set for a column-stand, be to-no-these's daughter-house: and of all that thou give me i will surely give the tenth unto thee. veha’eben hazot ’asher samti mazebah yihyeh bet ’elohim, vekhol ’asher titen li ‘aser ’a‘aserenu lakh.
wySa yeqb rglyw wylk arzh bny qdm then jacob-backstreet went on his journey, and came into the land of the with-mum-people of the east. vayisa ya‘aqob raglav, vayelekh ’arzah bene qedem.
wyra whnh bar bSdh whnh Sm SlSh edry zan rbzym elyh ky mn hbar hhwa ySqw hedrym whabn gdlh el py hbar and he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it; for out of that well they watered the flocks: and a great father-child-stone was upon the well's mouth. vayar vehineh be’er basadeh vehineh sham sheloshah ‘edre zon robezim ‘aleha ki min habe’er hahiv yashqu ha‘adarim, veha’eben gedolah ‘al pi habe’er.
wnaspw Smh kl hedrym wgllw at habn mel py hbar whSqw at hzan whSybw at habn el py hbar lmqmh and thither were all the flocks added: and they rolled the father-child-stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the father-child-stone again upon the well's mouth in his place. vene’esfu shamah khal ha‘adarim vegalalu ha’eben me‘al pi habe’er vehishqu hazon, veheshibu ha’eben ‘al pi habe’er limqomah.
wyamr lhm yeqb axy mayn atm wyamrw mxrn anxnw and jacob-backstreet said unto them, my brethren, whence be ye? and they said, of haran-conceived-gladness are we. vayomer lahem ya‘aqob ’akhay me’ayin ’atem, vayomeru mekharan ’anakhenu.
wyamr lhm hydetm at lbn bn nxwr wyamrw ydenw and he said unto them, hand-know ye laban-white child-between of nahor-snore? and they said, we hand-know him. vayomer lahem hayda‘tem laban ben nakhor, vayomeru yada‘enu.
wyamr lhm hSlwm lw wyamrw Slwm whnh rxl btw bah em hzan and he said unto them, is he well? and they said, he is well: and, behold, rachel-ewe his daughter-hoof-bat-child cometh with the sheep. vayomer lahem hashalom lo, vayomeru shalom vehineh rakhel bito ba’ah ‘im hazon.
wyamr hn ewd hywm gdwl la et hasp hmqnh hSqw hzan wlkw rew and he said, lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the in-them-animal should be added together: from-waters ye the sheep, and go and feed them. vayomer hen ‘od hayom gadol lo ‘et he’asef hamiqneh, hashqu hazon ulekhu re‘u.
wyamrw la nwkl ed aSr yaspw kl hedrym wgllw at habn mel py hbar whSqynw hzan and they said, we cannot, until all the flocks be added together, and till they roll the father-child-stone from the well's mouth; then we from-waters the sheep. vayomeru lo nukhal ‘ad ’asher ye’asefu kal ha‘adarim vegalalu ha’eben me‘al pi habe’er, vehishqinu hazon.
ewdnw mdbr emm wrxl bah em hzan aSr labyh ky reh hwa and while he yet spake with them, rachel-ewe came with her father's sheep; for she kept them. ‘odenu medaber ‘imam, verakhel ba’ah ‘im hazon ’asher le’abiha ki ro‘ah hi
wyhy kaSr rah yeqb at rxl bt lbn axy amw wat zan lbn axy amw wygS yeqb wygl at habn mel py hbar wySq at zan lbn axy amw and it came to pass, when jacob-backstreet saw rachel-ewe the daughter-hoof-bat-child of laban-white his mother's brother, and the sheep of laban-white his mother's brother, that jacob-backstreet went near, and rolled the father-child-stone from the well's mouth, and watered the flock of laban-white his mother's brother. vayhi ka’asher ra’ah ya‘aqob rakhel bat laban ’akhi ’imo ve’et zon laban ’akhi ’imo, vayigash ya‘aqob vayagel ha’eben me‘al pi habe’er vayashq zon laban ’akhi ’imo.
wySq yeqb lrxl wySa at qlw wybk and jacob-backstreet kissed rachel-ewe, and lifted up his voice, and wept. vayishaq ya‘aqob lerakhel, vayisa qolo vayebek.
wygd yeqb lrxl ky axy abyh hwa wky bn rbqh hwa wtrz wtgd labyh and jacob-backstreet told rachel-ewe that he was her father's brother, and that he was rebekah-stall's child-between: and she ran and told her father. vayaged ya‘aqob lerakhel ki ’akhi ’abiha hu vekhi ben ribqah hu, vataraz vataged le’abiha.
wyhy kSme lbn at Sme yeqb bn axtw wyrz lqratw wyxbq lw wynSq lw wybyahw al bytw wyspr llbn at kl hdbrym halh and it came to pass, when laban-white heard the tidings of jacob-backstreet his sister's child-between, that he ran to until-witness him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his daughter-house. and he told laban-white all these things. vayhi khishmoa‘ laban shema‘ ya‘aqob ben ’akhoto vayaraz liqrato vaykhabeq lo vaynasheq lo vaybi’ehu ’el beto, vaysaper lelaban kal hadebarim ha’eleh.
wyamr lw lbn ak ezmy wbSry ath wySb emw xdS ymym and laban-white said to him, surely thou art my bone and my flesh. and he abode with him the space of a month. vayomer lo laban ’akh ‘azmi ubesari ’atah, vayesheb ‘imo khodesh yamim.
wyamr lbn lyeqb hky axy ath webdtny xnm hgydh ly mh mSkrtk and laban-white said unto jacob-backstreet, because thou art my brother, shouldest thou therefore work for me for nought? tell me, what thy wages be? vayomer laban leya‘aqob hakhi ’akhi ’atah va‘abadtani khinam, hagidah li mah maskurtekha.
wllbn Sty bnwt Sm hgdlh lah wSm hqTnh rxl and laban-white had two children-betweenesss: the name of the elder was leah-tired, and the name of the younger was rachel-ewe. ulelaban shetei banot, shem hagedolah le’ah veshem haqetanah rakhel.
weyny lah rkwt wrxl hyth ypt tar wypt mrah leah-tired was tender eyed; and rachel-ewe was beautiful and well favored. ve‘enei le’ah rakot, verakhel hayetah yefat to’ar vifat mar’eh.
wyahb yeqb at rxl wyamr aebdk Sbe Snym brxl btk hqTnh and jacob-backstreet loved rachel-ewe; and said, i will work for thee seven years for rachel-ewe thy younger daughter-hoof-bat-child. vaye’ehab ya‘aqob rakhel, vayomer ’e‘ebadekha sheba‘ shanim berakhel bitekha haqetanah.
wyamr lbn Twb tty ath lk mtty ath layS axr Sbh emdy and laban-white said, it is better that i give her to thee, than that i should give her to another man: abide with me. vayomer laban tob titi ’otah lakh mititi ’otah le’ish ’akher, shebah ‘imadi.
wyebd yeqb brxl Sbe Snym wyhyw beynyw kymym axdym bahbtw ath and jacob-backstreet worked for seven years for rachel-ewe; and they seemed unto him and a few days, for the love he had to her. vaya‘abod ya‘aqob berakhel sheba‘ shanim, vayihyu be‘enav keyamim ’akhadim be’ahabato ’otah.
wyamr yeqb al lbn hbh at aSty ky mlaw ymy wabwah alyh and jacob-backstreet said unto laban-white, give me my woman, for my days are fulfilled, that i may go in unto her. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el laban habah ’ishti ki male’u yamay, ve’abo’ah ’eleha.
wyasp lbn at kl anSy hmqwm wyeS mSth and laban-white added together all the men of the place, and made a until-conception. vaye’esof laban kal ’anshei hamaqom vaya‘as mishteh.
wyhy berb wyqx at lah btw wyba ath alyw wyba alyh and it came to pass in the evening, that he took leah-tired his daughter-hoof-bat-child, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her. vayhi ba‘ereb vayiqakh le’ah bito vayabei ’otah ’elav, vayabo ’eleha.
wytn lbn lh at clph Spxtw llah btw Spxh and laban-white gave unto his daughter-hoof-bat-child leah-tired zilpah-sprinkle his maid for an handmaid. vayiten laban zilpah shifkhato, lele’ah bito shifkhah.
wyhy bbqr whnh hwa lah wyamr al lbn mh cat eSyt ly hla brxl ebdty emk wlmh rmytny and it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was leah-tired: and he said to laban-white, what is this thou hast done unto me? did not i work for with thee for rachel-ewe? wherefore then hast thou beguiled me? vayhi baboqer vehineh hi le’ah, vayomer ’el laban mah zot ‘asita li halo berakhel ‘abadti ‘imakh velamah rimitani.
wyamr lbn la yeSh kn bmqwmnw ltt hzeyrh lpny hbkyrh and laban-white said, it must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before-turns the firstborn. vayomer laban lo ye‘aseh khen bimqomenu, latet haze‘irah lifnei habekhirah.
mla Sbe cat wntnh lk gm at cat bebdh aSr tebd emdy ewd Sbe Snym axrwt fulfil her week, and we will give thee this also for the work which thou work for with me yet seven other years. malei shebua‘ zot, venitenah lekha gam zot ba‘abodah ’asher ta‘abod ‘imadi ‘od sheba‘ shanim ’akherot.
wyeS yeqb kn wymla Sbe cat wytn lw at rxl btw lw laSh and jacob-backstreet did so, and fulfilled her week: and he gave him rachel-ewe his daughter-hoof-bat-child to woman also. vaya‘as ya‘aqob ken vaymalei shebua‘ zot, vayiten lo rakhel bito lo le’ishah.
wytn lbn lrxl btw at blhh Spxtw lh lSpxh and laban-white gave to rachel-ewe his daughter-hoof-bat-child bilhah-good-times his handmaid to be her maid. vayiten laban lerakhel bito bilhah shifkhato, lah leshifkhah.
wyba gm al rxl wyahb gm at rxl mlah wyebd emw ewd Sbe Snym axrwt and he went in also unto rachel-ewe, and he loved also rachel-ewe more than leah-tired, and worked for with him yet seven other years. vayabo gam ’el rakhel vaye’ehab gam rakhel mile’ah, vaya‘abod ‘imo ‘od sheba‘ shanim ’akherot.
wyra yhwh ky Snwah lah wyptx at rxmh wrxl eqrh and when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah saw that leah-tired was hated, he opened her womb: and rachel-ewe was barren. vayar yhvh ki senu’ah le’ah vayiftakh rakhmah, verakhel ‘aqarah.
wthr lah wtld bn wtqra Smw rawbn ky amrh ky rah yhwh benyy ky eth yahbny aySy and leah-tired conceived, and conceived-of a child-between, and she called his name reuben-see-child: for she said, surely yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath looked upon my affliction; now therefore my man will love me. vatahar le’ah vateled ben vatiqra shemo re’uben, ki ’amerah ki ra’ah yhvh be‘anyi ki ‘atah ye’ehabani ’ishi.
wthr ewd wtld bn wtamr ky Sme yhwh ky Snwah anky wytn ly gm at ch wtqra Smw Smewn and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between; and said, because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath heard i was hated, he hath therefore given me this child-between also: and she called his name simeon-hear-home. vatahar ‘od vateled ben vatomer ki shama‘ yhvh ki senu’ah ’anokhi vayiten li gam zeh, vatiqra shemo shim‘on.
wthr ewd wtld bn wtamr eth hpem ylwh aySy aly ky yldty lw SlSh bnym el kn qra Smw lwy and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between; and said, now this time will my man be joined unto me, because i have born him three children-betweens: therefore was his name called levi-join. vatahar ‘od vateled ben vatomer ‘atah hapa‘am yilaveh ’ishi ’elay ki yaladti lo sheloshah banim, ‘al ken qara shemo levi.
wthr ewd wtld bn wtamr hpem awdh at yhwh el kn qrah Smw yhwdh wtemd mldt and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between: and she said, now will i praise yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: therefore she called his name judah-know; and left bearing. vatahar ‘od vateled ben vatomer hapa‘am ’odeh yhvh ‘al ken qare’ah shemo yehudah, vata‘amod miledet.
wtra rxl ky la yldh lyeqb wtqna rxl baxth wtamr al yeqb hbh ly bnym wam ayn mth anky and when rachel-ewe saw that she conceived-of jacob-backstreet no children-betweens, rachel-ewe envied her sister; and said unto jacob-backstreet, give me children-betweens, or else i die. vatere rakhel ki lo yaledah leya‘aqob vateqanei rakhel ba’akhotah, vatomer ’el ya‘aqob habah li banim ve’im ’ayin metah ’anokhi.
wyxr ap yeqb brxl wyamr htxt alhym anky aSr mne mmk pry bTn and jacob-backstreet's nose-anger was kindled against rachel-ewe: and he said, am i in to-no-these's stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb? vayikhar ’af ya‘aqob berakhel, vayomer hatakhat ’elohim ’anokhi ’asher mana‘ mimekh peri baten.
wtamr hnh amty blhh ba alyh wtld el brky wabnh gm anky mmnh and she said, behold my maid bilhah-good-times, go in unto her; and she bear upon my knees, that i may also have children-betweens by her. vatomer hineh ’amati bilhah bo ’eleha, veteled ‘al birkay ve’ibaneh gam ’anokhi mimenah.
wttn lw at blhh Spxth laSh wyba alyh yeqb and she gave him bilhah-good-times her handmaid to woman: and jacob-backstreet went in unto her. vatiten lo ’et bilhah shifkhatah le’ishah, vayabo ’eleha ya‘aqob.
wthr blhh wtld lyeqb bn and bilhah-good-times conceived, and conceived-of jacob-backstreet a child-between. vatahar bilhah vateled leya‘aqob ben.
wtamr rxl dnny alhym wgm Sme bqly wytn ly bn el kn qrah Smw dn and rachel-ewe said, to-no-these hath decided me, and hath also heard my voice, and hath given me a child-between: therefore called she his name dan-discuss. vatomer rakhel danani ’elohim vegam shama‘ beqoli vayiten li ben, ‘al ken qare’ah shemo dan.
wthr ewd wtld blhh Spxt rxl bn Sny lyeqb and bilhah-good-times rachel-ewe's maid conceived again, and conceived-of jacob-backstreet a second child-between. vatahar ‘od vateled bilhah shifkhat rakhel, ben sheni leya‘aqob.
wtamr rxl nptwly alhym nptlty em axty gm yklty wtqra Smw nptly and rachel-ewe said, with great wrestlings have i wrestled with my sister, and i have prevailed: and she called his name naphtali-twisted. vatomer rakhel naftulei ’elohim niftalti ‘im ’akhoti gam yakholeti, vatiqra shemo naftali.
wtra lah ky emdh mldt wtqx at clph Spxth wttn ath lyeqb laSh when leah-tired saw that she had left bearing, she took zilpah-sprinkle her maid, and gave her jacob-backstreet to woman. vatere le’ah ki ‘amedah miledet, vatiqakh zilpah shifkhatah vatiten ’otah leya‘aqob le’ishah.
wtld clph Spxt lah lyeqb bn and zilpah-sprinkle leah-tired's maid conceived-of jacob-backstreet a child-between. vateled zilpah shifkhat le’ah leya‘aqob ben.
wtamr lah bgd ba gd wtqra at Smw gd and leah-tired said, luck comet: and she called his name gad-tell-luck. vatomer le’ah gad, vatiqra shemo gad.
wtld clph Spxt lah bn Sny lyeqb and zilpah-sprinkle leah-tired's maid conceived-of jacob-backstreet a second child-between. vateled zilpah shifkhat le’ah ben sheni leya‘aqob.
wtamr lah baSry ky aSrwny bnwt wtqra at Smw aSr and leah-tired said, blissful am i, for children-betweenesss will call me knee-fluffy-blessed: and she called his name asher-bliss. vatomer le’ah be’asheri ki ’isheruni banot, vatiqra shemo ’asher.
wylk rawbn bymy qzyr xTym wymza dwdaym bSdh wyba atm al lah amw wtamr rxl al lah tny na ly mdwday bnk and reuben-see-child went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them unto his mother leah-tired. then rachel-ewe said to leah-tired, give me, i pray thee, of thy child-between's mandrakes. vayelekh re’uben bimei qezir khitim vayimza duda’im basadeh vayabei ’otam ’el le’ah ’imo, vatomer rakhel ’el le’ah teni na li miduda’ei benekh.
wtamr lh hmeT qxtk at aySy wlqxt gm at dwday bny wtamr rxl lkn ySkb emk hlylh txt dwday bnk and she said unto her, is it a small matter that thou hast taken my man? and wouldest thou take away my child-between's mandrakes also? and rachel-ewe said, therefore he lie with thee to night for thy child-between's mandrakes. vatomer lah ham‘at qakhtekh ’ishi velaqakhat gam duda’ei beni, vatomer rakhel lakhen yishkab ‘imakh halaylah takhat duda’ei benekh.
wyba yeqb mn hSdh berb wtza lah lqratw wtamr aly tbwa ky Skr Skrtyk bdwday bny wySkb emh blylh hwa and jacob-backstreet came out of the field in the evening, and leah-tired went out to until-witness him, and said, thou must come in unto me; for surely i have hired thee with my child-between's mandrakes. and he lay with her that night. vayabo ya‘aqob min hasadeh ba‘ereb vatezei le’ah liqrato vatomer ’elay tabo ki sakhor sekhartikha beduda’ei beni, vayishkab ‘imah balaylah hu.
wySme alhym al lah wthr wtld lyeqb bn xmySy and to-no-these hearkened unto leah-tired, and she conceived, and conceived-of jacob-backstreet the fifth child-between. vayishma‘ ’elohim ’el le’ah, vatahar vateled leya‘aqob ben khamishi.
wtamr lah ntn alhym Skry aSr ntty Spxty laySy wtqra Smw ySSkr and leah-tired said, to-no-these hath given me my wage, because i have given my maiden to my man: and she called his name issachar-wage. vatomer le’ah natan ’elohim sekhari ’asher natati shifkhati le’ishi, vatiqra shemo yisashkhar.
wthr ewd lah wtld bn SSy lyeqb and leah-tired conceived again, and conceived-of jacob-backstreet the sixth child-between. vatahar ‘od le’ah vateled ben shishi leya‘aqob
wtamr lah cbdny alhym aty cbd Twb hpem ycblny aySy ky yldty lw SSh bnym wtqra at Smw cblwn and leah-tired said, to-no-these hath endued me with a good dowry; now will my man dwell with me, because i have born him six children-betweens: and she called his name zebulun-fertile. vatomer le’ah zebadani ’elohim ’oti zebed tob hapa‘am yizbeleni ’ishi ki yaladti lo shishah banim, vatiqra shemo zebulun.
waxr yldh bt wtqra at Smh dynh and afterwards she conceived-of a daughter-hoof-bat-child, and called her name dinah-discuss. ve’akhar yaledah bat, vatiqra shemah dinah.
wyckr alhym at rxl wySme alyh alhym wyptx at rxmh and to-no-these remembered rachel-ewe, and to-no-these hearkened to her, and opened her womb. vayizkor ’elohim rakhel, vayishma‘ ’eleha ’elohim vayiftakh rakhmah.
wthr wtld bn wtamr asp alhym at xrpty and she conceived, and conceived-of a child-between; and said, to-no-these hath taken away my reproach: vatahar vateled ben, vatomer ’asaf ’elohim kherpati.
wtqra at Smw ywsp lamr ysp yhwh ly bn axr and she called his name joseph-add; and said, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah add to me another child-between. vatiqra shemo yosef lemor, yosef yhvh li ben ’akher.
wyhy kaSr yldh rxl at ywsp wyamr yeqb al lbn Slxny walkh al mqwmy wlarzy and it came to pass, when rachel-ewe had born joseph-add, that jacob-backstreet said unto laban-white, send me away, that i may go unto mine own place, and to my country. vayhi ka’asher yaledah rakhel yosef, vayomer ya‘aqob ’el laban shalekheni ve’elekhah ’el meqomi ule’arzi.
tnh at nSy wat yldy aSr ebdty atk bhn walkh ky ath ydet at ebdty aSr ebdtyk give me my women and my children-betweens, for whom i have worked for thee, and let me go: for thou knowest my work which i have done thee. tenah ’et nashay ve’et yeladay ’asher ‘abadti ’otekha bahen ve’elekhah, ki ’atah yada‘ta ‘abodati ’asher ‘abadtikha.
wyamr alyw lbn am na mzaty xn beynyk nxSty wybrkny yhwh bgllk and laban-white said unto him, i pray thee, if i have found favor in thine eyes, tarry: for i have learned by experience that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath knee-fluffy-blessed me for thy sake. vayomer ’elav laban ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha, nikhashti vaybarakheni yhvh biglalekha.
wyamr nqbh Skrk ely watnh and he said, appoint me thy wages, and i will give it. vayomar, naqebah sekharekha ‘alay ve’etenah.
wyamr alyw ath ydet at aSr ebdtyk wat aSr hyh mqnk aty and he said unto him, thou knowest how i have worked for thee, and how thy in-them-animal was with me. vayomer ’elav ’atah yada‘ta ’asher ‘abadtikha, ve’et ’asher hayah miqnekha ’iti.
ky meT aSr hyh lk lpny wyprz lrb wybrk yhwh atk lrgly weth mty aeSh gm anky lbyty for it was little which thou hadst before-turns i came, and it is now increased unto a multitude; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath knee-fluffy-blessed thee since my coming: and now when i provide for mine own daughter-house also? ki me‘at ’asher hayah lekha lefanay vayifroz larob vaybarekh yhvh ’otekha leragli, ve‘atah matay ’e‘eseh gam ’anokhi lebeti.
wyamr mh atn lk wyamr yeqb la ttn ly mawmh am teSh ly hdbr hch aSwbh areh zank aSmr and he said, what i give thee? and jacob-backstreet said, no give me any thing: if thou wilt do this thing for me, i will again feed and keep thy flock. vayomer mah ’eten lakh, vayomer ya‘aqob lo titen li me’umah ’im ta‘aseh li hadabar hazeh ’ashubah ’er‘eh zonekha ’eshmor.
aebr bkl zank hywm hsr mSm kl Sh nqd wTlwa wkl Sh xwm bkSbym wTlwa wnqd becym whyh Skry i will pass through all thy flock to day, removing from thence all the speckled and spotted in-them-animal, and all the brown in-them-animal among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the intense-goats: and of such be my hire. ’e‘ebor bekhal zonekha hayom haser misham kal seh naqod vetalu vekhal seh khum bakesabim vetalu venaqod ba‘izim, vehayah sekhari.
wenth by zdqty bywm mxr ky tbwa el Skry lpnyk kl aSr aynnw nqd wTlwa becym wxwm bkSbym gnwb hwa aty so my being right answer for me in time to come, when it come for my hire before-turns thy face-turns: every one that is not speckled and spotted among the intense-goats, and brown among the sheep, that be counted stolen with me. ve‘anetah bi zidqati beyom makhar ki tabo ‘al sekhari lefanekha, kol ’asher ’enenu naqod vetalu ba‘izim vekhum bakesabim ganub hu ’iti.
wyamr lbn hn lw yhy kdbrk and laban-white said, behold, i would it might be according to thy bee-word. vayomer laban hen, lu yehi khidbarekha.
wysr bywm hhwa at htySym heqdym whTlaym wat kl hecym hnqdwt whTlat kl aSr lbn bw wkl xwm bkSbym wytn byd bnyw and he removed that day the he intense-goats that were ring-streaked and spotted, and all the she intense-goats that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some to-between-bin-between-build-white in it, and all the brown among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his children-betweens. vayasar bayom hahu hateyashim ha‘aqudim vehatelu’im ve’et kal ha‘izim hanequdot vehatelu’ot kol ’asher laban bo vekhal khum bakesabim, vayiten beyad banav.
wySm drk SlSt ymym bynw wbyn yeqb wyeqb reh at zan lbn hnwtrt and he set three days' journey betwixt-bin himself and jacob-backstreet: and jacob-backstreet fed the rest of laban-white's flocks. vayasem derekh sheloshet yamim beno uben ya‘aqob, veya‘aqob ro‘eh zon laban hanotarot.
wyqx lw yeqb mql lbnh lx wlwc wermwn wypzl bhn pzlwt lbnwt mxSp hlbn aSr el hmqlwt and jacob-backstreet took him pens of green poplar, and of the hazel and chestnut tree; and pilled to-between-bin-between-build-white streaks in them, and made the to-between-bin-between-build-white appear which was in the pens. vayiqakh lo ya‘aqob maqal libneh lakh veluz ve‘ermon, vayfazel bahen pezalot lebanot makhsof halaban ’asher ‘al hamaqlot.
wyzg at hmqlwt aSr pzl brhTym bSqtwt hmym aSr tban hzan lStwt lnkx hzan wyxmnh bban lStwt and he set the pens which he had pilled before-turns the flocks in the gutters in the watering troughs when the flocks came to drink, that they should conceive when they came to drink. vayazeg hamaqlot ’asher pizel barohatim beshiqatot hamayim, ’asher tabona hazon lishtot lenokhakh hazon vayekhamnah bebo’an lishtot.
wyxmw hzan al hmqlwt wtldn hzan eqdym nqdym wTlaym and the flocks conceived before-turns the pens, and brought forth in-them-animal ring-streaked, speckled, and spotted. vayekhemu hazon ’el hamaqlot, vateladna hazon ‘aqudim nequdim utelu’im.
whkSbym hpryd yeqb wytn pny hzan al eqd wkl xwm bzan lbn wySt lw edrym lbdw wla Stm el zan lbn and jacob-backstreet did separate the lambs, and set the face-turns-turns of the flocks toward the ring-streaked, and all the brown in the flock of laban-white; and he put his own flocks by themselves, and put them not unto laban-white's in-them-animal. vehakesabim hifrid ya‘aqob vayiten penei hazon ’el ‘aqod vekhal khum bezon laban, vayashet lo ‘adarim lebado velo shatam ‘al zon laban.
whyh bkl yxm hzan hmqSrwt wSm yeqb at hmqlwt leyny hzan brhTym lyxmnh bmqlwt and it came to pass, whensoever the stronger in-them-animal did conceive, that jacob-backstreet laid the pens before-turns the eyes of the in-them-animal in the gutters, that they might conceive among the pens. vehayah bekhal yakhem hazon hamqusharot vesam ya‘aqob hamaqlot le‘enei hazon barohatim, leyakhmenah bamaqlot.
wbheTyp hzan la ySym whyh heTpym llbn whqSrym lyeqb and when the in-them-animal were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler were laban-white's, and the stronger jacob-backstreet's. ubeha‘atif hazon lo yasim, vehayah ha‘atufim lelaban vehaqeshurim leya‘aqob.
wyprz hayS mad mad wyhy lw zan rbwt wSpxwt webdym wgmlym wxmrym and the man increased exceedingly, and had much in-them-animal, and maid-mothers, and workers, and ripen-camels, and asses. vayifroz ha’ish me’od me’od, vayhi lo zon rabot ushefakhot va‘abadim ugemalim vakhamorim.
wySme at dbry bny lbn lamr lqx yeqb at kl aSr labynw wmaSr labynw eSh at kl hkbd hch and he heard the bee-words of laban-white's children-betweens, saying, jacob-backstreet hath taken away all that was our father's; and of that which was our father's hath he gotten all this heaviness. vayishma‘ dibrei bene laban lemor laqakh ya‘aqob kal ’asher le’abinu, ume’asher le’abinu ‘asah kal hakabod hazeh.
wyra yeqb at pny lbn whnh aynnw emw ktmwl SlSwm and jacob-backstreet beheld the countenance of laban-white, and, behold, it was not toward him as before-turns. vayar ya‘aqob penei laban, vehineh ’enenu ‘imo kitmol shilshom.
wyamr yhwh al yeqb Swb al arz abwtyk wlmwldtk wahyh emk and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto jacob-backstreet, return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and i will be with thee. vayomer yhvh ’el ya‘aqob shub ’el ’erez ’abotekha ulemoladtekha, ve’ehyeh ‘imakh.
wySlx yeqb wyqra lrxl wllah hSdh al zanw and jacob-backstreet sent and called rachel-ewe and leah-tired to the field unto his flock, vayishlakh ya‘aqob vayiqra lerakhel ulele’ah, hasadeh ’el zono.
wyamr lhn rah anky at pny abykn ky aynnw aly ktml SlSm walhy aby hyh emdy and said unto them, i see your father's countenance, that it is not toward me as before-turns; and the to-no-these of my father hath been with me. vayomer lahen ro’eh ’anokhi penei ’abikhen ki ’enenu ’elay kitmol shilshom, velohei ’abi hayah ‘imadi.
watnh ydetn ky bkl kxy ebdty at abykn and ye hand-know that with all my dynamic i have worked for your father. ve’atenah yeda‘ten, ki bekhal kokhi ‘abadti ’abikhen.
wabykn htl by whxlp at mSkrty eSrt mnym wla ntnw alhym lhre emdy and your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; and to-no-these suffered him not to hurt me. va’abikhen hetel bi vehekhelif maskurti ‘aseret monim, velo netano ’elohim lehara‘ ‘imadi.
am kh yamr nqdym yhyh Skrk wyldw kl hzan nqdym wam kh yamr eqdym yhyh Skrk wyldw kl hzan eqdym if he said thus, the speckled be thy wages; then all the in-them-animal conceived-of speckled: and if he said thus, the ring-streaked be thy hire; then conceived-of all the in-them-animal ring-streaked. ’im koh yomar nequdim yihyeh sekharekha veyaledu khal hazon nequdim, ve’im koh yomar ‘aqudim yihyeh sekharekha veyaledu khal hazon ‘aqudim.
wyzl alhym at mqnh abykm wytn ly thus to-no-these hath taken away the in-them-animal of your father, and given them to me. vayazel ’elohim miqneh ’abikhem vayiten li.
wyhy bet yxm hzan waSa eyny wara bxlwm whnh hetdym helym el hzan eqdym nqdym wbrdym and it came to pass at the time that the in-them-animal conceived, that i lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the ram-voicelesss which leaped upon the in-them-animal were ring-streaked, speckled, and grizzled. vayhi be‘et yakhem hazon va’esa ‘enay va’ere bakhalom, vehineh ha‘atudim ha‘olim ‘al hazon ‘aqudim nequdim uberudim.
wyamr aly mlak halhym bxlwm yeqb wamr hnny and the angel-messanger of to-no-these spake unto me in a dream, saying, jacob-backstreet: and i said, here am i. vayomer ’elay mal’akh ha’elohim bakhalom ya‘aqob, va’omar hineni.
wyamr Sa na eynyk wrah kl hetdym helym el hzan eqdym nqdym wbrdym ky rayty at kl aSr lbn eSh lk and he said, lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the ram-voicelesss which leap upon the in-them-animal are ring-streaked, speckled, and grizzled: for i have seen all that laban-white doeth unto thee. vayomer sa na ‘enekha ure’eh kal ha‘atudim ha‘olim ‘al hazon ‘aqudim nequdim uberudim, ki ra’iti kal ’asher laban ‘oseh lakh.
anky hal byt al aSr mSxt Sm mzbh aSr ndrt ly Sm ndr eth qwm za mn harz hcat wSwb al arz mwldtk i am the to-no-these of bethel-house-towards, where thou lubeedst the column-stand, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred. ’anokhi ha’el bet ’el ’asher mashakhta mazebah ’asher nadarta li neder, ‘atah qum zei min ha’arez hazot veshub ’el ’erez moladtekha.
wten rxl wlah wtamrnh lw hewd lnw xlq wnxlh bbyt abynw and rachel-ewe and leah-tired answered and said unto him, is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's daughter-house? vata‘an rakhel vele’ah vatomarnah lo, ha‘od lanu kheleq venakhalah bebet ’abinu.
hlwa nkrywt nxSbnw lw ky mkrnw wyakl gm akwl at kspnw are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money. halo nakheriyot nekhshabnu lo ki mekharanu, vayokhal gam ’akhol kaspenu.
ky kl heSr aSr hzyl alhym mabynw lnw hwa wlbnynw weth kl aSr amr alhym alyk eSh for all the riches which to-no-these hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children-betweens's: now then, whatsoever to-no-these hath said unto thee, do. ki khal ha‘osher ’asher hizil ’elohim me’abinu lanu hu ulebanenu, ve‘atah kol ’amar ’elohim ’elekha ‘aseh.
wyqm yeqb wySa at bnyw wat nSyw el hgmlym then jacob-backstreet rose up, and set his children-betweens and his women upon ripen-camels; vayaqam ya‘aqob, vayisa banav ve’et nashav ‘al hagemalim.
wynhg at kl mqnhw wat kl rkSw aSr rkS mqnh qnynw aSr rkS bpdn arm lbwa al yzxq abyw arzh knen and he carried away all his in-them-animal, and all his goods which he had gotten, the in-them-animal of his getting, which he had gotten in padanaram-redeemed-stack, for to go to isaac-laughter his father in the land of canaan-mobile-trade. vayinhag kal miqnehu ve’et kal rekhusho ’asher rakhash miqneh qinyano ’asher rakhash befadan ’aram, labo ’el yizkhaq ’abiv ’arzah kena‘an.
wlbn hlk lgcc at zanw wtgnb rxl at htrpym aSr labyh and laban-white went to shear his sheep: and rachel-ewe had stolen the images that were her father's. velaban halakh ligzoz zono, vatignob rakhel haterafim ’asher le’abiha.
wygnb yeqb at lb lbn harmy el bly hgyd lw ky brx hwa and jacob-backstreet stole away unawares to laban-white the arami-high, in that he told him not that he fled. vayignob ya‘aqob leb laban ha’arami, ‘al beli higid lo ki boreakh hu.
wybrx hwa wkl aSr lw wyqm wyebr at hnhr wySm at pnyw hr hgled so he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face-turns toward the mount gilead-roll-until-heap. vayibrakh hu vekhal ’asher lo vayaqam vaya‘abor hanahar, vayasem panav har hagil‘ad.
wygd llbn bywm hSlySy ky brx yeqb and it was told laban-white on the third day that jacob-backstreet was fled. vayugad lelaban bayom hashelishi, ki barakh ya‘aqob.
wyqx at axyw emw wyrdp axryw drk Sbet ymym wydbq atw bhr hgled and he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey; and they overtook him in the mount gilead-roll-until-heap. vayiqakh ’ekhav ‘imo vayirdof ’akharav derekh shib‘at yamim, vayadbeq ’oto behar hagil‘ad.
wyba alhym al lbn harmy bxlm hlylh wyamr lw hSmr lk pn tdbr em yeqb mTwb ed re and to-no-these came to laban-white the arami-high in a dream by night, and said unto him, take heed that thou speak not to jacob-backstreet either good or bad. vayabo ’elohim ’el laban ha’arami bakhalom halayelah, vayomer lo hishamer lekha pen tedaber ‘im ya‘aqob mitob ‘ad ra‘.
wySg lbn at yeqb wyeqb tqe at ahlw bhr wlbn tqe at axyw bhr hgled then laban-white overtook jacob-backstreet. now jacob-backstreet had pitched his tent in the mount: and laban-white with his brethren pitched in the mount of gilead-roll-until-heap. vayaseg laban ya‘aqob, veya‘aqob taqa‘ ’aholo bahar velaban taqa‘ ’et ’ekhav behar hagil‘ad.
wyamr lbn lyeqb mh eSyt wtgnb at lbby wtnhg at bnty kSbywt xrb and laban-white said to jacob-backstreet, what hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my children-betweenesss, as captives taken with the sword? vayomer laban leya‘aqob meh ‘asita vatignob lebabi, vatenaheg benotay kishbuyot khareb.
lmh nxbat lbrx wtgnb aty wla hgdt ly waSlxk bSmxh wbSrym btp wbknwr wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that i might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp? lamah nakhbeta libroakh vatignob ’oti, velo higadta li va’ashalekhakha besimkhah ubeshirim betof ubekhinor.
wla nTStny lnSq lbny wlbnty eth hsklt eSw and hast not suffered me to kiss my children-betweens and my children-betweenesss? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing. velo netashtani lenasheq lebanay velibnotay, ‘atah hiskalta ‘aso.
yS lal ydy leSwt emkm re walhy abykm amS amr aly lamr hSmr lk mdbr em yeqb mTwb ed re it is in the dynamic of my hand to do you hurt: and the to-no-these of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, take thou heed that thou speak not to jacob-backstreet either good or bad. yesh le’el yadi la‘asot ‘imakhem ra‘, velohei ’abikhem ’emesh ’amar ’elay lemor hishamer midaber ‘im ya‘aqob mitob ‘ad ra‘.
weth hlk hlkt ky nksp nkspth lbyt abyk lmh gnbt at alhy and now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father's daughter-house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my to-no-these? ve‘atah halokh halakhta ki nikhsof nikhsaftah lebet ’abikha, lamah ganabta ’elohay.
wyen yeqb wyamr llbn ky yraty ky amrty pn tgcl at bnwtyk memy and jacob-backstreet answered and said to laban-white, because i was afraid: for i said, peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy children-betweenesss from me. vaya‘an ya‘aqob vayomer lelaban, ki yareti ki ’amarti pen tigzol benotekha me‘imi.
em aSr tmza at alhyk la yxyh ngd axynw hkr lk mh emdy wqx lk wla yde yeqb ky rxl gnbtm with whomsoever thou findest thy to-no-these, let him not live: before-turns our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. for jacob-backstreet hand-knew not that rachel-ewe had stolen them. ‘im ’asher timza ’elohekha lo yikhyeh neged ’akhenu haker lekha mah ‘imadi veqakh lakh, velo yada‘ ya‘aqob ki rakhel genabatam.
wyba lbn bahl yeqb wbahl lah wbahl Sty hamht wla mza wyza mahl lah wyba bahl rxl and laban-white went into jacob-backstreet's tent, and into leah-tired's tent, and into the two maid-mothers' tents; and he found them not. then went he out of leah-tired's tent, and entered into rachel-ewe's tent. vayabo laban be’ohel ya‘aqob ube’ohel le’ah ube’ohel shetei ha’amahot velo maza, vayezei me’ohel le’ah vayabo be’ohel rakhel.
wrxl lqxh at htrpym wtSmm bkr hgml wtSb elyhm wymSS lbn at kl hahl wla mza now rachel-ewe had taken the images, and put them in the ripen-camel's all-tool, and sat upon them. and laban-white searched all the tent, and found them not. verakhel laqekhah haterafim vatesimem bekhar hagamal vatesheb ‘alehem, vaymashesh laban kal ha’ohel velo maza.
wtamr al abyh al yxr beyny adny ky lwa awkl lqwm mpnyk ky drk nSym ly wyxpS wla mza at htrpym and she said to her father, let it not displease my base-lord that i cannot rise up before-turns thee; for the custom of women is upon me. and he searched and found not the images. vatomer ’el ’abiha ’al be‘enei ’adoni ki lo ’ukhal laqum mipanekha ki derekh nashim li, vaykhapes velo maza haterafim.
wyxr lyeqb wyrb blbn wyen yeqb wyamr llbn mh pSey mh xTaty ky dlqt axry and jacob-backstreet was wroth, and chode with laban-white: and jacob-backstreet answered and said to laban-white, what is my fire-name? what is my miss, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me? vayikhar leya‘aqob vayareb belaban, vaya‘an ya‘aqob vayomer lelaban mah pish‘i mah khatati ki dalaqta ’akharay.
ky mSSt at kl kly mh mzat mkl kly bytk Sym kh ngd axy waxyk wywkyxw byn Snynw whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy daughter-household stuff? set it here before-turns my brethren and thy brethren, that they may decide betwixt-bin us both. ki mishashta kal kelay mah mazata mikol kele betekha sim koh neged ’akhay ve’akhekha, veyokhikhu ben shenenu.
ch eSrym Snh anky emk rxlyk wecyk la Sklw wayly zank la aklty this double-ten-twenty years have i been with thee; thy ewes and thy she intense-goats have not cast their young, and the ram-voicelesss of thy flock have i not eaten. zeh ‘esrim shanah ’anokhi ‘imakh rekhelekha ve‘izekha lo shikelu, ve’elei zonekha lo ’akhaleti.
Trph la hbaty alyk anky axTnh mydy tbqSnh gnbty ywm wgnbty lylh that which was torn of beasts i brought not unto thee; i conceived-of the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night. terefah lo hebeti ’elekha ’anokhi ’akhatenah miyadi tebaqshenah, genubti yom ugenubti layelah.
hyyty bywm aklny xrb wqrx blylh wtdd Snty meyny thus i was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes. hayiti bayom ’akhalani khoreb veqerakh balayelah, vatidad shenati me‘enay.
ch ly eSrym Snh bbytk ebdtyk arbe eSrh Snh bSty bntyk wSS Snym bzank wtxlp at mSkrty eSrt mnym thus have i been double-ten-twenty years in thy daughter-house; i worked for thee fourteen years for thy two children-betweenesss, and six years for thy in-them-animal: and thou hast changed my wages ten times. zeh li ‘esrim shanah bebetekha ‘abadtikha ’arba‘ ‘esreh shanah bishtei benotekha veshesh shanim bezonekha, vatakhalef maskurti ‘aseret monim.
lwly alhy aby alhy abrhm wpxd yzxq hyh ly ky eth ryqm Slxtny at enyy wat ygye kpy rah alhym wywkx amS except the to-no-these of my father, the to-no-these of abraham-their-dick, and the fear of isaac-laughter, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty. to-no-these hath seen mine affliction and the labor of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight. lulei ’elohei ’abi ’elohei ’abraham ufakhad yizkhaq hayah li ki ‘atah reqam shilakhtani,. ‘aneyi ve’et yegia‘ kapay ra’ah ’elohim vayokhakh ’amesh.
wyen lbn wyamr al yeqb hbnwt bnty whbnym bny whzan zany wkl aSr ath rah ly hwa wlbnty mh aeSh lalh hywm aw lbnyhn aSr yldw and laban-white answered and said unto jacob-backstreet, these children-betweenesss are my children-betweenesss, and these children-betweens are my children-betweens, and these in-them-animal are my in-them-animal, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can i do this day unto these my children-betweenesss, or unto their children-betweens which they have born? vaya‘an laban vayomer ’el ya‘aqob habanot benotay vehabanim banay vehazon zoni vekhol ’asher ’atah ro’eh li hu, velibnotay mah ’e‘eseh la’eleh hayom ’o libnehen ’asher yaladu.
weth lkh nkrth bryt any wath whyh led byny wbynk now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, i and thou; and let it be for a witness between-bin me and thee. ve‘atah lekhah nikhretah berit ’ani va’atah, vehayah le‘ed beni ubenekha.
wyqx yeqb abn wyrymh mzbh and jacob-backstreet took a father-child-stone, and set it up for a column-stand. vayiqakh ya‘aqob ’aben, vayrimeha mazebah.
wyamr yeqb laxyw lqTw abnym wyqxw abnym wyeSw gl wyaklw Sm el hgl and jacob-backstreet said unto his brethren, gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap. vayomer ya‘aqob le’ekhav liqtu ’abanim vayiqkhu ’abanim vaya‘asu gal, vayokhelu sham ‘al hagal.
wyqra lw lbn ygr Shdwta wyeqb qra lw gled and laban-white called it jegarsahadutha-awe-of-data: and jacob-backstreet called it galeed-roll-until-heap. vayiqra lo laban yegar sahaduta, veya‘aqob qara gal‘ed.
wyamr lbn hgl hch ed byny wbynk hywm el kn qra Smw gled and laban-white said, this heap is a witness between-bin me and thee this day. therefore was the name of it called galeed-roll-until-heap; vayomer laban hagal hazeh ‘ed beni ubenekha hayom, ‘al ken qara shemo gal‘ed.
whmzph aSr amr yzp yhwh byny wbynk ky nstr ayS mrehw and mizpah-watch; for he said, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah watch between-bin me and thee, when we are absent one from another. vehamizpah ’asher ’amar yizef yhvh beni ubenekha, ki nisater ’ish mere‘ehu.
am tenh at bnty wam tqx nSym el bnty ayn ayS emnw rah alhym ed byny wbynk if thou afflict my children-betweenesss, or if thou take other women beside my children-betweenesss, no man is with us; see, to-no-these is witness betwixt-bin me and thee. ’im te‘aneh benotay ve’im tiqakh nashim ‘al benotay ’en ’ish ‘imanu, re’eh ’elohim ‘ed beni ubenekha.
wyamr lbn lyeqb hnh hgl hch whnh hmzbh aSr yryty byny wbynk and laban-white said to jacob-backstreet, behold this heap, and behold this column-stand, which i have cast betwixt-bin me and thee: vayomer laban leya‘aqob, hineh hagal hazeh vehineh hamazebah ’asher yariti beni ubenekha.
ed hgl hch wedh hmzbh am any la aebr alyk at hgl hch wam ath la tebr aly at hgl hch wat hmzbh hcat lreh this heap be witness, and this column-stand be witness, that i will not pass over this heap to thee, and that no pass over this heap and this column-stand unto me, for harm. ‘ed hagal hazeh ve‘edah hamazebah, ’im ’ani lo ’e‘ebor ’elekha hagal hazeh ve’im ’atah lo ta‘abor ’elay hagal hazeh ve’et hamazebah hazot lera‘ah.
alhy abrhm walhy nxwr ySpTw bynynw alhy abyhm wySbe yeqb bpxd abyw yzxq the to-no-these of abraham-their-dick, and the to-no-these of nahor-snore, the to-no-these of their father, decide betwixt-bin us. and jacob-backstreet sware by the fear of his father isaac-laughter. ’elohei ’abraham velohei nakhor yishpetu benenu ’elohei ’abihem, vayishaba‘ ya‘aqob befakhad ’abiv yizkhaq.
wycbx yeqb cbx bhr wyqra laxyw lakl lxm wyaklw lxm wylynw bhr then jacob-backstreet butchered butch upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount. vayizbakh ya‘aqob zebakh bahar vayiqra le’ekhav le’ekhal lakhem, vayokhelu lekhem vayalinu bahar.
wySkm lbn bbqr wynSq lbnyw wlbnwtyw wybrk athm wylk wySb lbn lmqmw and early in the morning laban-white rose up, and kissed his children-betweens and his children-betweenesss, and knee-fluffy-blessed them: and laban-white departed, and returned unto his place. vayashkem laban baboqer vaynasheq lebanav velibnotav vaybarekh ’ethem, vayelekh vayashab laban limqomo.
wyeqb hlk ldrkw wypgew bw mlaky alhym and jacob-backstreet went on his way, and the angel-messangers of to-no-these met him. veya‘aqob halakh ledarko, vayifge‘u bo mal’akhei ’elohim.
wyamr yeqb kaSr ram mxnh alhym ch wyqra Sm hmqwm hhwa mxnym and when jacob-backstreet saw them, he said, this is to-no-these's troop-cluster: and he called the name of that place mahanaim-camping. vayomer ya‘aqob ka’asher ra’am makhaneh ’elohim zeh, vayiqra shem hamaqom hahu makhanayim.
wySlx yeqb mlakym lpnyw al eSw axyw arzh Seyr Sdh adwm and jacob-backstreet sent messengers before-turns him to esau-do his brother unto the land of seir-hair-style, the country of edom-man. vayishlakh ya‘aqob mal’akhim lefanav ’el ‘esav ’akhiv, ’arzah se‘ir sedeh ’edom.
wyzw atm lamr kh tamrwn ladny leSw kh amr ebdk yeqb em lbn grty waxr ed eth and he direct them, saying, thus ye speak unto my base-lord esau-do; thy worker jacob-backstreet saith thus, i have sojourned with laban-white, and stayed there until now: vayzav ’otam lemor koh tomerun ladoni le‘esav, koh ’amar ‘abdekha ya‘aqob ‘im laban garti va’ekhar ‘ad ‘atah.
wyhy ly Swr wxmwr zan webd wSpxh waSlxh lhgyd ladny lmza xn beynyk and i have wall-oxen, and asses, flocks, and workers, and familiars: and i have sent to tell my base-lord, that i may find attractiveness in thy sight. vayhi li shor vakhamor zon ve‘ebed veshifkhah, va’eshlekhah lehagid ladoni limzo khen be‘enekha.
wySbw hmlakym al yeqb lamr banw al axyk al eSw wgm hlk lqratk warbe mawt ayS emw and the messengers returned to jacob-backstreet, saying, we came to thy brother esau-do, and also he cometh to until-witness thee, and four hundred men with him. vayashubu hamal’akhim ’el ya‘aqob lemor, banu ’el ’akhikha ‘esav vegam holekh liqratekha ve’arba‘ me’ot ’ish ‘imo.
wyyra yeqb mad wyzr lw wyxz at hem aSr atw wat hzan wat hbqr whgmlym lSny mxnwt then jacob-backstreet was greatly afraid and distressed: and he divided the with-mum-people that was with him, and the flocks, and visit-cattles, and the ripen-camels, into two bands; vayira ya‘aqob me’od vayezer lo, vayakhaz ha‘am ’asher ’ito ve’et hazon ve’et habaqar vehagemalim lishnei makhanot.
wyamr am ybwa eSw al hmxnh haxt whkhw whyh hmxnh hnSar lplyTh and said, if esau-do come to the one company, and hit it, then the other company which is left escape. vayomer ’im yabo ‘esav ’el hamakhaneh ha’akhat vehikahu, vehayah hamakhaneh hanish’ar lifletah.
wyamr yeqb alhy aby abrhm walhy aby yzxq yhwh hamr aly Swb larzk wlmwldtk wayTybh emk and jacob-backstreet said, o to-no-these of my father abraham-their-dick, and to-no-these of my father isaac-laughter, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah which saidst unto me, return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and i will deal well with thee: vayomer ya‘aqob ’elohei ’abi ’abraham velohei ’abi yizkhaq, yhvh ha’omer ’elay shub le’arzekha ulemoladtekha ve’etibah ‘imakh.
qTnty mkl hxsdym wmkl hamt aSr eSyt at ebdk ky bmqly ebrty at hyrdn hch weth hyyty lSny mxnwt i am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast showed unto thy worker; for with my staff i passed over this jordan-its-going-down; and now i am become two bands. qatoneti mikol hakhasadim umikal ha’emet ’asher ‘asita ‘abdekha, ki bemaqli ‘abarti hayarden hazeh ve‘atah hayiti lishnei makhanot.
hzylny na myd axy myd eSw ky yra anky atw pn ybwa whkny am el bnym deliver me, i pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of esau-do: for i fear him, lest he will come and hit me, and the mother with children-betweens. hazileni na miyad ’akhi miyad ‘esav, ki yarei ’anokhi ’oto pen yabo vehikani ’em ‘al banim.
wath amrt hyTb ayTyb emk wSmty at crek kxwl hym aSr la yspr mrb and thou saidst, i will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude. ve’atah ’amarta heteb ’etib ‘imakh, vesamti zar‘akha kekhol hayam ’asher lo yisafer merob.
wyln Sm blylh hhwa wyqx mn hba bydw mnxh leSw axyw and he lodged there that same night; and took of that which came to his hand a present for esau-do his brother; vayalen sham balaylah hahu, vayiqakh min haba beyado minkhah le‘esav ’akhiv.
ecym matym wtySym eSrym rxlym matym waylym eSrym two hundred she intense-goats, and double-ten-twenty he intense-goats, two hundred ewes, and double-ten-twenty ram-voicelesss, ‘izim matayim uteyashim ‘esrim, rekhelim matayim ve’elim ‘esrim.
gmlym mynyqwt wbnyhm SlSym prwt arbeym wprym eSrh atnt eSrym weyrm eSrh thirty milch ripen-camels with their colts, forty kine, and ten bulls, double-ten-twenty she asses, and ten foals. gemalim meniqot ubenehem sheloshim, parot ’arba‘im ufarim ‘asarah ’atonot ‘esrim va‘yarim ‘asarah.
wytn byd ebdyw edr edr lbdw wyamr al ebdyw ebrw lpny wrwx tSymw byn edr wbyn edr and he delivered them into the hand of his workers, every drove by themselves; and said unto his workers, pass over before-turns me, and put a space betwixt-bin drove and drove. vayiten beyad ‘abadav ‘eder ‘eder lebado, vayomer ’el ‘abadav ‘ibru lefanay verevakh tasimu ben ‘eder uben ‘eder.
wyzw at hraSwn lamr ky ypgSk eSw axy wSalk lamr lmy ath wanh tlk wlmy alh lpnyk and he direct the foremost, saying, when esau-do my brother until-witnesseth thee, and asketh thee, saying, whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before-turns thee? vayzav harishon lemor, ki yifgashekha ‘esav ’akhi vish’elekha lemor lemi ’atah ve’anah telekh ulemi ’eleh lefanekha.
wamrt lebdk lyeqb mnxh hwa Slwxh ladny leSw whnh gm hwa axrynw then thou say, they be thy worker jacob-backstreet's; it is a present sent unto my base-lord esau-do: and, behold, also he is behind us. ve’amarta le‘abdekha leya‘aqob minkhah hi shelukhah ladoni le‘esav, vehineh gam hu ’akharenu.
wyzw gm at hSny gm at hSlySy gm at kl hhlkym axry hedrym lamr kdbr hch tdbrwn al eSw bmzakm atw and so direct he the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, on this manner ye speak unto esau-do, when ye find him. vayzav hasheni gam hashelishi gam kal haholekhim ha‘adarim lemor, kadabar hazeh tedaberun ’el ‘esav bemoza’akhem ’oto.
wamrtm gm hnh ebdk yeqb axrynw ky amr akprh pnyw bmnxh hhlkt lpny waxry kn arah pnyw awly ySa pny and say ye moreover, behold, thy worker jacob-backstreet is behind us. for he said, i will appease him with the present that goeth before-turns me, and afterward i will see his face-turns; peradventure he will accept of me. va’amartem gam hineh ‘abdekha ya‘aqob ’akharenu, ki ’amar ’akhaperah fanav baminkhah haholekhet lefanay ve’akhare khen ’er’eh fanav ’ulay yisa fanay.
wtebr hmnxh el pnyw whwa ln blylh hhwa bmxnh so went the present over before-turns him: and himself lodged that night in the company. vata‘abor haminkhah ‘al panav, vehu lan balaylah hahu bamakhaneh.
wyqm blylh hwa wyqx at Sty nSyw wat Sty Spxtyw wat axd eSr yldyw wyebr at mebr ybq and he rose up that night, and took his two women, and his two familiars, and his eleven children-betweens, and passed over the ford jaboq-boxwood. vayaqam balaylah hu vayiqakh shetei nashav ve’et shetei shifkhotav ve’et ’akhad ‘asar yeladav, vaya‘abor ma‘abar yaboq.
wyqxm wyebrm at hnxl wyebr at aSr lw and he took them, and sent them over the brook, and sent over that he had. vayiqakhem vaya‘abirem hanakhal, vaya‘aber ’asher lov
wywtr yeqb lbdw wyabq ayS emw ed elwt hSxr and jacob-backstreet was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day. vayivater ya‘aqob lebado, vaye’abeq ’ish ‘imo ‘ad ‘alot hashakhar.
wyra ky la ykl lw wyge bkp yrkw wtqe kp yrk yeqb bhabqw emw and when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of jacob-backstreet's thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him. vayar ki lo yakhol lo vayiga‘ bekhaf yerekho, vateqa‘ kaf yerekh ya‘aqob behe’abeqo ‘imo.
wyamr Slxny ky elh hSxr wyamr la aSlxk ky am brktny and he said, let me go, for the day breaketh. and he said, i will not let thee go, except thou knee-fluffy-bless me. vayomer shalekheni ki ‘alah hashakhar, vayomer lo ’ashalekhakha ki ’im berakhtani.
wyamr alyw mh Smk wyamr yeqb and he said unto him, what is thy name? and he said, jacob-backstreet. vayomer ’elav mah shemekha, vayomer ya‘aqob.
wyamr la yeqb yamr ewd Smk ky am ySral ky Sryt em alhym wem anSym wtwkl and he said, thy name be called no more jacob-backstreet, and israel-juicy-towards: for you are fluent in to-no-these and in men, and you can do it. vayomer lo ya‘aqob ye’amer ‘od shimkha ’im yisra’el, ki sarita ‘im ’elohim ve‘im ’anashim vatukhal.
wySal yeqb wyamr hgydh na Smk wyamr lmh ch tSal lSmy wybrk atw Sm and jacob-backstreet asked him, and said, tell me, i pray thee, thy name. and he said, wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name? and he knee-fluffy-blessed him there. vayish’al ya‘aqob vayomer hagidah na shemekha vayomer lamah zeh tish’al lishmi, vaybarekh ’oto sham.
wyqra yeqb Sm hmqwm pnyal ky rayty alhym pnym al pnym wtnzl npSy and jacob-backstreet called the name of the place towards-face-turnings-of: for i have seen to-no-these face-turns to face-turns, and my life is preserved. vayiqra ya‘aqob shem hamaqom peni’el, ki ra’iti ’elohim panim ’el panim vatinazel nafshi.
wycrx lw hSmS kaSr ebr at pnwal whwa zle el yrkw and as he passed over penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his side-zoleah. vayizrakh lo hashemesh ka’asher ‘abar penu’el, vehu zolea‘ ‘al yerekho.
el kn la yaklw bny ySral at gyd hnSh aSr el kp hyrk ed hywm hch ky nge bkp yrk yeqb bgyd hnSh therefore children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards eat not of the sinew which shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day: because he touched the hollow of jacob-backstreet's thigh in the sinew that shrank. ‘al ken lo yokhelu bene yisra’el gid hanasheh ’asher ‘al kaf hayarekh ‘ad hayom hazeh, ki naga‘ bekhaf yerekh ya‘aqob begid hanasheh.
wySa yeqb eynyw wyra whnh eSw ba wemw arbe mawt ayS wyxz at hyldym el lah wel rxl wel Sty hSpxwt and jacob-backstreet lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, esau-do came, and with him four hundred men. and he divided children-betweens unto leah-tired, and unto rachel-ewe, and unto the two handmaids. vayisa ya‘aqob ‘enav vayar vehineh ‘esav ba ve‘imo ’arba‘ me’ot ’ish, vayakhaz hayladim ‘al le’ah ve‘al rakhel ve‘al shetei hashefakhot.
wySm at hSpxwt wat yldyhn raSnh wat lah wyldyh axrnym wat rxl wat ywsp axrnym and he put the handmaids and their children-betweens foremost, and leah-tired and her children-betweens after, and rachel-ewe and joseph-add here-hindermost. vayasem hashefakhot ve’et yaldehen rishonah, ve’et le’ah viladeha ’akharonim ve’et rakhel ve’et yosef ’akharonim.
whwa ebr lpnyhm wyStxw arzh Sbe pemym ed gStw ed axyw and he passed over before-turns them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother. vehu ‘abar lifnehem, vayishtakhu ’arzah sheba‘ pe‘amim ‘ad gishto ‘ad ’akhiv.
wyrz eSw lqratw wyxbqhw wypl el zwarw wySqhw wybkw and esau-do ran to until-witness him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him: and they wept. vayaraz ‘esav liqrato vaykhabeqehu vayipol ‘al zavarav vayishaqehu, vayibku.
wySa at eynyw wyra at hnSym wat hyldym wyamr my alh lk wyamr hyldym aSr xnn alhym at ebdk and he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and children-betweens; and said, who are those with thee? and he said, children-betweens which to-no-these hath graciously given thy worker. vayisa ‘enav vayar hanashim ve’et hayladim vayomer mi ’eleh lakh, vayomar hayladim ’asher khanan ’elohim ‘abdekha.
wtgSn hSpxwt hnh wyldyhn wtStxwyn then the handmaidens came near, they and their children-betweens, and they bowed themselves. vatigashna hashefakhot henah veyaldehen vatishtakhavena.
wtgS gm lah wyldyh wyStxww waxr ngS ywsp wrxl wyStxww and leah-tired also with her children-betweens came near, and bowed themselves: and after came joseph-add near and rachel-ewe, and they bowed themselves. vatigash gam le’ah viladeha vayishtakhavu, ve’akhar nigash yosef verakhel vayishtakhavu.
wyamr my lk kl hmxnh hch aSr pgSty wyamr lmza xn beyny adny and he said, what meanest thou by all this drove which i met? and he said, these are to find attractiveness in the sight of my base-lord. vayomer mi lekha kal hamakhaneh hazeh ’asher pagasheti, vayomer limzo khen be‘enei ’adoni.
wyamr eSw yS ly rb axy yhy lk aSr lk and esau-do said, i have enough, my brother; keep that thou hast unto thyself. vayomer ‘esav yesh li rab, ’akhi yehi ’asher lakh.
wyamr yeqb al na am na mzaty xn beynyk wlqxt mnxty mydy ky el kn rayty pnyk krat pny alhym wtrzny and jacob-backstreet said, nay, i pray thee, if now i have found attractiveness in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand: for therefore i have seen thy face-turns, as though i had seen the face-turns of to-no-these, and thou wast pleased with me. vayomer ya‘aqob ’al na ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha velaqakhta minkhati miyadi, ki ‘al ken ra’iti fanekha kir’ot penei ’elohim vatirzeni.
qx na at brkty aSr hbat lk ky xnny alhym wky yS ly kl wypzr bw wyqx take, i pray thee, my knee-fluffy-blessing that is brought to thee; because to-no-these hath dealt graciously with me, and because i have enough. and he urged him, and he took it. qakh na birkhati ’asher hubat lakh ki khanani ’elohim vekhi yesh li khol, vayifzar bo vayiqakh.
wyamr nseh wnlkh walkh lngdk and he said, let us take our journey, and let us go, and i will go before-turns thee. vayomer nis‘ah venelekhah, ve’elekhah lenegdekha.
wyamr alyw adny yde ky hyldym rkym whzan whbqr elwt ely wdpqwm ywm axd wmtw kl hzan and he said unto him, my base-lord knoweth that children-betweens are tender, and the flocks and visit-cattles with young are with me: and if men should overdrive them one day, all the flock will die. vayomer ’elav ’adoni yodea‘ ki hayladim rakim vehazon vehabaqar ‘alot ‘alay, udefaqum yom ’ekhad vametu kal hazon.
yebr na adny lpny ebdw wany atnhlh laTy lrgl hmlakh aSr lpny wlrgl hyldym ed aSr aba al adny Seyrh let my base-lord, i pray thee, pass over before-turns his worker: and i will lead on softly, according as the in-them-animal that goeth before-turns me and children-betweens be able to endure, until i come unto my base-lord unto seir-hair-style. ya‘abar na ’adoni lifnei ‘abdo, va’ani ’etnahalah le’iti leregel hamelakhah ’asher lefanay uleregel hayladim ‘ad ’asher ’abo ’el ’adoni se‘irah.
wyamr eSw azygh na emk mn hem aSr aty wyamr lmh ch amza xn beyny adny and esau-do said, let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me. and he said, what needeth it? let me find attractiveness in the sight of my base-lord. vayomer ‘esav ’azigah na ‘imekha min ha‘am ’asher ’iti, vayomer lamah zeh ’emza khen be‘enei ’adoni.
wySb bywm hhwa eSw ldrkw Seyrh so esau-do returned that day on his way unto seir-hair-style. vayashab bayom hahu ‘esav ledarko se‘irah.
wyeqb nse skth wybn lw byt wlmqnhw eSh skt el kn qra Sm hmqwm skwt and jacob-backstreet journeyed to succoth-booths, and between-built him an daughter-house, and made booths for his in-them-animal: therefore the name of the place is called succoth-booths. veya‘aqob nasa‘ sukotah vayiben lo bayit, ulemiqnehu ‘asah sukot ‘al ken qara shem hamaqom sukot.
wyba yeqb Slm eyr Skm aSr barz knen bbaw mpdn arm wyxn at pny heyr and jacob-backstreet came to shalem-whole, a light-city of shechem-shoulder, which is in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, when he came from padanaram-redeemed-stack; and pitched his tent before-turns the light-city. vayabo ya‘aqob shalem ‘ir shekhem ’asher be’erez kena‘an bebo’o mipadan ’aram, vayikhan penei ha‘ir.
wyqn at xlqt hSdh aSr nTh Sm ahlw myd bny xmwr aby Skm bmah qSyTh and he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of children-betweens of ham-hotor, shechem-shoulder's father, for an hundred pieces of money. vayiqen khelqat hasadeh ’asher natah ’aholo miyad bene khamor ’abi shekhem, beme’ah qesitah.
wyzb Sm mcbx wyqra lw al alhy ySral and he erected there an butcher-kitchen, and called it eleloheisrael-theohries-of-immersion. vayazeb sham mizbeakh, vayiqra lo ’el ’elohei yisra’el.
wtza dynh bt lah aSr yldh lyeqb lrawt bbnwt harz and dinah-discuss the daughter-hoof-bat-child of leah-tired, which she conceived-of unto jacob-backstreet, went out to see children-betweenesss of the land. vatezei dinah bat le’ah ’asher yaledah leya‘aqob, lir’ot bibnot ha’arez.
wyra ath Skm bn xmwr hxwy nSya harz wyqx ath wySkb ath wyenh and when shechem-shoulder child-between of ham-hotor the hivite-experience, prince of the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and answered her. vayar ’otah shekhem ben khamor hakhivi nesi ha’arez, vayiqakh ’otah vayishkab ’otah vay‘aneha.
wtdbq npSw bdynh bt yeqb wyahb at hner wydbr el lb hner and his being clave unto dinah-discuss the daughter-hoof-bat-child of jacob-backstreet, and he loved the damsel, and spake kindly unto the damsel. vatidbaq nafsho bedinah bat ya‘aqob, vaye’ehab hana‘ara vaydaber ‘al leb hana‘ara.
wyamr Skm al xmwr abyw lamr qx ly at hyldh hcat laSh and shechem-shoulder spake unto his father ham-hotor, saying, get me this damsel to woman. vayomer shekhem ’el khamor ’abiv lemor, qakh li hayaldah hazot le’ishah.
wyeqb Sme ky Tma at dynh btw wbnyw hyw at mqnhw bSdh whxrS yeqb ed bam and jacob-backstreet heard that he had tama dinah-discuss his daughter-hoof-bat-child: now his children-betweens were with his in-them-animal in the field: and jacob-backstreet held his peace until they were come. veya‘aqob shama‘ ki timei dinah bito ubanav hayu ’et miqnehu basadeh, vehekherish ya‘aqob ‘ad bo’am.
wyza xmwr aby Skm al yeqb ldbr atw and ham-hotor the father of shechem-shoulder went out unto jacob-backstreet to commune with him. vayezei khamor ’abi shekhem ’el ya‘aqob, ledaber ’ito.
wbny yeqb baw mn hSdh kSmem wytezbw hanSym wyxr lhm mad ky nblh eSh bySral lSkb at bt yeqb wkn la yeSh and children-betweens of jacob-backstreet came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in israel-juicy-towards in lying with jacob-backstreet's daughter-hoof-bat-child: which thing ought not to be done. ubenei ya‘aqob ba’u min hasadeh keshame‘am vayit‘azebu ha’anashim vayikhar me’od, ki nebalah ‘asah beyisra’el lishkab ’et bat ya‘aqob vekhen lo ye‘aseh.
wydbr xmwr atm lamr Skm bny xSqh npSw bbtkm tnw na ath lw laSh and ham-hotor communed with them, saying, the being of my child-between shechem-shoulder longeth for your daughter-hoof-bat-child: i pray you give her him to woman. vaydaber khamor ’itam lemor, shekhem beni khasheqah nafsho bebitekhem tenu na ’otah lo le’ishah.
whtxtnw atnw bntykm ttnw lnw wat bntynw tqxw lkm and make ye marriages with us, and give your children-betweenesss unto us, and take our children-betweenesss unto you. vehitkhatenu ’otanu, benotekhem titenu lanu ve’et benotenu tiqkhu lakhem.
watnw tSbw wharz thyh lpnykm Sbw wsxrwh whaxcw bh and ye dwell with us: and the land be before-turns you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein. ve’itanu teshebu, veha’arez tihyeh lifnekhem shebu usekharuha vehe’akhazu bah.
wyamr Skm al abyh wal axyh amza xn beynykm waSr tamrw aly atn and shechem-shoulder said unto her father and unto her brethren, let me find attractiveness in your eyes, and what ye say unto me i will give. vayomer shekhem ’el ’abih ve’el ’akheha ’emza khen be‘enekhem, va’asher tomeru ’elay ’eten.
hrbw ely mad mhr wmtn watnh kaSr tamrw aly wtnw ly at hner laSh ask me never so much dowry and gift, and i will give according as ye say unto me: and give me the damsel to woman. harbu ‘alay me’od mohar umatan ve’etenah ka’asher tomeru ’elay, utenu li hana‘ara le’ishah.
wyenw bny yeqb at Skm wat xmwr abyw bmrmh wydbrw aSr Tma at dynh axtm and children-betweens of jacob-backstreet answered shechem-shoulder and ham-hotor his father deceitfully, and said, because he had tama dinah-discuss their sister: vaya‘anu bene ya‘aqob shekhem ve’et khamor ’abiv bemirmah vaydaberu, ’asher time dinah ’akhotam.
wyamrw alyhm la nwkl leSwt hdbr hch ltt at axtnw layS aSr lw erlh ky xrph hwa lnw and they said unto them, we cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is foreskinned; for that were a reproach unto us: vayomeru ’alehem lo nukhal la‘asot hadabar hazeh latet ’akhotenu le’ish ’asher ‘arelah, ki kherpah hi lanu.
ak bcat nawt lkm am thyw kmnw lhml lkm kl ckr and in this will we consent unto you: if ye will be as we be, that every rememberer of you be scribe-circumcised; ’akh bezot ne’ot lakhem, ’im tihyu khamonu lehimol lakhem kal zakhar.
wntnw at bntynw lkm wat bntykm nqx lnw wySbnw atkm whyynw lem axd then will we give our children-betweenesss unto you, and we will take your children-betweenesss to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one with-mum-people. venatanu benotenu lakhem ve’et benotekhem niqakh lanu, veyashabnu ’itekhem vehayinu le‘am ’ekhad.
wam la tSmew alynw lhmwl wlqxnw at btnw whlknw and if ye will not hearken unto us, to be scribe-circumcised; then will we take our daughter-hoof-bat-child, and we will be gone. ve’im lo tishme‘u ’elenu lehimol, velaqakhnu bitenu vehalakhenu.
wyyTbw dbryhm beyny xmwr wbeyny Skm bn xmwr and their bee-words pleased ham-hotor, and shechem-shoulder ham-hotor's child-between. vayitebu dibrehem khamor, ube‘enei shekhem ben khamor.
wla axr hner leSwt hdbr ky xpz bbt yeqb whwa nkbd mkl byt abyw and the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in jacob-backstreet's daughter-hoof-bat-child: and he was more honorable than all the daughter-house of his father. velo ’ekhar hana‘ar la‘asot hadabar ki khafez bebat ya‘aqob, vehu nikhbad mikol bet ’abiv.
wyba xmwr wSkm bnw al Ser eyrm wydbrw al anSy eyrm lamr and ham-hotor and shechem-shoulder his child-between came unto the hair-gate of their light-city, and communed with the men of their light-city, saying, vayabo khamor ushekhem beno ’el sha‘ar ‘iram, vaydaberu ’el ’anshei ‘iram lemor.
hanSym halh Slmym hm atnw wySbw barz wysxrw ath wharz hnh rxbt ydym lpnyhm at bntm nqx lnw lnSym wat bntynw ntn lhm these men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their children-betweenesss to us for women, and let us give them our children-betweenesss. ha’anashim ha’eleh shelemim hem ’itanu veyeshebu ba’arez veyiskharu ’otah veha’arez hineh rakhabat yadayim lifnehem, benotam niqakh lanu lenashim ve’et benotenu niten lahem.
ak bcat yatw lnw hanSym lSbt atnw lhywt lem axd bhmwl lnw kl ckr kaSr hm nmlym only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us, to be one with-mum-people, if every rememberer among us be scribe-circumcised, as they are scribe-circumcised. ’akh bezot ye’otu ha’anashim lashebet ’itanu lihyot le‘am ’ekhad, behimol lanu kal zakhar ka’asher hem nimolim.
mqnhm wqnynm wkl bhmtm hlwa lnw hm ak nawth lhm wySbw atnw not their in-them-animal and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us. miqnehem veqinyanam vekhal behemtam halo lanu hem, ’akh ne’otah lahem veyeshebu ’itanu.
wySmew al xmwr wal Skm bnw kl yzay Ser eyrw wymlw kl ckr kl yzay Ser eyrw and unto ham-hotor and unto shechem-shoulder his child-between hearkened all that went out of the hair-gate of his light-city; and every rememberer was scribe-circumcised, all that went out of the hair-gate of his light-city. vayishme‘u ’el khamor ve’el shekhem beno kal yoze’ei sha‘ar ‘iro, vayimolu kal zakhar kal yoze’ei sha‘ar ‘iro.
wyhy bywm hSlySy bhywtm kabym wyqxw Sny bny yeqb Smewn wlwy axy dynh ayS xrbw wybaw el heyr bTx wyhrgw kl ckr and it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of children-betweens of jacob-backstreet, simeon-hear-home and levi-join, dinah-discuss's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the light-city boldly, and slew all the rememberers. vayhi bayom hashelishi bihyotam ko’abim vayiqkhu shene bene ya‘aqob shim‘on velevi ’akhei dinah ’ish kharbo vayabo’u ‘al ha‘ir betakh, vayahargu kal zakhar.
wat xmwr wat Skm bnw hrgw lpy xrb wyqxw at dynh mbyt Skm wyzaw and they slew ham-hotor and shechem-shoulder his child-between with the edge of the sword, and took dinah-discuss out of shechem-shoulder's daughter-house, and went out. ve’et khamor ve’et shekhem beno haregu lefi khareb, vayiqkhu dinah mibet shekhem vayeze’u.
bny yeqb baw el hxllym wybcw heyr aSr Tmaw axwtm children-betweens of jacob-backstreet came upon the slain, and spoiled the light-city, because they had ceased their sister. benei ya‘aqob ba’u ‘al hakhalalim vayabozu ha‘ir, ’asher time’u ’akhotam.
at zanm wat bqrm wat xmryhm wat aSr beyr wat aSr bSdh lqxw they took their sheep, and their wall-oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the light-city, and that which was in the field, zonam ve’et beqaram ve’et khamorehem, ve’et ’asher ba‘ir ve’et ’asher basadeh laqakhu.
wat kl xylm wat kl Tpm wat nSyhm Sbw wybcw wat kl aSr bbyt and all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their women took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the daughter-house. ve’et kal khelam ve’et kal tapam ve’et neshehem shabu vayabozu, ve’et kal ’asher babayit.
wyamr yeqb al Smewn wal lwy ekrtm aty lhbaySny bySb harz bkneny wbprcy wany mty mspr wnaspw ely whkwny wnSmdty any wbyty and jacob-backstreet said to simeon-hear-home and levi-join, ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the canaan-mobile-tradeites and the perizzite-unwalleds: and i being few in number, they gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and i be destroyed, i and my daughter-house. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el shim‘on ve’el levi ‘akhartem ’oti lehab’isheni beyosheb ha’arez bakena‘ani ubaperizi, va’ani metei mispar vene’esfu ‘alay vehikuni venishmadti ’ani ubeti.
wyamrw hkcwnh yeSh at axwtnw and they said, should he deal with our sister as with an harlot? vayomeru, hakhzonah ya‘aseh ’akhotenu.
wyamr alhym al yeqb qwm elh byt al wSb Sm weSh Sm mcbx lal hnrah alyk bbrxk mpny eSw axyk and to-no-these said unto jacob-backstreet, arise, go up to bethel-house-towards, and dwell there: and make there an butcher-kitchen unto to-no-these, that appeared unto thee when thou fleddest from the face-turns of esau-do thy brother. vayomer ’elohim ’el ya‘aqob qum ‘aleh bet ’el vesheb sham, va‘aseh sham mizbeakh la’el hanir’eh ’elekha bebarekhakha mipenei ‘esav ’akhikha.
wyamr yeqb al bytw wal kl aSr emw hsrw at alhy hnkr aSr btkkm whThrw whxlypw Smltykm then jacob-backstreet said unto his daughter-household, and to all that were with him, put away the strange to-no-these that are among you, and be bright-climaxing, and change your garments: vayomer ya‘aqob ’el beto ve’el kal ’asher ‘imo, hasiru ’elohei hanekhar ’asher betokhekhem vehitaharu vehakhalifu simlotekhem.
wnqwmh wnelh byt al waeSh Sm mcbx lal henh aty bywm zrty wyhy emdy bdrk aSr hlkty and let us arise, and go up to bethel-house-towards; and i will make there an butcher-kitchen unto to-no-these, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which i went. venaqumah vena‘aleh ’el, ve’e‘eseh sham mizbeakh la’el ha‘oneh ’oti beyom zarati vayhi ‘imadi baderekh ’asher halakheti.
wytnw al yeqb at kl alhy hnkr aSr bydm wat hncmym aSr bacnyhm wyTmn atm yeqb txt halh aSr em Skm and they gave unto jacob-backstreet all the strange to-no-these which were in their hand, and all their earrings which were in their ears; and jacob-backstreet hid them under the oak which was by shechem-shoulder. vayitenu ’el ya‘aqob kal ’elohei hanekhar ’asher beyadam ve’et hanezamim ’asher be’azenehem, vayitmon ’otam ya‘aqob takhat ha’elah ’asher ‘im shekhem.
wysew wyhy xtt alhym el herym aSr sbybtyhm wla rdpw axry bny yeqb and they journeyed: and the terror of to-no-these was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after children-betweens of jacob-backstreet. vayisa‘u, vayhi khitat ’elohim ‘al he‘arim ’asher sebibotehem velo radefu ’akharei benei ya‘aqob.
wyba yeqb lwch aSr barz knen hwa byt al hwa wkl hem aSr emw so jacob-backstreet came to luz-hazel, which is in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, that is, bethel-house-towards, he and all the with-mum-people that were with him. vayabo ya‘aqob luzah ’asher be’erez kena‘an hi bet ’el, hu vekhal ha‘am ’asher ‘imo.
wybn Sm mcbx wyqra lmqwm al byt al ky Sm nglw alyw halhym bbrxw mpny axyw and he between-built there an butcher-kitchen, and called the place towards-theory-house: because there to-no-these appeared unto him, when he fled from the face-turns of his brother. vayiben sham mizbeakh vayiqra lamaqom ’el ’el, ki sham niglu ’elav ha’elohim bebarekho mipenei ’akhiv.
wtmt dbrh mynqt rbqh wtqbr mtxt lbyt al txt halwn wyqra Smw alwn bkwt and deborah-bee rebekah-stall's nurse died, and she was buried beneath bethel-house-towards under an oak: and the name of it was called alonbachut-tree-of-crying. vatamat deborah meneqet ribqah vatiqaber mitakhat ’el takhat ha’alon, vayiqra shemo bakhut.
wyra alhym al yeqb ewd bbaw mpdn arm wybrk atw and to-no-these appeared unto jacob-backstreet again, when he came out of padanaram-redeemed-stack, and knee-fluffy-blessed him. vayera ’elohim ’el ya‘aqob ‘od bebo’o mipadan ’aram, vaybarekh ’oto.
wyamr lw alhym Smk yeqb la yqra Smk ewd yeqb ky am ySral yhyh Smk wyqra at Smw ySral and to-no-these said unto him, thy name is jacob-backstreet: thy name not be called any more jacob-backstreet, and israel-juicy-towards be thy name: and he called his name israel-juicy-towards. vayomer lo ’elohim shimkha ya‘aqob, lo yiqarei shimkha ‘od ya‘aqob ki ’im yisra’el yihyeh shemekha vayiqra shemo yisra’el.
wyamr lw alhym any al Sdy prh wrbh gwy wqhl gwym yhyh mmk wmlkym mxlzyk yzaw and to-no-these said unto him, i am to-no-these almighty: be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations be of thee, and king-molochs come out of thy loins; vayomer lo ’elohim ’ani ’el shaday pereh urebeh go uqehal goyim yihyeh mimeka, umelakhim mekhalazekha yeze’u.
wat harz aSr ntty labrhm wlyzxq lk atnnh wlcrek axryk atn at harz and the land which i gave abraham-their-dick and isaac-laughter, to thee i will give it, and to thy seed after thee will i give the land. ve’et ha’arez ’asher natati le’abraham uleyizkhaq lekha ’etenenah, ulezar‘akha ’akharekha ’eten ha’arez.
wyel melyw alhym bmqwm aSr dbr atw and to-no-these went up from him in the place where he talked with him. vaya‘al me‘alav ’elohim, bamaqom ’asher diber ’ito.
wyzb yeqb mzbh bmqwm aSr dbr atw mzbt abn wysk elyh nsk wyzq elyh Smn and jacob-backstreet set up a column-stand in the place where he talked with him, even a page-column-erection of father-child-stone: and he poured a pouring thereon, and he poured name-from-oil thereon. vayazeb ya‘aqob mazebah bamaqom ’asher diber ’ito mazebet ’aben, vayasekh ‘aleha nesekh vayizoq ‘aleha shamen.
wyqra yeqb at Sm hmqwm aSr dbr atw Sm alhym byt al and jacob-backstreet called the name of the place where to-no-these spake with him, bethel-house-towards. vayiqra ya‘aqob shem hamaqom ’asher diber ’ito ’elohim ’el.
wysew mbyt al wyhy ewd kbrt harz lbwa aprth wtld rxl wtqS bldth and they journeyed from bethel-house-towards; and there was and a little way to come to ephrath-wishy-washy: and rachel-ewe travailed, and she had hard labor. vayis‘u mibet ’el vayhi ‘od kibrat ha’arez labo ’efratah, vateled rakhel vateqash belidtah.
wyhy bhqSth bldth wtamr lh hmyldt al tyray ky gm ch lk bn and it came to pass, when she was in hard labor, that the midwife said unto her, fear not; thou have this child-between also. vayhi behaqshotah belidtah, vatomer lah hamyaledet ’al tire’i ki gam zeh lakh ben.
wyhy bzat npSh ky mth wtqra Smw bn awny wabyw qra lw bnymyn and it came to pass, as her being was in departing, (for she died) that she called his name benoni-he-between-of-my-sexual-potency: and his father called him benjamin-he-between-of-righthand. vayhi bezet nafshah ki metah vatiqra shemo ’oni, ve’abiv qara lo binyamin.
wtmt rxl wtqbr bdrk aprth hwa byt lxm and rachel-ewe died, and was buried in the way to ephrath-wishy-washy, which is bethlehem-house-of-bread. vatamat rakhel, vatiqaber bederekh ’efratah hi lakhem.
wyzb yeqb mzbh el qbrth hwa mzbt qbrt rxl ed hywm and jacob-backstreet set a column-stand upon her grave: that is the page-column-erection of rachel-ewe's grave unto this day. vayazeb ya‘aqob mazebah ‘al qeburatah, hi mazebet qeburat rakhel ‘ad hayom.
wyse ySral wyT ahlh mhlah lmgdl edr and israel-juicy-towards journeyed, and spread his tent beyond the tower of edar-visit-cattle. vayisa‘ yisra’el, vayet ’aholoh mehale’ah ‘eder.
wyhy bSkn ySral barz hhwa wylk rawbn wySkb at blhh pylgS abyw wySme ySral wyhyw bny yeqb Snym eSr and it came to pass, when israel-juicy-towards dwelt in that land, that reuben-see-child went and lay with bilhah-good-times his father's concubine: and israel-juicy-towards heard it. now children-betweens of jacob-backstreet were twelve: vayhi bishkon yisra’el ba’arez hahiv vayelekh re’uben vayishkab bilhah pilegesh ’abiv vayishma‘ yisra’el vayihyu bene ya‘aqob shenem ‘asar.

wbny clph Spxt lah gd waSr alh bny yeqb aSr yld lw bpdn arm and children-betweens of zilpah-sprinkle, leah-tired's handmaid: gad-tell-luck, and asher-bliss: these are children-betweens of jacob-backstreet, which were born to him in padanaram-redeemed-stack. ubenei zilpah shifkhat le’ah gad ve’asher, ’eleh benei ya‘aqob ’asher yulad lo befadan ’aram.
wyba yeqb al yzxq abyw mmra qryt harbe hwa xbrwn aSr gr Sm abrhm wyzxq and jacob-backstreet came unto isaac-laughter his father unto mamre-see-bitter, unto the light-city of arba-ambush, which is hebron-friend-joy, where abraham-their-dick and isaac-laughter sojourned. vayabo ya‘aqob ’el yizkhaq ’abiv mamrei ha’arba‘, hi khebron ’asher gar sham ’abraham veyizkhaq.
wyhyw ymy yzxq mat Snh wSmnym Snh and the days of isaac-laughter were an hundred and fourscore years. vayihyu yemei yizkhaq, me’at shanah ushemonim shanah.
wygwe yzxq wymt wyasp al emyw cqn wSbe ymym wyqbrw atw eSw wyeqb bnyw and isaac-laughter gave up the breath-spirit, and died, and was added unto his with-mum-people, being old and full of days: and his children-betweens esau-do and jacob-backstreet buried him. vayigva‘ yizkhaq vayamat vaye’asef ’el ‘amav zaqen useba‘ yamim, vayiqberu ’oto ‘esav veya‘aqob banav.
walh tldwt eSw hwa adwm now these are the generations of esau-do, who is edom-man. ve’eleh toledot ‘esav hu ’edom.
eSw lqx at nSyw mbnwt knen at edh bt aylwn hxty wat ahlybmh bt enh bt zbewn hxwy esau-do took his women of children-betweenesss of canaan-mobile-trade; adah-witness the daughter-hoof-bat-child of elon-tree the hittite-cut, and aholibamah-my-tent-in-what the daughter-hoof-bat-child of anah-answer the daughter-hoof-bat-child of zibeon-crayon the hivite-experience; ‘esav laqakh nashav mibenot kena‘an, ‘adah bat ’elon hakhiti ve’et ’aholibamah bat ‘anah bat zib‘on hakhivi.
wat bSmt bt ySmeal axwt nbywt and bashemath-perfumery ishmael-towards-hears's daughter-hoof-bat-child, sister of nebajoth-lets-house. ve’et basemat bat yishma‘el ’akhot nebayot.
wtld edh leSw at alypc wbSmt yldh at rewal and adah-witness conceived-of to esau-do eliphaz-my-towards-gold; and bashemath-perfumery conceived-of reuel; vateled ‘adah le‘esav ’elifaz, ubasemat yaledah re‘u’el.
wahlybmh yldh at yeyS yewS wat yelm wat qrx alh bny eSw aSr yldw lw barz knen and aholibamah-my-tent-in-what conceived-of jeush-wain-moth, and jaalam-disappear, and korah-bald-ice: these are children-betweens of esau-do, which were born unto him in the land of canaan-mobile-trade. ve’aholibamah yaledah ‘yosh ye‘ush ve’et ya‘lam ve’et qorakh, ’eleh benei ‘esav ’asher yuledu lo be’erez kena‘an.
wyqx eSw at nSyw wat bnyw wat bntyw wat kl npSwt bytw wat mqnhw wat kl bhmtw wat kl qnynw aSr rkS barz knen wylk al arz mpny yeqb axyw and esau-do took his women, and his children-betweens, and his children-betweenesss, and all the persons of his daughter-house, and his in-them-animal, and all his beasts, and all his substance, which he had got in the land of canaan-mobile-trade; and went into the country from the face-turns of his brother jacob-backstreet. vayiqakh ‘esav nashav ve’et banav ve’et benotav ve’et kal nafshot beto ve’et miqnehu ve’et kal behemto ve’et kal qinyano ’asher rakhash be’erez kena‘an, vayelekh ’el ’erez mipenei ya‘aqob ’akhiv.
ky hyh rkwSm rb mSbt yxdw wla yklh arz mgwryhm lSat atm mpny mqnyhm for their riches were more than that they might dwell together; and the land wherein they were strangers could not bear them because of their in-them-animal. ki hayah rekhusham rab mishebet yakhdav, velo yakhelah ’erez megurehem laset ’otam mipenei miqnehem.
wySb eSw bhr Seyr eSw hwa adwm thus dwelt esau-do in mount seir-hair-style: esau-do is edom-man. vayesheb ‘esav behar se‘ir ‘esav hu ’edom.

alh Smwt bny eSw alypc bn edh aSt eSw rewal bn bSmt aSt eSw these are the names of esau-do's children-betweens; eliphaz-my-towards-gold child-between of adah-witness the woman of esau-do, reuel child-between of bashemath-perfumery the woman of esau-do. ’eleh shemot bene ‘esav, ’elifaz ben ‘adah ’eshet ‘esav re‘u’el ben basemat ’eshet ‘esav.
wyhyw bny alypc tymn awmr zpw wgetm wqnc and children-betweens of eliphaz-my-towards-gold were tema-rightn, omar-speech, zepho-expect-float, and gatam-arrive, and kenaz-like-a-go-out-hawk. vayihyu benei ’elifaz, teman ’omar zefo vega‘tam uqenaz.

alh bny Seyr hxry ySby harz lwTn wSwbl wzbewn wenh these are children-betweens of seir-hair-style the hori-my-holete-hole, who inhabited the land; lotan, and shobal-trail, and zibeon-crayon, and anah-answer, ’eleh bene se‘ir hakhori yoshebei ha’arez, lotan veshobal vezib‘on va‘anah.
