wdSwn wazr wdySn alh alwpy hxry bny Seyr barz adwm and dishon-fertilize, and ezer-constrained, and dishan-fertilize: these are the dukes of the hori-my-holete-holes-mountain, children-betweens of seir-hair-style in the land of edom-man. vedishon ve’ezer vedishan, ’eleh ’alufei hakhori benei se‘ir be’erez ’edom.
wyhyw bny lwTn xry whymm waxwt lwTn tmne and children-betweens of lotan were hori-my-hole and hemam; and lotan's sister was timna-prevent. vayihyu bene lotan khori vehemam, va’akhot lotan timna‘.
walh bny Swbl elwn wmnxt weybl Spw wawnm and children-betweens of shobal-trail were these; alvan, and manahath, and ebal-mourning, shepho, and onam. ve’eleh benei shobal ‘alvan umanakhat ve‘ebal, shefo ve’onam.
walh bny zbewn wayh wenh hwa enh aSr mza at hymm bmdbr bretw at hxmrym lzbewn abyw and these are children-betweens of zibeon-crayon; both ajah, and anah-answer: this was that anah-answer that found the mules in the place-of-word-desert, as he fed the asses of zibeon-crayon his father. ve’eleh bene zib‘on ve’ayah va‘anah, hu ‘anah ’asher maza hayemim bamidbar bir‘oto hakhamorim lezib‘on ’abiv.
walh bny enh dSn wahlybmh bt enh and children-betweens of anah-answer were these; dishon-fertilize, and aholibamah-my-tent-in-what the daughter-hoof-bat-child of anah-answer. ve’eleh bene ‘anah dishon, ve’aholibamah bat ‘anah.
walh bny dySn xmdn waSbn wytrn wkrn and these are children-betweens of dishon-fertilize; hemdan, and eshban, and ithran, and cheran. ve’eleh benei dishan, khemdan ve’eshban veyitran ukheran.
alh bny azr blhn wcewn weqn children-betweens of ezer-constrained are these; bilhan, and zaavan, and akan. ’eleh bene ’ezer, bilhan veza‘avan va‘aqan.
alh bny dySn ewz warn children-betweens of dishan-fertilize are these; uz-goose, and aran. ’eleh bene dishan ‘uz va’aran.
alh alwpy hxry alwp lwTn alwp Swbl alwp zbewn alwp enh these are the dukes that came of the hori-my-holete-holes-mountain; duke lotan, duke shobal-trail, duke zibeon-crayon, duke anah-answer, ’eleh ’alufei hakhori, ’aluf lotan ’aluf shobal ’aluf zib‘on ’aluf ‘anah.
alwp dSn alwp azr alwp dySn alh alwpy hxry lalpyhm barz Seyr duke dishon-fertilize, duke ezer-constrained, duke dishan-fertilize: these are the dukes that came of hori-my-hole, among their dukes in the land of seir-hair-style. ’aluf dishon ’aluf ’ezer ’aluf dishan, ’eleh ’alufei hakhori le’alufehem be’erez se‘ir.
walh hmlkym aSr mlkw barz adwm lpny mlk mlk lbny ySral and these are the king-molochs that reigned in the land of edom-man, before-turns there reigned any king-moloch over children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards. ve’eleh hamelakhim ’asher malekhu be’erez ’edom, lifnei melakh melekh libnei yisra’el.
wymlk badwm ble bn bewr wSm eyrw dnhbh and bela-swallow child-between of beor-in-the-skin reigned in edom-man: and the name of his light-city was dinhabah-lets-discuss. vayimlokh be’edom bela‘ ben be‘or, veshem ‘iro dinhabah.
wymt ble wymlk txtyw ywbb bn crx mbzrh and bela-swallow died, and job-bringab-crying child-between of zerah-shine of bozrah-in-trouble reigned in his stead. vayamat bala‘, vayimlokh takhtav yobab ben zerakh mibazerah.
wymt ywbb wymlk txtyw xSm marz htymny and job-bringab-crying died, and husham-rain of the land of tema-rightni reigned in his stead. vayamat yobab, vayimlokh takhtav khusham me’erez hatemani.
wymt xSm wymlk txtyw hdd bn bdd hmkh at mdyn bSdh mwab wSm eyrw ewyt and husham-rain died, and hadad-thunder child-between of bedad-alone, who smote midian-place-of-discussed-teaching in the field of moab-from-father, reigned in his stead: and the name of his light-city was avith-convulsion. vayamat khusham, vayimlokh takhtav hadad ben bedad hamakeh midyan bisdeh mo’ab veshem ‘iro ‘avit.
wymt hdd wymlk txtyw Smlh mmSrqh and hadad-thunder died, and samlah-dress of masrekah-from-her-whistle reigned in his stead. vayamat hadad, vayimlokh takhtav samlah mimasreqah.
wymt Smlh wymlk txtyw Sawl mrxbwt hnhr and samlah-dress died, and saul-lent of rehob-wideoth-wide-area by the river reigned in his stead. vayamat samlah, vayimlokh takhtav sha’ul merekhobot hanahar.
wymt Sawl wymlk txtyw bel xnn bn ekbwr and saul-lent died, and baalhanan-owner-deals-kindly child-between of achbor-mouse reigned in his stead. vayamat sha’ul, vayimlokh takhtav khanan ben ‘akhbor.
wymt bel xnn bn ekbwr wymlk txtyw hdr wSm eyrw pew wSm aStw mhyTbal bt mTrd bt my chb and baalhanan-owner-deals-kindly child-between of achbor-mouse died, and hadad-thunder-sharpen reigned in his stead: and the name of his light-city was pau-groan; and his woman's name was towards-from-proper, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of matred-nuisance, the daughter-hoof-bat-child of mezahab-from-gold. vayamat khanan ben ‘akhbor vayimlokh takhtav hadar veshem ‘iro pa‘u, veshem ’ishto mehetab’el bat matred bat mei zahab.
walh Smwt alwpy eSw lmSpxtm lmqmtm bSmtm alwp tmne alwp elwh alwp ytt and these are the names of the dukes that came of esau-do, according to their families, after their places, by their names; duke timna-preventh, duke alvah-foliage, duke jetheth, ve’eleh shemot ’alufei ‘esav lemishpekhotam limqomotam bishmotam, ’aluf timna‘ ’aluf ‘alvah ’aluf yetet.
alwp ahlybmh alwp alh alwp pynn duke aholibamah-my-tent-in-what, duke elah-terebinth, duke pinon-clear-off, ’aluf ’aholibamah ’aluf ’elah ’aluf pinon.
alwp qnc alwp tymn alwp mbzr duke kenaz-like-a-go-out-hawk, duke tema-rightn, duke mibzar-fortress, ’aluf qenaz ’aluf teman ’aluf mibzar.
alwp mgdyal alwp eyrm alh alwpy adwm lmSbtm barz axctm hwa eSw aby adwm duke towards-from-kid, duke light-city-their: these be the dukes of edom-man, according to their habitations in the land of their possession: he is esau-do the father of the edom-manites. ’aluf magdi’el ’aluf ‘iram, ’eleh ’alufei ’edom lemoshebotam be’erez ’akhuzatam hu ‘esav ’abi ’edom.
wySb yeqb barz mgwry abyw barz knen and jacob-backstreet dwelt in the land wherein his father was a stranger, in the land of canaan-mobile-trade. vayesheb ya‘aqob be’erez megurei ’abiv, be’erez kena‘an.
alh tldwt yeqb ywsp bn Sbe eSrh Snh hyh reh at axyw bzan whwa ner at bny blhh wat bny clph nSy abyw wyba ywsp at dbtm reh al abyhm these are the generations of jacob-backstreet. joseph-add, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren; and the lad was with children-betweens of bilhah-good-times, and with children-betweens of zilpah-sprinkle, his father's women: and joseph-add brought unto his father their bad report. ’eleh toledot ya‘aqob yosef ben sheba‘ ‘esreh shanah hayah ro‘eh ’et ’ekhav bazon vehu na‘ar ’et benei bilhah ve’et benei zilpah neshei ’abiv, vayabei yosef dibatam ra‘ah ’el ’abihem.
wySral ahb at ywsp mkl bnyw ky bn cqnym hwa lw weSh lw ktnt psym now israel-juicy-towards loved joseph-add more than all his children-betweens, because he was child-between of his old age: and he made him a you-wrote-coat of technicolor-stripes. veyisra’el ’ahab yosef mikal banav ki ben zequnim hu lo, ve‘asah lo ketonet pasim.
wyraw axyw ky atw ahb abyhm mkl axyw wySnaw atw wla yklw dbrw lSlm and when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him. vayir’u ’ekhav ki ’oto ’ahab ’abihem mikal ’ekhav vayisne’u ’oto, velo yakhelu dabero leshalom.
wyxlm ywsp xlwm wygd laxyw wywspw ewd Sna atw and joseph-add dreamed a dream, and he told it his brethren: and they hated him yet the more. vayakhalom yosef khalom vayaged le’ekhav, vayosifu ‘od seno ’oto.
wyamr alyhm Smew na hxlwm hch aSr xlmty and he said unto them, hear, i pray you, this dream which i have dreamed: vayomer ’alehem, shim‘u na hakhalom hazeh ’asher khalameti.
whnh anxnw malmym almym btwk hSdh whnh qmh almty wgm nzbh whnh tsbynh almtykm wtStxwyn lalmty for, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves stood round about, and made obeisance to my sheaf. vehineh ’anakhnu me’alemim ’alumim betokh hasadeh vehineh qamah ’alumati vegam nizabah, vehineh tesubenah ’alumotekhem vatishtakhavena la’alumati.
wyamrw lw axyw hmlk tmlk elynw am mSwl tmSl bnw wywspw ewd Sna atw el xlmtyw wel dbryw and his brethren said to him, thou indeed reign over us? or thou indeed have dominion over us? and they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his bee-words. vayomeru lo ’ekhav hamalokh timlokh ‘alenu ’im mashol timshol banu, vayosifu ‘od seno ’oto ‘al khalomotav ve‘al debarav.
wyxlm ewd xlwm axr wyspr atw laxyw wyamr hnh xlmty xlwm ewd whnh hSmS whyrx waxd eSr kwkbym mStxwym ly and he dreamed yet another dream, and told it his brethren, and said, behold, i have dreamed a dream more; and, behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me. vayakhalom ‘od khalom ’akher vaysaper ’oto le’ekhav, vayomer hineh khalamti khalom ‘od vehineh hashemesh vehayareakh ve’akhad ‘asar kokhabim mishtakhavim li.
wyspr al abyw wal axyw wyger bw abyw wyamr lw mh hxlwm hch aSr xlmt hbwa nbwa any wamk waxyk lhStxwt lk arzh and he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said unto him, what is this dream that thou hast dreamed? i and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth? vaysaper ’el ’abiv ve’el ’ekhav vayig‘ar bo ’abiv vayomer lo mah hakhalom hazeh ’asher khalameta, habo nabo ’ani ve’imekha ve’akhekha lehishtakhavot lekha ’arezah.
wyqnaw bw axyw wabyw Smr at hdbr and his brethren envied him; and his father guard-observed the saying. vayqan’u bo ’ekhav, ve’abiv shamar hadabar.
wylkw axyw lrewt at zan abyhm bSkm and his brethren went to feed their father's flock in shechem-shoulder. vayelekhu ’ekhav, lir‘ot zon ’abihem bishkhem.
wyamr ySral al ywsp hlwa axyk reym bSkm lkh waSlxk alyhm wyamr lw hnny and israel-juicy-towards said unto joseph-add, do not thy brethren feed the flock in shechem-shoulder? come, and i will send thee unto them. and he said to him, here am i. vayomer yisra’el ’el yosef halo ’akhekha ro‘im bishkhem lekhah ve’eshlakhakha ’alehem, vayomer lo hineni.
wyamr lw lk na rah at Slwm axyk wat Slwm hzan whSbny dbr wySlxhw memq xbrwn wyba Skmh and he said to him, go, i pray thee, see whether it be well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me bee-word again. so he sent him out of the vale of hebron-friend-joy, and he came to shechem-shoulder. vayomer lo lekh na re’eh shelom ’akhekha ve’et shelom hazon vahashibeni dabar, vayishlakhehu me‘emeq khebron vayabo shekhemah.
wymzahw ayS whnh teh bSdh wySalhw hayS lamr mh tbqS and a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, what seekest thou? vayimza’ehu ’ish vehineh to‘eh basadeh, vayish’alehu ha’ish lemor mah tebaqesh.
wyamr at axy anky mbqS hgydh na ly ayph hm reym and he said, i seek my brethren: tell me, i pray thee, where they feed their flocks. vayomer ’akhay ’anokhi mebaqesh, hagidah na li ’efoh hem ro‘im.
wyamr hayS nsew mch ky Smety amrym nlkh dtynh wylk ywsp axr axyw wymzam bdtn and the man said, they are departed hence; for i heard them say, let us go to dothan-decree. and joseph-add went after his brethren, and found them in dothan-decree. vayomer ha’ish nase‘u mizeh ki shama‘ti ’omerim nelekhah dotayenah, vayelekh yosef ’akhar ’ekhav vayimza’em bedotan.
wyraw atw mrxq wbTrm yqrb alyhm wytnklw atw lhmytw and when they saw him afar off, even before-turns he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him. vayir’u ’oto merakhoq, ubeterem yiqrab ’alehem vayitnakelu ’oto lahamito.
wyamrw ayS al axyw hnh bel hxlmwt hlch ba and they said one to another, behold, this dreamer cometh. vayomeru ’ish ’el ’akhiv, hineh hakhalomot halazeh ba.
weth lkw wnhrghw wnSlkhw baxd hbrwt wamrnw xyh reh aklthw wnrah mh yhyw xlmtyw come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit, and we will say, some bad beast hath devoured him: and we see what will become of his dreams. ve‘atah lekhu venahargehu venashlikhehu be’akhad haborot ve’amarnu khayah ra‘ah ’akhalatehu, venir’eh mah yihyu khalomotav.
wySme rawbn wyzlhw mydm wyamr la nknw npS and reuben-see-child heard it, and he delivered him out of their hands; and said, let us not kill him. vayishma‘ re’uben vayazilehu miyadam, vayomer lo nakenu nafesh.
wyamr alhm rawbn al tSpkw dm hSlykw atw al hbwr hch aSr bmdbr wyd al tSlxw bw lmen hzyl atw mydm lhSybw al abyw and reuben-see-child said unto them, shed no blood, and cast him into this pit that is in the place-of-word-desert, and lay no hand upon him; that he might rid him out of their hands, to deliver him to his father again. vayomer ’alehem re’uben ’al tishpekhu dam hashlikhu ’oto ’el habor hazeh ’asher bamidbar veyad ’al tishlekhu bo, lema‘an hazil ’oto miyadam lahashibo ’el ’abiv.
wyhy kaSr ba ywsp al axyw wypSyTw at ywsp at ktntw at ktnt hpsym aSr elyw and it came to pass, when joseph-add was come unto his brethren, that they stripped joseph-add out of his you-wrote-coat, his you-wrote-coat of many colors that was on him; vayhi ka’asher ba yosef ’el ’ekhav, vayafshitu yosef kutaneto ketonet hapasim ’asher ‘alav.
wyqxhw wySlkw atw hbrh whbwr rq ayn bw mym and they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty, there was no from-waters in it. vayiqakhuhu vayashlikhu ’oto haborah, vehabor req ’en bo mayim.
wySbw lakl lxm wySaw eynyhm wyraw whnh arxt ySmealym bah mgled wgmlyhm nSaym nkat wzry wlT hwlkym lhwryd mzrymh and they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a company of ishmael-towards-hearsites came from gilead-roll-until-heap with their ripen-camels bearing spicery and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to mizraim-narrows. vayeshebu le’ekhal lekhem vayis’u ‘enehem vayir’u vehineh ’orekhat yishme‘elim ba’ah migil‘ad, ugemalehem nose’im nekhot uzeri valot holkhim lehorid mizrayemah.
wyamr yhwdh al axyw mh bze ky nhrg at axynw wksynw at dmw and judah-know said unto his brethren, what profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood? vayomer yehudah ’el ’ekhav, mah beza‘ ki naharog ’akhinu vekhisinu damo.
lkw wnmkrnw lySmealym wydnw al thy bw ky axynw bSrnw hwa wySmew axyw come, and let us sell him to the ishmael-towards-hearsites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother and our flesh. and his brethren were content. lekhu venimkerenu layishme‘elim veyadenu ’al tehi bo ki ’akhinu besarenu hu, vayishme‘u ’ekhav.
wyebrw anSym mdynym sxrym wymSkw wyelw at ywsp mn hbwr wymkrw at ywsp lySmealym beSrym ksp wybyaw at ywsp mzrymh then there passed by midian-place-of-discussed-teachingites merchantmen; and they drew and lifted up joseph-add out of the pit, and sold joseph-add to the ishmael-towards-hearsites for double-ten-twenty pieces of silver: and they brought joseph-add into mizraim-narrows. vaya‘abru ’anashim midyanim sokharim vayimshekhu vaya‘alu yosef min habor vayimkeru yosef layishme‘elim be‘esrim kasef, vayabi’u yosef mizrayemah.
wySb rawbn al hbwr whnh ayn ywsp bbwr wyqre at bgdyw and reuben-see-child returned unto the pit; and, behold, joseph-add was not in the pit; and he rent his clothes. vayashab re’uben ’el habor vehineh ’en yosef babor, vayiqra‘ begadav.
wySb al axyw wyamr hyld aynnw wany anh any ba and he returned unto his brethren, and said, child is not; and i, whither i go? vayashab ’el ’ekhav vayomar, hayeled ’enenu va’ani ’anah ’ani ba.
wyqxw at ktnt ywsp wySxTw Seyr ecym wyTblw at hktnt bdm and they took joseph-add's you-wrote-coat, and killed a kid of the intense-goats, and dipped the you-wrote-coat in the blood; vayiqkhu ketonet yosef, vayishkhatu se‘ir ‘izim vayitbelu hakutonet badam.
wySlxw at ktnt hpsym wybyaw al abyhm wyamrw cat mzanw hkr na hktnt bnk hwa am la and they sent the you-wrote-coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father; and said, this have we found: hand-know now whether it be thy child-between's you-wrote-coat or no. vayshalekhu ketonet hapasim vayabi’u ’el ’abihem vayomeru zot mazanu, haker na haketonet binkha hi ’im lo.
wykyrh wyamr ktnt bny xyh reh aklthw Trp Trp ywsp and he hand-knew it, and said, it is my child-between's you-wrote-coat; an bad beast hath devoured him; joseph-add is without doubt rent in pieces. vayakirah vayomer ketonet beni khayah ra‘ah ’akhalatehu, tarof toraf yosef.
wyqre yeqb Smltyw wySm Sq bmtnyw wytabl el bnw ymym rbym and jacob-backstreet rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his loins, and mourned for his child-between many days. vayiqra‘ ya‘aqob simlotav vayasem saq bematenav, vayit’abel ‘al beno yamim rabim.
wyqmw kl bnyw wkl bntyw lnxmw wyman lhtnxm wyamr ky ard al bny abl Salh wybk atw abyw and all his children-betweens and all his children-betweenesss rose up to comfort him; and he refused to be comforted; and he said, for i will go down into the grave unto my child-between mourning. thus his father wept for him. vayaqumu khal banav vekhal benotav lenakhamo vayma’en lehitnakhem vayomer ki ’ered ’el beni ’abel she’olah, vayebek ’oto ’abiv.
whmdnym mkrw atw al mzrym lpwTypr srys preh Sr hTbxym and the midian-place-of-discussed-teachingites sold him into mizraim-narrows unto potiphar-given-by-ra, an officer of pharaoh-big-house's, and captain of the guard. vehamedanim makheru ’oto ’el mizrayim, lefotifar seris par‘oh sar hatabakhim.
wyhy bet hhwa wyrd yhwdh mat axyw wyT ed ayS edlmy wSmw xyrh and it came to pass at that time, that judah-know went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain adullam-until-whyite-just-fleeing, whose name was hirah-freedom. vayhi ba‘et hahiv vayered yehudah me’et ’ekhav, vayet ‘ad ’ish ‘adulami ushemo khirah.
wyra Sm yhwdh bt ayS kneny wSmw Swe wyqxh wyba alyh and judah-know saw there a daughter-hoof-bat-child of a certain canaan-mobile-tradeite, whose name was shuah-talk; and he took her, and went in unto her. vayar sham yehudah bat ’ish kena‘ani ushemo shua‘, vayiqakheha vayabo ’eleha.
wthr wtld bn wyqra at Smw er and she conceived, and conceived-of a child-between; and he called his name er-awake. vatahar vateled ben, vayiqra shemo ‘er.
wthr ewd wtld bn wtqra at Smw awnn and she conceived again, and conceived-of a child-between; and she called his name onan-trouble-vigor. vatahar ‘od vateled ben, vatiqra shemo ’onan.
wtsp ewd wtld bn wtqra at Smw Slh whyh bkcyb bldth atw and she yet again conceived, and conceived-of a child-between; and called his name shelah-pulled-out: and he was at chezib-in-a-lie, when she conceived-of him. vatosef ‘od vateled ben vatiqra shemo shelah, vehayah bikhzib belidtah ’oto.
wyqx yhwdh aSh ler bkwrw wSmh tmr and judah-know took a woman for er-awake his firstborn, whose name was tamar-palm-date. vayiqakh yehudah ’ishah le‘er bekhoro, ushemah tamar.
wyhy er bkwr yhwdh re beyny yhwh wymthw yhwh and er-awake, judah-know's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah slew him. vayhi ‘er bekhor yehudah ra‘ be‘enei yhvh, vaymitehu yhvh.
wyamr yhwdh lawnn ba al aSt axyk wybm ath whqm cre laxyk and judah-know said unto onan-trouble-vigor, go in unto thy brother's woman, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother. vayomer yehudah le’onan bo ’el ’eshet ’akhikha veyabem ’otah, vehaqem zera‘ le’akhikha.
wyde awnn ky la lw yhyh hcre whyh am ba al aSt axyw wSxt arzh lblty ntn cre laxyw and onan-trouble-vigor hand-knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother's woman, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother. vayeda‘ ’onan ki lo lo yihyeh hazara‘, vehayah ’im ba ’el ’eshet ’akhiv veshikhet ’arzah lebilti netan zera‘ le’akhiv.
wyre beyny yhwh aSr eSh wymt gm atw and the thing which he did displeased yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: wherefore he slew him also. vayera‘ be‘enei yhvh ’asher ‘asah, vayamet gam ’oto.
wyamr yhwdh ltmr kltw Sby almnh byt abyk ed ygdl Slh bny ky amr pn ymwt gm hwa kaxyw wtlk tmr wtSb byt abyh then said judah-know to tamar-palm-date his daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching, remain a widow at thy father's daughter-house, till shelah-pulled-out my child-between be grown: for he said, lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. and tamar-palm-date went and dwelt in her father's daughter-house. vayomer yehudah letamar kalato shebi ’almanah bet ’abikh ‘ad yigdal shelah beni ki ’amar pen yamut gam hu ke’ekhav, vatelekh tamar vatesheb bet ’abiha.
wyrbw hymym wtmt bt Swe aSt yhwdh wynxm yhwdh wyel el gccy zanw hwa wxyrh rehw hedlmy tmnth and in process of time the daughter-hoof-bat-child of shuah-talk judah-know's woman died; and judah-know was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to timna-preventth, he and his friend hirah-freedom the adullam-until-whyite-just-fleeing. vayirbu hayamim vatamat bat shua‘ ’eshet yehudah, vayinakhem yehudah vaya‘al ‘al gozazei zono hu vekhirah re‘ehu ha‘adulami timnatah.
wygd ltmr lamr hnh xmyk elh tmnth lgc zanw and it was told tamar-palm-date, saying, behold thy father in law goeth up to timna-preventth to shear his sheep. vayugad letamar lemor, hineh khamikh ‘oleh timnatah lagoz zono.
wtsr bgdy almnwth melyh wtks bzeyp wttelp wtSb bptx eynym aSr el drk tmnth ky rath ky gdl Slh whwa la ntnh lw laSh and she put her widow's garments off from her, and covered her with a breaker, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to timna-preventth; for she saw that shelah-pulled-out was grown, and she was not given unto him to woman. vatasar bigdei ’almenutah me‘aleha vatekhas baza‘if vatit‘alaf vatesheb befetakh ‘enayim ’asher ‘al derekh timnatah, ki ra’atah ki gadal shelah vehiv lo nitenah lo le’ishah.
wyrah yhwdh wyxSbh lcwnh ky ksth pnyh when judah-know saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face-turns. vayir’eha yehudah vayakhshebeha lezonah, ki khisetah paneha.
wyT alyh al hdrk wyamr hbh na abwa alyk ky la yde ky kltw hwa wtamr mh ttn ly ky tbwa aly and he turned unto her by the way, and said, go to, i pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he hand-knew not that she was his daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching.) and she said, what wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me? vayet ’eleha ’el haderekh vayomer habah na ’abo ’elayikh ki lo yada‘ ki khalato hi vatomer mah titen li ki tabo ’elay.
wyamr anky aSlx gdy ecym mn hzan wtamr am ttn erbwn ed Slxk and he said, i will send thee a kid from the flock. and she said, wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it? vayomer ’anokhi ’ashalakh gedi ‘izim min hazon, vatomer ’im titen ‘erabon ‘ad shalekhekha.
wyamr mh herbwn aSr atn lk wtamr xtmk wptylk wmTk aSr bydk wytn lh wyba alyh wthr lw and he said, what pledge i give thee? and she said, thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. and he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him. vayomer mah ha‘erabon ’asher ’eten lakh vatomer khotamekha ufetilekha umatekha ’asher beyadekha, vayiten lah vayabo ’eleha vatahar lo.
wtqm wtlk wtsr zeyph melyh wtlbS bgdy almnwth and she arose, and went away, and laid by her breaker from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood. vataqam vatelekh vatasar ze‘ifah me‘aleha, vatilbash bigdei ’almenutah.
wySlx yhwdh at gdy hecym byd rehw hedlmy lqxt herbwn myd haSh wla mzah and judah-know sent the kid by the hand of his friend the adullam-until-whyite-just-fleeing, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: and he found her not. vayishlakh yehudah gedi ha‘izim beyad re‘ehu ha‘adulami laqakhat ha‘erabon miyad ha’ishah, velo meza’ah.
wySal at anSy mqmh lamr ayh hqdSh hwa beynym el hdrk wyamrw la hyth bch qdSh then he asked the men of that place, saying, where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? and they said, there was no harlot in this place. vayish’al ’anshei meqomah lemor ’ayeh haqedeshah hi ba‘enayim ‘al hadarekh, vayomeru lo hayetah bazeh qedeshah.
wySb al yhwdh wyamr la mzatyh wgm anSy hmqwm amrw la hyth bch qdSh and he returned to judah-know, and said, i cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place. vayashab ’el yehudah vayomer lo mezatiha, vegam ’anshei hamaqom ’ameru lo hayetah bazeh qedeshah.
wyamr yhwdh tqx lh pn nhyh lbwc hnh Slxty hgdy hch wath la mzath and judah-know said, let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, i sent this kid, and thou hast not found her. vayomer yehudah tiqakh lah pen nihyeh labuz, hineh shalakhti hagedi hazeh ve’atah lo mezatah.
wyhy kmSlS xdSym wygd lyhwdh lamr cnth tmr kltk wgm hnh hrh lcnwnym wyamr yhwdh hwzyawh wtSrp and it came to pass about three months after, that it was told judah-know, saying, tamar-palm-date thy daughter-hoof-bat-child in teaching hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. and judah-know said, bring her forth, and let her be burnt. vayhi kemishlosh khodashim vayugad lihudah lemor zanetah tamar kalatekha vegam hineh harah liznunim, vayomer yehudah hozi’uha vetisaref.
hwa mwzat whya Slxh al xmyh lamr layS aSr alh lw anky hrh wtamr hkr na lmy hxtmt whptylym whmTh halh when she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, by the man, whose these are, am i with child: and she said, discern, i pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff. hi muzet vehi shalekhah ’el khamiha lemor le’ish ’asher ’eleh lo ’anokhi harah, vatomer haker na lemi hakhotemet vehapetilim vehamateh ha’eleh.
wykr yhwdh wyamr zdqh mmny ky el kn la nttyh lSlh bny wla ysp ewd ldeth and judah-know acknowledged them, and said, she hath been more just than i; because that i gave her not to shelah-pulled-out my child-between. and he hand-knew her again no more. vayaker yehudah vayomer zadeqah mimeni ki ‘al ken lo netatiha leshelah beni, velo yasaf ‘od leda‘tah
wyhy bet ldth whnh tawmym bbTnh and it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb. vayhi be‘et lidtah, vehineh te’omim bebitnah.
wyhy bldth wytn yd wtqx hmyldt wtqSr el ydw Sny lamr ch yza raSnh and it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a two caterpillars thread, saying, this came out first. vayhi belidtah vayiten yad, vatiqakh hamyaledet vatiqshor ‘al yado shani lemor zeh yaza rishonah.
wyhy kmSyb ydw whnh yza axyw wtamr mh przt elyk prz wyqra Smw prz and it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, how hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called parez-breach. vayhi kemeshib yado vehineh yaza ’akhiv vatomer mah parazta ‘alekha parez, vayiqra shemo parez.
waxr yza axyw aSr el ydw hSny wyqra Smw crx and afterward came out his brother, that had the two caterpillars thread upon his hand: and his name was called zarah-shine. ve’akhar yaza ’akhiv ’asher ‘al yado hashani, vayiqra shemo zarakh.
wywsp hwrd mzrymh wyqnhw pwTypr srys preh Sr hTbxym ayS mzry myd hySmealym aSr hwrdhw Smh and joseph-add was brought down to mizraim-narrows; and potiphar-given-by-ra, an officer of pharaoh-big-house, captain of the guard, an mizraim-narrowsian, bought him of the hands of the ishmael-towards-hearsites, which had brought him down thither. veyosef hurad mizrayemah, vayiqnehu potifar seris par‘oh sar hatabakhim mizri miyad hayishme‘elim ’asher horiduhu shamah.
wyhy yhwh at ywsp wyhy ayS mzlyx wyhy bbyt adnyw hmzry and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was with joseph-add, and he was a prosperous man; and he was in the daughter-house of his master the mizraim-narrowsian. vayhi yhvh ’et yosef vayhi ’ish mazliakh, vayhi bebet ’adonav hamizri.
wyra adnyw ky yhwh atw wkl aSr hwa eSh yhwh mzlyx bydw and his master saw that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was with him, and that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah made all that he did to prosper in his hand. vayar ’adonav ki yhvh ’ito, vekhol ’asher hu ‘oseh yhvh mazliakh beyado.
wymza ywsp xn beynyw wySrt atw wypqdhw el bytw wkl yS lw ntn bydw and joseph-add found attractiveness in his sight, and he worked for him: and he made him overseer over his daughter-house, and all that he had he put into his hand. vayimza yosef khen be‘enav vaysharet ’oto, vayafqidehu ‘al beto vekhal yesh lo natan beyado.
wyhy mac hpqyd atw bbytw wel kl aSr yS lw wybrk yhwh at byt hmzry bgll ywsp wyhy brkt yhwh bkl aSr yS lw bbyt wbSdh and it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his daughter-house, and over all that he had, that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah knee-fluffy-blessed the mizraim-narrowsian's daughter-house for joseph-add's sake; and the knee-fluffy-blessing of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was upon all that he had in the daughter-house, and in the field. vayhi me’az hifqid ’oto bebeto ve‘al kal ’asher yesh lo vaybarekh yhvh bet hamizri biglal yosef, vayhi birkat yhvh bekhal ’asher yesh lo babayit ubasadeh.
wyecb kl aSr lw byd ywsp wla yde atw mawmh ky am hlxm aSr hwa awkl wyhy ywsp yph tar wyph mrah and he left all that he had in joseph-add's hand; and he hand-knew not ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. and joseph-add was a goodly person, and well favored. vaya‘azob kal ’asher lo beyad yosef velo yada‘ ’ito me’umah ki ’im halekhem ’asher hu ’okhel, vayhi yosef yefeh to’ar vifeh mar’eh.
wyhy axr hdbrym halh wtSa aSt adnyw at eynyh al ywsp wtamr Skbh emy and it came to pass after these things, that his master's woman cast her eyes upon joseph-add; and she said, lie with me. vayhi ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh vatisa ’eshet ’adonav ‘eneha ’el yosef, vatomer shikhbah ‘imi.
wyman wyamr al aSt adnyw hn adny la yde aty mh bbyt wkl aSr yS lw ntn bydy and he refused, and said unto his master's woman, behold, my master wotteth not what is with me in the daughter-house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand; vayma’en vayomer ’el ’eshet ’adonav hen ’adoni lo yada‘ ’iti mah babayit, vekhol ’asher yesh lo natan beyadi.
aynnw gdwl bbyt hch mmny wla xSk mmny mawmh ky am awtk baSr at aStw wayk aeSh hreh hgdlh hcat wxTaty lalhym there is none greater in this daughter-house than i; neither hath he kept back any thing from me and thee, because thou art his woman: how then can i do this great wickedness, and miss against to-no-these? ’enenu gadol babayit hazeh mimeni velo khasakh mimeni me’umah ki ’im ’otakh ba’asher ’at ’ishto, ve’ekh ’e‘eseh hara‘ah hagedolah hazot vekhatati lelohim.
wyhy kdbrh al ywsp ywm ywm wla Sme alyh lSkb azlh lhywt emh and it came to pass, as she spake to joseph-add day by day, that he hearkened not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her. vayhi kedaberah ’el yosef yom yom, velo shama‘ ’eleha lishkab ’ezlah lihyot ‘imah.
wyhy khywm hch wyba hbyth leSwt mlaktw wayn ayS manSy hbyt Sm bbyt and it came to pass about this time, that joseph-add went into the daughter-house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the daughter-house there within. vayhi kehayom hazeh vayabo habaytah la‘asot melakhto, ve’en ’ish me’anshei habayit sham babayit.
wttpShw bbgdw lamr Skbh emy wyecb bgdw bydh wyns wyza hxwzh and she caught him by his garment, saying, lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out. vatitpesehu bebigdo lemor shikhbah ‘imi, vaya‘azob bigdo beyadah vayanas vayezei hakhuzah.
wyhy krawth ky ecb bgdw bydh wyns hxwzh and it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth, vayhi kir’otah ki ‘azab bigdo beyadah, vayanas hakhuzah.
wtqra lanSy byth wtamr lhm lamr raw hbya lnw ayS ebry lzxq bnw ba aly lSkb emy waqra bqwl gdwl that she called unto the men of her daughter-house, and spake unto them, saying, see, he hath brought in an hebrew-cross-over unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and i cried with a loud voice: vatiqra le’anshei betah vatomer lahem lemor re’u hebi lanu ’ish ‘ibri lezakheq banu, ba ’elay lishkab ‘imi va’eqra beqol gadol.
wyhy kSmew ky hrymty qwly waqra wyecb bgdw azly wyns wyza hxwzh and it came to pass, when he heard that i lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and got him out. vayhi kheshame‘o ki harimoti qoli va’eqra, vaya‘azob bigdo ’ezli vayanas vayezei hakhuzah.
wtnx bgdw azlh ed bwa adnyw al bytw and she laid up his garment by her, until his base-lord came home. vatanakh bigdo ’ezlah, ‘ad bo ’adonav ’el beto.
wtdbr alyw kdbrym halh lamr ba aly hebd hebry aSr hbat lnw lzxq by and she spake unto him according to these bee-words, saying, the hebrew-cross-over worker, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to mock me: vatedaber ’elav kadebarim ha’eleh lemor, ba ’elay ha‘ebed ha‘ibri ’asher hebeta lanu lezakheq bi.
wyhy khrymy qwly waqra wyecb bgdw azly wyns hxwzh and it came to pass, as i lifted up my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled out. vayhi kaharimi qoli va’eqra, vaya‘azob bigdo ’ezli vayanas hakhuzah.
wyhy kSme adnyw at dbry aStw aSr dbrh alyw lamr kdbrym halh eSh ly ebdk wyxr apw and it came to pass, when his master heard the bee-words of his woman, which she spake unto him, saying, after this manner did thy worker to me; that his wrath was kindled. vayhi khishmoa‘ ’adonav dibrei ’ishto ’asher diberah ’elav lemor kadebarim ha’eleh ‘asah li ‘abdekha, vayikhar ’apo.
wyqx adny ywsp atw wytnhw al byt hshr mqwm aSr aswry asyry hmlk aswrym wyhy Sm bbyt hshr and joseph-add's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king-moloch's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison. vayiqakh ’adonei yosef ’oto vayitenehu ’el bet hasohar meqom ’asher ’asirei hamelekh ’asurim, vayhi sham bebet hasohar.
wyhy yhwh at ywsp wyT alyw xsd wytn xnw beyny Sr byt hshr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was with joseph-add, and showed him mercy, and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison. vayhi yhvh ’et yosef vayet ’elav khased, vayiten khino be‘enei sar bet hasohar.
wytn Sr byt hshr byd ywsp at kl hasyrm aSr bbyt hshr wat kl aSr eSym Sm hwa hyh eSh and the keeper of the prison committed to joseph-add's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatsoever they did there, he was the doer of it. vayiten sar bet hasohar beyad yosef kal ha’asirim ’asher bebet hasohar, ve’et kal ’asher ‘osim sham hu hayah ‘oseh.
ayn Sr byt hshr rah at kl mawmh bydw baSr yhwh atw waSr hwa eSh yhwh mzlyx the keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was with him, and that which he did, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah made it to prosper. ’en sar bet hasohar ro’eh kal me’umah beyado ba’asher yhvh ’ito, va’asher hu ‘oseh yhvh mazliakh.
wyhy axr hdbrym halh xTaw mSqh mlk mzrym whaph ladnyhm lmlk mzrym and it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows and his baker had offended their base-lord the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows. vayhi ’akhar hadebarim ha’eleh khate’u mashqeh melekh mizrayim veha’ofeh, la’adonehem lemelekh mizrayim.
wyqzp preh el Sny srysyw el Sr hmSqym wel Sr hawpym and pharaoh-big-house was wroth against two of his officers, against the chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers. vayiqzof par‘oh ‘al shenei sarisav, ‘al sar hamashqim ve‘al sar ha’ofim.
wytn atm bmSmr byt Sr hTbxym al byt hshr mqwm aSr ywsp aswr Sm and he put them in ward in the daughter-house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where joseph-add was bound. vayiten ’otam bemishmar bet sar hatabakhim ’el bet hasohar, meqom ’asher yosef ’asur.
wypqd Sr hTbxym at ywsp atm wySrt atm wyhyw ymym bmSmr and the captain of the guard charged joseph-add with them, and he worked for them: and they continued a season in ward. vayifqod sar hatabakhim yosef ’itam vaysharet ’otam, vayihyu yamim bemishmar.
wyxlmw xlwm Snyhm ayS xlmw blylh axd ayS kptrwn xlmw hmSqh whaph aSr lmlk mzrym aSr aswrym bbyt hshr and they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows, which were bound in the prison. vayakhalmu khalom shenehem ’ish khalomo belaylah ’ekhad ’ish kefitron khalomo, hamashqeh veha’ofeh ’asher lemelekh mizrayim ’asher ’asurim bebet hasohar.
wyba alyhm ywsp bbqr wyra atm whnm cepym and joseph-add came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad. vayabo ’alehem yosef baboqer, vayar ’otam vehinam zo‘afim.
wySal at srysy preh aSr atw bmSmr byt adnyw lamr mdwe pnykm reym hywm and he asked pharaoh-big-house's officers that were with him in the ward of his base-lord's daughter-house, saying, wherefore look ye so sadly to day? vayish’al serisei far‘oh ’asher ’ito bemishmar bet ’adonav lemor, madua‘ penekhem ra‘im hayom.
wyamrw alyw xlwm xlmnw wptr ayn atw wyamr alhm ywsp hlwa lalhym ptrnym sprw na ly and they said unto him, we have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. and joseph-add said unto them, do not interpretations belong to to-no-these? tell me them, i pray you. vayomeru ’elav khalom khalamnu ufoter ’en ’oto, vayomer ’alehem yosef halo lelohim pitronim saperu na li.
wyspr Sr hmSqym at xlmw lywsp wyamr lw bxlwmy whnh gpn lpny and the chief butler told his dream to joseph-add, and said to him, in my dream, behold, a vine was before-turns me; vaysaper sar hamashqim khalomo leyosef, vayomer lo bakhalomi vehineh gefen lefanay.
wbgpn SlSh Srygm whya kprxt elth nzh hbSylw aSkltyh enbym and in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes: ubagefen sheloshah sarigim, vehi kheforakhat ‘aletah nizah hibshilu ’ashkeloteha ‘anabim.
wkws preh bydy waqx at henbym waSxT atm al kws preh watn at hkws el kp preh and pharaoh-big-house's cup was in my hand: and i took the grapes, and pressed them into pharaoh-big-house's cup, and i gave the cup into pharaoh-big-house's hand. vekhos par‘oh beyadi, va’eqakh ha‘anabim va’eskhat ’otam ’el kos par‘oh va’eten hakos ‘al kaf par‘oh.
wyamr lw ywsp ch ptrnw SlSt hSrgym SlSt ymym hm and joseph-add said unto him, this is the interpretation of it: the three branches are three days: vayomer lo yosef zeh pitrono, sheloshet hasarigim sheloshet yamim hem.
bewd SlSt ymym ySa preh at raSk whSybk el knk wntt kws preh bydw kmSpT hraSwn aSr hyyt mSqhw yet within three days pharaoh-big-house lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou deliver pharaoh-big-house's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler. be‘od sheloshet yamim yisa far‘oh roshekha vahashibekha ‘al kanekha, venatata khos par‘oh beyado kamishpat harishon ’asher hayita mashqehu.
ky am ckrtny atk kaSr yyTb lk weSyt na emdy xsd whckrtny al preh whwzatny mn hbyt hch and think on me when it be well with thee, and show kindness, i pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto pharaoh-big-house, and bring me out of this daughter-house: ki ’im zekhartani ’itekha ka’asher yitab lakh ve‘asita na ‘imadi khased, vehizkartani ’el par‘oh vehozetani min habayit hazeh.
ky gnb gnbty marz hebrym wgm ph la eSyty mawmh ky Smw aty bbwr for indeed i was stolen away out of the land of the hebrew-cross-overs: and here also have i done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon. ki gunob gunabti me’erez ha‘ibrim, vegam poh lo ‘asiti me’umah ki samu ’oti babor.
wyra Sr hapym ky Twb ptr wyamr al ywsp ap any bxlwmy whnh SlSh sly xry el raSy when the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto joseph-add, i also was in my dream, and, behold, i had three to-between-bin-between-build-white baskets on my head: vayar sar ha’ofim ki tob patar, vayomer ’el yosef ’af ’ani bakhalomi vehineh sheloshah salei khori ‘al roshi.
wbsl helywn mkl makl preh meSh aph whewp akl atm mn hsl mel raSy and in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for pharaoh-big-house; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head. ubasal ha‘elyon mikol ma’akhal par‘oh ma‘aseh ’ofeh, veha‘of ’okhel ’otam min hasal me‘al roshi.
wyen ywsp wyamr ch ptrnw SlSt hslym SlSt ymym hm and joseph-add answered and said, this is the interpretation thereof: the three baskets are three days: vaya‘an yosef vayomer zeh pitrono, sheloshet hasalim sheloshet yamim hem.
bewd SlSt ymym ySa preh at raSk melyk wtlh awtk el ez wakl hewp at bSrk melyk yet within three days pharaoh-big-house lift up thy head from off thee, and hang thee on a tree; and the birds eat thy flesh from off thee. be‘od sheloshet yamim yisa far‘oh roshekha me‘alekha vetalah ’otkha ‘al ‘ez, ve’akhal ha‘of besarekha me‘alekha.
wyhy bywm hSlySy ywm hldt at preh wyeS mSth lkl ebdyw wySa at raS Sr hmSqym wat raS Sr hapym btwk ebdyw and it came to pass the third day, which was pharaoh-big-house's birthday, that he made a until-conception unto all his workers: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his workers. vayhi bayom hashelishi yom huledet par‘oh vaya‘as mishteh lekhal ‘abadav, vayisa rosh sar hamashqim ve’et rosh sar ha’ofim betokh ‘abadav.
wySb at Sr hmSqym el mSqhw wytn hkws el kp preh and he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into pharaoh-big-house's hand: vayasheb sar hamashqim ‘al mashqehu, vayiten hakos ‘al kaf par‘oh.
wat Sr hapym tlh kaSr ptr lhm ywsp and he hanged the chief baker: as joseph-add had interpreted to them. ve’et sar ha’ofim talah, ka’asher patar lahem yosef.
wla ckr Sr hmSqym at ywsp wySkxhw yet did not the chief butler remember joseph-add, and forgat him. velo zakhar sar hamashqim yosef vayishkakhehu.
wyhy mqz Sntym ymym wpreh xlm whnh emd el hyar and it came to pass at the end of two full years, that pharaoh-big-house dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river. vayhi miqez shenatayim yamim, ufar‘oh kholem vehineh ‘omed ‘al hay’or.
whnh mn hyar elt Sbe prwt ypwt mrah wbryat bSr wtreynh baxw and, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favored kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow. vehineh min hay’or ‘olot sheba‘ parot yefot mar’eh uberi’ot basar, vatir‘enah ba’akhu.
whnh Sbe prwt axrwt elwt axryhn mn hyar rewt mrah wdqwt bSr wtemdnh azl hprwt el Spt hyar and, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favored and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river. vehineh sheba‘ parot ’akherot ‘olot ’akharehen min hay’or ra‘ot mar’eh vedaqot basar, vata‘amodenah ’ezel haparot ‘al sefat hay’or.
wtaklnh hprwt rewt hmrah wdqt hbSr at Sbe hprwt ypt hmrah whbryat wyyqz preh and the ill favored and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favored and fat kine. so pharaoh-big-house awoke. vatokhalnah haparot ra‘ot hamar’eh vedaqot habasar sheba‘ haparot yefot hamar’eh vehaberi’ot, vayiqaz par‘oh.
wyySn wyxlm Snyt whnh Sbe Sblym elwt bqnh axd bryawt wTbwt and he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn-swimming came up upon one stalk, rank and good. vayishan vayakhalom shenit, vehineh sheba‘ shibolim ‘olot beqaneh ’ekhad beri’ot vetobot.
whnh Sbe Sblym dqwt wSdwpt qdym zmxwt axryhn and, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them. vehineh sheba‘ shibolim daqot ushedufot qadim, zomekhot ’akharehen.
wtblenh hSblym hdqwt at Sbe hSblym hbryawt whmlawt wyyqz preh whnh xlwm and the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. and pharaoh-big-house awoke, and, behold, it was a dream. vatibla‘nah hashibolim hadaqot sheba‘ hashibolim haberi’ot vehamele’ot, vayiqaz par‘oh vehineh khalom.
wyhy bbqr wtpem rwxw wySlx wyqra at kl xrTmy mzrym wat kl xkmyh wyspr preh lhm at xlmw wayn pwtr awtm lpreh and it came to pass in the morning that his breath-spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of mizraim-narrows, and all the wise men thereof: and pharaoh-big-house told them his dream; and there was none that could interpret them unto pharaoh-big-house. vayhi baboqer vatipa‘em rukho vayishlakh vayiqra kal khartumei mizrayim ve’et kal khakhameha, vaysaper par‘oh lahem khalomo ve’en poter ’otam lefar‘oh.
wydbr Sr hmSqym at preh lamr at xTay any mckyr hywm then spake the chief butler unto pharaoh-big-house, saying, i do remember my faults this day: vaydaber sar hamashqim ’et par‘oh lemor, khata’ay ’ani mazkir hayom.
preh qzp el ebdyw wytn aty bmSmr byt Sr hTbxym aty wat Sr hapym pharaoh-big-house was wroth with his workers, and put me in ward in the captain of the guard's daughter-house, both me and the chief baker: par‘oh qazaf ‘al ‘abadav, vayiten ’oti bemishmar bet sar hatabakhim ’oti ve’et sar ha’ofim.
wnxlmh xlwm blylh axd any whwa ayS kptrwn xlmw xlmnw and we dreamed a dream in one night, i and he; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream. vanakhalmah khalom belaylah ’ekhad ’ani vahu, ’ish kefitron khalomo khalamenu.
wSm atnw ner ebry ebd lSr hTbxym wnspr lw wyptr lnw at xlmtynw ayS kxlmw ptr and there was there with us a young man, an hebrew-cross-over, worker to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he did interpret. vesham ’itanu na‘ar ‘ibri ‘ebed lesar hatabakhim vanesaper lo vayiftar lanu khalomotenu, ’ish kakhalomo patar.
wyhy kaSr ptr lnw kn hyh aty hSyb el kny watw tlh and it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was; me he restored unto mine office, and him he hanged. vayhi ka’asher patar lanu ken hayah, ’oti heshib ‘al kani ve’oto talah.
wySlx preh wyqra at ywsp wyryzhw mn hbwr wyglx wyxlp Smltyw wyba al preh then pharaoh-big-house sent and called joseph-add, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came in unto pharaoh-big-house. vayishlakh par‘oh vayiqra yosef vayrizuhu min habor, vaygalakh vaykhalef simlotav vayabo ’el par‘oh.
wyamr preh al ywsp xlwm xlmty wptr ayn atw wany Smety elyk lamr tSme xlwm lptr atw and pharaoh-big-house said unto joseph-add, i have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and i have heard say of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it. vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef khalom khalamti ufoter ’en ’oto, va’ani shama‘ti ‘alekha lemor tishma‘ khalom liftor ’oto.
wyen ywsp at preh lamr bledy alhym yenh at Slwm preh and joseph-add answered pharaoh-big-house, saying, it is not in me: to-no-these give pharaoh-big-house an answer of peace. vaya‘an yosef par‘oh lemor bil‘aday, ’elohim ya‘aneh shelom par‘oh.
wydbr preh al ywsp bxlmy hnny emd el Spt hyar and pharaoh-big-house said unto joseph-add, in my dream, behold, i stood upon the bank of the river: vaydaber par‘oh ’el yosef, bakhalomi hini ‘omed ‘al sefat hay’or.
whnh mn hyar elt Sbe prwt bryawt bSr wypt tar wtreynh baxw and, behold, there came up out of the river seven kine, fatfleshed and well favored; and they fed in a meadow: vehineh min hay’or ‘olot sheba‘ parot beri’ot basar vifot to’ar, vatir‘enah ba’akhu.
whnh Sbe prwt axrwt elwt axryhn dlwt wrewt tar mad wrqwt bSr la rayty khnh bkl arz mzrym lre and, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor and very ill favored and leanfleshed, such as i never saw in all the land of mizraim-narrows for badness: vehineh sheba‘ parot ’akherot ‘olot ’akharehen dalot vera‘ot to’ar me’od veraqot basar, lo ra’iti khahenah bekhal ’erez mizrayim laroa‘.
wtaklnh hprwt hrqwt whrewt at Sbe hprwt hraSnwt hbryat and the lean and the ill favored kine did eat up the first seven fat kine: vatokhalnah haparot haraqot vehara‘ot, sheba‘ haparot harishonot haberi’ot.
wtbanh al qrbnh wla nwde ky baw al qrbnh wmrayhn re kaSr btxlh wayqz and when they had eaten them up, it could not be hand-known that they had eaten them; and they were still ill favored, as at the beginning. so i awoke. vatabonah qirbenah velo noda‘ ki ba’u qirbenah umar’ehen ra‘ ka’asher batekhilah, va’iqaz.
wara bxlmy whnh Sbe Sblym elt bqnh axd mlat wTbwt and i saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ears came up in one stalk, full and good: va’ere bakhalomi, vehineh sheba‘ shibolim ‘olot beqaneh ’ekhad mele’ot vetobot.
whnh Sbe Sblym znmwt dqwt Sdpwt qdym zmxwt axryhm and, behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them: vehineh sheba‘ shibolim zenumot daqot shedufot qadim, zomekhot ’akharehem.
wtblen hSblym hdqt at Sbe hSblym hTbwt wamr al hxrTmym wayn mgyd ly and the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and i told this unto the magicians; and there was none that could declare it to me. vatibla‘na hashibolim hadaqot sheba‘ hashibolim hatobot, va’omar ’el hakhartumim ve’en magid li.
wyamr ywsp al preh xlwm preh axd hwa at aSr halhym eSh hgyd lpreh and joseph-add said unto pharaoh-big-house, the dream of pharaoh-big-house is one: to-no-these hath showed pharaoh-big-house what he is about to do. vayomer yosef ’el par‘oh khalom par‘oh ’ekhad hu, ’asher ha’elohim ‘oseh higid lefar‘oh.
Sbe prt hTbt Sbe Snym hnh wSbe hSblym hTbt Sbe Snym hnh xlwm axd hwa the seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one. sheba‘ parot hatobot sheba‘ shanim henah vesheba‘ hashibolim hatobot sheba‘ shanim henah, khalom ’ekhad hu.
wSbe hprwt hrqwt whret helt axryhn Sbe Snym hnh wSbe hSblym hrqwt Sdpwt hqdym yhyw Sbe Sny reb and the seven thin and ill favored kine that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind be seven years of famine. vesheba‘ haparot haraqot vehara‘ot ha‘olot ’akharehen sheba‘ shanim henah vesheba‘ hashibolim hareqot shedufot haqadim, yihyu sheba‘ shenei ra‘ab.
hwa hdbr aSr dbrty al preh aSr halhym eSh hrah at preh this is the thing which i have bee-spoken unto pharaoh-big-house: what to-no-these is about to do he showeth unto pharaoh-big-house. hu hadabar ’asher dibarti ’el par‘oh, ’asher ha’elohim ‘oseh her’ah par‘oh.
hnh Sbe Snym bawt Sbe gdwl bkl arz mzrym behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of mizraim-narrows: hineh sheba‘ shanim ba’ot, saba‘ gadol bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
wqmw Sbe Sny reb axryhn wnSkx kl hSbe barz mzrym wklh hreb at harz and there arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty be forgotten in the land of mizraim-narrows; and the famine consume the land; veqamu sheba‘ shenei ra‘ab ’akharehen venishkakh kal hasaba‘ be’erez mizrayim, vekhilah hara‘ab ha’arez.
wla ywde hSbe barz mpny hreb hhwa axry kn ky kbd hwa mad and the plenty not be hand-known in the land by reason of that famine following; for it be very grievous. velo yivada‘ hasaba‘ ba’arez mipenei hara‘ab hahu ’akhare khen, ki khabed hu me’od.
wel hSnwt hxlwm al preh pemym ky nkwn hdbr mem halhym wmmhr halhym leStw and for that the dream was doubled unto pharaoh-big-house twice; it is because the thing is established by to-no-these, and to-no-these will shortly bring it to pass. ve‘al hishanot hakhalom ’el par‘oh pa‘amayim, ki nakhon hadabar me‘im ha’elohim umemaher ha’elohim la‘asoto.
weth yra preh ayS nbwn wxkm wySythw el arz mzrym now therefore let pharaoh-big-house look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of mizraim-narrows. ve‘atah yere far‘oh ’ish nabon vekhakham, vishitehu ‘al ’erez mizrayim.
yeSh preh wypqd pqdym el harz wxmS at arz mzrym bSbe Sny hSbe let pharaoh-big-house do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of mizraim-narrows in the seven plenteous years. ya‘aseh far‘oh veyafqed peqidim ‘al ha’arez, vekhimesh ’erez mizrayim besheba‘ shenei hasaba‘.
wyqbzw at kl akl hSnym hTbt hbat halh wyzbrw br txt yd preh akl berym wSmrw and let them gather all the food of those good years that come, and lay up corn-swimming under the hand of pharaoh-big-house, and let them keep food in the cities. veyiqbezu kal ’okhel hashanim hatobot haba’ot ha’eleh, veyizberu bar takhat yad par‘oh ’okhel be‘arim veshamaru.
whyh hakl lpqdwn larz lSbe Sny hreb aSr thyyn barz mzrym wla tkrt harz breb and that food be for store to the land against the seven years of famine, which be in the land of mizraim-narrows; that the land perish not through the famine. vehayah ha’okhel lefiqadon la’arez lesheba‘ shenei hara‘ab ’asher tihyena be’erez mizrayim, velo tikaret ha’arez bara‘ab.
wyyTb hdbr beyny preh wbeyny kl ebdyw and the thing was good in the eyes of pharaoh-big-house, and in the eyes of all his workers. vayitab hadabar be‘enei far‘oh, ube‘enei kal ‘abadav.
wyamr preh al ebdyw hnmza kch ayS aSr rwx alhym bw and pharaoh-big-house said unto his workers, can we find such a one as this is, a man in whom breath-spirit of to-no-these is? vayomer par‘oh ’el ‘abadav, hanimza khazeh ’ish ’asher ruakh ’elohim bo.
wyamr preh al ywsp axry hwdye alhym awtk at kl cat ayn nbwn wxkm kmwk and pharaoh-big-house said unto joseph-add, forasmuch as to-no-these hath showed thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art: vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef ’akharei hodia‘ ’elohim ’otkha kal zot, ’en nabon vekhakham kamokha.
ath thyh el byty wel pyk ySq kl emy rq hksa agdl mmk thou be over my daughter-house, and according unto thy bee-word all my with-mum-people be ruled: only in the throne will i be greater than thou. ’atah tihyeh ‘al beti ve‘al pikha yishaq kal ‘ami, raq hakisei ’egdal mimeka.
wyamr preh al ywsp rah ntty atk el kl arz mzrym and pharaoh-big-house said unto joseph-add, see, i have set thee over all the land of mizraim-narrows. vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef, re’eh natati ’otekha ‘al kal ’erez mizrayim.
wysr preh at Tbetw mel ydw wytn ath el yd ywsp wylbS atw bgdy SS wySm rbd hchb el zwarw and pharaoh-big-house took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon joseph-add's hand, and arrayed him in vestures six, and put a gold chain about his neck; vayasar par‘oh taba‘to me‘al yado vayiten ’otah ‘al yad yosef, vayalbesh ’oto bigde shesh vayasem rebid hazahab ‘al zavaro.
wyrkb atw bmrkbt hmSnh aSr lw wyqraw lpnyw abrk wntwn atw el kl arz mzrym and he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had; and they cried before-turns him, bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of mizraim-narrows. vayarkeb ’oto bemirkebet hamishneh ’asher lo vayiqre’u lefanav ’abrekh, venaton ’oto ‘al kal ’erez mizrayim.
wyamr preh al ywsp any preh wbledyk la yrym ayS at ydw wat rglw bkl arz mzrym and pharaoh-big-house said unto joseph-add, i am pharaoh-big-house, and without thee no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of mizraim-narrows. vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef ’ani far‘oh, ubil‘adekha lo yarim ’ish yado ve’et raglo bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
wyqra preh Sm ywsp zpnt penx wytn lw at asnt bt pwTy pre khn an laSh wyza ywsp el arz mzrym and pharaoh-big-house called joseph-add's name ; and he gave him to woman asenath-thorn-bush the daughter-hoof-bat-child of potipherah-given-by-ra dimmer-server of on. and joseph-add went out over all the land of mizraim-narrows. vayiqra far‘oh shem yosef pa‘neakh vayiten lo ’asenat bat poti fera‘ kohen ’on le’ishah, vayezei yosef ‘al ’erez mizrayim.
wywsp bn SlSym Snh bemdw lpny preh mlk mzrym wyza ywsp mlpny preh wyebr bkl arz mzrym and joseph-add was thirty years old when he stood before-turns pharaoh-big-house king-moloch of mizraim-narrows. and joseph-add went out from the presence of pharaoh-big-house, and went throughout all the land of mizraim-narrows. veyosef ben sheloshim shanah be‘amedo lifnei par‘oh melekh mizrayim, vayezei yosef milifnei far‘oh vaya‘bor bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
wteS harz bSbe Sny hSbe lqmzym and in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls. vata‘as ha’arez besheba‘ shenei hasaba‘, liqmazim.
wyqbz at kl akl Sbe Snym aSr hyw barz mzrym wytn akl berym akl Sdh heyr aSr sbybtyh ntn btwkh and he added up all the food of the seven years, which were in the land of mizraim-narrows, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every light-city, laid he up in the same. vayiqboz kal ’okhel sheba‘ shanim ’asher hayu be’erez mizrayim vayiten ’okhel be‘arim, ’okhel sedeh ha‘ir ’asher sebiboteha natan betokhah.
wyzbr ywsp br kxwl hym hrbh mad ed ky xdl lspr ky ayn mspr and joseph-add added corn-swimming as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number. vayizbor yosef bar kekhol hayam harbeh me’od, ‘ad ki khadal lispor ki ’en mispar.
wlywsp yld Sny bnym bTrm tbwa Snt hreb aSr yldh lw asnt bt pwTy pre khn awn and unto joseph-add were born two children-betweens before-turns the years of famine came, which asenath-thorn-bush the daughter-hoof-bat-child of potipherah-given-by-ra dimmer-server of on conceived-of unto him. uleyosef yulad shenei banim beterem tabo shenat hara‘ab, ’asher yaledah lo ’asenat bat poti fera‘ kohen ’on.
wyqra ywsp at Sm hbkwr mnSh ky nSny alhym at kl emly wat kl byt aby and joseph-add called the name of the firstborn manasseh-place-of-sleep: for to-no-these, said he, hath let me sleep over my toil, and all my father's daughter-house. vayiqra yosef shem habekhor menasheh, ki nashani ’elohim kal ‘amali ve’et kal bet ’abi.
wat Sm hSny qra aprym ky hprny alhym barz enyy and the name of the second called he ephraim-fruitful: for to-no-these hath caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction. ve’et shem hasheni qara ’efrayim, ki hifrani ’elohim be’erez ‘aneyi.
wtklynh Sbe Sny hSbe aSr hyh barz mzrym and the seven years of plenteousness, that was in the land of mizraim-narrows, were ended. vatikhlenah sheba‘ shenei hasaba‘, ’asher hayah be’erez mizrayim.
wtxlynh Sbe Sny hreb lbwa kaSr amr ywsp wyhy reb bkl harzwt wbkl arz mzrym hyh lxm and the seven years of dearth began to come, according as joseph-add had said: and the dearth was in all lands; and in all the land of mizraim-narrows there was bread. vatekhilenah sheba‘ shenei hara‘ab labo ka’asher ’amar yosef, vayhi ra‘ab bekhal ha’arazot ubekhal ’erez mizrayim hayah lakhem.
wtreb kl arz mzrym wyzeq hem al preh llxm wyamr preh lkl mzrym lkw al ywsp aSr yamr lkm teSw and when all the land of mizraim-narrows was famished, the with-mum-people cried to pharaoh-big-house for bread: and pharaoh-big-house said unto all the mizraim-narrowsians, go unto joseph-add; what he saith to you, do. vatir‘ab kal ’erez mizrayim vayiz‘aq ha‘am ’el par‘oh lalakhem, vayomer par‘oh lekhal mizrayim lekhu ’el yosef ’asher yomar lakhem ta‘asu.
whreb hyh el kl pny harz wyptx ywsp at kl aSr bhm wySbr lmzrym wyxcq hreb barz mzrym and the famine was over all the face-turns of the earth: and joseph-add opened all the storehouses, and sold unto the mizraim-narrowsians; and the famine waxed sore in the land of mizraim-narrows. vehara‘ab hayah ‘al kal penei ha’arez, vayiftakh yosef kal ’asher bahem vayishbor lemizrayim vayekhezaq hara‘ab be’erez mizrayim.
wkl harz baw mzrymh lSbr al ywsp ky xcq hreb bkl harz and all countries came into mizraim-narrows to joseph-add for to buy corn-swimming; because that the famine was so sore in all lands. vekhal ha’arez ba’u mizraymah lishbor ’el yosef, ki khazaq hara‘ab bekhal ha’arez.
wyra yeqb ky yS Sbr bmzrym wyamr yeqb lbnyw lmh ttraw now when jacob-backstreet saw that there was corn-swimming in mizraim-narrows, jacob-backstreet said unto his children-betweens, why do ye look one upon another? vayar ya‘aqob ki yesh sheber bemizrayim, vayomer ya‘aqob lebanav lamah titra’u.
wyamr hnh Smety ky yS Sbr bmzrym rdw Smh wSbrw lnw mSm wnxyh wla nmwt and he said, behold, i have heard that there is corn-swimming in mizraim-narrows: get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die. vayomer hineh shama‘ti ki yesh sheber bemizrayim, redu shamah veshibru lanu misham venikhyeh velo namut.
wyrdw axy ywsp eSrh lSbr br mmzrym and joseph-add's ten brethren went down to buy corn-swimming in mizraim-narrows. vayeredu ’akhe yosef ‘asarah, lishbor bar mimizrayim.
wat bnymyn axy ywsp la Slx yeqb at axyw ky amr pn yqranw aswn and benjamin-he-between-of-righthand, joseph-add's brother, jacob-backstreet sent not with his brethren; for he said, lest peradventure mischief befall him. ve’et binyamin ’akhi yosef lo shalakh ya‘aqob ’et ’ekhav, ki ’amar pen yiqra’enu ’ason.
wybaw bny ySral lSbr btwk hbaym ky hyh hreb barz knen and children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards came to buy corn-swimming among those that came: for the famine was in the land of canaan-mobile-trade. vayabo’u benei yisra’el lishbor betokh haba’im, ki hayah hara‘ab be’erez kena‘an.
wywsp hwa hSlyT el harz hwa hmSbyr lkl em harz wybaw axy ywsp wyStxww lw apym arzh and joseph-add was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the with-mum-people of the land: and joseph-add's brethren came, and bowed down themselves before-turns him with their face-turns-turns to the earth. veyosef hu hashalit ‘al ha’arez hu hamashbir lekhal ‘am ha’arez, vayabo’u ’akhei yosef vayishtakhavu lo ’apayim ’arezah.
wyra ywsp at axyw wykrm wytnkr alyhm wydbr atm qSwt wyamr alhm mayn batm wyamrw marz knen lSbr akl and joseph-add saw his brethren, and he hand-knew them, and made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them; and he said unto them, whence come ye? and they said, from the land of canaan-mobile-trade to buy food. vayar yosef ’ekhav vayakirem, vayitnaker ’alehem vaydaber ’itam qashot vayomer ’alehem me’ayin batem vayomeru me’erez kena‘an lishbar ’okhel.
wykr ywsp at axyw whm la hkrhw and joseph-add hand-knew his brethren, and they hand-knew not him. vayaker yosef ’ekhav, vehem lo hikiruhu.
wyckr ywsp at hxlmwt aSr xlm lhm wyamr alhm mrglym atm lrawt at erwt harz batm and joseph-add remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come. vayizkor yosef hakhalomot ’asher khalam lahem, vayomer ’alehem meragelim ’atem lir’ot ‘ervat ha’arez batem.
wyamrw alyw la adny webdyk baw lSbr akl and they said unto him, nay, my base-lord, and to buy food are thy workers come. vayomeru ’elav lo ’adoni, va‘abadekha ba’u lishbar ’okhel.
klnw bny ayS axd nxnw knym anxnw la hyw ebdyk mrglym we are all one man's children-betweens; we are true men, thy workers are no spies. kulanu benei ’ish ’ekhad nakhenu, kenim ’anakhnu lo hayu ‘abadekha meragelim.
wyamr alhm la ky erwt harz batm lrawt and he said unto them, nay, and to see the nakedness of the land ye are come. vayomer ’alehem, lo ki ‘ervat ha’arez batem lir’ot.
wyamrw Snym eSr ebdyk axym anxnw bny ayS axd barz knen whnh hqTn at abynw hywm whaxd aynnw and they said, thy workers are twelve brethren, children-betweens of one man in the land of canaan-mobile-trade; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not. vayomeru shenem ‘asar ‘abadekha ’akhim ’anakhnu benei ’ish ’ekhad be’erez kena‘an, vehineh haqaton ’et ’abinu hayom veha’ekhad ’enenu.
wyamr alhm ywsp hwa aSr dbrty alkm lamr mrglym atm and joseph-add said unto them, that is it that i spake unto you, saying, ye are spies: vayomer ’alehem yosef, hu ’asher dibarti ’alekhem lemor meragelim ’atem.
bcat tbxnw xy preh am tzaw mch ky am bbwa axykm hqTn hnh hereby ye be proved: by the life of pharaoh-big-house ye not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither. bezot tibakhenu, khei far‘oh ’im teze’u mizeh ki ’im bebo ’akhikhem haqaton henah.
Slxw mkm axd wyqx at axykm watm hasrw wybxnw dbrykm hamt atkm wam la xy preh ky mrglym atm send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye be kept in prison, that your bee-words may be proved, whether there be any truth in you: or else by the life of pharaoh-big-house surely ye are spies. shilkhu mikem ’ekhad veyiqakh ’akhikhem ve’atem he’aseru veyibakhanu dibrekhem ha’emet ’itekhem, ve’im lo khei far‘oh ki meragelim ’atem.
wyasp atm al mSmr SlSt ymym and he put them all together into ward three days. vaye’esof ’otam ’el mishmar sheloshet yamim.
wyamr alhm ywsp bywm hSlySy cat eSw wxyw at halhym any yra and joseph-add said unto them the third day, this do, and live; for i fear to-no-these: vayomer ’alehem yosef bayom hashelishi zot ‘asu vikhyu, ha’elohim ’ani yare.
am knym atm axykm axd yasr bbyt mSmrkm watm lkw hbyaw Sbr rebwn btykm if ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound in the daughter-house of your prison: go ye, carry corn-swimming for the famine of your daughter-houses: ’im kenim ’atem ’akhikhem ’ekhad ye’aser bebet mishmarkhem, ve’atem lekhu habi’u sheber ra‘abon batekhem.
wat axykm hqTn tbyaw aly wyamnw dbrykm wla tmwtw wyeSw kn and bring your youngest brother unto me; so your bee-words be verified, and ye not die. and they did so. ve’et ’akhikhem haqaton tabi’u ’elay veye’amenu dibrekhem velo tamutu, vaya‘asu khen.
wyamrw ayS al axyw abl aSmym anxnw el axynw aSr raynw zrt npSw bhtxnnw alynw wla Smenw el kn bah alynw hzrh hcat and they said one to another, we are verily fire-name concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his being, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us. vayomeru ’ish ’el ’akhiv ’abal ’ashemim ’anakhnu ‘al ’akhinu ’asher ra’inu zarat nafsho behitkhano ’elenu velo shama‘enu, ‘al ken ba’ah ’elenu hazarah hazot.
wyen rawbn atm lamr hlwa amrty alykm lamr al txTaw byld wla Smetm wgm dmw hnh ndrS and reuben-see-child answered them, saying, spake i not unto you, saying, do not miss against child; and ye would not hear? therefore, behold, also his blood is required. vaya‘an re’uben ’otam lemor halo ’amarti ’alekhem lemor ’al tekhet’u bayeled velo shema‘tem, vegam damo hineh nidrash.
whm la ydew ky Sme ywsp ky hmlyz byntm and they hand-knew not that joseph-add understood them; for he spake unto them by an interpreter. vehem lo yade‘u ki shomea‘ yosef, ki hameliz benotam.
wysb melyhm wybk wySb alhm wydbr alhm wyqx matm at Smewn wyasr atw leynyhm and he turned himself about from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them simeon-hear-home, and bound him before-turns their eyes. vayisob me‘alehem vayebek, vayashab ’alehem vaydaber ’alehem vayiqakh me’itam shim‘on vaye’esor ’oto le‘enehem.
wyzw ywsp wymlaw at klyhm br wlhSyb kspyhm ayS al Sqw wltt lhm zdh ldrk wyeS lhm kn then joseph-add direct to fill their sacks with corn-swimming, and to restore every man's money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus did he unto them. vayzav yosef vaymal’u kelehem bar ulehashib kaspehem ’ish ’el saqo velatet lahem zedah ladarekh, vaya‘as lahem ken.
wySaw at Sbrm el xmryhm wylkw mSm and they laded their asses with the corn-swimming, and departed thence. vayis’u shibram ‘al khamorehem, vayelekhu misham.
wyptx haxd at Sqw ltt mspwa lxmrw bmlwn wyra at kspw whnh hwa bpy amtxtw and as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn, he espied his money; for, behold, it was in his sack's mouth. vayiftakh ha’ekhad saqo latet mispo lakhamoro bamalon, vayar kaspo vehineh hu befi ’amtakhto.
wyamr al axyw hwSb kspy wgm hnh bamtxty wyza lbm wyxrdw ayS al axyw lamr mh cat eSh alhym lnw and he said unto his brethren, my money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, what is this that to-no-these hath done unto us? vayomer ’el ’ekhav hushab kaspi vegam hineh be’amtakhti, vayezei libam vayekherdu ’ish ’el ’akhiv lemor mah zot ‘asah ’elohim lanu.
wybaw al yeqb abyhm arzh knen wygydw lw at kl hqrt atm lamr and they came unto jacob-backstreet their father unto the land of canaan-mobile-trade, and told him all that befell unto them; saying, vayabo’u ’el ya‘aqob ’abihem ’arzah kena‘an, vayagidu lo kal haqorot ’otam lemor.
dbr hayS adny harz atnw qSwt wytn atnw kmrglym at harz the man, who is the base-lord of the land, spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country. diber ha’ish ’adonei ha’arez ’itanu qashot, vayiten ’otanu kimragelim ha’arez.
wnamr alyw knym anxnw la hyynw mrglym and we said unto him, we are true men; we are no spies: vanomer ’elav kenim ’anakhenu, lo hayinu meragelim.
Snym eSr anxnw axym bny abynw haxd aynnw whqTn hywm at abynw barz knen we be twelve brethren, children-betweens of our father; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of canaan-mobile-trade. shenem ‘asar ’anakhnu ’akhim benei ’abinu, ha’ekhad ’enenu vehaqaton hayom ’et ’abinu be’erez kena‘an.
wyamr alynw hayS adny harz bcat ade ky knym atm axykm haxd hnyxw aty wat rebwn btykm qxw wlkw and the man, the base-lord of the country, said unto us, hereby i hand-know that ye are true men; leave one of your brethren here with me, and take food for the famine of your daughter-households, and be gone: vayomer ’elenu ha’ish ’adonei ha’arez bezot ’eda‘ ki khenim ’atem, ’akhikhem ha’ekhad hanikhu ’iti ve’et ra‘abon batekhem qekhu valekhu.
whbyaw at axykm hqTn aly wadeh ky la mrglym atm ky knym atm at axykm atn lkm wat harz tsxrw and bring your youngest brother unto me: then i hand-know that ye are no spies, and that ye are true men: so will i deliver you your brother, and ye traffic in the land. vehabi’u ’akhikhem haqaton ’elay ve’ede‘ah ki lo meragelim ’atem ki khenim ’atem,. ’akhikhem ’eten lakhem ve’et ha’arez tiskharu.
wyhy hm mryqym Sqyhm whnh ayS zrwr kspw bSqw wyraw at zrrwt kspyhm hmh wabyhm wyyraw and it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every man's bundle of money was in his sack: and when both they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid. vayhi hem meriqim saqehem vehineh ’ish zeror kaspo besaqo, vayir’u zerorot kaspehem hemah va’abihem vayira’u.
wyamr alhm yeqb abyhm aty Skltm ywsp aynnw wSmewn aynnw wat bnymn tqxw ely hyw klnh and jacob-backstreet their father said unto them, me have ye bereaved of my children-betweens: joseph-add is not, and simeon-hear-home is not, and ye will take benjamin-he-between-of-righthand away: all these things are against me. vayomer ’alehem ya‘aqob ’abihem ’oti shikaltem, yosef ’enenu veshim‘on ’enenu ve’et binyamin tiqakhu ‘alay hayu khulanah.
wyamr rawbn al abyw lamr at Sny bny tmyt am la abyanw alyk tnh atw el ydy wany aSybnw alyk and reuben-see-child spake unto his father, saying, slay my two children-betweens, if i bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and i will bring him to thee again. vayomer re’uben ’el ’abiv lemor shenei banay tamit ’im lo ’abi’enu ’elekha, tenah ’oto ‘al yadi va’ani ’ashibenu ’elekha.
wyamr la yrd bny emkm ky axyw mt whwa lbdw nSar wqrahw aswn bdrk aSr tlkw bh whwrdtm at Sybty bygwn Sawlh and he said, my child-between not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go, then ye bring down my gray gate-hairs with sorrow to the grave. vayomer lo yered beni ‘imakhem, ki ’akhiv met vehu lebado nish’ar uqera’ahu ’ason baderekh ’asher telekhu bah vehoradtem sebati beyagon she’olah.
whreb kbd barz and the famine was sore in the land. vehara‘ab kabed ba’arez.
wyhy kaSr klw lakl at hSbr aSr hbyaw mmzrym wyamr alyhm abyhm Sbw Sbrw lnw meT akl and it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn-swimming which they had brought out of mizraim-narrows, their father said unto them, go again, buy us a little food. vayhi ka’asher kilu le’ekhol hasheber ’asher hebi’u mimizrayim, vayomer ’alehem ’abihem shubu shibru lanu me‘at ’okhel.
wyamr alyw yhwdh lamr hed hed bnw hayS lamr la traw pny blty axykm atkm and judah-know spake unto him, saying, the man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, ye not see my face-turns, except your brother be with you. vayomer ’elav yehudah lemor, ha‘ed he‘id banu ha’ish lemor lo tir’u fanay bilti ’akhikhem ’itekhem.
am ySk mSlx at axynw atnw nrdh wnSbrh lk akl if thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food: ’im yeshkha meshaleakh ’akhinu ’itanu, neredah venishberah lekha ’okhel.
wam aynk mSlx la nrd ky hayS amr alynw la traw pny blty axykm atkm and if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down: for the man said unto us, ye not see my face-turns, except your brother be with you. ve’im ’enekha meshaleakh lo nered, ki ha’ish ’amar ’elenu lo tir’u fanay bilti ’akhikhem ’itekhem.
wyamr ySral lmh hretm ly lhgyd layS hewd lkm ax and israel-juicy-towards said, wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother? vayomer yisra’el lamah hare‘otem li, lehagid la’ish ha‘od lakhem ’akh.
wyamrw Sawl Sal hayS lnw wlmwldtnw lamr hewd abykm xy hyS lkm ax wngd lw el py hdbrym halh hydwe nde ky yamr hwrydw at axykm and they said, the man asked us straitly of our state, and of our kindred, saying, is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these bee-words: could we certainly hand-know that he would say, bring your brother down? vayomeru sha’ol sha’al ha’ish lanu ulemoladtenu lemor ha‘od ’abikhem khay hayesh lakhem ’akh vanaged lo ‘al pi hadebarim ha’eleh, hayadoa‘ neda‘ ki yomar horidu ’akhikhem.
wyamr yhwdh al ySral abyw Slxh hner aty wnqwmh wnlkh wnxyh wla nmwt gm anxnw gm ath gm Tpnw and judah-know said unto israel-juicy-towards his father, send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones. vayomer yehudah ’el yisra’el ’abiv shilkhah hana‘ar ’iti venaqumah venelekhah, venikhyeh velo namut gam ’anakhnu gam ’atah gam tapenu.
anky aerbnw mydy tbqSnw am la hbyatyw alyk whzgtyw lpnyk wxTaty lk kl hymym i will be surety for him; of my hand thou require him: if i bring him not unto thee, and set him before-turns thee, then let me bear the blame for ever: ’anokhi ’e‘erbenu miyadi tebaqshenu, ’im lo habi’otiv ’elekha vehizagtiv lefanekha vekhatati lekha kal hayamim.
ky lwla htmhmhnw ky eth Sbnw ch pemym for except we had lingered, surely now we had returned this second time. ki lulei hitmahmahenu, ki ‘atah shabnu zeh fa‘amayim.
wyamr alhm ySral abyhm am kn apwa cat eSw qxw mcmrt harz bklykm whwrydw layS mnxh meT zry wmeT dbS nkat wlT bTnym wSqdym and their father israel-juicy-towards said unto them, if it must be so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your tools, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, scents, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds: vayomer ’alehem yisra’el ’abihem ’im ken ’efo zot ‘asu qekhu mizimrat ha’arez bikhlekhem vehoridu la’ish minkhah, me‘at zori ume‘at debash nekhot valot batenim usheqedim.
wksp mSnh qxw bydkm wat hksp hmwSb bpy amtxtykm tSybw bydkm awly mSgh hwa and take double money in your hand; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks, carry it again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight: vekhesef mishneh qekhu beyedkhem, ve’et hakesef hamushab befi ’amtekhotekhem tashibu beyedkhem ’ulay mishgeh hu.
wat axykm qxw wqwmw Swbw al hayS take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man: ve’et ’akhikhem qakhu, vequmu shubu ’el ha’ish.
wal Sdy ytn lkm rxmym lpny hayS wSlx lkm at axykm axr wat bnymyn wany kaSr Sklty Sklty and to-no-these almighty give you mercy before-turns the man, that he may send away your other brother, and benjamin-he-between-of-righthand. if i be bereaved of my children-betweens, i am bereaved. ve’el shaday yiten lakhem rakhamim lifnei ha’ish veshilakh lakhem ’akhikhem ’akher ve’et binyamin, va’ani ka’asher shakholeti shakhaleti.
wyqxw hanSym at hmnxh hcat wmSnh ksp lqxw bydm wat bnymn wyqmw wyrdw mzrym wyemdw lpny ywsp and the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand and benjamin-he-between-of-righthand; and rose up, and went down to mizraim-narrows, and stood before-turns joseph-add. vayiqkhu ha’anashim haminkhah hazot umishneh kesef laqekhu beyadam ve’et binyamin, vayaqumu vayeredu mizrayim vaya‘amdu lifnei yosef.
wyra ywsp atm at bnymyn wyamr laSr el bytw hba at hanSym hbyth wTbx Tbx whkn ky aty yaklw hanSym bzhrym and when joseph-add saw benjamin-he-between-of-righthand with them, he said to the ruler of his daughter-house, bring these men home, and slay, and make ready; for these men dine with me at noon. vayar yosef ’itam binyamin vayomer la’asher ‘al beto habei ha’anashim habayetah, uteboakh tebakh vehakhen ki ’iti yokhelu ha’anashim bazahorayim.
wyeS hayS kaSr amr ywsp wyba hayS at hanSym byth ywsp and the man did as joseph-add bade; and the man brought the men into joseph-add's daughter-house. vaya‘as ha’ish ka’asher ’amar yosef, vayabei ha’ish ha’anashim betah yosef.
wyyraw hanSym ky hwbaw byt ywsp wyamrw el dbr hksp hSb bamtxtynw btxlh anxnw mwbaym lhtgll elynw wlhtnpl elynw wlqxt atnw lebdym wat xmrynw and the men were afraid, because they were brought into joseph-add's daughter-house; and they said, because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for workers, and our asses. vayire’u ha’anashim ki hube’u bet yosef vayomeru ‘al debar hakesef hashab be’amtekhotenu batekhilah ’anakhnu muba’im, lehitgolel ‘alenu ulehitnapel ‘alenu velaqakhat ’otanu la‘abadim ve’et khamorenu.
wygSw al hayS aSr el byt ywsp wydbrw alyw ptx hbyt and they came near to the steward of joseph-add's daughter-house, and they communed with him at the opening of the daughter-house, vayigeshu ’el ha’ish ‘al bet yosef, vaydaberu ’elav petakh habayit.
wyamrw by adny yrd yrdnw btxlh lSbr akl and said, o sir, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food: vayomeru ’adoni, yarod yaradnu batekhilah lishbar ’okhel.
wyhy ky banw al hmlwn wnptxh at amtxtynw whnh ksp ayS bpy amtxtw kspnw bmSqlw wnSb atw bydnw and it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand. vayhi ki banu ’el hamalon vaniftekhah ’amtekhotenu vehineh khesef ’ish befi ’amtakhto kaspenu bemishqalo, vanasheb ’oto beyadenu.
wksp axr hwrdnw bydnw lSbr akl la ydenw my Sm kspnw bamtxtynw and other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food: we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks. vekhesef ’akher horadnu beyadenu lishbar ’okhel, lo yada‘nu mi sam kaspenu be’amtekhotenu.
wyamr Slwm lkm al tyraw alhykm walhy abykm ntn lkm mTmwn bamtxtykm kspkm ba aly wywza alhm at Smewn and he said, peace be to you, fear not: your to-no-these, and the to-no-these of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: i had your money. and he brought simeon-hear-home out unto them. vayomer shalom lakhem ’al tira’u ’elohekhem velohei ’abikhem natan lakhem matmon be’amtekhotekhem kaspekhem ba ’elay, vayozei ’alehem shim‘on.
wyba hayS at hanSym byth ywsp wytn mym wyrxzw rglyhm wytn mspwa lxmryhm and the man brought the men into joseph-add's daughter-house, and gave them from-waters, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender. vayabei ha’ish ha’anashim betah yosef, vayiten mayim vayirkhazu raglehem vayiten mispo lakhamorehem.
wykynw at hmnxh ed bwa ywsp bzhrym ky Smew ky Sm yaklw lxm and they made ready the present against joseph-add came at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there. vayakhinu haminkhah ‘ad bo yosef bazahorayim, ki shame‘u ki sham yokhelu lakhem.
wyba ywsp hbyth wybyaw lw at hmnxh aSr bydm hbyth wyStxww lw arzh and when joseph-add came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the daughter-house, and bowed themselves to him to the earth. vayabo yosef habaytah vayabi’’u lo haminkhah ’asher beyadam habayetah, vayishtakhavu lo ’arezah.
wySal lhm lSlwm wyamr hSlwm abykm hcqn aSr amrtm hewdnw xy and he asked them of their welfare, and said, is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? is he yet alive? vayish’al lahem leshalom vayomer hashalom ’abikhem hazaqen ’asher ’amartem, ha‘odenu khay.
wyamrw Slwm lebdk labynw ewdnw xy wyqdw wyStxw wyStxww and they answered, thy worker our father is in good health, he is yet alive. and they bowed down their heads, and made obeisance. vayomeru shalom le‘abdekha le’abinu ‘odenu khay, vayiqedu vayishtakhavu
wySa eynyw wyra at bnymyn axyw bn amw wyamr hch axykm hqTn aSr amrtm aly wyamr alhym yxnk bny and he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother benjamin-he-between-of-righthand, his mother's child-between, and said, is this your younger brother, of whom ye spake unto me? and he said, to-no-these be attracted unto thee, my child-between. vayisa ‘enav vayar binyamin ’akhiv ben ’imo vayomer hazeh ’akhikhem haqaton ’asher ’amartem ’elay, vayomar ’elohim yakhenekha beni.
