wymhr ywsp ky nkmrw rxmyw al axyw wybqS lbkwt wyba hxdrh wybk Smh and joseph-add made haste; for his bowels did yearn upon his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there. vaymaher yosef ki nikhmeru rakhamav ’el ’akhiv vaybaqesh libkot, vayabo hakhadrah vayebek shamah.
wyrxz pnyw wyza wytapq wyamr Symw lxm and he washed his face-turns, and went out, and refrained himself, and said, set on bread. vayirkhaz panav vayeze, vayit’apaq vayomer simu lakhem.
wySymw lw lbdw wlhm lbdm wlmzrym haklym atw lbdm ky la ywklwn hmzrym lakl at hebrym lxm ky twebh hwa lmzrym and they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the mizraim-narrowsians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because the mizraim-narrowsians might not eat bread with the hebrew-cross-overs; for that is an abomination unto the mizraim-narrowsians. vayasimu lo lebado velahem lebadam, velamizrim ha’okhelim ’ito lebadam ki lo yukhelun hamizrim le’ekhol ’et ha‘ibrim lekhem ki to‘ebah hi lemizrayim.
wySbw lpnyw hbkr kbkrtw whzeyr kzertw wytmhw hanSym ayS al rehw and they sat before-turns him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marveled one at another. vayeshebu lefanav habekhor kibkhorato vehaza‘ir kiz‘irato, vayitmehu ha’anashim ’ish ’el re‘ehu.
wySa mSat mat pnyw alhm wtrb mSat bnymn mmSat klm xmS ydwt wyStw wySkrw emw and he took and sent messes unto them from before-turns him: and benjamin-he-between-of-righthand's mess was five times so much as any of theirs. and they drank, and were merry with him. vayisa mas’ot me’et panav ’alehem vatereb mas’at binyamin mimas’ot kulam khamesh yadot, vayishtu vayishkeru ‘imo.
wyzw at aSr el bytw lamr mla at amtxt hanSym akl kaSr ywklwn Sat wSym ksp ayS bpy amtxtw and he direct the steward of his daughter-house, saying, fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man's money in his sack's mouth. vayzav ’asher ‘al beto lemor malei ’amtekhot ha’anashim ’okhel ka’asher yukhelun se’et, vesim kesef ’ish befi ’amtakhto.
wat gbyey gbye hksp tSym bpy amtxt hqTn wat ksp Sbrw wyeS kdbr ywsp aSr dbr and put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack's mouth of the youngest, and his corn-swimming money. and he did according to the bee-word that joseph-add had bee-spoken. ve’et gebi‘i gebia‘ hakesef tasim befi ’amtakhat haqaton ve’et kesef shibro, vaya‘as kidbar yosef ’asher diber.
hbqr awr whanSym Slxw hmh wxmryhm as soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses. haboqer ’or, veha’anashim shulekhu hemah vakhamorehem.
hm yzaw at heyr la hrxyqw wywsp amr laSr el bytw qwm rdp axry hanSym whSgtm wamrt alhm lmh Slmtm reh txt Twbh and when they were gone out of the light-city, and not yet far off, joseph-add said unto his steward, up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, wherefore have ye rewarded bad for good? hem yaze’u ’et ha‘ir lo hirkhiqu veyosef ’amar la’asher ‘al beto qum redof ’akharei ha’anashim, vehisagtam ve’amarta ’alehem lamah shilamtem ra‘ah takhat tobah.
hlwa ch aSr ySth adny bw whwa nxS ynxS bw hretm aSr eSytm is not this it in which my base-lord drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done bad in so doing. halo zeh ’asher yishteh ’adoni bo vehu nakhesh yenakhesh bo, hare‘otem ’asher ‘asitem.
wySgm wydbr alhm at hdbrym halh and he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same bee-words. vayasigem, vaydaber ’alehem hadebarim ha’eleh.
wyamrw alyw lmh ydbr adny kdbrym halh xlylh lebdyk meSwt kdbr hch and they said unto him, wherefore saith my base-lord these bee-words? to-no-these forbid that thy workers should do according to this thing: vayomeru ’elav lamah yedaber ’adoni kadebarim ha’eleh, khalilah la‘abadekha me‘asot kadabar hazeh.
hn ksp aSr mzanw bpy amtxtynw hSybnw alyk marz knen wayk ngnb mbyt adnyk ksp aw chb behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of canaan-mobile-trade: how then should we steal out of thy base-lord's daughter-house silver or gold? hen kesef ’asher mazanu befi ’amtekhotenu heshibonu ’elekha me’erez kena‘an, ve’ekh nignob mibet ’adonekha kesef ’o zahab.
aSr ymza atw mebdyk wmt wgm anxnw nhyh ladny lebdym with whomsoever of thy workers it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my base-lord's workers. ’asher yimazei ’ito me‘abadekha vamet, vegam ’anakhnu nihyeh ladoni la‘abadim.
wyamr gm eth kdbrykm kn hwa aSr ymza atw yhyh ly ebd watm thyw nqym and he said, now also let it be according unto your bee-words: he with whom it is found be my worker; and ye be blameless. vayomer gam ‘atah khedibrekhem ken hu, ’asher yimazei ’ito yihyeh li ‘abed ve’atem tihyu neqiyim.
wymhrw wywrdw ayS at amtxtw arzh wyptxw ayS amtxtw then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack. vaymaharu vayoridu ’ish ’amtakhto ’arezah, vayiftekhu ’ish ’amtakhto.
wyxpS bgdwl hxl wbqTn klh wymza hgbye bamtxt bnymn and he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in benjamin-he-between-of-righthand's sack. vaykhapes bagadol hekhel ubaqaton kilah, vayimazei hagabia‘ be’amtakhat binyamin.
wyqrew Smltm wyems ayS el xmrw wySbw heyrh then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the light-city. vayiqre‘u simlotam, vaya‘amos ’ish khamoro vayashubu ha‘irah.
wyba yhwdh waxyw byth ywsp whwa ewdnw Sm wyplw lpnyw arzh and judah-know and his brethren came to joseph-add's daughter-house; for he was yet there: and they fell before-turns him on the ground. vayabo yehudah ve’ekhav betah yosef vehu ‘odenu sham, vayipelu lefanav ’arezah.
wyamr lhm ywsp mh hmeSh hch aSr eSytm hlwa ydetm ky nxS ynxS ayS aSr kmny and joseph-add said unto them, what deed is this that ye have done? wot ye not that such a man as i can certainly divine? vayomer lahem yosef mah hama‘aseh hazeh ’asher ‘asitem, halo yeda‘tem ki nakhesh yenakhesh ’ish ’asher kamoni.
wyamr yhwdh mh namr ladny mh ndbr wmh nzTdq halhym mza at ewn ebdyk hnnw ebdym ladny gm anxnw gm aSr nmza hgbye bydw and judah-know said, what we say unto my base-lord? what we speak? or how we clear ourselves? to-no-these hath found out the torment of thy workers: behold, we are my base-lord's workers, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found. vayomer yehudah mah nomar ladoni mah nedaber umah niztadaq, ha’elohim maza ‘avon ‘abadekha hinenu ‘abadim ladoni gam ’anakhnu gam ’asher nimza hagabia‘ beyado.
wyamr xlylh ly meSwt cat hayS aSr nmza hgbye bydw hwa yhyh ly ebd watm elw lSlwm al abykm and he said, to-no-these forbid that i should do so: and the man in whose hand the cup is found, he be my worker; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father. vayomer khalilah li me‘asot zot, ha’ish ’asher nimza hagabia‘ beyado hu yihyeh li ‘abed ve’atem ‘alu leshalom ’el ’abikhem.
wygS alyw yhwdh wyamr by adny ydbr na ebdk dbr bacny adny wal yxr apk bebdk ky kmwk kpreh then judah-know came near unto him, and said, oh my base-lord, let thy worker, i pray thee, speak a bee-word in my base-lord's ears, and let not thine nose-anger burn against thy worker: for thou art even as pharaoh-big-house. vayigash ’elav yehudah vayomer bi ’adoni yedaber na ‘abdekha dabar be’azenei ’adoni ve’al yikhar ’apekha be‘abdekha, ki khamokha kefar‘oh.
adny Sal at ebdyw lamr hyS lkm ab aw ax my base-lord asked his workers, saying, have ye a father, or a brother? ’adoni sha’al ‘abadav lemor, hayesh lakhem ’ab ’o ’akh.
wnamr al adny yS lnw ab cqn wyld cqnym qTn waxyw mt wywtr hwa lbdw lamw wabyw ahbw and we said unto my base-lord, we have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him. vanomer ’el ’adoni yesh lanu ’ab zaqen veyeled zequnim qatan, ve’akhiv met vayivater hu lebado le’imo ve’abiv ’ahebo.
wtamr al ebdyk hwrdhw aly waSymh eyny elyw and thou saidst unto thy workers, bring him down unto me, that i may set mine eyes upon him. vatomer ’el ‘abadekha horiduhu ’elay, ve’asimah ‘eni ‘alav.
wnamr al adny la ywkl hner lecb at abyw wecb at abyw wmt and we said unto my base-lord, the lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die. vanomer ’el ’adoni lo hana‘ar la‘azob ’abiv, ve‘azab ’abiv vamet.
wtamr al ebdyk am la yrd axykm hqTn atkm la tspwn lrawt pny and thou saidst unto thy workers, except your youngest brother come down with you, ye see my face-turns no more. vatomer ’el ‘abadekha ’im lo yered ’akhikhem haqaton ’itekhem, lo tosifun lir’ot panay.
wyhy ky elynw al ebdk aby wngd lw at dbry adny and it came to pass when we came up unto thy worker my father, we told him the bee-words of my base-lord. vayhi ki ‘alinu ’el ‘abdekha ’abi, vanaged lo ’et dibrei ’adoni.
wyamr abynw Sbw Sbrw lnw meT akl and our father said, go again, and buy us a little food. vayomer ’abinu, shubu shibru lanu me‘at ’okhel.
wnamr la nwkl lrdt am yS axynw hqTn atnw wyrdnw ky la nwkl lrawt pny hayS waxynw hqTn aynnw atnw and we said, we cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man's face-turns, except our youngest brother be with us. vanomer lo nukhal laredet, ’im yesh ’akhinu haqaton ’itanu veyaradnu ki lo nukhal lir’ot penei ha’ish ve’akhinu haqaton ’enenu ’itanu.
wyamr ebdk aby alynw atm ydetm ky Snym yldh ly aSty and thy worker my father said unto us, ye hand-know that my woman conceived-of me two children-betweens: vayomer ‘abdekha ’abi ’elenu, ’atem yeda‘tem ki shenayim yaledah li ’ishti.

weth kbay al ebdk aby whner aynnw atnw wnpSw qSwrh bnpSw now therefore when i come to thy worker my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad's life; ve‘atah kebo’i ’el ‘abdekha ’abi vehana‘ar ’enenu ’itanu, venafsho qeshurah benafsho.
whyh krawtw ky ayn hner wmt whwrydw ebdyk at Sybt ebdk abynw bygwn Salh it come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy workers bring down the gray gate-hairs of thy worker our father with sorrow to the grave. vehayah kir’oto ki ’en hana‘ar vamet, vehoridu ‘abadekha sebat ‘abdekha ’abinu beyagon she’olah.
ky ebdk erb at hner mem aby lamr am la abyanw alyk wxTaty laby kl hymym for thy worker became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, if i bring him not unto thee, then i bear the blame to my father for ever. ki ‘abdekha ‘arab hana‘ar me‘im ’abi lemor, ’im lo ’abi’enu ’elekha vekhatati le’abi kal hayamim.
weth ySb na ebdk txt hner ebd ladny whner yel em axyw now therefore, i pray thee, let thy worker abide instead of the lad a worker to my base-lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren. ve‘atah yesheb na ‘abdekha takhat hana‘ar ‘ebed ladoni, vehana‘ar ya‘al ‘im ’ekhav.

wla ykl ywsp lhtapq lkl hnzbym elyw wyqra hwzyaw kl ayS mely wla emd ayS atw bhtwde ywsp al axyw then joseph-add could not refrain himself before-turns all them that stood by him; and he cried, cause every man to go out from me. and there stood no man with him, while joseph-add made himself hand-known unto his brethren. velo yakhol yosef lehit’apeq lekhol hanizabim ‘alav vayiqra hozi’u khal ’ish me‘alay, velo ‘amad ’ish ’ito behitvada‘ yosef ’el ’ekhav.
wytn at qlw bbky wySmew mzrym wySme byt preh and he wept aloud: and the mizraim-narrowsians and the daughter-house of pharaoh-big-house heard. vayiten qolo bibkhi, vayishme‘u mizrayim vayishma‘ bet par‘oh.
wyamr ywsp al axyw any ywsp hewd aby xy wla yklw axyw lenwt atw ky nbhlw mpnyw and joseph-add said unto his brethren, i am joseph-add; doth my father yet live? and his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence. vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav ’ani yosef ha‘od ’abi khay, velo yakhelu ’ekhav la‘anot ’oto ki nibhalu mipanav.
wyamr ywsp al axyw gSw na aly wygSw wyamr any ywsp axykm aSr mkrtm aty mzrymh and joseph-add said unto his brethren, come near to me, i pray you. and they came near. and he said, i am joseph-add your brother, whom ye sold into mizraim-narrows. vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav geshu na ’elay vayigashu, vayomer ’ani yosef ’akhikhem ’asher mekhartem mizrayemah.
weth al tezbw wal yxr beynykm ky mkrtm aty hnh ky lmxyh Slxny alhym lpnykm now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for to-no-these did send me before-turns you to preserve life. ve‘atah ’al te‘azebu ve’al yikhar be‘enekhem ki mekhartem ’oti henah, ki lemikhyah shelakhani ’elohim lifnekhem.
ky ch Sntym hreb bqrb harz wewd xmS Snym aSr ayn xryS wqzyr for these two years hath the famine been in the land: and yet there are five years, in the which there neither be earing nor harvest. ki zeh shenatayim hara‘ab beqereb ha’arez, ve‘od khamesh shanim ’asher ’en kharish veqazir
wySlxny alhym lpnykm lSwm lkm Saryt barz wlhxywt lkm lplyTh gdlh and to-no-these sent me before-turns you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance. vayishlakheni ’elohim lifnekhem lasum lakhem she’erit ba’arez, ulehakhayot lakhem lifletah gedolah.
weth la atm Slxtm aty hnh ky halhym wySymny lab lpreh wladwn lkl bytw wmSl bkl arz mzrym so now it was not you that sent me hither, and to-no-these: and he hath made me a father to pharaoh-big-house, and base-lord of all his daughter-house, and a ruler throughout all the land of mizraim-narrows. ve‘atah lo ’atem shelakhtem ’oti henah ki ha’elohim, vaysimeni le’ab lefar‘oh ule’adon lekhal beto umoshel bekhal ’erez mizrayim.
mhrw welw al aby wamrtm alyw kh amr bnk ywsp Smny alhym ladwn lkl mzrym rdh aly al temd haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, thus saith thy child-between joseph-add, to-no-these hath made me base-lord of all mizraim-narrows: come down unto me, tarry not: maharu va‘alu ’el ’abi va’amartem ’elav koh ’amar binkha yosef samani ’elohim le’adon lekhal mizrayim, redah ’elay ’al ta‘amod.
wySbt barz gSn whyyt qrwb aly ath wbnyk wbny bnyk wzank wbqrk wkl aSr lk and thou dwell in the land of goshen-rain, and thou be near unto me, thou, and thy children-betweens, and thy children-betweens's children-betweens, and thy flocks, and thy visit-cattles, and all that thou hast: veyashabta be’erez goshen vehayita qarob ’elay ’atah ubanekha ubenei banekha, vezonekha ubeqarekha vekhal ’asher lakh.
wklklty atk Sm ky ewd xmS Snym reb pn twrS ath wbytk wkl aSr lk and there will i nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy daughter-household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty. vekhilkalti ’otekha sham ki ‘od khamesh shanim ra‘ab, pen tivaresh ’atah ubetekha vekhal ’asher lakh.

whql nSme byt preh lamr baw axy ywsp wyyTb beyny preh wbeyny ebdyw and the fame thereof was heard in pharaoh-big-house's daughter-house, saying, joseph-add's brethren are come: and it was good in the eyes of pharaoh-big-house well, and his workers. vehaqol nishma‘ bet par‘oh lemor ba’u ’akhei yosef, vayitab be‘enei far‘oh ube‘enei ‘abadav.
wyamr preh al ywsp amr al axyk cat eSw Tenw at beyrkm wlkw baw arzh knen and pharaoh-big-house said unto joseph-add, say unto thy brethren, this do ye; lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of canaan-mobile-trade; vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef ’emor ’el ’akhekha zot ‘asu, ta‘anu be‘irekhem ulekhu bo’u ’arzah kena‘an.

wath zwyth cat eSw qxw lkm marz mzrym eglwt lTpkm wlnSykm wnSatm at abykm wbatm now thou art direct, this do ye; take you wagons out of the land of mizraim-narrows for your little ones, and for your women, and bring your father, and come. ve’atah zuvetah zot ‘asu, qekhu lakhem me’erez mizrayim ‘agalot letapekhem velinshekhem unesatem ’abikhem ubatem.

wyeSw kn bny ySral wytn lhm ywsp eglwt el py preh wytn lhm zdh ldrk and children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards did so: and joseph-add gave them wagons, according to the directive of pharaoh-big-house, and gave them provision for the way. vaya‘asu khen benei yisra’el vayiten lahem yosef ‘agalot ‘al pi far‘oh, vayiten lahem zedah ladarekh.

wyse ySral wkl aSr lw wyba barh Sbe wycbx cbxym lalhy abyw yzxq and israel-juicy-towards took his journey with all that he had, and came to beer-wellsheba-well-of-seven-swear, and butchered butchs unto the to-no-these of his father isaac-laughter. vayisa‘ yisra’el vekhal ’asher lo vayabo be’erah shaba‘, vayizbakh zebakhim lelohei ’abiv yizkhaq.

wyqxw at mqnyhm wat rkwSm aSr rkSw barz knen wybaw mzrymh yeqb wkl crew atw and they took their in-them-animal, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, and came into mizraim-narrows, jacob-backstreet, and all his seed with him: vayiqkhu miqnehem ve’et rekhusham ’asher rakheshu be’erez kena‘an vayabo’u mizrayemah, ya‘aqob vekhal zar‘o ’ito.

wbny Smewn ymwal wymyn wahd wykyn wzxr wSawl bn hknenyt and children-betweens of simeon-hear-home; towards-his-sea, and jamin-righthand, and ohad-one, and jachin-prepare, and zohar-bleach, and shaul-lent child-between of a canaan-mobile-tradeitish woman. ubenei shim‘on yemu’el veyamin ve’ohad veyakhin vezokhar, vesha’ul ben hakena‘anit.

wbny yhwdh er wawnn wSlh wprz wcrx wymt er wawnn barz knen wyhyw bny prz xzrwn wxmwl and children-betweens of judah-know; er-awake, and onan-trouble-vigor, and shelah-pulled-out, and parez-breach, and zarah-shine: and er-awake and onan-trouble-vigor died in the land of canaan-mobile-trade. and children-betweens of parez-breach were hezron-courtyard and ham-hotul. ubenei yehudah ‘er ve’onan veshelah vaferez vazarakh, vayamat ‘er ve’onan be’erez kena‘an vayihyu bene ferez khezron vekhamul.

alh bny lah aSr yldh lyeqb bpdn arm wat dynh btw kl npS bnyw wbnwtyw SlSym wSlS these be children-betweens of leah-tired, which she conceived-of unto jacob-backstreet in padanaram-redeemed-stack, with his daughter-hoof-bat-child dinah-discuss: all the beings of his children-betweens and his children-betweenesss were thirty and three. ’eleh benei le’ah ’asher yaledah leya‘aqob befadan ’aram ve’et dinah bito, kal nefesh banav ubenotav sheloshim veshalosh.
wbny gd zpywn wxgy Swny wazbn ery warwdy waraly and children-betweens of gad-tell-luck; ziphion-hide-north, and haggi-my-holiday, shuni-my-difference, and ezbon-finger, eri-cities, and arod-bronzei-my-bronze, and towards-my-light-up. ubenei gad zifyon vekhagi shuni ve’ezbon, ‘eri va’arodi ve’ar’eli.

alh bny clph aSr ntn lbn llah btw wtld at alh lyeqb SS eSrh npS these are children-betweens of zilpah-sprinkle, whom laban-white gave to leah-tired his daughter-hoof-bat-child, and these she conceived-of unto jacob-backstreet, even sixteen beings. ’eleh benei zilpah ’asher natan laban lele’ah bito, vateled ’eleh leya‘aqob shesh ‘esreh nafesh.
bny rxl aSt yeqb ywsp wbnymn children-betweens of rachel-ewe jacob-backstreet's woman; joseph-add, and benjamin-he-between-of-righthand. benei rakhel ’eshet ya‘aqob yosef ubinyamin.
wywld lywsp barz mzrym aSr yldh lw asnt bt pwTy pre khn an at mnSh wat aprym and unto joseph-add in the land of mizraim-narrows were born manasseh-place-of-sleep and ephraim-fruitful, which asenath-thorn-bush the daughter-hoof-bat-child of potipherah-given-by-ra dimmer-server of on conceived-of unto him. vayivaled leyosef be’erez mizrayim ’asher yaledah lo ’asenat bat poti fera‘ kohen ’on, menasheh ve’et ’efrayim.
wbny bnymn ble wbkr waSbl gra wnemn axy wraS mpym wxpym ward and children-betweens of benjamin-he-between-of-righthand were bela-swallowh, and becher-young-male-ripen-camel, and ashbel-fire-not, gera-stranger, and naaman-with-them, ehi-my-brother, and rosh-head, mupim-from-mouths, and khupim-innocent-shores, and ard-descending-bronze. ubenei binyamin bela‘ vabekher ve’ashbel gera vena‘aman ’ekhi varosh, mupim vekhupim va’ared.
alh bny rxl aSr yld lyeqb kl npS arbeh eSr these are children-betweens of rachel-ewe, which were born to jacob-backstreet: all the beings were fourteen. ’eleh benei rakhel ’asher yulad leya‘aqob, kal nefesh ’arba‘ah ‘asar.
wbny dn xSym and children-betweens of dan-discuss; hushim-feeling. ubene dan khushim.
wbny nptly yxzal wgwny wyzr wSlm and children-betweens of naphtali-twisted; jakhzel-press-towards, and guni-my-tint, and jezer-my-creative-instinct, and shilem-whole-peace. ubenei naftali, yakhze’el veguni veyezer veshilem.
alh bny blhh aSr ntn lbn lrxl btw wtld at alh lyeqb kl npS Sbeh these are children-betweens of bilhah-good-times, which laban-white gave unto rachel-ewe his daughter-hoof-bat-child, and she conceived-of these unto jacob-backstreet: all the beings were seven. ’eleh benei bilhah ’asher natan laban lerakhel bito, vateled ’eleh leya‘aqob kal nefesh shib‘ah.
kl hnpS hbah lyeqb mzrymh yzay yrkw mlbd nSy bny yeqb kl npS SSym wSS all the beings that came with jacob-backstreet into mizraim-narrows, which came out of his loins, besides jacob-backstreet's children-betweens' women, all the beings were threescore and six; kal hanefesh haba’ah leya‘aqob mizraymah yoze’ei yerekho milebad neshei bene ya‘aqob, kal nefesh shishim vashesh.
wbny ywsp aSr yld lw bmzrym npS Snym kl hnpS lbyt yeqb hbah mzrymh Sbeym and children-betweens of joseph-add, which were born him in mizraim-narrows, were two beings: all the beings of the daughter-house of jacob-backstreet, which came into mizraim-narrows, were threescore and ten. ubenei yosef ’asher yulad lo bemizrayim nefesh shenayim, kal hanefesh lebet ya‘aqob haba’ah mizraymah shib‘im.
wat yhwdh Slx lpnyw al ywsp lhwrt lpnyw gSnh wybaw arzh gSn and he sent judah-know before-turns him unto joseph-add, to direct his face-turns unto goshen-rain; and they came into the land of goshen-rain. ve’et yehudah shalakh lefanav ’el yosef lehorot lefanav goshenah, vayabo’u ’arzah goshen.
wyasr ywsp mrkbtw wyel lqrat ySral abyw gSnh wyra alyw wypl el zwaryw wybk el zwaryw ewd and joseph-add made ready his chariot, and went up to until-witness israel-juicy-towards his father, to goshen-rain, and presented himself unto him; and he fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while. vaye’sor yosef merkabto vaya‘al liqrat yisra’el ’abiv goshenah, vayera ’elav vayipol ‘al zavarav vayebek ‘al zavarav ‘od.
wyamr ySral al ywsp amwth hpem axry rawty at pnyk ky ewdk xy and israel-juicy-towards said unto joseph-add, now let me die, since i have seen thy face-turns, because thou art yet alive. vayomer yisra’el ’el yosef ’amutah hapa‘am, ’akharei re’oti panekha ki ‘odkha khay.
wyamr ywsp al axyw wal byt abyw aelh wagydh lpreh wamrh alyw axy wbyt aby aSr barz knen baw aly and joseph-add said unto his brethren, and unto his father's daughter-house, i will go up, and show pharaoh-big-house, and say unto him, my brethren, and my father's daughter-house, which were in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, are come unto me; vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav ve’el bet ’abiv ’e‘eleh ve’agidah lefar‘oh, ve’omerah ’elav ’akhay ubet ’abi ’asher be’erez kena‘an ba’u ’elay.
whanSym rey zan ky anSy mqnh hyw wzanm wbqrm wkl aSr lhm hbyaw and the men are shepherds, for their trade hath been to feed in-them-animal; and they have brought their flocks, and their visit-cattles, and all that they have. veha’anashim ro‘ei zon ki ’anshei miqneh hayu, vezonam ubeqaram vekhal ’asher lahem hebi’u.
whyh ky yqra lkm preh wamr mh meSykm and it come to pass, when pharaoh-big-house call you, and say, what is your occupation? vehayah ki yiqra lakhem par‘oh, ve’amar mah ma‘asekhem.
wamrtm anSy mqnh hyw ebdyk mnewrynw wed eth gm anxnw gm abtynw bebwr tSbw barz gSn ky twebt mzrym kl reh zan that ye say, thy workers' trade hath been about in-them-animal from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of goshen-rain; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the mizraim-narrowsians. va’amartem ’anshei miqneh hayu ‘abadekha mine‘urenu ve‘ad ‘atah gam ’anakhnu gam ’abotenu, ba‘abur teshebu be’erez goshen ki to‘abat mizrayim kal ro‘eh zon.
wyba ywsp wygd lpreh wyamr aby waxy wzanm wbqrm wkl aSr lhm baw marz knen whnm barz gSn then joseph-add came and told pharaoh-big-house, and said, my father and my brethren, and their flocks, and their visit-cattles, and all that they have, are come out of the land of canaan-mobile-trade; and, behold, they are in the land of goshen-rain. vayabo yosef vayaged lefar‘oh vayomer ’abi ve’akhay vezonam ubeqaram vekhal ’asher lahem ba’u me’erez kena‘an, vehinam be’erez goshen.
wmqzh axyw lqx xmSh anSym wyzgm lpny preh and he took some of his brethren, even five men, and presented them unto pharaoh-big-house. umiqzeh ’ekhav laqakh khamishah ’anashim, vayazigem lifnei far‘oh.
wyamr preh al axyw mh meSykm wyamrw al preh reh zan ebdyk gm anxnw gm abwtynw and pharaoh-big-house said unto his brethren, what is your occupation? and they said unto pharaoh-big-house, thy workers are shepherds, both we, and also our fathers. vayomer par‘oh ’el ’ekhav mah ma‘asekhem, vayomeru ’el par‘oh ro‘eh zon ‘abadekha gam ’anakhnu gam ’abotenu.
wyamrw al preh lgwr barz banw ky ayn mreh lzan aSr lebdyk ky kbd hreb barz knen weth ySbw na ebdyk barz gSn they said moreover unto pharaoh-big-house, for to sojourn in the land are we come; for thy workers have no pasture for their flocks; for the famine is sore in the land of canaan-mobile-trade: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy workers dwell in the land of goshen-rain. vayomeru ’el par‘oh lagur ba’arez banu ki ’en mir‘eh lazon ’asher la‘abadekha ki khabed hara‘ab be’erez kena‘an, ve‘atah yeshebu na ‘abadekha be’erez goshen.
wyamr preh al ywsp lamr abyk waxyk baw alyk and pharaoh-big-house spake unto joseph-add, saying, thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee: vayomer par‘oh ’el yosef lemor, ’abikha ve’akhekha ba’u ’elekha.
arz mzrym lpnyk hwa bmyTb harz hwSb at abyk wat axyk ySbw barz gSn wam ydet wyS bm anSy xyl wSmtm Sry mqnh el aSr ly the land of mizraim-narrows is before-turns thee; in the best of the land make thy father and brethren to dwell; in the land of goshen-rain let them dwell: and if thou knowest any men of activity among them, then make them rulers over my in-them-animal. ’erez mizrayim lefanekha hi bemetab ha’arez hosheb ’abikha ve’et ’akhekha, yeshebu be’erez goshen ve’im yada‘ta veyesh bam ’anshe khayil vesamtam sarei miqneh ‘al ’asher li.
wyba ywsp at yeqb abyw wyemdhw lpny preh wybrk yeqb at preh and joseph-add brought in jacob-backstreet his father, and set him before-turns pharaoh-big-house: and jacob-backstreet knee-fluffy-blessed pharaoh-big-house. vayabei yosef ya‘aqob ’abiv vaya‘amidehu lifnei far‘oh, vaybarekh ya‘aqob par‘oh.
wyamr preh al yeqb kmh ymy Sny xyyk and pharaoh-big-house said unto jacob-backstreet, how old art thou? vayomer par‘oh ’el ya‘aqob, kamah yemei shenei khayekha.
wyamr yeqb al preh ymy Sny mgwry SlSym wmat Snh meT wreym hyw ymy Sny xyy wla hSygw at ymy Sny xyy abty bymy mgwryhm and jacob-backstreet said unto pharaoh-big-house, the days of the years of my pilgrimage are an hundred and thirty years: few and bad have the days of the years of my life been, and have not attained unto the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage. vayomer ya‘aqob ’el par‘oh yemei shenei meguray sheloshim ume’at shanah, me‘at vera‘im hayu yemei shenei khayay velo hisigu yemei shenei khayei ’abotay bimei megurehem.
wybrk yeqb at preh wyza mlpny preh and jacob-backstreet knee-fluffy-blessed pharaoh-big-house, and went out from before-turns pharaoh-big-house. vaybarekh ya‘aqob par‘oh, vayezei milifnei far‘oh.
wywSb ywsp at abyw wat axyw wytn lhm axch barz mzrym bmyTb harz barz remss kaSr zwh preh and joseph-add placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of mizraim-narrows, in the best of the land, in the land of ram-voicelessses-born-by-ra, as pharaoh-big-house had direct. vayosheb yosef ’abiv ve’et ’ekhav vayiten lahem ’akhuzah be’erez mizrayim bemetab ha’arez be’erez ra‘meses, ka’asher zivah far‘oh.
wyklkl ywsp at abyw wat axyw wat kl byt abyw lxm lpy hTp and joseph-add nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father's daughter-household, with bread, according to their families. vaykhalkel yosef ’abiv ve’et ’ekhav ve’et kal bet ’abiv, lekhem lefi hataf.
wlxm ayn bkl harz ky kbd hreb mad wtlh arz mzrym warz knen mpny hreb and there was no bread in all the land; for the famine was very sore, so that the land of mizraim-narrows and all the land of canaan-mobile-trade fainted by reason of the famine. velekhem ’en bekhal ha’arez ki khabed hara‘ab me’od, vatelah ’erez mizrayim ve’erez kena‘an mipenei hara‘ab.
wylqT ywsp at kl hksp hnmza barz mzrym wbarz knen bSbr aSr hm Sbrym wyba ywsp at hksp byth preh and joseph-add added up all the money that was found in the land of mizraim-narrows, and in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, for the corn-swimming which they bought: and joseph-add brought the money into pharaoh-big-house's daughter-house. vaylaqet yosef kal hakesef hanimza be’erez mizrayim ube’erez kena‘an basheber ’asher hem shoberim, vayabei yosef hakesef betah far‘oh.
wytm hksp marz mzrym wmarz knen wybaw kl mzrym al ywsp lamr hbh lnw lxm wlmh nmwt ngdk ky aps ksp and when money failed in the land of mizraim-narrows, and in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, all the mizraim-narrowsians came unto joseph-add, and said, give us bread: for why should we die in thy presence? for the money faileth. vayitom hakesef me’erez mizrayim ume’erez kena‘an vayabo’u khal mizrayim ’el yosef lemor habah lanu lekhem velamah namut negdekha, ki ’afes kasef.
wyamr ywsp hbw mqnykm watnh lkm bmqnykm am aps ksp and joseph-add said, give your in-them-animal; and i will give you for your in-them-animal, if money fail. vayomer yosef habu miqnekhem ve’etenah lakhem bemiqnekhem, ’im ’afes kasef.
wybyaw at mqnyhm al ywsp wytn lhm ywsp lxm bswsym wbmqnh hzan wbmqnh hbqr wbxmrym wynhlm blxm bkl mqnhm bSnh hhwa and they brought their in-them-animal unto joseph-add: and joseph-add gave them bread in exchange for horses, and for the flocks, and for the in-them-animal of the visit-cattles, and for the asses: and he fed them with bread for all their in-them-animal for that year. vayabi’u miqnehem ’el yosef vayiten lahem yosef lekhem basusim ubemiqneh hazon ubemiqneh habaqar ubakhamorim, vaynahalem balekhem bekhal miqnehem bashanah hahiv.
wttm hSnh hhwa wybaw alyw bSnh hSnyt wyamrw lw la nkxd madny ky am tm hksp wmqnh hbhmh al adny la nSar lpny adny blty am gwytnw wadmtnw when that year was ended, they came unto him the second year, and said unto him, we will not hide it from my base-lord, how that our money is spent; my base-lord also hath our visit-cattles of in-them-animal; there is not ought left in the sight of my base-lord, and our bodies, and our lands: vatitom hashanah hahiv vayabo’u ’elav bashanah hashenit vayomeru lo lo nekhakhed me’adoni ki ’im tam hakesef umiqneh habehemah ’el ’adoni, lo nish’ar lifnei ’adoni bilti ’im geviyatenu ve’admatenu.
lmh nmwt leynyk gm anxnw gm admtnw qnh atnw wat admtnw blxm wnhyh anxnw wadmtnw ebdym lpreh wtn cre wnxyh wla nmwt whadmh la tSm wherefore we die before-turns thine eyes, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be workers unto pharaoh-big-house: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, that the land be not desolate. lamah namut le‘enekha gam ’anakhnu gam ’admatenu qeneh ’otanu ve’et ’admatenu balakhem, venihyeh ’anakhnu ve’admatenu ‘abadim lefar‘oh veten zera‘ venikhyeh velo namut veha’adamah lo tesham.
wyqn ywsp at kl admt mzrym lpreh ky mkrw mzrym ayS Sdhw ky xcq elhm hreb wthy harz lpreh and joseph-add bought all the land of mizraim-narrows for pharaoh-big-house; for the mizraim-narrowsians sold every man his field, because the famine prevailed over them: so the land became pharaoh-big-house's. vayiqen yosef kal ’admat mizrayim lefar‘oh ki makheru mizrayim ’ish sadehu ki khazaq ‘alehem hara‘ab, vatehi ha’arez lefar‘oh.
wat hem hebyr atw lerym mqzh gbwl mzrym wed qzhw and as for the with-mum-people, he removed them to cities from one end of the borders of mizraim-narrows even to the other end thereof. ve’et ha‘am he‘ebir ’oto le‘arim, miqzeh gebul mizrayim ve‘ad qazehu.
rq admt hkhnym la qnh ky xq lkhnym mat preh waklw at xqm aSr ntn lhm preh el kn la mkrw at admtm only the land of the dimmer-servers bought he not; for the dimmer-servers had a portion assigned them of pharaoh-big-house, and did eat their portion which pharaoh-big-house gave them: wherefore they sold not their lands. raq ’admat hakohanim lo qanah, ki khoq lakohanim me’et par‘oh ve’akhelu khuqam ’asher natan lahem par‘oh ‘al ken lo makheru ’admatam.
wyamr ywsp al hem hn qnyty atkm hywm wat admtkm lpreh ha lkm cre wcretm at hadmh then joseph-add said unto the with-mum-people, behold, i have bought you this day and your land for pharaoh-big-house: lo, here is seed for you, and ye sow the land. vayomer yosef ’el ha‘am hen qaniti ’etkhem hayom ve’et ’admatkhem lefar‘oh, he lakhem zera‘ uzera‘tem ha’adamah.
whyh btbwat wnttm xmySyt lpreh warbe hydt yhyh lkm lcre hSdh wlaklkm wlaSr bbtykm wlakl lTpkm and it come to pass in the increase, that ye give the fifth part unto pharaoh-big-house, and four parts be your own, for seed of the field, and for your food, and for them of your daughter-households, and for food for your little ones. vehayah batebu’ot unetatem khamishit lefar‘oh, ve’arba‘ hayadot yihyeh lakhem lezera‘ hasadeh ule’akhelekhem vela’asher bebatekhem vele’ekhol letapekhem.
wyamrw hxytnw nmza xn beyny adny whyynw ebdym lpreh and they said, thou hast saved our lives: let us find attractiveness in the sight of my base-lord, and we will be pharaoh-big-house's workers. vayomeru hekheyitanu, nimza khen be‘enei ’adoni vehayinu ‘abadim lefar‘oh.
wySm ath ywsp lxq ed hywm hch el admt mzrym lpreh lxmS rq admt hkhnym lbdm la hyth lpreh and joseph-add made it a teaching over the land of mizraim-narrows unto this day, that pharaoh-big-house should have the fifth part, except the land of the dimmer-servers only, which became not pharaoh-big-house's. vayasem ’otah yosef lekhoq ‘ad hayom hazeh ‘al ’admat mizrayim lefar‘oh lakhomesh, raq ’admat hakohanim lebadam lo hayetah lefar‘oh.
wySb ySral barz mzrym barz gSn wyaxcw bh wyprw wyrbw mad and israel-juicy-towards dwelt in the land of mizraim-narrows, in the country of goshen-rain; and they had possessions therein, and grew, and multiplied exceedingly. vayesheb yisra’el be’erez mizrayim be’erez goshen, vaye’akhazu bah vayifru vayirbu me’od.
wyxy yeqb barz mzrym Sbe eSrh Snh wyhy ymy yeqb Sny xyyw Sbe Snym warbeym wmat Snh and jacob-backstreet lived in the land of mizraim-narrows seventeen years: so the whole age of jacob-backstreet was an hundred forty and seven years. vaykhi ya‘aqob be’erez mizrayim sheba‘ ‘esreh shanah, vayhi yeme ya‘aqob shenei khayav sheba‘ shanim ve’arba‘im ume’at shanah.
wyqrbw ymy ySral lmwt wyqra lbnw lywsp wyamr lw am na mzaty xn beynyk Sym na ydk txt yrky weSyt emdy xsd wamt al na tqbrny bmzrym and the time drew nigh that israel-juicy-towards must die: and he called his child-between joseph-add, and said unto him, if now i have found attractiveness in thy sight, put, i pray thee, thy hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me; bury me not, i pray thee, in mizraim-narrows: vayiqrebu yeme yisra’el lamut vayiqra libno leyosef vayomer lo ’im na mazati khen be‘enekha sim na yadekha takhat yerekhi, ve‘asita ‘imadi khesed ve’emet ’al na tiqbereni bemizrayim.
wSkbty em abty wnSatny mmzrym wqbrtny bqbrtm wyamr anky aeSh kdbrk and i will lie with my fathers, and thou carry me out of mizraim-narrows, and bury me in their buryingplace. and he said, i will do as thou hast said. veshakhabti ‘im ’abotay unesatani mimizrayim uqebartani biqburatam, vayomar ’anokhi ’e‘eseh khidbarekha.
wyamr hSbeh ly wySbe lw wyStxw ySral el raS hmTh and he said, swear unto me. and he sware unto him. and israel-juicy-towards bowed himself upon the bed's head. vayomer hishabe‘ah li vayishaba‘ lo, vayishtakhu yisra’el ‘al rosh hamitah.
wyhy axry hdbrym halh wyamr lywsp hnh abyk xlh wyqx at Sny bnyw emw at mnSh wat aprym and it came to pass after these things, that one told joseph-add, behold, thy father is sick: and he took with him his two children-betweens, manasseh-place-of-sleep and ephraim-fruitful. vayhi ’akharei hadebarim ha’eleh vayomer leyosef hineh ’abikha kholeh, vayiqakh shenei banav ‘imo menasheh ve’et ’efrayim.
wygd lyeqb wyamr hnh bnk ywsp ba alyk wytxcq ySral wySb el hmTh and one told jacob-backstreet, and said, behold, thy child-between joseph-add cometh unto thee: and israel-juicy-towards strengthened himself, and sat upon the bed. vayaged leya‘aqob vayomer hineh binkha yosef ba ’elekha, vayitkhazeq yisra’el vayesheb ‘al hamitah.
wyamr yeqb al ywsp al Sdy nrah aly blwc barz knen wybrk aty and jacob-backstreet said unto joseph-add, to-no-these almighty appeared unto me at luz-hazel in the land of canaan-mobile-trade, and knee-fluffy-blessed me, vayomer ya‘aqob ’el yosef ’el shaday nir’ah ’elay beluz be’erez kena‘an, vaybarekh ’oti.
wyamr aly hnny mprk whrbytk wnttyk lqhl emym wntty at harz hcat lcrek axryk axct ewlm and said unto me, behold, i will make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, and i will make of thee a multitude of with-mum-people; and will give this land to thy seed after thee for an everlasting possession. vayomer ’elay hini mafrekha vehirbitikha unetatikha liqhal ‘amim, venatati ha’arez hazot lezar‘akha ’akharekha ’akhuzat ‘olam.
weth Sny bnyk hnwldym lk barz mzrym ed bay alyk mzrymh ly hm aprym wmnSh krawbn wSmewn yhyw ly and now thy two children-betweens, ephraim-fruitful and manasseh-place-of-sleep, which were born unto thee in the land of mizraim-narrows before-turns i came unto thee into mizraim-narrows, are mine; as reuben-see-child and simeon-hear-home, they be mine. ve‘atah shene banekha hanoladim lekha be’erez mizrayim ‘ad bo’i ’elekha mizraymah li hem, ’efrayim umenasheh kir’uben veshim‘on yihyu li.
wmwldtk aSr hwldt axryhm lk yhyw el Sm axyhm yqraw bnxltm and thy issue, which thou begettest after them, be thine, and be called after the name of their brethren in their inheritance. umoladtekha ’asher holadta ’akharehem lekha yihyu, ‘al shem ’akhehem yiqare’u benakhalatam.
wany bbay mpdn mth ely rxl barz knen bdrk bewd kbrt arz lba aprth waqbrh Sm bdrk aprt hwa byt lxm and as for me, when i came from padan, rachel-ewe died by me in the land of canaan-mobile-trade in the way, when yet there was and a little way to come unto ephrath-wishy-washy: and i buried her there in the way of ephrath-wishy-washy; the same is bethlehem-house-of-bread. va’ani bebo’i mipadan metah ‘alay rakhel be’erez kena‘an baderekh be‘od kibrat ’erez labo ’efratah, va’eqbereha sham bederekh ’efrat hi lakhem.
wyra ySral at bny ywsp wyamr my alh and israel-juicy-towards beheld joseph-add's children-betweens, and said, who are these? vayar yisra’el benei yosef, vayomer mi ’eleh.
wyamr ywsp al abyw bny hm aSr ntn ly alhym bch wyamr qxm na aly wabrkm and joseph-add said unto his father, they are my children-betweens, whom to-no-these hath given me in this place. and he said, bring them, i pray thee, unto me, and i will knee-fluffy-bless them. vayomer yosef ’el ’abiv banay hem ’asher natan li ’elohim bazeh, vayomar qakhem na ’elay va’abarakhem.
weyny ySral kbdw mcqn la ywkl lrawt wygS atm alyw wySq lhm wyxbq lhm now the eyes of israel-juicy-towards were dim for age, so that he could not see. and he brought them near unto him; and he kissed them, and embraced them. ve‘enei yisra’el kabedu mizoqen lo yukhal lir’ot, vayagesh ’otam ’elav vayishaq lahem vaykhabeq lahem.
wyamr ySral al ywsp rah pnyk la pllty whnh hrah aty alhym gm at crek and israel-juicy-towards said unto joseph-add, i had not thought to see thy face-turns: and, lo, to-no-these hath showed me also thy seed. vayomer yisra’el ’el yosef re’oh fanekha lo filaleti, vehineh her’ah ’oti ’elohim gam zar‘ekha.
wywza ywsp atm mem brkyw wyStxw lapyw arzh and joseph-add brought them out from between-bin his knees, and he bowed himself with his face-turns to the earth. vayozei yosef ’otam me‘im birkav, vayishtakhu le’apav ’arezah.
wyqx ywsp at Snyhm at aprym bymynw mSmal ySral wat mnSh bSmalw mymyn ySral wygS alyw and joseph-add took them both, ephraim-fruitful in his right hand toward israel-juicy-towards's left hand, and manasseh-place-of-sleep in his left hand toward israel-juicy-towards's right hand, and brought them near unto him. vayiqakh yosef ’et shenehem ’et ’efrayim bimino misemol yisra’el ve’et menasheh bismolo mimin yisra’el, vayagesh ’elav.

wyraw axy ywsp ky mt abyhm wyamrw lw ySTmnw ywsp whSb ySyb lnw at kl hreh aSr gmlnw atw and when joseph-add's brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, joseph-add will peradventure hate us, and will certainly requite us all the bad which we did unto him. vayir’u ’akhe yosef ki met ’abihem vayomeru lu yistemenu yosef, vehasheb yashib lanu kal hara‘ah ’asher gamalnu ’oto.
wyzww al ywsp lamr abyk zwh lpny mwtw lamr and they sent a messenger unto joseph-add, saying, thy father did direct before-turns he died, saying, vayzavu ’el yosef lemor, ’abikha zivah lifnei moto lemor.
kh tamrw lywsp ana Sa na pSe axyk wxTatm ky reh gmlwk weth Sa na lpSe ebdy alhy abyk wybk ywsp bdbrm alyw so ye say unto joseph-add, forgive, i pray thee now, the fire-name of thy brethren, and their miss; for they did unto thee bad: and now, we pray thee, forgive the fire-name of the workers of the to-no-these of thy father. and joseph-add wept when they spake unto him. koh tomeru leyosef ’ana sa na pesha‘ ’akhekha vekhatatam ki ra‘ah gemalukha ve‘atah sa na lefesha‘ ‘abdei ’elohei ’abikha, vayebek yosef bedaberam ’elav.

wyamr alhm ywsp al tyraw ky htxt alhym any and joseph-add said unto them, fear not: for am i in the place of to-no-these? vayomer ’alehem yosef ’al tira’u, ki hatakhat ’elohim ’ani.
watm xSbtm ely reh alhym xSbh lTbh lmen eSh kywm hch lhxyt em rb and as for you, ye thought bad against me; and to-no-these meant it unto good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much with-mum-people alive. ve’atem khashabtem ‘alay ra‘ah, ’elohim khashabah letobah lema‘an ‘asoh kayom hazeh lehakhayot ‘am rab.
weth al tyraw anky aklkl atkm wat Tpkm wynxm awtm wydbr el lbm now therefore fear ye not: i will nourish you, and your little ones. and he comforted them, and spake kindly unto them. ve‘atah ’al tira’u ’anokhi ’akhalkel ’etkhem ve’et tapekhem, vaynakhem ’otam vaydaber ‘al libam.
wySb ywsp bmzrym hwa wbyt abyw wyxy ywsp mah weSr Snym and joseph-add dwelt in mizraim-narrows, he, and his father's daughter-house: and joseph-add lived an hundred and ten years. vayesheb yosef bemizrayim hu ubet ’abiv, vaykhi yosef me’ah va‘eser shanim.
wyra ywsp laprym bny SlSym gm bny mkyr bn mnSh yldw el brky ywsp and joseph-add saw ephraim-fruitful's children-betweens of the third generation: children-betweens also of machi-of-beatr-recognize child-between of manasseh-place-of-sleep were brought up upon joseph-add's knees. vayar yosef le’efrayim benei shileshim, gam benei makhir ben menasheh yuledu ‘al birkei yosef.
wyamr ywsp al axyw anky mt walhym pqd ypqd atkm whelh atkm mn harz hcat al harz aSr nSbe labrhm lyzxq wlyeqb and joseph-add said unto his brethren, i die: and to-no-these will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land unto the land which he sware to abraham-their-dick, to isaac-laughter, and to jacob-backstreet. vayomer yosef ’el ’ekhav ’anokhi met, velohim paqod yifqod ’etkhem vehe‘elah ’etkhem min ha’arez hazot ’el ha’arez ’asher nishba‘ le’abraham leyizkhaq uleya‘aqob.
wySbe ywsp at bny ySral lamr pqd ypqd alhym atkm wheltm at ezmty mch and joseph-add took an toward-oath of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, saying, to-no-these will surely visit you, and ye carry up my bones from hence. vayashba‘ yosef benei yisra’el lemor, paqod yifqod ’elohim ’etkhem veha‘alitem ‘azmotay mizeh.
wymt ywsp bn mah weSr Snym wyxnTw atw wyySm barwn bmzrym so joseph-add died, being an hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in mizraim-narrows. vayamat yosef ben me’ah va‘eser shanim, vayakhantu ’oto vayisem ba’aron bemizrayim.
walh Smwt bny ySral hbaym mzrymh at yeqb ayS wbytw baw now these are the names of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, which came into mizraim-narrows; every man and his daughter-household came with jacob-backstreet. ve’eleh shemot benei yisra’el haba’im mizrayemah, ’et ya‘aqob ’ish ubeto ba’u.
rawbn Smewn lwy wyhwdh reuben-see-child, simeon-hear-home, levi-join, and judah-know, re’uben shim‘on levi vihudah.
ySSkr cbwln wbnymn issachar-wage, zebulun-fertile, and benjamin-he-between-of-righthand, yisashkhar zebulun ubeneyamin
dn wnptly gd waSr dan-discuss, and naphtali-twisted, gad-tell-luck, and asher-bliss. dan venaftali gad ve’asher.
wyhy kl npS yzay yrk yeqb Sbeym npS wywsp hyh bmzrym and all the beings that came out of the loins of jacob-backstreet were seventy beings: for joseph-add was in mizraim-narrows already. vayhi kal nefesh yoze’ei yerekh ya‘aqob shib‘im nafesh, veyosef hayah bemizrayim.
wymt ywsp wkl axyw wkl hdwr hhwa and joseph-add died, and all his brethren, and all that generation. vayamat yosef vekhal ’ekhav vekhol hador hahu.
wbny ySral prw wySrzw wyrbw wyezmw bmad mad wtmla harz atm and children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them. ubenei yisra’el paru vayishrezu vayirbu vaya‘azmu bim’od me’od, vatimalei ha’arez ’otam.
wyqm mlk xdS el mzrym aSr la yde at ywsp now there arose up a new king-moloch over mizraim-narrows, which hand-knew not joseph-add. vayaqam melekh khadash ‘al mizrayim, ’asher lo yada‘ yosef.
wyamr al emw hnh em bny ySral rb wezwm mmnw and he said unto his with-mum-people, behold, the with-mum-people of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards are more and mightier than we: vayomer ’el ‘amo, hineh ‘am benei yisra’el rab ve‘azum mimenu.
hbh ntxkmh lw pn yrbh whyh ky tqranh mlxmh wnwsp gm hwa el Snaynw wnlxm bnw welh mn harz come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our father-adversaries, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land. habah nitkhakemah lo, pen yirbeh vehayah ki tiqrenah milkhamah venosaf gam hu ‘al sone’enu venilkham banu ve‘alah min ha’arez.
wySymw elyw Sry msym lmen entw bsbltm wybn ery msknwt lpreh at ptm wat remss therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. and they between-built for pharaoh-big-house treasure cities, pithom and raamses. vayasimu ‘alav misim lema‘an ‘anoto besiblotam, vayiben ‘arei miskenot lefar‘oh pitom ve’et ra‘amses.
wkaSr yenw atw kn yrbh wkn yprz wyqzw mpny bny ySral and the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. and they were grieved because of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards. vekha’asher ye‘anu ’oto ken yirbeh vekhen yifroz, vayaquzu mipenei benei yisra’el.
wyebdw mzrym at bny ySral bprk and the mizraim-narrowsians made children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards to work for with rigor: vaya‘abidu mizrayim benei yisra’el befarekh.
wymrrw at xyyhm bebdh qSh bxmr wblbnym wbkl ebdh bSdh at kl ebdtm aSr ebdw bhm bprk and they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in mortar, and in brick-l-between, and in all manner of work in the field: all their work, wherein they made them work for, was with rigor. vaymareru khayehem ba‘abodah qashah bekhomer ubilbenim ubekhal ‘abodah basadeh, kal ‘abodatam ’asher ‘abedu bahem befarekh.
wyamr mlk mzrym lmyldt hebryt aSr Sm haxt Sprh wSm hSnyt pweh and the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows spake to the hebrew-cross-over midwives, of which the name of the one was shiphrah-book-cow, and the name of the other pua-beautyh-cry: vayomer melekh mizrayim lamyaledot ha‘ibriyot, ’asher shem ha’akhat shifrah veshem hashenit pu‘ah.
wyamr byldkn at hebrywt wraytn el habnym am bn hwa whmtn atw wam bt hya wxyh and he said, when ye do the office of a midwife to the hebrew-cross-over women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a child-between, then ye kill him: and if it be a daughter-hoof-bat-child, then she live. vayomer beyaledkhen ’et ha‘ibriyot ure’iten ‘al ha’abenayim, ’im ben hu vahamiten ’oto ve’im bat hi vakhayah.
wtyran hmyldt at halhym wla eSw kaSr dbr alyhn mlk mzrym wtxyyn at hyldym and the midwives feared to-no-these, and did not as the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows direct them, and saved the men children-betweens alive. vatirena hamyaledot ha’elohim velo ‘asu ka’asher diber ’alehen melekh mizrayim, vatekhayena hayladim.
wyqra mlk mzrym lmyldt wyamr lhn mdwe eSytn hdbr hch wtxyyn at hyldym and the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows called for the midwives, and said unto them, why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men children-betweens alive? vayiqra melekh mizrayim lamyaledot vayomer lahen madua‘ ‘asiten hadabar hazeh, vatekhayena hayladim.
wtamrn hmyldt al preh ky la knSym hmzryt hebryt ky xywt hnh bTrm tbwa alhn hmyldt wyldw and the midwives said unto pharaoh-big-house, because the hebrew-cross-over women are not as the mizraim-narrowsian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them. vatomarna hamyaledot ’el par‘oh ki lo khanashim hamizriyot ha‘ibriyot, ki khayot henah beterem tabo ’alehen hamyaledet veyaladu.
wyyTb alhym lmyldt wyrb hem wyezmw mad therefore to-no-these dealt well with the midwives: and the with-mum-people multiplied, and waxed very mighty. vayeteb ’elohim lamyaledot, vayireb ha‘am vaya‘azmu me’od.
wyhy ky yraw hmyldt at halhym wyeS lhm btym and it came to pass, because the midwives feared to-no-these, that he made them daughter-houses. vayhi ki yare’u hamyaledot ha’elohim, vaya‘as lahem batim.
wyzw preh lkl emw lamr kl hbn hylwd hyarh tSlykhw wkl hbt txywn and pharaoh-big-house charged all his with-mum-people, saying, every child-between that is born ye cast into the river, and every daughter-hoof-bat-child ye save alive. vayzav par‘oh lekhal ‘amo lemor, kal haben hayilod hay’orah tashlikhuhu vekhal habat tekhayun.
wylk ayS mbyt lwy wyqx at bt lwy and there went a man of the daughter-house of levi-join, and took to woman a daughter-hoof-bat-child of levi-join. vayelekh ’ish mibet levi, vayiqakh ’et bat levi.
wthr haSh wtld bn wtra atw ky Twb hwa wtzpnhw SlSh yrxym and the woman conceived, and conceived-of a child-between: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months. vatahar ha’ishah vateled ben, vatere ki tob hu vatizpenehu sheloshah yerakhim.
wla yklh ewd hzpynw wtqx lw tbt gma wtxmrh bxmr wbcpt wtSm bh at hyld wtSm bswp el Spt hyar and when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an cabinet of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put child therein; and she laid it in the flags by the river's brink. velo yakhelah ‘od hazefino vatiqakh lo tebat gome vatakhmerah bakhemar ubazafet, vatasem bah hayeled vatasem basuf ‘al sefat hay’or.
wttzb axtw mrxq ldeh mh yeSh lw and his sister stood afar off, to wit what would be done to him. vatetazab ’akhoto merakhoq, lede‘ah mah ye‘aseh lo.
wtrd bt preh lrxz el hyar wnertyh hlkt el yd hyar wtra at htbh btwk hswp wtSlx at amth wtqxh and the daughter-hoof-bat-child of pharaoh-big-house came down to wash herself at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river's side; and when she saw the cabinet among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it. vatered bat par‘oh lirkhoz ‘al hay’or vena‘aroteha holekhot ‘al yad hay’or, vatere hatebah betokh hasuf vatishlakh ’amatah vatiqakheha
wtptx wtrahw at hyld whnh ner bkh wtxml elyw wtamr myldy hebrym ch and when she had opened it, she saw child: and, behold, the babe wept. and she had compassion on him, and said, this is one of the hebrew-cross-overs' children-betweens. vatiftakh vatir’ehu hayeled vehineh na‘ar bokheh, vatakhmol ‘alav vatomer miyaldei ha‘ibrim zeh.
wtamr axtw al bt preh halk wqraty lk aSh mynqt mn hebryt wtynq lk at hyld then said his sister to pharaoh-big-house's daughter-hoof-bat-child, i go and call to thee a nurse of the hebrew-cross-over women, that she may nurse child for thee? vatomer ’akhoto ’el bat par‘oh ha’elekh veqarati lakh ’ishah meneqet min ha‘ibriyot, veteniq lakh hayaled.
wtamr lh bt preh lky wtlk helmh wtqra at am hyld and pharaoh-big-house's daughter-hoof-bat-child said to her, go. and the maid went and called child's mother. vatomer lah bat par‘oh lekhi, vatelekh ha‘almah vatiqra ’em hayaled.
wtamr lh bt preh hylyky at hyld hch whynqhw ly wany atn at Skrk wtqx haSh hyld wtnyqhw and pharaoh-big-house's daughter-hoof-bat-child said unto her, take this child away, and nurse it for me, and i will give thee thy wages. and the women took child, and nursed it. vatomer lah bat par‘oh helikhi hayeled hazeh veheniqihu li va’ani ’eten sekharekh, vatiqakh ha’ishah hayeled vateniqehu.
wygdl hyld wtbahw lbt preh wyhy lh lbn wtqra Smw mSh wtamr ky mn hmym mSythw and child grew, and she brought him unto pharaoh-big-house's daughter-hoof-bat-child, and he became her child-between. and she called his name mose-extracted: and she said, because i drew him out of the from-waters. vayigdal hayeled vatebi’ehu lebat par‘oh vayhi lah leben, vatiqra shemo mosheh vatomer ki min hamayim meshitihu.
wyhy bymym hhm wygdl mSh wyza al axyw wyra bsbltm wyra ayS mzry mkh ayS ebry maxyw and it came to pass in those days, when mose-extracted was grown, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he spied an mizraim-narrowsian smiting an hebrew-cross-over, one of his brethren. vayhi bayamim hahem vayigdal mosheh vayezei ’el ’ekhav vayar besiblotam, vayar mizri makeh ‘ibri me’ekhav.
wypn kh wkh wyra ky ayn ayS wyk at hmzry wyTmnhw bxwl and he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he slew the mizraim-narrowsian, and hid him in the sand. vayifen koh vakhoh vayar ki ’en ’ish, vayakh hamizri vayitmenehu bakhol.
wyza bywm hSny whnh Sny anSym ebrym nzym wyamr lrSe lmh tkh rek and when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the hebrew-cross-overs strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, wherefore hitst thou thy fellow? vayezei bayom hasheni vehineh shene ’anashim ‘ibrim nizim, vayomer larasha‘ lamah takeh re‘ekha.
wyamr my Smk layS Sr wSpT elynw hlhrgny ath amr kaSr hrgt at hmzry wyyra mSh wyamr akn nwde hdbr and he said, who made thee a prince and a decide over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the mizraim-narrowsian? and mose-extracted feared, and said, surely this thing is hand-known. vayomer mi samekha sar veshofet ‘alenu halharegeni ’atah ’omer ka’asher haragta hamizri, vayira mosheh vayomar ’akhen noda‘ hadabar.
wySme preh at hdbr hch wybqS lhrg at mSh wybrx mSh mpny preh wySb barz mdyn wySb el hbar now when pharaoh-big-house heard this thing, he sought to slay mose-extracted. and mose-extracted fled from the face-turns of pharaoh-big-house, and dwelt in the land of midian-place-of-discussed-teaching: and he sat down by a well. vayishma‘ par‘oh hadabar hazeh vaybaqesh laharog mosheh, vayibrakh mosheh mipenei far‘oh vayesheb be’erez midyan vayesheb ‘al habe’er.
wlkhn mdyn Sbe bnwt wtbanh wtdlnh wtmlanh at hrhTym lhSqwt zan abyhn now the dimmer-server of midian-place-of-discussed-teaching had seven children-betweenesss: and they came and drew from-waters, and filled the troughs to from-waters their father's flock. ulekhohen midyan sheba‘ banot, vatabonah vatidlenah vatemalenah ’et harehatim lehashqot zon ’abihen.
wybaw hreym wygrSwm wyqm mSh wywSen wySq at zanm and the shepherds came and drove them away: and mose-extracted stood up and helped them, and watered their flock. vayabo’u haro‘im vaygareshum, vayaqam mosheh vayoshi‘an vayashq zonam.
wtbanh al rewal abyhn wyamr mdwe mhrtn ba hywm and when they came to reuel their father, he said, how is it that ye are come so soon to day? vatabonah ’el re‘u’el ’abihen, vayomer madua‘ miharten bo hayom.
wtamrn ayS mzry hzylnw myd hreym wgm dlh dlh lnw wySq at hzan and they said, an mizraim-narrowsian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and also drew from-waters enough for us, and watered the flock. vatomarna mizri hizilanu miyad haro‘im, vegam daloh dalah lanu vayashq hazon.
wyamr al bntyw wayw lmh ch ecbtn at hayS qran lw wyakl lxm and he said unto his children-betweenesss, and where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread. vayomer ’el benotav ve’ayo, lamah zeh ‘azabten ha’ish qir’en lo veyokhal lakhem.
wywal mSh lSbt at hayS wytn at zprh btw lmSh and mose-extracted was content to dwell with the man: and he gave mose-extracted zipor-birdah-bird his daughter-hoof-bat-child. vayo’el mosheh lashebet ’et ha’ish, vayiten ziporah bito lemosheh.
wtld bn wyqra at Smw grSm ky amr gr hyyty barz nkryh and she conceived-of him a child-between, and he called his name gershom-stranger: for he said, i have been a stranger in a strange land. vateled ben vayiqra shemo gereshom, ki ’amar ger hayiti be’erez nakheriyah.
wyhy bymym hrbym hhm wymt mlk mzrym wyanxw bny ySral mn hebdh wyceqw wtel Swetm al halhym mn hebdh and it came to pass in process of time, that the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows died: and children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto to-no-these by reason of the bondage. vayhi bayamim harabim hahem vayamat melekh mizrayim vaye’anekhu bene yisra’el min ha‘abodah vayiz‘aqu, vata‘al shav‘atam ’el ha’elohim min ha‘abodah.
wySme alhym at naqtm wyckr alhym at brytw at abrhm at yzxq wat yeqb and to-no-these heard their groaning, and to-no-these remembered his covenant with abraham-their-dick, with isaac-laughter, and with jacob-backstreet. vayishma‘ ’elohim na’aqatam, vayizkor ’elohim berito ’et ’abraham ’et yizkhaq ve’et ya‘aqob.
wyra alhym at bny ySral wyde alhym and to-no-these looked upon children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, and to-no-these had respect unto them. vayar ’elohim benei yisra’el, vayeda‘ ’elohim.
wmSh hyh reh at zan ytrw xtnw khn mdyn wynhg at hzan axr hmdbr wyba al hr halhym xrbh now mose-extracted kept the flock of jethro-look his father in law, the dimmer-server of midian-place-of-discussed-teaching: and he led the flock to the backside of the place-of-word-desert, and came to the mountain of to-no-these, even to horeb-sword. umosheh ro‘eh zon yitro khoteno kohen midyan, vayinhag hazon ’akhar hamidbar vayabo ’el har ha’elohim khorebah.
wyra mlak yhwh alyw blbt aS mtwk hsnh wyra whnh hsnh ber baS whsnh aynnw akl and the angel-messanger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed. vayera mal’akh yhvh ’elav belabat ’esh mitokh haseneh, vayar vehineh haseneh bo‘er ba’esh vehaseneh ’enenu ’ukal.
wyamr mSh asrh na warah at hmrah hgdl hch mdwe la yber hsnh and mose-extracted said, i will now turn aside, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt. vayomer mosheh ’asurah na ve’er’eh hamar’eh hagadol hazeh, madua‘ lo yib‘ar haseneh.
wyra yhwh ky sr lrawt wyqra alyw alhym mtwk hsnh wyamr mSh mSh wyamr hnny and when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah saw that he turned aside to see, to-no-these called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, mose-extracted, mose-extracted. and he said, here am i. vayar yhvh ki sar lir’ot, vayiqra ’elav ’elohim mitokh haseneh vayomer mosheh mosheh vayomer hineni.
wyamr al tqrb hlm Sl nelyk mel rglyk ky hmqwm aSr ath ewmd elyw admt qdS hwa and he said, draw not nigh hither: put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is dedicated-finished ground. vayomer ’al tiqrab halom, shal ne‘alekha me‘al raglekha ki hamaqom ’asher ’atah ‘omed ’admat qodesh hu.
wyamr anky alhy abyk alhy abrhm alhy yzxq walhy yeqb wystr mSh pnyw ky yra mhbyT al halhym moreover he said, i am the to-no-these of thy father, the to-no-these of abraham-their-dick, the to-no-these of isaac-laughter, and the to-no-these of jacob-backstreet. and mose-extracted hid his face-turns; for he was afraid to look upon to-no-these. vayomer ’anokhi ’elohei ’abikha ’elohei ’abraham ’elohei yizkhaq velohei ya‘aqob, vayaster mosheh panav ki yare mehabit ’el ha’elohim.
wyamr yhwh rah rayty at eny emy aSr bmzrym wat zeqtm Smety mpny ngSyw ky ydety at mkabyw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said, i have surely seen the affliction of my with-mum-people which are in mizraim-narrows, and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for i hand-know their sorrows; vayomer yhvh ra’oh ra’iti ‘oni ‘ami ’asher bemizrayim, ve’et za‘aqatam shama‘ti mipenei nogesav ki yada‘ti makh’obav.
ward lhzylw myd mzrym wlheltw mn harz hhwa al arz Twbh wrxbh al arz cbt xlb wdbS al mqwm hkneny whxty whamry whprcy whxwy whybwsy and i am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the mizraim-narrowsians, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the canaan-mobile-tradeites, and the hittite-cuts-tusk, and the amorite-talkers, and the perizzite-unwalleds, and the hivite-experiences, and the jebusite-tramplers. va’ered lehazilo miyad mizrayim uleha‘aloto min ha’arez hahiv ’el ’erez tobah urekhabah ’el ’erez zabat khalab udebash, ’el meqom hakena‘ani vehakhiti veha’emori vehaperizi vehakhivi vehaybusi.
weth hnh zeqt bny ySral bah aly wgm rayty at hlxz aSr mzrym lxzym atm now therefore, behold, the cry of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards is come unto me: and i have also seen the oppression wherewith the mizraim-narrowsians oppress them. ve‘atah hineh za‘aqat bene yisra’el ba’ah ’elay, vegam ra’iti halakhaz ’asher mizrayim lokhazim ’otam.
weth lkh waSlxk al preh whwza at emy bny ySral mmzrym come now therefore, and i will send thee unto pharaoh-big-house, that thou mayest bring forth my with-mum-people children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards out of mizraim-narrows. ve‘atah lekhah ve’eshlakhakha ’el par‘oh, vehozei ‘ami bene yisra’el mimizrayim.
wyamr mSh al halhym my anky ky alk al preh wky awzya at bny ySral mmzrym and mose-extracted said unto to-no-these, who am i, that i should go unto pharaoh-big-house, and that i should bring forth children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards out of mizraim-narrows? vayomer mosheh ’el ha’elohim mi ’anokhi ki ’elekh ’el par‘oh, vekhi ’ozi benei yisra’el mimizrayim.
wyamr ky ahyh emk wch lk hawt ky anky Slxtyk bhwzyak at hem mmzrym tebdwn at halhym el hhr hch and he said, certainly i will be with thee; and this be a token unto thee, that i have sent thee: when thou hast brought forth the with-mum-people out of mizraim-narrows, ye work for to-no-these upon this mountain. vayomer ki ’ehyeh ‘imakh vezeh lekha ha’ot ki ’anokhi shelakhtikha, behozi’akha ha‘am mimizrayim ta‘abdun ha’elohim ‘al hahar hazeh.
wyamr mSh al halhym hnh anky ba al bny ySral wamrty lhm alhy abwtykm Slxny alykm wamrw ly mh Smw mh amr alhm and mose-extracted said unto to-no-these, behold, when i come unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, and say unto them, the to-no-these of your fathers hath sent me unto you; and they say to me, what is his name? what i say unto them? vayomer mosheh ’el ha’elohim hineh ’anokhi ba ’el benei yisra’el ve’amarti lahem ’elohei ’abotekhem shelakhani ’alekhem, ve’ameru li mah shemo mah ’omar ’alehem.
wyamr alhym al mSh ahyh aSr ahyh wyamr kh tamr lbny ySral ahyh Slxny alykm and to-no-these said unto mose-extracted, i am that i am: and he said, thus thou say unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, i am hath sent me unto you. vayomer ’elohim ’el mosheh ’ehyeh ’asher ’ehyeh, vayomer koh tomar libnei yisra’el ’ehyeh shelakhani ’alekhem.
wyamr ewd alhym al mSh kh tamr al bny ySral yhwh alhy abtykm alhy abrhm alhy yzxq walhy yeqb Slxny alykm ch Smy lelm wch ckry ldr dr and to-no-these said moreover unto mose-extracted, thus thou say unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of your fathers, the to-no-these of abraham-their-dick, the to-no-these of isaac-laughter, and the to-no-these of jacob-backstreet, hath sent me unto you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations. vayomer ‘od ’elohim ’el mosheh koh tomar ’el benei yisra’el yhvh ’elohei ’abotekhem ’elohei ’abraham ’elohei yizkhaq velohei ya‘aqob shelakhani ’alekhem, zeh shemi le‘olam vezeh zikhri ledor dor.
lk waspt at cqny ySral wamrt alhm yhwh alhy abtykm nrah aly alhy abrhm yzxq wyeqb lamr pqd pqdty atkm wat heSwy lkm bmzrym go, and gather the elders of israel-juicy-towards together, and say unto them, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of your fathers, the to-no-these of abraham-their-dick, of isaac-laughter, and of jacob-backstreet, appeared unto me, saying, i have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in mizraim-narrows: lekh ve’asafta ziqnei yisra’el ve’amarta ’alehem yhvh ’elohei ’abotekhem nir’ah ’elay ’elohei ’abraham yizkhaq veya‘aqob lemor, paqod paqadti ’etkhem ve’et he‘asui lakhem bemizrayim.
wamr aelh atkm meny mzrym al arz hkneny whxty whamry whprcy whxwy whybwsy al arz cbt xlb wdbS and i have said, i will bring you up out of the affliction of mizraim-narrows unto the land of the canaan-mobile-tradeites, and the hittite-cuts-tusk, and the amorite-talkers, and the perizzite-unwalleds, and the hivite-experiences, and the jebusite-tramplers, unto a land flowing with milk and honey. va’omar ’a‘aleh ’etkhem me‘oni mizrayim ’el ’erez hakena‘ani vehakhiti veha’emori vehaperizi vehakhivi vehaybusi, ’el ’erez zabat khalab udebash.
wSmew lqlk wbat ath wcqny ySral al mlk mzrym wamrtm alyw yhwh alhy hebryym nqrh elynw weth nlkh na drk SlSt ymym bmdbr wncbxh lyhwh alhynw and they hearken to thy voice: and thou come, thou and the elders of israel-juicy-towards, unto the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows, and ye say unto him, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of the hebrew-cross-overs hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the place-of-word-desert, that we may butcher to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these. veshame‘u leqolekha, ubata ’atah veziqnei yisra’el ’el melekh mizrayim va’amartem ’elav yhvh ’elohei ha‘ibriyim niqrah ‘alenu ve‘atah nelakhah na derekh sheloshet yamim bamidbar venizbekhah yhvh ’elohenu.
wany ydety ky la ytn atkm mlk mzrym lhlk wla byd xcqh and i am sure that the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows will not let you go, no, not by a mighty hand. va’ani yada‘ti ki lo yiten ’etkhem melekh mizrayim lahalokh, velo beyad khazaqah.
wSlxty at ydy whkyty at mzrym bkl nplaty aSr aeSh bqrbw waxry kn ySlx atkm and i will stretch out my hand, and hit mizraim-narrows with all my wonders which i will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go. veshalakhti yadi vehiketi mizrayim bekhol nifle’otay ’asher ’e‘eseh beqirbo, ve’akhare khen yeshalakh ’etkhem.
wntty at xn hem hch beyny mzrym whyh ky tlkwn la tlkw ryqm and i will give this with-mum-people favor in the sight of the mizraim-narrowsians: and it come to pass, that, when ye go, ye not go empty. venatati khen ha‘am hazeh be‘enei mizrayim, vehayah ki telekhun lo telekhu reqam.
wSalh aSh mSknth wmgrt byth kly ksp wkly chb wSmlt wSmtm el bnykm wel bntykm wnzltm at mzrym and every woman borrow of her neighbor, and of her that sojourneth in her daughter-house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye put them upon your children-betweens, and upon your children-betweenesss; and ye spoil the mizraim-narrowsians. vesha’alah ’ishah mishekhentah umigarat betah kele khesef ukhelei zahab usemalot, vesamtem ‘al benekhem ve‘al benotekhem venizaltem mizrayim.
wyen mSh wyamr whn la yamynw ly wla ySmew bqly ky yamrw la nrah alyk yhwh and mose-extracted answered and said, and, behold, they will not be coached by me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath not appeared unto thee. vaya‘an mosheh vayomer vehen lo ya’aminu li velo yishme‘u beqoli, ki yomeru lo nir’ah ’elekha yhvh.
wyamr alyw yhwh mch mh ch bydk wyamr mTh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto him, what is that in thine hand? and he said, a pen. vayomer ’elav yhvh mah zeh beyadekha, vayomer mateh.
wyamr hSlykhw arzh wySlykhw arzh wyhy lnxS wyns mSh mpnyw and he said, cast it on the ground. and he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and mose-extracted fled from before-turns it. vayomer hashlikhehu ’arzah vayashlikhehu ’arzah vayhi lenakhash, vayanas mosheh mipanav.
wyamr yhwh al mSh Slx ydk waxc bcnbw wySlx ydw wyxcq bw wyhy lmTh bkpw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto mose-extracted, put forth thine hand, and take it by the tail. and he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a pen in his hand: vayomer yhvh ’el mosheh shelakh yadekha ve’ekhoz biznabo, vayishlakh yado vayakhazeq bo vayhi lemateh bekhapo.
lmen yamynw ky nrah alyk yhwh alhy abtm alhy abrhm alhy yzxq walhy yeqb that they may be coached by that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of their fathers, the to-no-these of abraham-their-dick, the to-no-these of isaac-laughter, and the to-no-these of jacob-backstreet, hath appeared unto thee. lema‘an ya’aminu ki nir’ah ’elekha yhvh ’elohei ’abotam, ’elohei ’abraham ’elohei yizkhaq velohei ya‘aqob.
wyamr yhwh lw ewd hba na ydk bxyqk wyba ydw bxyqw wywzah whnh ydw mzret kSlg and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said furthermore unto him, put now thine hand into thy bosom. and he put his hand into his bosom: and when he took it out, behold, his hand was speckled-waspish-speckled as snow. vayomer yhvh lo ‘od habe na yadekha bekheqekha vayabei yado bekheqo, vayozi’ah vehineh yado mezora‘at kashaleg.
wyamr hSb ydk al xyqk wySb ydw al xyqw wywzah mxyqw whnh Sbh kbSrw and he said, put thine hand into thy bosom again. and he put his hand into his bosom again; and plucked it out of his bosom, and, behold, it was turned again as his other flesh. vayomer hasheb yadekha ’el kheqekha vayasheb yado ’el kheqo, vayozi’ah mekheqo vehineh shabah kibsaro.
whyh am la yamynw lk wla ySmew lql hat hraSwn whamynw lql hat haxrwn and it come to pass, if they will not be coached by thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will be coached by the voice of the latter sign. vehayah ’im lo ya’aminu lakh velo yishme‘u leqol ha’ot harishon, vehe’eminu leqol ha’ot ha’akharon.
whyh am la yamynw gm lSny hatwt halh wla ySmewn lqlk wlqxt mmymy hyar wSpkt hybSh whyw hmym aSr tqx mn hyar whyw ldm bybSt and it come to pass, if they will not be coached by also these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou take of the from-waters of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: and the from-waters which thou takest out of the river become blood upon the dry land. vehayah ’im lo ya’aminu gam lishnei ha’otot ha’eleh velo yishme‘un leqolekha velaqakhta mimemei hay’or veshafakhta hayabashah, vehayu hamayim ’asher tiqakh min hay’or vehayu ledam bayabashet.
wyamr mSh al yhwh by adny la ayS dbrym anky gm mtmwl gm mSlSm gm mac dbrk al ebdk ky kbd ph wkbd lSwn anky and mose-extracted said unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, o my yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, i am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast bee-spoken unto thy worker: and i am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue. vayomer mosheh ’el yhvh bi ’adonay lo ’ish debarim ’anokhi gam mitemol gam mishilshom gam me’az daberkha ’el ‘abdekha, ki khebad peh ukhebad lashon ’anokhi.
wyamr yhwh alyw my Sm ph ladm aw my ySwm alm aw xrS aw pqx aw ewr hla anky yhwh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto him, who hath made man's mouth? or who maketh the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? have not i yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah? vayomer yhvh ’elav mi sam peh la’adam ’o mi yasum ’ilem ’o kheresh ’o fiqeakh ’o ‘iver, halo ’anokhi yhvh.
weth lk wanky ahyh em pyk whwrytyk aSr tdbr now therefore go, and i will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou say. ve‘atah lekh, ve’anokhi ’ehyeh ‘im pikha vehoretikha ’asher tedaber.
wyamr by adny Slx na byd tSlx and he said, o my yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, send, i pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send. vayomer bi ’adonay, shelakh na beyad tishlakh.
wyxr ap yhwh bmSh wyamr hla ahrn axyk hlwy ydety ky dbr ydbr hwa wgm hnh hwa yza lqratk wrak wSmx blbw and the nose-anger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was kindled against mose-extracted, and he said, is not aaron-cabinet the levi-jointe thy brother? i hand-know that he can speak well. and also, behold, he cometh forth to until-witness thee: and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart. vayikhar ’af yhvh bemosheh vayomer halo ’aharon ’akhikha halevi yada‘ti ki daber yedaber hu, vegam hineh hu yozei liqratekha vera’akha vesamakh belibo.
wdbrt alyw wSmt at hdbrym bpyw wanky ahyh em pyk wem pyhw whwryty atkm at aSr teSwn and thou speak unto him, and put bee-words in his mouth: and i will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye do. vedibarta ’elav vesamta hadebarim befiv, ve’anokhi ’ehyeh ‘im pikha ve‘im pihu vehoreti ’etkhem ’asher ta‘asun.
wdbr hwa lk al hem whyh hwa yhyh lk lph wath thyh lw lalhym and he be thy spokesman unto the with-mum-people: and he be, even he be to thee instead of a mouth, and thou be to him instead of to-no-these. vediber hu lekha ’el ha‘am, vehayah hu yihyeh lekha lefeh ve’atah tihyeh lo lelohim.
wat hmTh hch tqx bydk aSr teSh bw at hatt and thou take this pen in thine hand, wherewith thou do signs. ve’et hamateh hazeh tiqakh beyadekha, ’asher ta‘aseh bo ha’otot.
wylk mSh wySb al ytr xtnw wyamr lw alkh na waSwbh al axy aSr bmzrym warah hewdm xyym wyamr ytrw lmSh lk lSlwm and mose-extracted went and returned to jethro-look his father in law, and said unto him, let me go, i pray thee, and return unto my brethren which are in mizraim-narrows, and see whether they be yet alive. and jethro-look said to mose-extracted, go in peace. vayelekh mosheh vayashab ’el yeter khoteno vayomer lo ’elekhah na ve’ashubah ’el ’akhay ’asher bemizrayim ve’er’eh ha‘odam khayim, vayomer yitro lemosheh lekh leshalom.
wyamr yhwh al mSh bmdyn lk Sb mzrym ky mtw kl hanSym hmbqSym at npSk and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto mose-extracted in midian-place-of-discussed-teaching, go, return into mizraim-narrows: for all the men are dead which sought thy life. vayomer yhvh ’el mosheh bemidyan lekh shub mizrayim, ki metu kal ha’anashim hambaqshim nafshekha.
wyqx mSh at aStw wat bnyw wyrkbm el hxmr wySb arzh mzrym wyqx mSh at mTh halhym bydw and mose-extracted took his woman and his children-betweens, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of mizraim-narrows: and mose-extracted took the pen of to-no-these in his hand. vayiqakh mosheh ’ishto ve’et banav vayarkibem ‘al hakhamor vayashab ’arzah mizrayim, vayiqakh mosheh mateh ha’elohim beyado.
wyamr yhwh al mSh blktk lSwb mzrymh rah kl hmptym aSr Smty bydk weSytm lpny preh wany axcq at lbw wla ySlx at hem and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto mose-extracted, when thou goest to return into mizraim-narrows, see that thou do all those wonders before-turns pharaoh-big-house, which i have put in thine hand: and i will harden his heart, that he not let the with-mum-people go. vayomer yhvh ’el mosheh belekhtekha lashub mizraymah re’eh kal hamofetim ’asher samti beyadekha va‘asitam lifnei far‘oh, va’ani ’akhazeq libo velo yeshalakh ha‘am.
wamrt al preh kh amr yhwh bny bkry ySral and thou say unto pharaoh-big-house, thus saith yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, israel-juicy-towards is my child-between, even my firstborn: ve’amarta ’el par‘oh, koh ’amar yhvh beni bekhori yisra’el.
wamr alyk Slx at bny wyebdny wtman lSlxw hnh anky hrg at bnk bkrk and i say unto thee, let my child-between go, that he may work for me: and if thou refuse to let him go, behold, i will slay thy child-between, even thy firstborn. va’omar ’elekha shalakh beni veya‘abdeni vatema’en leshalekho, hineh ’anokhi horeg binkha bekhorekha.
wyhy bdrk bmlwn wypgShw yhwh wybqS hmytw and it came to pass by the way in the inn, that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah met him, and sought to kill him. vayhi baderekh bamalon, vayifgeshehu yhvh vaybaqesh hamito.
wtqx zprh zr wtkrt at erlt bnh wtge lrglyw wtamr ky xtn dmym ath ly then zipor-birdah-bird took a sharp father-child-stone, and cut off the foreskin of her child-between, and cast it at his feet, and said, surely a bloody man art thou to me. vatiqakh ziporah zor vatikhrot ‘arelat benah vataga‘ leraglav, vatomer ki khatan damim ’atah li.
wyrp mmnw ac amrh xtn dmym lmwlt so he let him go: then she said, a bloody man thou art, because of the script-circumcision. vayiref mimenu, ’az ’amerah khatan damim lamulot.
wyamr yhwh al ahrn lk lqrat mSh hmdbrh wylk wypgShw bhr halhym wySq lw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said to aaron-cabinet, go into the place-of-word-desert to until-witness mose-extracted. and he went, and met him in the mount of to-no-these, and kissed him. vayomer yhvh ’el ’aharon lekh liqrat mosheh hamidbarah, vayelekh vayifgeshehu behar ha’elohim vayishaq lo.
wygd mSh lahrn at kl dbry yhwh aSr Slxw wat kl hatt aSr zwhw and mose-extracted told aaron-cabinet all the bee-words of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah who had sent him, and all the signs which he had direct him. vayaged mosheh le’aharon kal dibrei yhvh ’asher shelakho, ve’et kal ha’otot ’asher zivahu.
wylk mSh wahrn wyaspw at kl cqny bny ySral and mose-extracted and aaron-cabinet went and added together all the elders of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards: vayelekh mosheh ve’aharon, vaya’asfu kal ziqnei benei yisra’el.
wydbr ahrn at kl hdbrym aSr dbr yhwh al mSh wyeS hatt leyny hem and aaron-cabinet spake all the bee-words which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had bee-spoken unto mose-extracted, and did the signs in the sight of the with-mum-people. vaydaber ’aharon kal hadebarim ’asher diber yhvh ’el mosheh, vaya‘as ha’otot le‘enei ha‘am.
wyamn hem wySmew ky pqd yhwh at bny ySral wky rah at enym wyqdw wyStxww and the with-mum-people was coached by: and when they heard that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had visited children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, and that he had looked upon their affliction, then they bowed their heads and partook-shatakh. vaya’amen ha‘am, vayishme‘u ki faqad yhvh benei yisra’el vekhi ra’ah ‘aneyam vayiqedu vayishtakhavu
waxr baw mSh wahrn wyamrw al preh kh amr yhwh alhy ySral Slx at emy wyxgw ly bmdbr and afterward mose-extracted and aaron-cabinet went in, and told pharaoh-big-house, thus saith yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of israel-juicy-towards, let my with-mum-people go, that they may hold a until-conception unto me in the place-of-word-desert. ve’akhar ba’u mosheh ve’aharon vayomeru ’el par‘oh, koh ’amar yhvh ’elohei yisra’el shalakh ‘ami veyakhogu li bamidbar.
wyamr preh my yhwh aSr aSme bqlw lSlx at ySral la ydety at yhwh wgm at ySral la aSlx and pharaoh-big-house said, who is yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, that i should obey his voice to let israel-juicy-towards go? i hand-know not yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, neither will i let israel-juicy-towards go. vayomer par‘oh mi yhvh ’asher ’eshma‘ beqolo leshalakh yisra’el, lo yada‘ti yhvh vegam ’et yisra’el lo ’ashaleakh.
wyamrw alhy hebrym nqra elynw nlkh na drk SlSt ymym bmdbr wncbxh lyhwh alhynw pn ypgenw bdbr aw bxrb and they said, the to-no-these of the hebrew-cross-overs hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the place-of-word-desert, and butcher unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these; lest he fall upon us with word-bee, or with the sword. vayomeru ’elohei ha‘ibrim niqra ‘alenu, nelakhah na derekh sheloshet yamim bamidbar venizbekhah yhvh ’elohenu pen yifga‘enu badeber ’o bekhareb.
wyamr alhm mlk mzrym lmh mSh wahrn tpryew at hem mmeSyw lkw lsbltykm and the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows said unto them, wherefore do ye, mose-extracted and aaron-cabinet, let the with-mum-people from their works? get you unto your burdens. vayomer ’alehem melekh mizrayim lamah mosheh ve’aharon tafri‘u ha‘am mima‘asav, lekhu lesiblotekhem.
wyamr preh hn rbym eth em harz whSbtm atm msbltm and pharaoh-big-house said, behold, the with-mum-people of the land now are many, and ye make them rest from their burdens. vayomer par‘oh hen rabim ‘atah ‘am ha’arez, vehishbatem ’otam misiblotam.
