wydbr ahrn al mSh hn hywm hqrybw at xTatm wat eltm lpny yhwh wtqranh aty kalh waklty xTat hywm hyyTb beyny yhwh and aaron-cabinet said unto mose-extracted, behold, this day have they inwarded their miss and their on-up before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah; and such things have befallen me: and if i had eaten the miss to day, should it have been accepted in the sight of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah? vaydaber ’aharon ’el mosheh hen hayom hiqribu khatatam ve’et ‘olatam lifnei yhvh vatiqrenah ’oti ka’eleh, ve’akhalti khatat hayom hayitab be‘enei yhvh.
wySme mSh wyyTb beynyw and when mose-extracted heard that, he was content. vayishma‘ mosheh vayitab be‘enav.
wydbr yhwh al mSh wal ahrn lamr alhm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto mose-extracted and to aaron-cabinet, saying unto them, vaydaber yhvh ’el mosheh ve’el ’aharon lemor ’alehem.
dbrw al bny ySral lamr cat hxyh aSr taklw mkl hbhmh aSr el harz speak unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, saying, these are the beasts which ye eat among all the beasts that are on the earth. daberu ’el benei yisra’el lemor, zot hakhayah ’asher tokhelu mikal habehemah ’asher ‘al ha’arez.
kl mprst prsh wSset Sse prst melt grh bbhmh ath taklw whatsoever parteth the part-hoof, and is cloven-footed, and cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that ye eat. kol mafreset parsah veshosa‘at shesa‘ perasot ma‘alat gerah babehemah, tokhelu.
ak at ch la taklw mmely hgrh wmmprysy hprsh at hgml ky melh grh hwa wprsh aynnw mprys Tma hwa lkm nevertheless these ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the part-hoof: as the ripen-camel, because he cheweth the cud, and divideth not the part-hoof; he is stained-ceased unto you. ’akh zeh lo tokhelu mima‘alei hagerah umimafrisei haparsah, hagamal ki ma‘aleh gerah hu ufarsah ’enenu mafris tamei hu lakhem.
wat hSpn ky melh grh hwa wprsh la yprys Tma hwa lkm and the turn-coney, because he cheweth the cud, and divideth not the part-hoof; he is stained-ceased unto you. ve’et hashafan ki ma‘aleh gerah hu ufarsah lo yafris, tamei hu lakhem.
wat harnbt ky melt grh hwa wprsh la hprysh Tmah hwa lkm and the pine-house-hare, because he cheweth the cud, and divideth not the part-hoof; he is stained-ceased unto you. ve’et ha’arnebet ki ma‘alat gerah hi ufarsah lo hifrisah, teme’ah hi lakhem.
wat hxcyr ky mprys prsh hwa wSse Sse prsh whwa grh la ygr Tma hwa lkm and the return-swine, though he divide the part-hoof, and be cloven-footed, yet he cheweth not the cud; he is stained-ceased to you. ve’et hakhazir ki mafris parsah hu veshosa‘ shesa‘ parsah vehu gerah lo yigar, tamei hu lakhem.
mbSrm la taklw wbnbltm la tgew Tmaym hm lkm of their flesh ye not eat, and their carcass ye not touch; they are stained-ceased to you. mibesaram lo tokhelu ubeniblatam lo tiga‘u, teme’im hem lakhem.
at ch taklw mkl aSr bmym kl aSr lw snpyr wqSqSt bmym bymym wbnxlym atm taklw these ye eat of all that are in the from-waters: whatsoever hath fins and scales in the from-waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them ye eat. zeh tokhelu mikol ’asher bamayim, kol ’asher lo senapir veqasqeset bamayim bayamim ubanekhalim ’otam tokhelu.
wkl aSr ayn lw snpyr wqSqSt bymym wbnxlym mkl Srz hmym wmkl npS hxyh aSr bmym Sqz hm lkm and all that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that move in the from-waters, and of any living thing which is in the from-waters, they be an abomination unto you: vekhol ’asher ’en lo senapir veqasqeset bayamim ubanekhalim mikol sherez hamayim umikol nefesh hakhayah ’asher bamayim, sheqez hem.
wSqz yhyw lkm mbSrm la taklw wat nbltm tSqzw they be even an abomination unto you; ye not eat of their flesh, and ye have their carcasses in abomination. vesheqez yihyu lakhem, mibesaram lo tokhelu ve’et niblatam teshaqezu.
kl aSr ayn lw snpyr wqSqSt bmym Sqz hwa lkm whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the from-waters, that be an abomination unto you. kol ’asher ’en senapir veqasqeset bamayim, sheqez hu lakhem.
wat alh tSqzw mn hewp la yaklw Sqz hm at hnSr wat hprs wat hecnyh and these are they which ye have in abomination among the fowls; they not be eaten, they are an abomination: the drop-eagle, and the slize-spread-ossifrage, and the daring-ospray, ve’et ’eleh teshaqezu min ha‘of lo ye’akhelu sheqez hem, hanesher ve’et haperes ve’et ha‘azeniyah.
wat hdah wat hayh lmynh and the enough-kite, and the where-buzzard after his kind; ve’et hada’ah ve’et ha’ayah leminah.
at kl erb lmynw every evening-raven after his kind; kal ‘oreb lemino.
wat bt hyenh wat htxms wat hSxp wat hnz lmynhw and the daughter-of-dove-ostrich, and the rob-night-go-out-hawk, and the sprocket-seagull, and the go-out-hawk after his kind, ve’et haya‘anah ve’et hatakhmas ve’et hashakhaf, ve’et hanez leminehu.
wat hkws wat hSlk wat hynSwp and the cup-daughter-of-dove-ostrich, and the send-cormorant, and the blow-daughter-of-dove-ostrich, ve’et hakos ve’et hashalakh ve’et hayanshuf.
wat htnSmt wat hqat wat hrxm and the give-that-dead-barn-daughter-of-dove-ostrich, and the now-pelican, and the gier drop-eagle, ve’et hatinshemet ve’et haqa’at ve’et harakham.
wat hxsydh hanph lmynh wat hdwkypt wat heTlp and the charity-stork, the sift-heron after her kind, and the pushing-lapwing, and the hoof-bat. ve’et hakhasidah ha’anafah leminah, ve’et hadukhifat ve’et ha‘atalef.
kl Srz hewp hhlk el arbe Sqz hwa lkm all fowls that creep, going upon all four, be an abomination unto you. kol sherez ha‘of haholekh ‘al ’arba‘, sheqez hu lakhem.
ak at ch taklw mkl Srz hewp hhlk el arbe aSr la lw kreym mmel lrglyw lntr bhn el harz yet these may ye eat of every flying creeping thing that goeth upon all four, which have legs above their feet, to leap withal upon the earth; ’akh zeh tokhelu mikol sherez ha‘of haholekh ‘al ’arba‘, ’asher lo khera‘ayim mima‘al leraglav lenater bahen ‘al ha’arez.
at alh mhm taklw at harbh lmynw wat hslem lmynhw wat hxrgl lmynhw wat hxgb lmynhw even these of them ye may eat; the locust after his kind, and the bald locust after his kind, and the beetle after his kind, and the grasshopper after his kind. ’eleh tokhelu ha’arbeh lemino ve’et hasale‘am leminehu, ve’et hakhargol leminehu ve’et hekhagab leminehu.
wkl Srz hewp aSr lw arbe rglym Sqz hwa lkm and all other flying creeping things, which have four feet, be an abomination unto you. vekhol ha‘of ’asher lo ’arba‘ raglayim, sheqez hu lakhem.
wlalh tTmaw kl hnge bnbltm yTma ed herb and for these ye be stained-ceased: whosoever toucheth the carcass of them be stained-ceased until the even. ule’eleh titama’u, kal hanogea‘ beniblatam yitma ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl hnSa mnbltm ykbs bgdyw wTma ed herb and whosoever beareth ought of the carcass of them wash his clothes, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhal hanosei miniblatam, yekhabes begadav vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
lkl hbhmh aSr hwa mprst prsh wSse aynnh Sset wgrh aynnh melh Tmaym hm lkm kl hnge bhm yTma the carcasses of every beast which divideth the part-hoof, and is not cloven-footed, nor cheweth the cud, are stained-ceased unto you: every one that toucheth them be stained-ceased. lekhal habehemah ’asher hi mafreset parsah veshesa‘ ’enenah shosa‘at vegerah ’enenah ma‘alah teme’im hem lakhem, kal hanogea‘ bahem yitma.
wkl hwlk el kpyw bkl hxyh hhlkt el arbe Tmaym hm lkm kl hnge bnbltm yTma ed herb and whatsoever goeth upon his paws, among all manner of beasts that go on all four, those are stained-ceased unto you: whoso toucheth their carcass be stained-ceased until the even. vekhol holekh ‘al kapav bekhal hakhayah haholekhet ‘al ’arba‘ teme’im hem lakhem, kal hanogea‘ beniblatam yitma ‘ad ha‘areb.
whnSa at nbltm ykbs bgdyw wTma ed herb Tmaym hmh lkm and he that beareth the carcass of them wash his clothes, and be stained-ceased until the even: they are stained-ceased unto you. vehanosei niblatam yekhabes begadav vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb, teme’im hemah lakhem.
wch lkm hTma bSrz hSrz el harz hxld whekbr whzb lmynhw these also be stained-ceased unto you among the creeping things that creep upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise after his kind, vezeh lakhem hatame basherez hashorez ‘al ha’arez, hakholed veha‘akhbar vehazab leminehu.
whanqh whkx whlTah whxmT whtnSmt and the ferret, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole. veha’anaqah vehakoakh vehaleta’ah, vehakhomet vehatinshamet.
alh hTmaym lkm bkl hSrz kl hnge bhm bmtm yTma ed herb these are stained-ceased to you among all that creep: whosoever doth touch them, when they be dead, be stained-ceased until the even. ’eleh hateme’im lakhem bekhal hasharez, kal hanogea‘ bahem bemotam yitma ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl aSr ypl elyw mhm bmtm yTma mkl kly ez aw bgd aw ewr aw Sq kl kly aSr yeSh mlakh bhm bmym ywba wTma ed herb wThr and upon whatsoever any of them, when they are dead, doth fall, it be stained-ceased; whether it be any tool of wood, or raiment, or light-skin, or sack, whatsoever tool it be, wherein any work is done, it must be put into from-waters, and it be stained-ceased until the even; so it be bright-climaxingsed. vekhol ’asher yipol ‘alav mehem bemotam yitma mikal keli ‘ez ’o beged ’o ‘or ’o saq kal keli ’asher ye‘aseh melakhah bahem, bamayim yuba vetamei ‘ad ha‘ereb vetaher.
wkl kly xrS aSr ypl mhm al twkw kl aSr btwkw yTma watw tSbrw and every earthen tool, whereinto any of them falleth, whatsoever is in it be stained-ceased; and ye break it. vekhal keli kheres ’asher yipol mehem ’el tokho, kol ’asher betokho yitma ve’oto tishboru.
mkl hakl aSr yakl aSr ybwa elyw mym yTma wkl mSqh aSr ySth bkl kly yTma of all meat which may be eaten, that on which such from-waters cometh be stained-ceased: and all drink that may be drunk in every such tool be stained-ceased. mikal ha’okhel ’asher ye’akhel ’asher yabo ‘alav mayim yitma, vekhal mashqeh ’asher yishateh bekhal keli yitma.
wkl aSr ypl mnbltm elyw yTma tnwr wkyrym ytz Tmaym hm wTmaym yhyw lkm and every thing whereupon any part of their carcass falleth be stained-ceased; whether it be oven, or ranges for pots, they be broken down: for they are stained-ceased and be stained-ceased unto you. vekhol ’asher yipol miniblatam ‘alav yitma tanur vekhirayim yutaz teme’im hem, uteme’im yihyu lakhem.
ak meyn wbwr mqwh mym yhyh Thwr wnge bnbltm yTma nevertheless a fountain or pit, wherein there is plenty of from-waters, be bright-climaxing: and that which toucheth their carcass be stained-ceased. ’akh ma‘yan ubor miqveh mayim yihyeh tahor, venogea‘ beniblatam yitma.
wky ypl mnbltm el kl cre crwe aSr ycre Thwr hwa and if any part of their carcass fall upon any sowing seed which is to be sown, it be bright-climaxing. vekhi yipol miniblatam ‘al kal zera‘ zerua‘ ’asher yizarea‘, tahor hu.
wky ytn mym el cre wnpl mnbltm elyw Tma hwa lkm and if any from-waters be put upon the seed, and any part of their carcass fall thereon, it be stained-ceased unto you. vekhi yutan mayim ‘al zera‘ venafal miniblatam ‘alav, tamei hu lakhem.
wky ymwt mn hbhmh aSr hya lkm laklh hnge bnblth yTma ed herb and if any beast, of which ye may eat, die; he that toucheth the carcass thereof be stained-ceased until the even. vekhi yamut min habehemah ’asher hi lakhem le’akhlah hanogea‘ beniblatah yitma ‘ad ha‘areb.
whakl mnblth ykbs bgdyw wTma ed herb whnSa at nblth ykbs bgdyw wTma ed herb and he that eateth of the carcass of it wash his clothes, and be stained-ceased until the even: he also that beareth the carcass of it wash his clothes, and be stained-ceased until the even. veha’okhel miniblatah yekhabes begadav vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb, vehanosei niblatah yekhabes begadav vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl hSrz hSrz el harz Sqz hwa la yakl and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth be an abomination; it not be eaten. vekhal hasherez hashorez ‘al ha’arez, sheqez hu lo ye’akhel.
kl hwlk el gxwn wkl hwlk el arbe ed kl mrbh rglym lkl hSrz hSrz el harz la taklwm ky Sqz hm whatsoever goeth upon the nurture-belly, and whatsoever goeth upon all four, or whatsoever hath more feet among all creeping things that creep upon the earth, them ye not eat; for they are an abomination. kol holekh ‘al gakhon vekhol holekh ‘al ’arba‘ ‘ad kal marbeh raglayim lekhal hasherez hashorez ‘al ha’arez, lo tokhelum ki sheqez hem.
al tSqzw at npStykm bkl hSrz hSrz wla tTmaw bhm wnTmtm bm ye not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creepeth, neither ye make yourselves stained-ceased with them, that ye should be ceased thereby. ’al teshaqezu nafshotekhem bekhal hasherez hashorez, velo titame’u bahem venitmetem bam.
ky any yhwh alhykm whtqdStm whyytm qdSym ky qdwS any wla tTmaw at npStykm bkl hSrz hrmS el harz for i am yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these: ye therefore dedicate-finify yourselves, and ye be dedicated-finished; for i am dedicated-finished: neither ye cease yourselves with any manner of creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth. ki ’ani yhvh ’elohekhem vehitqadishtem vihyitem qedoshim ki qadosh ’ani, velo tetame’u nafshotekhem bekhal hasherez haromes ‘al ha’arez.
ky any yhwh hmelh atkm marz mzrym lhyt lkm lalhym whyytm qdSym ky qdwS any for i am yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah that bringeth you up out of the land of mizraim-narrows, to be your to-no-these: ye therefore be dedicated-finished, for i am dedicated-finished. ki ’ani yhvh hama‘aleh ’etkhem me’erez mizrayim lihyot lakhem lelohim, vihyitem qedoshim ki qadosh ’ani.
cat twrt hbhmh whewp wkl npS hxyh hrmSt bmym wlkl npS hSrzt el harz this is the teaching of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the from-waters, and of every creature that creepeth upon the earth: zot torat habehemah veha‘of vekhol nefesh hakhayah haromeset bamayim, ulekhal nefesh hashorezet ‘al ha’arez.
lhbdyl byn hTma wbyn hThr wbyn hxyh hnaklt wbyn hxyh aSr la takl to make a difference between-bin the stained-ceased and the bright-climaxing, and between-bin the beast that may be eaten and the beast that may not be eaten. lehabdil ben hatamei uben hatahor, uben hakhayah hane’ekhelet uben hakhayah ’asher lo te’akhel.
wydbr yhwh al mSh lamr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto mose-extracted, saying, vaydaber yhvh ’el mosheh lemor.
dbr al bny ySral lamr aSh ky tcrye wyldh ckr wTmah Sbet ymym kymy ndt dwth tTma speak unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, saying, if a woman have conceived seed, and born a man child: then she be stained-ceased seven days; according to the days of the separation for her infirmity she be stained-ceased. daber ’el benei yisra’el lemor ’ishah ki tazria‘ veyaledah zakhar, vetame’ah shib‘at yamim kimei nidat devotah titma.
wbywm hSmyny ymwl bSr erltw and in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin be scribe-circumcised. ubayom hashemini, yimol besar ‘arelato.
wSlSym ywm wSlSt ymym tSb bdmy Thrh bkl qdS la tge wal hmqdS la tba ed mlat ymy Thrh and she then continue in the blood of her purifying three and thirty days; she touch no dedicateed thing, nor come into the dedicated-finished, until the days of her purifying be fulfilled. usheloshim yom usheloshet yamim tesheb bidmei tahorah, bekhal qodesh lo tiga‘ ve’el hamiqdash lo tabo ‘ad melot yemei tahorah.
wam nqbh tld wTmah Sbeym kndth wSSym ywm wSSt ymym tSb el dmy Thrh and if she bear a maid child, then she be stained-ceased two weeks, as in her separation: and she continue in the blood of her purifying threescore and six days. ve’im neqebah teled vetame’ah shebu‘ayim kenidatah, veshishim yom vesheshet yamim tesheb ‘al demei tahorah.
wbmlat ymy Thrh lbn aw lbt tbya kbS bn Sntw lelh wbn ywnh aw tr lxTat al ptx ahl mwed al hkhn and when the days of her purifying are fulfilled, for a child-between, or for a daughter-hoof-bat-child, she bring a lamb of the first year for a on-up, and a young pigeon, or a turtledove, for a miss, unto the opening of the tent of until-conception, unto the dimmer-server: ubimlot yemei tahorah leben ’o lebat tabi kebes ben shenato le‘olah uben yonah ’o tor lekhatat, ’el petakh ’ohel mo‘ed ’el hakohen.
whqrybw lpny yhwh wkpr elyh wThrh mmqr dmyh cat twrt hyldt lckr aw lnqbh who inward it before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and make an out-of-town-ment for her; and she be bright-climaxingsed from the issue of her blood. this is the teaching for her that hath born a rememberer or a pierced. vehiqribo lifnei yhvh vekhiper ‘aleha vetaharah mimeqor dameha, zot torat hayoledet lazakhar ’o laneqebah.
wam la tmza ydh dy Sh wlqxh Sty trym aw Sny bny ywnh axd lelh waxd lxTat wkpr elyh hkhn wThrh and if she be not able to bring a lamb, then she bring two turtles, or two child-betweens of pigeons; the one for the on-up, and the other for a miss: and the dimmer-server make an out-of-town-ment for her, and she be bright-climaxing. ve’im lo timza yadah dei seh velaqekhah shete torim ’o shenei benei yonah ’ekhad le‘olah ve’ekhad lekhatat, vekhiper ‘aleha hakohen vetaherah.
wydbr yhwh al mSh wal ahrn lamr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto mose-extracted and aaron-cabinet, saying, vaydaber yhvh ’el mosheh ve’el ’aharon lemor.
adm ky yhyh bewr bSrw Sat aw spxt aw bhrt whyh bewr bSrw lnge zret whwba al ahrn hkhn aw al axd mbnyw hkhnym when a man have in the light-skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the light-skin of his flesh like the neganegaplague of vexing-speckled-waspishness; then he be brought unto aaron-cabinet the dimmer-server, or unto one of his children-betweens the dimmer-servers: ’adam ki yihyeh be‘or besaro se’et ’o sapakhat ’o baheret vehayah be‘or besaro lenega‘ zara‘at, vehuba ’el ’aharon hakohen ’o ’el ’akhad mibanav hakohanim.
wrah hkhn at hnge bewr hbSr wSer bnge hpk lbn wmrah hnge emq mewr bSrw nge zret hwa wrahw hkhn wTma atw and the dimmer-server look on the touch in the light-skin of the flesh: and when the gate-hair in the touch is turned to-between-bin-between-build-white, and the touch in sight be deeper than the light-skin of his flesh, it is a touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness: and the dimmer-server look on him, and pronounce him stained-ceased. vera’ah hakohen hanega‘ be‘or habasar vese‘ar banega‘ hafakh laban umar’eh hanega‘ ‘amoq me‘or besaro nega‘ zara‘at hu, vera’ahu hakohen vetimei ’oto.
wam bhrt lbnh hwa bewr bSrw wemq ayn mrah mn hewr wSerh la hpk lbn whsgyr hkhn at hnge Sbet ymym if the bright spot be to-between-bin-between-build-white in the light-skin of his flesh, and in sight be not deeper than the light-skin, and the gate-hair thereof be not turned to-between-bin-between-build-white; then the dimmer-server shut up him that hath the touch seven days: ve’im baheret lebanah hi be‘or besaro ve‘amoq ’en mar’eha min ha‘or use‘arah lo hafakh laban, vehisgir hakohen hanega‘ shib‘at yamim.
wrahw hkhn bywm hSbyey whnh hnge emd beynyw la pSh hnge bewr whsgyrw hkhn Sbet ymym Snyt and the dimmer-server look on him the seventh day: and, behold, if the touch in his sight be at a stay, and the touch spread not in the light-skin; then the dimmer-server shut him up seven days more: vera’ahu hakohen bayom hashebi‘i vehineh hanega‘ ‘amad be‘enav lo fasah hanega‘ ba‘or, vehisgiro hakohen shib‘at yamim shenit.
wrah hkhn atw bywm hSbyey Snyt whnh khh hnge wla pSh hnge bewr wThrw hkhn mspxt hya wkbs bgdyw wThr and the dimmer-server look on him again the seventh day: and, behold, if the touch be somewhat dark, and the touch spread not in the light-skin, the dimmer-server bright-climaxe him: it is and a scab: and he wash his clothes, and be bright-climaxing. vera’ah hakohen ’oto bayom hashebi‘i shenit vehineh kehah hanega‘ velo fasah hanega‘ ba‘or, vetiharo hakohen mispakhat hi vekhibes begadav vetaher.
wam pSh tpSh hmspxt bewr axry hratw al hkhn lThrtw wnrah Snyt al hkhn and if the scab spread much abroad in the light-skin, after that he hath been seen of the dimmer-server for his bright-climaxingsing, he be seen of the dimmer-server again. ve’im pasoh tifseh hamispakhat ba‘or ’akharei hera’oto ’el hakohen letahorato, venir’ah shenit ’el hakohen.
wrah hkhn whnh pSth hmspxt bewr wTmaw hkhn zret hwa and if the dimmer-server see that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the light-skin, then the dimmer-server stained-ceased him: it is a vexing-speckled-waspishness. vera’ah hakohen vehineh pasetah hamispakhat ba‘or, vetime’o hakohen zara‘at hi
nge zret ky thyh badm whwba al hkhn when the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness is in a man, then he be brought unto the dimmer-server; nega‘ zara‘at ki tihyeh be’adam, vehuba ’el hakohen.
wrah hkhn whnh Sat lbnh bewr whya hpkh Ser lbn wmxyt bSr xy bSat and the dimmer-server see him: and, behold, if the rising be to-between-bin-between-build-white in the light-skin, and it have turned the gate-hair to-between-bin-between-build-white, and there be quick live-raw flesh in the rising; vera’ah hakohen vehineh se’et lebanah ba‘or vehi hafekhah se‘ar laban, umikhyat basar khay bas’et.
zret nwSnt hwa bewr bSrw wTmaw hkhn la ysgrnw ky Tma hwa it is an old vexing-speckled-waspishness in the light-skin of his flesh, and the dimmer-server stained-ceased him, and not shut him up: for he is stained-ceased. zara‘at noshenet hi be‘or besaro vetime’o hakohen, lo yasgirenu ki tamei hu.
wam prwx tprx hzret bewr wksth hzret at kl ewr hnge mraSw wed rglyw lkl mrah eyny hkhn and if a vexing-speckled-waspishness break out abroad in the light-skin, and the vexing-speckled-waspishness cover all the light-skin of him that hath the touch from his head even to his foot, wheresoever the dimmer-server looketh; ve’im paroakh tifrakh hazara‘at ba‘or vekhisetah hazara‘at kal ‘or hanega‘ merosho ve‘ad raglav, lekhal ‘enei hakohen.
wrah hkhn whnh ksth hzret at kl bSrw wThr at hnge klw hpk lbn Thwr hwa then the dimmer-server consider: and, behold, if the vexing-speckled-waspishness have covered all his flesh, he bright-climaxe him that hath the touch: it is all turned to-between-bin-between-build-white: he is bright-climaxing. vera’ah hakohen vehineh khisetah hazara‘at kal besaro vetihar hanaga‘, kulo hafakh laban tahor hu.
wbywm hrawt bw bSr xy yTma and when live-raw flesh appeareth in him, he be stained-ceased. ubeyom hera’ot bo basar khay yitma.
wrah hkhn at hbSr hxy wTmaw hbSr hxy Tma hwa zret hwa and the dimmer-server see the live-raw flesh, and pronounce him to be stained-ceased: for the live-raw flesh is stained-ceased: it is a vexing-speckled-waspishness. vera’ah hakohen habasar hakhay vetime’o, habasar hakhay tamei hu zara‘at hu.
aw ky ySwb hbSr hxy wnhpk llbn wba al hkhn or if the live-raw flesh turn again, and be changed unto to-between-bin-between-build-white, he come unto the dimmer-server; ’o khi yashub habasar hakhay venehpakh lelaban, uba ’el hakohen.
wrahw hkhn whnh nhpk hnge llbn wThr hkhn at hnge Thwr hwa and the dimmer-server see him: and, behold, if the touch be turned into to-between-bin-between-build-white; then the dimmer-server bright-climaxe him that hath the touch: he is bright-climaxing. vera’ahu hakohen vehineh nehpakh hanega‘ lelaban, vetihar hakohen hanega‘ tahor hu.
wbSr ky yhyh bw berw Sxyn wnrpa the flesh also, in which, even in the light-skin thereof, was a grace-boil, and is healed, ubasar ki yihyeh be‘oro shekhin, venirpa.
whyh bmqwm hSxyn Sat lbnh aw bhrt lbnh admdmt wnrah al hkhn and in the place of the grace-boil there be a to-between-bin-between-build-white rising, or a bright spot, to-between-bin-between-build-white, and somewhat earthy-man-reddish, and it be showed to the dimmer-server; vehayah bimqom hashekhin se’et lebanah ’o baheret lebanah ’adamdamet, venir’ah ’el hakohen.
wrah hkhn whnh mrah Spl mn hewr wSerh hpk lbn wTmaw hkhn nge zret hwa bSxyn prxh and if, when the dimmer-server seeth it, behold, it be in sight lower than the light-skin, and the gate-hair thereof be turned to-between-bin-between-build-white; the dimmer-server stained-ceased him: it is a touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness broken out of the grace-boil. vera’ah hakohen vehineh mar’eha shafal min ha‘or use‘arah hafakh laban, vetime’o hakohen nega‘ zara‘at hi bashekhin parakhah.
wam yranh hkhn whnh ayn bh Ser lbn wSplh aynnh mn hewr whya khh whsgyrw hkhn Sbet ymym and if the dimmer-server look on it, and, behold, there be no to-between-bin-between-build-white gate-hairs therein, and if it be not lower than the light-skin, and be somewhat dark; then the dimmer-server shut him up seven days: ve’im yir’enah hakohen vehineh ’en bah se‘ar laban ushefalah ’enenah min ha‘or vehi khehah, vehisgiro hakohen shib‘at yamim.
wam pSh tpSh bewr wTma hkhn atw nge hwa and if it spread much abroad in the light-skin, then the dimmer-server stained-ceased him: it is a touch. ve’im pasoh tifseh ba‘or, vetimei hakohen nega‘ hi
wam txtyh temd hbhrt la pSth zrbt hSxyn hwa wThrw hkhn and if below stand-up the bright not spread a burning swimmer it and climaxe him the dimmer-server, it is a burning grace-boil; and the dimmer-server bright-climaxe him. ve’im takhteha ta‘amod habaheret lo fasatah zarebet hashekhin hi vetiharo hakohen.
aw bSr ky yhyh berw mkwt aS whyth mxyt hmkwh bhrt lbnh admdmt aw lbnh or if there be any flesh, in the light-skin whereof there is a hot burning, and the quick flesh that burneth have a to-between-bin-between-build-white bright spot, somewhat earthy-man-reddish, or to-between-bin-between-build-white; ’o basar ki yihyeh be‘oro mikhvat ’esh, vehayetah mikhyat hamikhvah baheret lebanah ’adamdemet ’o lebanah.
wrah ath hkhn whnh nhpk Ser lbn bbhrt wmrah emq mn hewr zret hwa bmkwh prxh wTma atw hkhn nge zret hwa then the dimmer-server look upon it: and, behold, if the gate-hair in the bright spot be turned to-between-bin-between-build-white, and it be in sight deeper than the light-skin; it is a vexing-speckled-waspishness broken out of the burning: wherefore the dimmer-server stained-ceased him: it is the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness. vera’ah ’otah hakohen vehineh nehpakh se‘ar laban babaheret umar’eha ‘amoq min ha‘or zara‘at hi bamikhvah parakhah, vetimei hakohen nega‘ zara‘at hi
wam yranh hkhn whnh ayn bbhrt Ser lbn wSplh aynnh mn hewr whwa khh whsgyrw hkhn Sbet ymym and if the dimmer-server look on it, and, behold, there be no to-between-bin-between-build-white gate-hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the other light-skin, and be somewhat dark; then the dimmer-server shut him up seven days: ve’im yir’enah hakohen vehineh ’en babeheret se‘ar laban ushefalah ’enenah min ha‘or vehiv khehah, vehisgiro hakohen shib‘at yamim.
wrahw hkhn bywm hSbyey am pSh tpSh bewr wTma hkhn atw nge zret hwa and the dimmer-server look upon him the seventh day: and if it be spread much abroad in the light-skin, then the dimmer-server stained-ceased him: it is the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness. vera’ahu hakohen bayom hashebi‘i, ’im pasoh tifseh ba‘or vetimei hakohen nega‘ zara‘at hi
wam txtyh temd hbhrt la pSth bewr whwa khh Sat hmkwh hwa wThrw hkhn ky zrbt hmkwh hwa and if below stand-up the bright not spread a burning swimmer it and climaxe him the dimmer-server in the light-skin, and it be somewhat dark; it is a rising of the burning, and the dimmer-server bright-climaxe him: for it is an inflammation of the burning. ve’im takhteha ta‘amod habaheret lo fasetah ba‘or vehiv khehah se’et hamikhvah hi vetiharo hakohen ki zarebet hamikhvah hi
wayS aw aSh ky yhyh bw nge braS aw bcqn if a man or woman have a touch upon the head or the beard; ve’ish ’o ’ishah ki yihyeh bo naga‘, berosh ’o bezaqan.
wrah hkhn at hnge whnh mrahw emq mn hewr wbw Ser zhb dq wTma atw hkhn ntq hwa zret hraS aw hcqn hwa then the dimmer-server see the touch: and, behold, if it be in sight deeper than the light-skin; and there be in it a yellow thin gate-hair; then the dimmer-server stained-ceased him: it is a dry scall, even a vexing-speckled-waspishness upon the head or beard. vera’ah hakohen hanega‘ vehineh mar’ehu ‘amoq min ha‘or ubo se‘ar zahob daq, vetimei hakohen neteq hu zara‘at harosh ’o hazaqan hu.
wky yrah hkhn at nge hntq whnh ayn mrahw emq mn hewr wSer Sxr ayn bw whsgyr hkhn at nge hntq Sbet ymym and if the dimmer-server look on the touch of the scall, and, behold, it be not in sight deeper than the light-skin, and that there is no black gate-hair in it; then the dimmer-server shut up him that hath the touch of the scall seven days: vekhi yir’eh hakohen nega‘ haneteq vehineh ’en mar’ehu ‘amoq min ha‘or vese‘ar shakhor ’en bo, vehisgir hakohen haneteq shib‘at yamim.
wrah hkhn at hnge bywm hSbyey whnh la pSh hntq wla hyh bw Ser zhb wmrah hntq ayn emq mn hewr and in the seventh day the dimmer-server look on the touch: and, behold, if the scall spread not, and there be in it no yellow gate-hair, and the scall be not in sight deeper than the light-skin; vera’ah hakohen hanega‘ bayom hashebi‘i vehineh lo fasah haneteq velo hayah bo se‘ar zahob, umar’eh haneteq ’en ‘amoq min ha‘or.
whtglx wat hntq la yglx whsgyr hkhn at hntq Sbet ymym Snyt he be shaven, and the scall he not shave; and the dimmer-server shut up him that hath the scall seven days more: vehitgalakh ve’et haneteq lo yegaleakh, vehisgir hakohen haneteq shib‘at yamim shenit.
wrah hkhn at hntq bywm hSbyey whnh la pSh hntq bewr wmrahw aynnw emq mn hewr wThr atw hkhn wkbs bgdyw wThr and in the seventh day the dimmer-server look on the scall: and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the light-skin, nor be in sight deeper than the light-skin; then the dimmer-server bright-climaxe him: and he wash his clothes, and be bright-climaxing. vera’ah hakohen haneteq bayom hashebi‘i vehineh lo fasah haneteq ba‘or umar’ehu ’enenu ‘amoq min ha‘or, vetihar hakohen vekhibes begadav vetaher.
wam pSh ypSh hntq bewr axry Thrtw and if the scall spread much in the light-skin after his bright-climaxingsing; ve’im pasoh yifseh haneteq ba‘or, ’akharei tahorato.
wrahw hkhn whnh pSh hntq bewr la ybqr hkhn lSer hzhb Tma hwa then the dimmer-server look on him: and, behold, if the scall be spread in the light-skin, the dimmer-server not seek for yellow gate-hair; he is stained-ceased. vera’ahu hakohen vehineh pasah haneteq ba‘or, lo yebaqer hakohen lase‘ar hazahob tamei hu.
wam beynyw emd hntq wSer Sxr zmx bw nrpa hntq Thwr hwa wThrw hkhn and if the scall be in his sight at a stay, and that there is black gate-hair grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is bright-climaxing: and the dimmer-server bright-climaxe him. ve’im be‘enav ‘amad haneteq vese‘ar shakhor zamakh bo nirpa haneteq tahor hu, vetiharo hakohen.
wayS aw aSh ky yhyh bewr bSrm bhrt bhrt lbnt if a man also or a woman have in the light-skin of their flesh bright spots, even to-between-bin-between-build-white bright spots; ve’ish ’o ’ishah ki yihyeh be‘or besaram beharot, beharot lebanot.
wrah hkhn whnh bewr bSrm bhrt khwt lbnt bhq hwa prx bewr Thwr hwa then the dimmer-server look: and, behold, if the bright spots in the light-skin of their flesh be darkish to-between-bin-between-build-white; it is a freckled spot that groweth in the light-skin; he is bright-climaxing. vera’ah hakohen vehineh be‘or besaram beharot kehot lebanot, bohaq hu parakh ba‘or tahor hu.
wayS ky ymrT raSw qrx hwa Thwr hwa and the man whose gate-hair is fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he bright-climaxing. ve’ish ki yimaret rosho, qereakh hu tahor hu.
wam mpat pnyw ymrT raSw gbx hwa Thwr hwa and he that hath his gate-hair fallen off from the part of his head toward his face-turns, he is forehead bald: yet is he bright-climaxing. ve’im mipe’at panav yimaret rosho, gibeakh hu tahor hu.
wky yhyh bqrxt aw bgbxt nge lbn admdm zret prxt hwa bqrxtw aw bgbxtw and if there be in the baldness, or thigh, a to-between-bin-between-build-white earthy-man-reddish touch; it is a vexing-speckled-waspishness sprung up in his baldness, or his thigh. vekhi yihyeh baqarakhat ’o bagabakhat nega‘ laban ’adamdam, zara‘at porakhat hi beqarakhto ’o begabakhto.
wrah atw hkhn whnh Sat hnge lbnh admdmt bqrxtw aw bgbxtw kmrah zret ewr bSr then the dimmer-server look upon it: and, behold, if the rising of the touch be to-between-bin-between-build-white earthy-man-reddish in his baldness, or in his thigh, as the vexing-speckled-waspishness appeareth in the light-skin of the flesh; vera’ah ’oto hakohen vehineh se’et hanega‘ lebanah ’adamdemet beqarakhto ’o begabakhto, kemar’eh zara‘at ‘or basar.
ayS zrwe hwa Tma hwa Tma yTmanw hkhn braSw ngew he is a speckled-waspish-speckled man, he is stained-ceased: the dimmer-server pronounce him utterly stained-ceased; his touch is in his head. ’ish zarua‘ hu tamei hu, tamei yetame’enu hakohen berosho nig‘o.
whzrwe aSr bw hnge bgdyw yhyw prmym wraSw yhyh prwe wel Spm yeTh wTma Tma yqra and the speckled-waspish in whom the touch is, his clothes be rent, and his head conceived-of, and he put a covering upon his upper lip, and cry, stained-ceased, stained-ceased. vehazarua‘ ’asher bo hanega‘ begadav yihyu ferumim verosho yihyeh farua‘ ve‘al safam ya‘teh, vetamei tamei yiqra.
kl ymy aSr hnge bw yTma Tma hwa bdd ySb mxwz lmxnh mwSbw all the days wherein the touch be in him he be ceased; he is stained-ceased: he dwell alone; without the camp his habitation be. kal yemei ’asher hanega‘ bo yitma tamei hu, badad yesheb mikhuz lamakhaneh moshabo.
whbgd ky yhyh bw nge zret bbgd zmr aw bbgd pStym the garment also that the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness is in, whether it be a woolen garment, or a linen garment; vehabeged ki yihyeh bo nega‘ zara‘at, bebeged zemer ’o bebeged pishtim.
aw bSty aw berb lpStym wlzmr aw bewr aw bkl mlakt ewr whether it be in the warp, or woof; of linen, or of woolen; whether in a light-skin, or in any thing made of light-skin; ’o bishti ’o be‘ereb lapishtim velazamer, ’o be‘or ’o bekhal melekhet ‘or.
whyh hnge yrqrq aw admdm bbgd aw bewr aw bSty aw berb aw bkl kly ewr nge zret hwa whrah at hkhn and if the touch be greenish or earthy-man-reddish in the garment, or in the light-skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of light-skin; it is a touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness, and be showed unto the dimmer-server: vehayah hanega‘ yeraqraq ’o ’adamdam babeged ’o ba‘or ’o basheti ’o ba‘ereb ’o bekhal keli ‘or nega‘ zara‘at hu, vehare’ah hakohen.
wrah hkhn at hnge whsgyr at hnge Sbet ymym and the dimmer-server look upon the touch, and shut up it that hath the touch seven days: vera’ah hakohen hanaga‘, vehisgir hanega‘ shib‘at yamim.
wrah at hnge bywm hSbyey ky pSh hnge bbgd aw bSty aw berb aw bewr lkl aSr yeSh hewr lmlakh zret mmart hnge Tma hwa and he look on the touch on the seventh day: if the touch be spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in a light-skin, or in any work that is made of light-skin; the touch is a fretting vexing-speckled-waspishness; it is stained-ceased. vera’ah hanega‘ bayom hashebi‘i ki fasah hanega‘ babeged ’o basheti ’o ba‘ereb ’o ba‘or lekhol ’asher ye‘aseh ha‘or zara‘at mam’eret hanega‘ tamei hu.
wSrp at hbgd aw at hSty aw at herb bzmr aw bpStym aw at kl kly hewr aSr yhyh bw hnge ky zret mmart hwa baS tSrp he therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woolen or in linen, or any thing of light-skin, wherein the touch is: for it is a fretting vexing-speckled-waspishness; it be burnt in the fire. vesaraf habeged ’o hasheti ’o ha‘ereb bazemer ’o bapishtim ’o kal keli ha‘or ’asher yihyeh bo hanaga‘, ki zara‘at mam’eret hi ba’esh tisaref.
wam yrah hkhn whnh la pSh hnge bbgd aw bSty aw berb aw bkl kly ewr and if the dimmer-server look, and, behold, the touch be not spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of light-skin; ve’im yir’eh hakohen vehineh lo fasah hanega‘ babeged ’o basheti ’o ba‘ereb, ’o bekhal keli ‘or.
wzwh hkhn wkbsw at aSr bw hnge whsgyrw Sbet ymym Snyt then the dimmer-server direct that they wash the thing wherein the touch is, and he shut it up seven days more: vezivah hakohen vekhibesu ’asher bo hanaga‘, vehisgiro shib‘at yamim shenit.
wrah hkhn axry hkbs at hnge whnh la hpk hnge at eynw whnge la pSh Tma hwa baS tSrpnw pxtt hwa bqrxtw aw bgbxtw and the dimmer-server look on the touch, after that it is washed: and, behold, if the touch have not changed his color, and the touch be not spread; it is stained-ceased; thou burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it be conceived-of within or without. vera’ah hakohen ’akharei hukabes hanega‘ vehineh lo hafakh hanega‘ ‘eno vehanega‘ lo fasah tamei hu ba’esh tisrefenu, pekhetet hi beqarakhto ’o begabakhto.
wam rah hkhn whnh khh hnge axry hkbs atw wqre atw mn hbgd aw mn hewr aw mn hSty aw mn herb and if the dimmer-server look, and, behold, the touch be somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he rend it out of the garment, or out of the light-skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof: ve’im ra’ah hakohen vehineh kehah hanega‘ ’akharei hukabes ’oto, veqara‘ ’oto min habeged ’o min ha‘or ’o min hasheti ’o min ha‘ereb.
wam trah ewd bbgd aw bSty aw berb aw bkl kly ewr prxt hwa baS tSrpnw at aSr bw hnge and if it appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of light-skin; it is a spreading touch: thou burn that wherein the touch is with fire. ve’im tera’eh ‘od babeged ’o basheti ’o ba‘ereb ’o bekhal keli ‘or porakhat hi ba’esh tisrefenu ’asher bo hanaga‘.
whbgd aw hSty aw herb aw kl kly hewr aSr tkbs wsr mhm hnge wkbs Snyt wThr and the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatsoever thing of light-skin it be, which thou wash, if the touch be departed from them, then it be washed the second time, and be bright-climaxing. vehabeged ’o hasheti ’o ha‘ereb ’o khal keli ha‘or ’asher tekhabes vesar mehem hanaga‘, vekhubas shenit vetaher.
cat twrt nge zret bgd hzmr aw hpStym aw hSty aw herb aw kl kly ewr lThrw aw lTmaw this is the teaching of the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness in a garment of woolen or linen, either in the warp, or woof, or any thing of light-skins, to pronounce it bright-climaxing, or to pronounce it stained-ceased. zot torat nega‘ zara‘at beged hazemer ’o hapishtim ’o hasheti ’o ha‘ereb ’o kal keli ‘or, letaharo ’o letame’o.
wydbr yhwh al mSh lamr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto mose-extracted, saying, vaydaber yhvh ’el mosheh lemor.
cat thyh twrt hmzre bywm Thrtw whwba al hkhn this be the teaching of the speckled-waspish in the day of his bright-climaxingsing: he be brought unto the dimmer-server: zot tihyeh torat hamezora‘ beyom tahorato, vehuba ’el hakohen.
wyza hkhn al mxwz lmxnh wrah hkhn whnh nrpa nge hzret mn hzrwe and the dimmer-server go forth out of the camp; and the dimmer-server look, and, behold, if the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness be healed in the speckled-waspish; veyaza hakohen ’el mikhuz lamakhaneh, vera’ah hakohen vehineh nirpa nega‘ hazara‘at min hazarua‘.
wzwh hkhn wlqx lmThr Sty zprym xywt Thrwt wez arc wSny twlet wacb then the dimmer-server direct to take for him that is to be bright-climaxingsed two birds alive and bright-climaxing, and cedar wood, and two caterpillars, and hyssop-discharging: vezivah hakohen velaqakh lamitaher shete ziporim khayot tehorot, ve‘ez ’erez usheni tola‘at ve’ezob.
wzwh hkhn wSxT at hzpwr haxt al kly xrS el mym xyym and the dimmer-server direct that one of the birds be killed in an earthen tool over running from-waters: vezivah hakohen veshakhat hazipor ha’ekhat, ’el keli kheres ‘al mayim khayim.
at hzpr hxyh yqx ath wat ez harc wat Sny htwlet wat hacb wTbl awtm wat hzpr hxyh bdm hzpr hSxTh el hmym hxyym as for the living bird, he take it, and the cedar wood, and the two caterpillars, and the hyssop-discharging, and dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running from-waters: ’et hazipor hakhayah yiqakh ’otah ve’et ‘ez ha’erez ve’et sheni hatola‘at ve’et ha’ezob, vetabal ’otam ve’et hazipor hakhayah bedam hazipor hashekhutah ‘al hamayim hakhayim.
whch el hmThr mn hzret Sbe pemym wThrw wSlx at hzpr hxyh el pny hSdh and he sprinkle upon him that is to be bright-climaxingsed from the vexing-speckled-waspishness seven times, and bright-climaxe him, and let the living bird loose into the open field. vehizah ‘al hamitaher min hazara‘at sheba‘ pe‘amim, vetiharo veshilakh hazipor hakhayah ‘al penei hasadeh.
wkbs hmThr at bgdyw wglx at kl Serw wrxz bmym wThr waxr ybwa al hmxnh wySb mxwz lahlw Sbet ymym and he that is to be bright-climaxingsed wash his clothes, and shave off all his gate-hair, and wash himself in from-waters, that he may be bright-climaxing: and after that he come into the camp, and tarry abroad out of his tent seven days. vekhibes hamitaher begadav vegilakh kal se‘aro verakhaz bamayim vetaher ve’akhar yabo ’el hamakhaneh, veyashab mikhuz le’aholo shib‘at yamim.
whyh bywm hSbyey yglx at kl Serw at raSw wat cqnw wat gbt eynyw wat kl Serw yglx wkbs at bgdyw wrxz at bSrw bmym wThr and it be on the seventh day, that he shave all his gate-hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his gate-hair he shave off: and he wash his clothes, also he wash his flesh in from-waters, and he be bright-climaxing. vehayah bayom hashebi‘i yegalakh kal se‘aro rosho ve’et zeqano ve’et ‘enav ve’et kal se‘aro yegaleakh, vekhibes begadav verakhaz besaro bamayim vetaher.
wbywm hSmyny yqx Sny kbSym tmymym wkbSh axt bt Snth tmymh wSlSh eSrnym slt mnxh blwlh bSmn wlg axd Smn and on the eighth day he take two he lambs simple, and one ewe lamb of the first year simple, and three tenth deals of fine basket-flour for a absorber, mingled with name-from-oil, and one log of name-from-oil. ubayom hashemini yiqakh shene khebasim temimim vekhabsah ’akhat bat shenatah temimah, usheloshah ‘esronim solet minkhah belulah bashemen velog ’ekhad shamen.
whemyd hkhn hmThr at hayS hmThr watm lpny yhwh ptx ahl mwed and the dimmer-server that maketh him bright-climaxing present the man that is to be made bright-climaxing, and those things, before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, at the opening of the tent of until-conception: vehe‘emid hakohen hamtaher ha’ish hamitaher ve’otam, lifnei yhvh petakh ’ohel mo‘ed.
wlqx hkhn at hkbS haxd whqryb atw laSm wat lg hSmn whnyp atm tnwph lpny yhwh and the dimmer-server take one he lamb, and inward him for a fire-name, and the log of name-from-oil, and sieve-pana them for a sieve before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: velaqakh hakohen hakebes ha’ekhad vehiqrib ’oto le’asham ve’et log hashamen, vehenif ’otam tenufah lifnei yhvh.
wSxT at hkbS bmqwm aSr ySxT at hxTat wat helh bmqwm hqdS ky kxTat haSm hwa lkhn qdS qdSym hwa and he slay the lamb in the place where he kill the miss and the on-up, in the dedicated-finished place: for as the miss is the dimmer-server's, so is the fire-name: it is most dedicated-finished: veshakhat hakebes bimqom ’asher yishkhat hakhatat ve’et ha‘olah bimqom haqodesh, ki kakhatat ha’asham hu lakohen qodesh qadashim hu.
wlqx hkhn mdm haSm wntn hkhn el tnwk acn hmThr hymnyt wel bhn ydw hymnyt wel bhn rglw hymnyt and the dimmer-server take some of the blood of the fire-name, and the dimmer-server put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be bright-climaxingsed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot: velaqakh hakohen midam ha’asham venatan hakohen ‘al tenukh ’ozen hamitaher haymanit, ve‘al bohen yado haymanit ve‘al bohen raglo haymanit.
wlqx hkhn mlg hSmn wyzq el kp hkhn hSmalyt and the dimmer-server take some of the log of name-from-oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand: velaqakh hakohen milog hashamen, veyazaq ‘al kaf hakohen hasemalit.
wTbl hkhn at azbew hymnyt mn hSmn aSr el kpw hSmalyt whch mn hSmn bazbew Sbe pemym lpny yhwh and the dimmer-server dip his right finger in the name-from-oil that is in his left hand, and sprinkle of the name-from-oil with his finger seven times before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: vetabal hakohen ’ezba‘o haymanit min hashemen ’asher ‘al kapo hasemalit, vehizah min hashemen be’ezba‘o sheba‘ pe‘amim lifnei yhvh.
wmytr hSmn aSr el kpw ytn hkhn el tnwk acn hmThr hymnyt wel bhn ydw hymnyt wel bhn rglw hymnyt el dm haSm and of the rest of the name-from-oil that is in his hand the dimmer-server put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be bright-climaxingsed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the fire-name: umiyeter hashemen ’asher ‘al kapo yiten hakohen ‘al tenukh ’ozen hamitaher haymanit ve‘al bohen yado haymanit ve‘al bohen raglo haymanit, ‘al dam ha’asham.
whnwtr bSmn aSr el kp hkhn ytn el raS hmThr wkpr elyw hkhn lpny yhwh and the remnant of the name-from-oil that is in the dimmer-server's hand he pour upon the head of him that is to be bright-climaxingsed: and the dimmer-server make an out-of-town-ment for him before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vehanotar bashemen ’asher ‘al kaf hakohen yiten ‘al rosh hamitaher, vekhiper ‘alav hakohen lifnei yhvh.
weSh hkhn at hxTat wkpr el hmThr mTmatw waxr ySxT at helh and the dimmer-server inward the miss, and make an out-of-town-ment for him that is to be bright-climaxingsed from his stained-ceasedness; and afterward he kill the on-up: ve‘asah hakohen hakhatat vekhiper ‘al hamitaher mitum’ato, ve’akhar yishkhat ha‘olah.
whelh hkhn at helh wat hmnxh hmcbxh wkpr elyw hkhn wThr and the dimmer-server inward the on-up and the absorber upon the butcher-kitchen: and the dimmer-server make an out-of-town-ment for him, and he be bright-climaxing. vehe‘elah hakohen ha‘olah ve’et haminkhah hamizbekhah, vekhiper ‘alav hakohen vetaher.
wam dl hwa wayn ydw mSgt wlqx kbS axd aSm ltnwph lkpr elyw weSrwn slt axd blwl bSmn lmnxh wlg Smn and if he be poor, and cannot get so much; then he take one lamb for a fire-name to be sieve-panad, to make an out-of-town-ment for him, and one tenth deal of fine basket-flour mingled with name-from-oil for a absorber, and a log of name-from-oil; ve’im dal hu ve’en yado maseget velaqakh kebes ’ekhad ’asham litnufah lekhaper ‘alav, ve‘isaron solet ’ekhad balul bashemen leminkhah velog shamen.
wSty trym aw Sny bny ywnh aSr tSyg ydw whyh axd xTat whaxd elh and two rises, or two child-betweens of pigeons, such as he is able to get; and the one be a miss, and the other a on-up. ushetei torim ’o shenei benei yonah ’asher tasig yado, vehayah ’ekhad khatat veha’ekhad ‘olah.
whbya atm bywm hSmyny lThrtw al hkhn al ptx ahl mwed lpny yhwh and he inward them on the eighth day for his bright-climaxingsing unto the dimmer-server, unto the opening of the tent of until-conception, before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vehebi ’otam bayom hashemini letahorato ’el hakohen, ’el petakh ’ohel mo‘ed lifnei yhvh.
wlqx hkhn at kbS haSm wat lg hSmn whnyp atm hkhn tnwph lpny yhwh and the dimmer-server take the lamb of the fire-name, and the log of name-from-oil, and the dimmer-server sieve-pana them for a sieve before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: velaqakh hakohen kebes ha’asham ve’et log hashamen, vehenif ’otam hakohen tenufah lifnei yhvh.
wSxT at kbS haSm wlqx hkhn mdm haSm wntn el tnwk acn hmThr hymnyt wel bhn ydw hymnyt wel bhn rglw hymnyt and he kill the lamb of the fire-name, and the dimmer-server take some of the blood of the fire-name, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be bright-climaxingsed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot: veshakhat kebes ha’asham velaqakh hakohen midam ha’asham venatan ‘al tenukh ’ozen hamitaher haymanit, ve‘al bohen yado haymanit ve‘al bohen raglo haymanit.
wmn hSmn yzq hkhn el kp hkhn hSmalyt and the dimmer-server pour of the name-from-oil into the palm of his own left hand: umin hashemen yizoq hakohen, ‘al kaf hakohen hasemalit.
whch hkhn bazbew hymnyt mn hSmn aSr el kpw hSmalyt Sbe pemym lpny yhwh and the dimmer-server sprinkle with his right finger some of the name-from-oil that is in his left hand seven times before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: vehizah hakohen be’ezba‘o haymanit min hashemen ’asher ‘al kapo hasemalit, sheba‘ pe‘amim lifnei yhvh.
wntn hkhn mn hSmn aSr el kpw el tnwk acn hmThr hymnyt wel bhn ydw hymnyt wel bhn rglw hymnyt el mqwm dm haSm and the dimmer-server put of the name-from-oil that is in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be bright-climaxingsed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the place of the blood of the fire-name: venatan hakohen min hashemen ’asher ‘al kapo ‘al tenukh ’ozen hamitaher haymanit ve‘al bohen yado haymanit ve‘al bohen raglo haymanit, ‘al meqom dam ha’asham.
whnwtr mn hSmn aSr el kp hkhn ytn el raS hmThr lkpr elyw lpny yhwh and the rest of the name-from-oil that is in the dimmer-server's hand he put upon the head of him that is to be bright-climaxingsed, to make an out-of-town-ment for him before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. vehanotar min hashemen ’asher ‘al kaf hakohen yiten ‘al rosh hamitaher, lekhaper ‘alav lifnei yhvh.
weSh at haxd mn htrym aw mn bny hywnh maSr tSyg ydw and he inward the one of the rises, or of child-betweens of pigeons, such as he can get; ve‘asah ha’ekhad min hatorim ’o min benei hayonah, me’asher tasig yado.
at aSr tSyg ydw at haxd xTat wat haxd elh el hmnxh wkpr hkhn el hmThr lpny yhwh even such as he is able to get, the one for a miss, and the other for a on-up, with the absorber: and the dimmer-server make an out-of-town-ment for him that is to be bright-climaxingsed before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. ’asher tasig yado ha’ekhad khatat ve’et ha’ekhad ‘olah ‘al haminkhah, vekhiper hakohen ‘al hamitaher lifnei yhvh.
cat twrt aSr bw nge zret aSr la tSyg ydw bThrtw this is the teaching of him in whom is the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness, whose hand is not able to get that which pertaineth to his bright-climaxingsing. zot torat ’asher nega‘ zara‘at, ’asher lo tasig yado betahorato.
wydbr yhwh al mSh wal ahrn lamr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto mose-extracted and unto aaron-cabinet, saying, vaydaber yhvh ’el mosheh ve’el ’aharon lemor.
ky tbaw al arz knen aSr any ntn lkm laxch wntty nge zret bbyt arz axctkm when ye be come into the land of canaan-mobile-trade, which i give to you for a possession, and i put the touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness in a daughter-house of the land of your possession; ki tabo’u ’el ’erez kena‘an ’asher ’ani noten lakhem la’akhuzah, venatati nega‘ zara‘at bebet ’erez ’akhuzatkhem.
wba aSr lw hbyt whgyd lkhn lamr knge nrah ly bbyt and he that owneth the daughter-house come and tell the dimmer-server, saying, it seemeth to me there is as it were a touch in the daughter-house: uba ’asher lo habayit vehigid lakohen lemor, kenega‘ nir’ah li babayit.
wzwh hkhn wpnw at hbyt bTrm yba hkhn lrawt at hnge wla yTma kl aSr bbyt waxr kn yba hkhn lrawt at hbyt then the dimmer-server direct that they empty the daughter-house, before-turns the dimmer-server go into it to see the touch, that all that is in the daughter-house be not made stained-ceased: and afterward the dimmer-server go in to see the daughter-house: vezivah hakohen ufinu habayit beterem yabo hakohen lir’ot hanega‘ velo yitma kal ’asher babayit, ve’akhar ken yabo hakohen lir’ot habayit.
wrah at hnge whnh hnge bqyrt hbyt Sqerwrt yrqrqt aw admdmt wmrayhn Spl mn hqyr and he look on the touch, and, behold, if the touch be in the walls of the daughter-house with hollow streaks, greenish or earthy-man-reddish, which in sight are lower than the wall; vera’ah hanega‘ vehineh hanega‘ beqirot habayit sheqa‘arurot yeraqraqot ’o ’adamdamot, umar’ehen shafal min haqir.
wyza hkhn mn hbyt al ptx hbyt whsgyr at hbyt Sbet ymym then the dimmer-server go out of the daughter-house to the opening of the daughter-house, and shut up the daughter-house seven days: veyaza hakohen min habayit ’el petakh habayit, vehisgir habayit shib‘at yamim.
wSb hkhn bywm hSbyey wrah whnh pSh hnge bqyrt hbyt and the dimmer-server come again the seventh day, and look: and, behold, if the touch be spread in the walls of the daughter-house; veshab hakohen bayom hashebi‘i, vera’ah vehineh pasah hanega‘ beqirot habayit.
wzwh hkhn wxlzw at habnym aSr bhn hnge whSlykw athn al mxwz leyr al mqwm Tma then the dimmer-server direct that they take away the stones in which the touch is, and they cast them into an stained-ceased place without the light-city: vezivah hakohen vekhilezu ha’abanim ’asher bahen hanaga‘, vehishlikhu ’ethen mikhuz la‘ir maqom tame.
wat hbyt yqze mbyt sbyb wSpkw at hepr aSr hqzw al mxwz leyr al mqwm Tma and he cause the daughter-house to be scraped within round about, and they pour out the dust that they scrape off without the light-city into an stained-ceased place: ve’et habayit yaqzia‘ mibayit sabib, veshafekhu he‘afar ’asher hiqzu mikhuz la‘ir ’el maqom tame.
wlqxw abnym axrwt whbyaw al txt habnym wepr axr yqx wTx at hbyt and they take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he take other mortar, and plaster the daughter-house. velaqekhu ’abanim ’akherot vehebi’u ’el takhat ha’abanim, ve‘afar ’akher yiqakh vetakh habayit.
wam ySwb hnge wprx bbyt axr xlz at habnym waxry hqzwt at hbyt waxry hTwx and if the touch come again, and break out in the daughter-house, after that he hath taken away the stones, and after he hath scraped the daughter-house, and after it is plastered; ve’im yashub hanega‘ ufarakh babayit ’akhar khilez ha’abanim, ve’akharei hiqzot habayit ve’akharei hitoakh.
wba hkhn wrah whnh pSh hnge bbyt zret mmart hwa bbyt Tma hwa then the dimmer-server come and look, and, behold, if the touch be spread in the daughter-house, it is a fretting vexing-speckled-waspishness in the daughter-house; it is stained-ceased. uba hakohen vera’ah vehineh pasah hanega‘ babayit, zara‘at mam’eret hi babayit tamei hu.
wntz at hbyt at abnyw wat ezyw wat kl epr hbyt whwzya al mxwz leyr al mqwm Tma and he break down the daughter-house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the mortar of the daughter-house; and he carry them forth out of the light-city into an stained-ceased place. venataz habayit ’abanav ve’et ‘ezav ve’et kal ‘afar habayit, vehozi mikhuz la‘ir ’el maqom tame.
whba al hbyt kl ymy hsgyr atw yTma ed herb moreover he that goeth into the daughter-house all the while that it is shut up be stained-ceased until the even. vehaba ’el habayit kal yemei hisgir yitma ‘ad ha‘areb.
whSkb bbyt ykbs at bgdyw whakl bbyt ykbs at bgdyw and he that lieth in the daughter-house wash his clothes; and he that eateth in the daughter-house wash his clothes. vehashokheb babayit yekhabes begadav, veha’okhel babayit yekhabes begadav.
wam ba yba hkhn wrah whnh la pSh hnge bbyt axry hTx at hbyt wThr hkhn at hbyt ky nrpa hnge and if the dimmer-server come in, and look upon it, and, behold, the touch hath not spread in the daughter-house, after the daughter-house was plastered: then the dimmer-server pronounce the daughter-house bright-climaxing, because the touch is healed. ve’im bo yabo hakohen vera’ah vehineh lo fasah hanega‘ babayit ’akharei hitoakh habayit, vetihar hakohen habayit ki nirpa hanaga‘.
wlqx lxTa at hbyt Sty zprym wez arc wSny twlet wacb and he take to bright-climaxingse the daughter-house two birds, and cedar wood, and two caterpillars, and hyssop-discharging: velaqakh lekhatei habayit shetei ziporim, ve‘ez ’erez usheni tola‘at ve’ezob.
wSxT at hzpr haxt al kly xrS el mym xyym and he kill the one of the birds in an earthen tool over running from-waters: veshakhat hazipor ha’ekhat, ’el keli kheres ‘al mayim khayim.
wlqx at ez harc wat hacb wat Sny htwlet wat hzpr hxyh wTbl atm bdm hzpr hSxwTh wbmym hxyym whch al hbyt Sbe pemym and he take the cedar wood, and the hyssop-discharging, and the two caterpillars, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running from-waters, and sprinkle the daughter-house seven times: velaqakh ‘ez ha’erez ve’et ha’ezob ve’et sheni hatola‘at ve’et hazipor hakhayah vetabal ’otam bedam hazipor hashekhutah ubamayim hakhayim, vehizah ’el habayit sheba‘ pe‘amim.
wxTa at hbyt bdm hzpwr wbmym hxyym wbzpr hxyh wbez harc wbacb wbSny htwlet and he bright-climaxingse the daughter-house with the blood of the bird, and with the running from-waters, and with the living bird, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssop-discharging, and with the two caterpillars: vekhitei habayit bedam hazipor ubamayim hakhayim, ubazipor hakhayah ube‘ez ha’erez uba’ezob ubishni hatola‘at.
wSlx at hzpr hxyh al mxwz leyr al pny hSdh wkpr el hbyt wThr and he send the living bird out of the light-city into the open fields, and make an out-of-town-ment for the daughter-house: and it be bright-climaxing. veshilakh hazipor hakhayah mikhuz la‘ir ’el penei hasadeh, vekhiper ‘al habayit vetaher.
cat htwrh lkl nge hzret wlntq this is the teaching for all manner of touch of vexing-speckled-waspishness, and scall, zot hatorah, lekhal nega‘ hazara‘at velanateq.
wlzret hbgd wlbyt and for the vexing-speckled-waspishness of a garment, and of a daughter-house, ulezara‘at habeged velabayit.
wlSat wlspxt wlbhrt and for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot: velas’et velasapakhat velabeharet.
lhwrt bywm hTma wbywm hThr cat twrt hzret to teach when it is stained-ceased, and when it is bright-climaxing: this is the teaching of vexing-speckled-waspishness. lehorot beyom hatamei ubeyom hatahor, zot torat hazara‘at.
wydbr yhwh al mSh wal ahrn lamr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto mose-extracted and to aaron-cabinet, saying, vaydaber yhvh ’el mosheh ve’el ’aharon lemor.
dbrw al bny ySral wamrtm alhm ayS ayS ky yhyh cb mbSrw cwbw Tma hwa speak unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, and say unto them, when any man hath a running issue out of his flesh, because of his issue he is stained-ceased. daberu ’el benei yisra’el va’amartem ’alehem, ’ish ’ish ki yihyeh zab mibesaro zobo tamei hu.
wcat thyh Tmatw bcwbw rr bSrw at cwbw aw hxtym bSrw mcwbw Tmatw hwa and this be his stained-ceasedness in his issue: whether his flesh run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it is his stained-ceasedness. vezot tihyeh tum’ato bezobo, rar besaro ’et zobo ’o hekhtim besaro mizobo tum’ato hi
kl hmSkb aSr ySkb elyw hcb yTma wkl hkly aSr ySb elyw yTma every bed, whereon he lieth that hath the issue, is stained-ceased: and every thing, whereon he sitteth, be stained-ceased. kal hamishkab ’asher yishkab hazab yitma, vekhal hakeli ’asher yesheb ‘alav yitma.
wayS aSr yge bmSkbw ykbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and whosoever toucheth his bed wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. ve’ish ’asher yiga‘ bemishkabo, yekhabes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
whySb el hkly aSr ySb elyw hcb ykbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and he that sitteth on any thing whereon he sat that hath the issue wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vehayosheb ‘al hakeli ’asher yesheb hazab, yekhabes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
whnge bbSr hcb ykbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vehanogea‘ bibsar hazab, yekhabes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wky yrq hcb bThwr wkbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and if he that hath the issue spit upon him that is bright-climaxing; then he wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhi yaroq hazab batahor, vekhibes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl hmrkb aSr yrkb elyw hcb yTma and what saddle soever he rideth upon that hath the issue be stained-ceased. vekhal hamerkab ’asher yirkab ‘alav hazab yitma.
wkl hnge bkl aSr yhyh txtyw yTma ed herb whnwSa awtm ykbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and whosoever toucheth any thing that was under him be stained-ceased until the even: and he that beareth any of those things wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhal hanogea‘ bekhol ’asher yihyeh takhtav yitma ‘ad ha‘areb, vehanosei ’otam yekhabes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl aSr yge bw hcb wydyw la STp bmym wkbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and whomsoever he toucheth that hath the issue, and hath not rinsed his hands in from-waters, he wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhol ’asher yiga‘ bo hazab veyadav lo shataf bamayim, vekhibes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkly xrS aSr yge bw hcb ySbr wkl kly ez ySTp bmym and the tool of earth, that he toucheth which hath the issue, be broken: and every tool of wood be rinsed in from-waters. ukheli kheres ’asher yiga‘ bo hazab yishaber, vekhal keli ‘ez yishatef bamayim.
wky yThr hcb mcwbw wspr lw Sbet ymym lThrtw wkbs bgdyw wrxz bSrw bmym xyym wThr and when he that hath an issue is bright-climaxingsed of his issue; then he number to himself seven days for his bright-climaxingsing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in running from-waters, and be bright-climaxing. vekhi yithar hazab mizobo vesafar lo shib‘at yamim letahorato vekhibes begadav, verakhaz besaro bemayim khayim vetaher.
wbywm hSmyny yqx lw Sty trym aw Sny bny ywnh wba lpny yhwh al ptx ahl mwed wntnm al hkhn and on the eighth day he take to him two rises, or two child-betweens of pigeons, and come before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah unto the opening of the tent of until-conception, and give them unto the dimmer-server: ubayom hashemini yiqakh lo shetei torim ’o shenei benei yonah, uba lifnei yhvh ’el petakh ’ohel mo‘ed unetanam ’el hakohen.
weSh atm hkhn axd xTat whaxd elh wkpr elyw hkhn lpny yhwh mcwbw and the dimmer-server inward them, the one for a miss, and the other for a on-up; and the dimmer-server make an out-of-town-ment for him before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah for his issue. ve‘asah ’otam hakohen ’ekhad khatat veha’ekhad ‘olah, vekhiper ‘alav hakohen lifnei yhvh mizobo.
wayS ky tza mmnw Skbt cre wrxz bmym at kl bSrw wTma ed herb and if any man's seed of copulation go out from him, then he wash all his flesh in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. ve’ish ki tezei mimenu shikhbat zara‘, verakhaz bamayim kal besaro vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl bgd wkl ewr aSr yhyh elyw Skbt cre wkbs bmym wTma ed herb and every garment, and every light-skin, whereon is the seed of copulation, be washed with from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhal beged vekhal ‘or ’asher yihyeh shikhbat zara‘, vekhubas bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
waSh aSr ySkb ayS ath Skbt cre wrxzw bmym wTmaw ed herb the woman also with whom man lie with seed of copulation, they both bathe themselves in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. ve’ishah ’asher yishkab ’ish shikhbat zara‘, verakhazu bamayim vetame’u ‘ad ha‘areb.
waSh ky thyh cbh dm yhyh cbh bbSrh Sbet ymym thyh bndth wkl hnge bh yTma ed herb and if a woman have an issue, and her issue in her flesh be blood, she be put apart seven days: and whosoever toucheth her be stained-ceased until the even. ve’ishah ki tihyeh zabah dam yihyeh zobah bibsarah, shib‘at yamim tihyeh benidatah vekhal hanogea‘ bah yitma ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl aSr tSkb elyw bndth yTma wkl aSr tSb elyw yTma and every thing that she lieth upon in her separation be stained-ceased: every thing also that she sitteth upon be stained-ceased. vekhol ’asher tishkab ‘alav benidatah yitma, vekhol ’asher tesheb ‘alav yitma.
wkl hnge bmSkbh ykbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and whosoever toucheth her bed wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhal hanogea‘ bemishkabah, yekhabes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wkl hnge bkl kly aSr tSb elyw ykbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and whosoever toucheth any thing that she sat upon wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhal hanogea‘ bekhal keli ’asher tesheb ‘alav, yekhabes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wam el hmSkb hwa aw el hkly aSr hwa ySbt elyw bngew bw yTma ed herb and if it be on her bed, or on any thing whereon she sitteth, when he toucheth it, he be stained-ceased until the even. ve’im ‘al hamishkab hu ’o ‘al hakeli ’asher hi yoshebet benage‘o yitma ‘ad ha‘areb.
wam Skb ySkb ayS ath wthy ndth elyw wTma Sbet ymym wkl hmSkb aSr ySkb elyw yTma and if any man lie with her at all, and her flowers be upon him, he be stained-ceased seven days; and all the bed whereon he lieth be stained-ceased. ve’im shakhob yishkab ’ish ’otah utehi nidatah ‘alav vetamei shib‘at yamim, vekhal hamishkab ’asher yishkab yitma.
waSh ky ycwb cwb dmh ymym rbym bla et ndth aw ky tcwb el ndth kl ymy cwb Tmath kymy ndth thyh Tmah hwa and if a woman have an issue of her blood many days out of the time of her separation, or if it run beyond the time of her separation; all the days of the issue of her stained-ceasedness be as the days of her separation: she be stained-ceased. ve’ishah ki yazub zob damah yamim rabim belo ‘et nidatah ’o khi tazub ‘al nidatah, kal yemei zob tum’atah kimei nidatah tihyeh teme’ah hi
kl hmSkb aSr tSkb elyw kl ymy cwbh kmSkb ndth yhyh lh wkl hkly aSr tSb elyw Tma yhyh kTmat ndth every bed whereon she lieth all the days of her issue be unto her as the bed of her separation: and whatsoever she sitteth upon be stained-ceased, as the stained-ceasedness of her separation. kal hamishkab ’asher tishkab kal yemei zobah kemishkab nidatah yihyeh lah, vekhal hakeli ’asher tesheb ‘alav tamei yihyeh ketum’at nidatah.
wkl hnwge bm yTma wkbs bgdyw wrxz bmym wTma ed herb and whosoever toucheth those things be stained-ceased, and wash his clothes, and bathe himself in from-waters, and be stained-ceased until the even. vekhal hanogea‘ bam yitma, vekhibes begadav verakhaz bamayim vetamei ‘ad ha‘areb.
wam Thrh mcwbh wsprh lh Sbet ymym waxr tThr and if she be bright-climaxingsed of her issue, then she number to herself seven days, and after that she be bright-climaxing. ve’im taharah mizobah, vesaferah lah shib‘at yamim ve’akhar tithar.
wbywm hSmyny tqx lh Sty trym aw Sny bny ywnh whbyah awtm al hkhn al ptx ahl mwed and on the eighth day she take unto her two turtles, or two child-betweens of pigeons, and bring them unto the dimmer-server, to the opening of the tent of until-conception. ubayom hashemini tiqakh lah shetei torim ’o shenei benei yonah, vehebi’ah ’otam ’el hakohen ’el petakh ’ohel mo‘ed.
weSh hkhn at haxd xTat wat haxd elh wkpr elyh hkhn lpny yhwh mcwb Tmath and the dimmer-server inward the one for a miss, and the other for a on-up; and the dimmer-server make an out-of-town-ment for her before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah for the issue of her stained-ceasedness. ve‘asah hakohen ha’ekhad khatat ve’et ha’ekhad ‘olah, vekhiper ‘aleha hakohen lifnei yhvh mizob tum’atah.
whcrtm at bny ySral mTmatm wla ymtw bTmatm bTmam at mSkny aSr btwkm thus ye separate children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards from their stained-ceasedness; that they die not in their stained-ceasedness, when they cease my dwelling that is among them. vehizartem bene yisra’el mitum’atam, velo yamutu betum’atam betame’am mishkani ’asher betokham.
cat twrt hcb waSr tza mmnw Skbt cre lTmah bh this is the teaching of him that hath an issue, and of him whose seed goeth from him, and is ceased therewith; zot torat hazab, va’asher tezei mimenu shikhbat zera‘ letame’ah bah.
whdwh bndth whcb at cwbw lckr wlnqbh wlayS aSr ySkb em Tmah and of her that is sick of her flowers, and of him that hath an issue, of the man, and of the woman, and of him that lieth with her that is stained-ceased. vehadavah benidatah vehazab zobo lazakhar velaneqebah, ule’ish ’asher yishkab ‘im teme’ah.
wydbr yhwh al mSh axry mwt Sny bny ahrn bqrbtm lpny yhwh wymtw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto mose-extracted after the death of the two children-betweens of aaron-cabinet, when they inwarded before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and died; vaydaber yhvh ’el mosheh ’akharei mot shenei benei ’aharon, beqarebatam lifne yhvh vayamutu.
wyamr yhwh al mSh dbr al ahrn axyk wal yba bkl et al hqdS mbyt lprkt al pny hkprt aSr el harn wla ymwt ky benn arah el hkprt and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto mose-extracted, speak unto aaron-cabinet thy brother, that he come not at all times into the dedicated-finished place within the breaker before-turns the out-of-townment, which is upon the cabinet; that he die not: for i will appear in the cloud upon the out-of-townment. vayomer yhvh ’el mosheh daber ’el ’aharon ’akhikha ve’al yabo bekhal ‘et ’el haqodesh mibet laparokhet, ’el penei hakaporet ’asher ‘al ha’aron velo yamut ki be‘anan ’era’eh ‘al hakaporet.
bcat yba ahrn al hqdS bpr bn bqr lxTat wayl lelh thus aaron-cabinet come into the dedicated-finished place: with a bull child-between of visit-cattle for a miss, and a ram-voiceless for a on-up. bezot yabo ’aharon ’el haqodesh, befar baqar lekhatat ve’ayil le‘olah.
ktnt bd qdS ylbS wmknsy bd yhyw el bSrw wbabnT bd yxgr wbmznpt bd yznp bgdy qdS hm wrxz bmym at bSrw wlbSm he put on the dedicated-finished linen you-wrote-coat, and he have the linen trousers upon his flesh, and be girded with a linen girdle, and with the linen branch-bonnet he be attired: these are dedicated-finished garments; therefore he wash his flesh in from-waters, and so put them on. ketonet bad qodesh yilbash umikhnese bad yihyu ‘al besaro ube’abnet bad yakhgor ubemiznefet bad yiznof, bigde qodesh hem verakhaz bamayim besaro ulebesham.
wmat edt bny ySral yqx Sny Seyry ecym lxTat wayl axd lelh and he take of the until-witness of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards two kids of the intense-goats for a miss, and one ram-voiceless for a on-up. ume’et ‘adat benei yisra’el yiqakh shene se‘irei ‘izim lekhatat, ve’ayil ’ekhad le‘olah.
whqryb ahrn at pr hxTat aSr lw wkpr bedw wbed bytw and aaron-cabinet inward his bull of the miss, which is for himself, and make an out-of-town-ment for himself, and for his daughter-house. vehiqrib ’aharon par hakhatat ’asher lo, vekhiper ba‘ado ube‘ad beto.
wlqx at Sny hSeyrm whemyd atm lpny yhwh ptx ahl mwed and he take the two intense-goats, and present them before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah at the opening of the tent of until-conception. velaqakh shenei hase‘irim, vehe‘emid ’otam lifnei yhvh petakh ’ohel mo‘ed.
wntn ahrn el Sny hSeyrm gwrlwt gwrl axd lyhwh wgwrl axd lecacl and aaron-cabinet cast lots upon the two intense-goats; one lot-cover for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and the other lot-cover for the azazel-out-outof. venatan ’aharon ‘al shenei hase‘irim goralot, goral ’ekhad yhvh vegoral ’ekhad la‘azazel.
whqryb ahrn at hSeyr aSr elh elyw hgwrl lyhwh weShw xTat and aaron-cabinet bring the intense-goat upon which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah's lot-cover fell, and inward him for a miss. vehiqrib ’aharon hasa‘ir ’asher ‘alah ‘alav hagoral yhvh, ve‘asahu khatat.
whSeyr aSr elh elyw hgwrl lecacl yemd xy lpny yhwh lkpr elyw lSlx atw lecacl hmdbrh and the intense-goat, on which the lot-cover fell to be the azazel-out-outof, be presented alive before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, to make an out-of-town-ment with him, and to let him go for a azazel-out-outof into the place-of-word-desert. vehasa‘ir ’asher ‘alah ‘alav hagoral la‘azazel ya‘omad khay lifnei yhvh lekhaper ‘alav, leshalakh la‘azazel hamidbarah.
whqryb ahrn at pr hxTat aSr lw wkpr bedw wbed bytw wSxT at pr hxTat aSr lw and aaron-cabinet bring the bull of the miss, which is for himself, and make an out-of-town-ment for himself, and for his daughter-house, and kill the bull of the miss which is for himself: vehiqrib ’aharon par hakhatat ’asher lo vekhiper ba‘ado ube‘ad beto, veshakhat par hakhatat ’asher lo.
wlqx mla hmxth gxly aS mel hmcbx mlpny yhwh wmla xpnyw qTrt smym dqh whbya mbyt lprkt and he take a censer full of burning coals of fire from off the butcher-kitchen before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and his hands full of smoke drug beaten small, and bring it within the breaker: velaqakh melo hamakhtah gakhale ’esh me‘al hamizbeakh milifnei yhvh umelo khafenav qetoret samim daqah, vehebi mibet laparokhet.
wntn at hqTrt el haS lpny yhwh wksh enn hqTrt at hkprt aSr el hedwt wla ymwt and he put the incense upon the fire before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, that the cloud of the incense may cover the out-of-townment that is upon the until-witness, that he die not: venatan haqetoret ‘al ha’esh lifnei yhvh, vekhisah ‘anan haqetoret hakaporet ’asher ‘al ha‘edut velo yamut.
wlqx mdm hpr whch bazbew el pny hkprt qdmh wlpny hkprt ych Sbe pemym mn hdm bazbew and he take of the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it with his finger upon the out-of-townment eastward; and before-turns the out-of-townment he sprinkle of the blood with his finger seven times. velaqakh midam hapar vehizah be’ezba‘o ‘al penei hakaporet qedemah, velifnei hakaporet yazeh sheba‘ pe‘amim min hadam be’ezba‘o.
wSxT at Seyr hxTat aSr lem whbya at dmw al mbyt lprkt weSh at dmw kaSr eSh ldm hpr whch atw el hkprt wlpny hkprt then he kill the intense-goat of the miss, that is for the with-mum-people, and bring his blood within the breaker, and do with that blood as he did with the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it upon the out-of-townment, and before-turns the out-of-townment: veshakhat se‘ir hakhatat ’asher la‘am vehebi damo ’el mibet laparokhet, ve‘asah ’et damo ka’asher ‘asah ledam hapar vehizah ’oto ‘al hakaporet velifnei hakaporet.
wkpr el hqdS mTmat bny ySral wmpSeyhm lkl xTatm wkn yeSh lahl mwed hSkn atm btwk Tmatm and he make an out-of-town-ment for the dedicated-finished place, because of the stained-ceasedness of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, and because of their crimes in all their misses: and so he do for the tent of until-conception, that remaineth among them in the midst of their stained-ceasedness. vekhiper ‘al haqodesh mitum’ot benei yisra’el umipish‘ehem lekhal khatotam, vekhen ya‘aseh le’ohel mo‘ed hashokhen ’itam betokh tum’otam.
wkl adm la yhyh bahl mwed bbaw lkpr bqdS ed zatw wkpr bedw wbed bytw wbed kl qhl ySral and there be no man in the tent of until-conception when he goeth in to make an out-of-town-ment in the dedicated-finished place, until he come out, and have made an out-of-town-ment for himself, and for his daughter-household, and for all the until-witness of israel-juicy-towards. vekhal ’adam lo yihyeh be’ohel mo‘ed bebo’o lekhaper baqodesh ‘ad zeto, vekhiper ba‘ado ube‘ad beto ube‘ad kal qehal yisra’el.
wyza al hmcbx aSr lpny yhwh wkpr elyw wlqx mdm hpr wmdm hSeyr wntn el qrnwt hmcbx sbyb and he go out unto the butcher-kitchen that is before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and make an out-of-town-ment for it; and take of the blood of the bull, and of the blood of the intense-goat, and put it upon the horn-rays of the butcher-kitchen round about. veyaza ’el hamizbeakh ’asher lifne yhvh vekhiper ‘alav, velaqakh midam hapar umidam hasa‘ir venatan ‘al qarnot hamizbeakh sabib.
whch elyw mn hdm bazbew Sbe pemym wThrw wqdSw mTmat bny ySral and he sprinkle of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and bright-climaxingse it, and dedicate-finify it from the stained-ceasedness of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards. vehizah ‘alav min hadam be’ezba‘o sheba‘ pe‘amim, vetiharo veqidesho mitum’ot benei yisra’el.
wklh mkpr at hqdS wat ahl mwed wat hmcbx whqryb at hSeyr hxy and when he hath made an end of out-of-towning the dedicated-finished place, and the tent of until-conception, and the butcher-kitchen, he inward the live intense-goat: vekhilah mikaper haqodesh ve’et ’ohel mo‘ed ve’et hamizbeakh, vehiqrib hasa‘ir hekhay.
wsmk ahrn at Sty ydw ydyw el raS hSeyr hxy whtwdh elyw at kl ewnt bny ySral wat kl pSeyhm lkl xTatm wntn atm el raS hSeyr wSlx byd ayS ety hmdbrh and aaron-cabinet lay both his hands upon the head of the live intense-goat, and confess over him all the seasons of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, and all their crimes in all their misses, putting them upon the head of the intense-goat, and send him away by the hand of a fit man into the place-of-word-desert: vesamakh ’aharon shetei yado yadav ‘al rosh hasa‘ir hakhay vehitvadah ‘alav kal ‘avonot benei yisra’el ve’et kal pish‘ehem lekhal khatotam, venatan ’otam ‘al rosh hasa‘ir veshilakh beyad ’ish ‘iti hamidbarah.
wnSa hSeyr elyw at kl ewntm al arz gcrh wSlx at hSeyr bmdbr and the intense-goat bear upon him all their seasons unto cut-off land: and he send the intense-goat in the place-of-word-desert. venasa hasa‘ir ‘alav kal ‘avonotam ’el ’erez gezerah, veshilakh hasa‘ir bamidbar.
wba ahrn al ahl mwed wpST at bgdy hbd aSr lbS bbaw al hqdS whnyxm Sm and aaron-cabinet come into the tent of until-conception, and put off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the dedicated-finished place, and leave them there: uba ’aharon ’el ’ohel mo‘ed ufashat bigdei habad ’asher labash bebo’o ’el haqodesh, vehinikham sham.
wrxz at bSrw bmym bmqwm qdwS wlbS at bgdyw wyza weSh at eltw wat elt hem wkpr bedw wbed hem and he wash his flesh with from-waters in the dedicated-finished place, and put on his garments, and come forth, and inward his on-up, and the on-up of the with-mum-people, and make an out-of-town-ment for himself, and for the with-mum-people. verakhaz besaro bamayim bemaqom qadosh velabash begadav, veyaza ve‘asah ‘olato ve’et ‘olat ha‘am vekhiper ba‘ado ube‘ad ha‘am.
wat xlb hxTat yqTyr hmcbxh and the fat of the miss he burn upon the butcher-kitchen. ve’et kheleb hakhatat yaqtir hamizbekhah.
whmSlx at hSeyr lecacl ykbs bgdyw wrxz at bSrw bmym waxry kn ybwa al hmxnh and he that send the intense-goat for the azazel-out-outof wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in from-waters, and afterward come into the camp. vehamshaleakh hasa‘ir la‘azazel yekhabes begadav verakhaz besaro bamayim, ve’akhare khen yabo ’el hamakhaneh.
wat pr hxTat wat Seyr hxTat aSr hwba at dmm lkpr bqdS ywzya al mxwz lmxnh wSrpw baS at ertm wat bSrm wat prSm and the bull for the miss, and the intense-goat for the miss, whose blood was brought in to make out-of-town-ment in the dedicated-finished place, one carry forth without the camp; and they burn in the fire their light-skins, and their flesh, and their dung. ve’et par hakhatat ve’et se‘ir hakhatat ’asher huba damam lekhaper baqodesh yozi mikhuz lamakhaneh, vesarefu ba’esh ‘orotam ve’et besaram ve’et pirsham.
whSrp atm ykbs bgdyw wrxz at bSrw bmym waxry kn ybwa al hmxnh and he that burneth them wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in from-waters, and afterward he come into the camp. vehasoref ’otam yekhabes begadav verakhaz besaro bamayim, ve’akhare khen yabo ’el hamakhaneh.
whyth lkm lxqt ewlm bxdS hSbyey beSwr lxdS tenw at npStykm wkl mlakh la teSw hacrx whgr hgr btwkkm and this be a statute for ever unto you: that in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, ye pauper your beings, and do no work at all, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger that sojourneth among you: vehayetah lakhem lekhuqat ‘olam, bakhodesh hashebi‘i be‘asor lakhodesh te‘anu nafshotekhem vekhal melakhah lo ta‘asu ha’ezrakh vehager hagar betokhkhem.
ky bywm hch ykpr elykm lThr atkm mkl xTatykm lpny yhwh tThrw for on that day the dimmer-server make an out-of-town-ment for you, to bright-climaxingse you, that ye may be bright-climaxing from all your misses before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. ki bayom hazeh yekhaper ‘alekhem letaher ’etkhem, mikol khatotekhem lifnei yhvh titharu.
Sbt Sbtwn hya lkm wenytm at npStykm xqt ewlm it be a sabbath-seven of rest unto you, and ye pauper your beings, by a statute for ever. shabat shabaton hi lakhem ve‘initem nafshotekhem, khuqat ‘olam.
wkpr hkhn aSr ymSx atw waSr ymla at ydw lkhn txt abyw wlbS at bgdy hbd bgdy hqdS and the dimmer-server, whom he lube, and whom he fill to dimmer-server in his father's stead, make the out-of-town-ment, and put on the linen clothes, even the dedicated-finished garments: vekhiper hakohen ’asher yimshakh va’asher yemalei yado lekhahen takhat ’abiv, velabash bigdei habad bigdei haqodesh.
wkpr at mqdS hqdS wat ahl mwed wat hmcbx ykpr wel hkhnym wel kl em hqhl ykpr and he make an out-of-town-ment for the dedicated-finished dedicated, and he make an out-of-town-ment for the tent of until-conception, and for the butcher-kitchen, and he make an out-of-town-ment for the dimmer-servers, and for all the with-mum-people of the until-witness. vekhiper ’et miqdash haqodesh ve’et ’ohel mo‘ed ve’et hamizbeakh yekhaper, ve‘al hakohanim ve‘al kal ‘am haqahal yekhaper.
