wam babn yd aSr ymwt bh hkhw wymt rzx hwa mwt ywmt hrzx and if he hit him with throwing a father-child-stone, wherewith he may die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murderer surely be put to death. ve’im be’eben yad ’asher yamut bah hikahu vayamot rozeakh hu, mot yumat harozeakh.
aw bkly ez yd aSr ymwt bw hkhw wymt rzx hwa mwt ywmt hrzx or if he hit him with an hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murderer surely be put to death. ’o bikhli ‘ez yad ’asher yamut bo hikahu vayamot rozeakh hu, mot yumat harozeakh.
gal hdm hwa ymyt at hrzx bpgew bw hwa ymytnw the revenger of blood himself slay the murderer: when he until-witnesseth him, he slay him. go’el hadam hu yamit harozeakh, befig‘o bo hu yemitenu.
wam bSnah yhdpnw aw hSlyk elyw bzdyh wymt and if he thrust him of hatred, or hurl at him by laying of wait, that he die; ve’im besin’ah yehdafenu, ’o hishlikh ‘alav bizdiyah vayamot.
aw baybh hkhw bydw wymt mwt ywmt hmkh rzx hwa gal hdm ymyt at hrzx bpgew bw or in enmity hit him with his hand, that he die: he that smote him surely be put to death; for he is a murderer: the revenger of blood slay the murderer, when he until-witnesseth him. ’o be’ebah hikahu beyado vayamot mot yumat hamakeh rozeakh hu, go’el hadam yamit harozeakh befig‘o bo.
wam bpte bla aybh hdpw aw hSlyk elyw kl kly bla zdyh and if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him any thing without laying of wait, ve’im befeta‘ belo ’ebah hadafo, ’o hishlikh ‘alav kal keli belo zediyah.
aw bkl abn aSr ymwt bh bla rawt wypl elyw wymt whwa la awyb lw wla mbqS retw or with any father-child-stone, wherewith a man may die, seeing him not, and cast it upon him, that he die, and was not his enemy, neither sought his harm: ’o bekhal ’eben ’asher yamut bah belo re’ot vayapel ‘alav vayamot, vehu lo ’oyeb lo velo mebaqesh ra‘ato.
wSpTw hedh byn hmkh wbyn gal hdm el hmSpTym halh then the until-witness decide between-bin the slayer and the revenger of blood according to these decision-grammars: veshafetu ha‘edah ben hamakeh uben go’el hadam, ‘al hamishpatim ha’eleh.
whzylw hedh at hrzx myd gal hdm whSybw atw hedh al eyr mqlTw aSr ns Smh wySb bh ed mwt hkhn hgdl aSr mSx atw bSmn hqdS and the until-witness deliver the slayer out of the hand of the revenger of blood, and the until-witness restore him to the light-city of his refuge, whither he was fled: and he abide in it unto the death of the high dimmer-server, which was lubeed with the dedicated-finished name-from-oil. vehizilu ha‘edah harozeakh miyad go’el hadam veheshibu ’oto ha‘edah ’el ‘ir miqlato ’asher nas shamah, veyashab bah ‘ad mot hakohen hagadol ’asher mashakh beshemen haqodesh.
wam yza yza hrzx at gbwl eyr mqlTw aSr ynws Smh and if the slayer at any time come without the border of the light-city of his refuge, whither he was fled; ve’im yazo yezei harozeakh, gebul ‘ir miqlato ’asher yanus shamah.
wmza atw gal hdm mxwz lgbwl eyr mqlTw wrzx gal hdm at hrzx ayn lw dm and the revenger of blood find him without the borders of the light-city of his refuge, and the revenger of blood kill the slayer; he not be guilty of blood: umaza ’oto go’el hadam mikhuz ligbul ‘ir miqlato, verazakh go’el hadam harozeakh ’en lo dam.
ky beyr mqlTw ySb ed mwt hkhn hgdl waxry mwt hkhn hgdl ySwb hrzx al arz axctw because he should have remained in the light-city of his refuge until the death of the high dimmer-server: and after the death of the high dimmer-server the slayer return into the land of his possession. ki be‘ir miqlato yesheb ‘ad mot hakohen hagadol, ve’akharei mot hakohen hagadol yashub harozeakh ’el ’erez ’akhuzato.
whyw alh lkm lxqt mSpT ldrtykm bkl mwSbtykm so these things be for a statute of decision-grammar unto you throughout your generations in all your dwellings. vehayu ’eleh lakhem lekhuqat mishpat ledorotekhem, bekhol moshebotekhem.
kl mkh npS lpy edym yrzx at hrzx wed axd la yenh bnpS lmwt whoso killeth any person, the murderer be put to death by the mouth of witnesses: and one witness not testify against any person to cause him to die. kal makeh nefesh lefi ‘edim yirzakh harozeakh, ve‘ed ’ekhad lo ya‘aneh benefesh lamut.
wla tqxw kpr lnpS rzx aSr hwa rSe lmwt ky mwt ywmt moreover ye take no satisfaction for the life of a murderer, which is fire-name of death: and he be deadly put to death. velo tiqkhu khofer lenefesh rozeakh ’asher hu rasha‘ lamut, ki mot yumat.
wla tqxw kpr lnws al eyr mqlTw lSwb lSbt barz ed mwt hkhn and ye take no satisfaction for him that is fled to the light-city of his refuge, that he should come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the dimmer-server. velo tiqkhu khofer lanus ’el ‘ir miqlato, lashub lashebet ba’arez ‘ad mot hakohen.
wla txnypw at harz aSr atm bh ky hdm hwa yxnyp at harz wlarz la ykpr ldm aSr Spk bh ky am bdm Spkw so ye not pollute the land wherein ye are: for blood it ceaseth the land: and the land cannot be bright-climaxingsed of the blood that is shed therein, and by the blood of him that shed it. velo takhanifu ha’arez ’asher ’atem bah ki hadam hu yakhanif ha’arez, vela’arez lo yekhupar ladam ’asher shupakh bah ki ’im bedam shofekho.
wla tTma at harz aSr atm ySbym bh aSr any Skn btwkh ky any yhwh Skn btwk bny ySral cease not therefore the land which ye inhabit, wherein i dwell: for i yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah dwell among children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards. velo tetamei ha’arez ’asher ’atem yoshebim bah ’asher ’ani shokhen betokhah, ki ’ani yhvh shokhen betokh benei yisra’el.
wyqrbw raSy habwt lmSpxt bny gled bn mkyr bn mnSh mmSpxt bny ywsp wydbrw lpny mSh wlpny hnSaym raSy abwt lbny ySral and the chief fathers of the families of children-betweens of gilead-roll-until-heap, child-between of machi-of-beatr-recognize, child-between of manasseh-place-of-sleep, of the families of children-betweens of joseph-add, came near, and spake before-turns mose-extracted, and before-turns the leaders, the chief fathers of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards: vayiqrebu rashei ha’abot lemishpakhat bene gil‘ad ben makhir ben menasheh mimishpekhot benei yosef, vaydaberu lifnei mosheh velifnei hanesi’im rashei ’abot libnei yisra’el.
wyamrw at adny zwh yhwh ltt at harz bnxlh bgwrl lbny ySral wadny zwh byhwh ltt at nxlt zlpxd axynw lbntyw and they said, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah direct my base-lord to give the land for an inheritance by lot-cover to children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards: and my base-lord was direct by yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to give the inheritance of zelophehad-whip-sharp our brother unto his children-betweenesss. vayomeru ’adoni zivah yhvh latet ha’arez benakhalah begoral libnei yisra’el, vadoni zuvah yhvh latet nakhalat zelafekhad ’akhinu libnotav.
whyw laxd mbny SbTy bny ySral lnSym wngreh nxltn mnxlt abtynw wnwsp el nxlt hmTh aSr thyynh lhm wmgrl nxltnw ygre and if they be married to any of children-betweens of the other branchs of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, then their inheritance be taken from the inheritance of our fathers, and be put to the inheritance of the branch whereunto they are received: so it be taken from the lot-cover of our inheritance. vehayu le’ekhad mibenei shibtei bene yisra’el lenashim venigre‘ah nakhalatan minakhalat ’abotenu venosaf ‘al nakhalat hamateh ’asher tihyenah lahem, umigoral nakhalatenu yigarea‘.
wam yhyh hybl lbny ySral wnwsph nxltn el nxlt hmTh aSr thyynh lhm wmnxlt mTh abtynw ygre nxltn and when the river-jubilee of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards be, then their inheritance be put unto the inheritance of the branch whereunto they are received: so their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the branch of our fathers. ve’im yihyeh hayobel libnei yisra’el venosfah nakhalatan ‘al nakhalat hamateh ’asher tihyenah lahem, uminakhalat mateh ’abotenu yigara‘ nakhalatan.
wyzw mSh at bny ySral el py yhwh lamr kn mTh bny ywsp dbrym and mose-extracted direct children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards according to the bee-word of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, saying, the branch of children-betweens of joseph-add hath said well. vayzav mosheh benei yisra’el ‘al pi yhvh lemor, ken mateh bene yosef doberim.
ch hdbr aSr zwh yhwh lbnwt zlpxd lamr lTwb beynyhm thyynh lnSym ak lmSpxt mTh abyhm thyynh lnSym this is the thing which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah doth direct concerning children-betweenesss of zelophehad-whip-sharp, saying, let them marry to whom they think best; only to the family of the branch of their father they marry. zeh hadabar ’asher zivah yhvh libnot zelafekhad lemor latob be‘enehem tihyenah. ’akh lemishpakhat mateh ’abihem tihyenah lenashim.
wla tsb nxlh lbny ySral mmTh al mTh ky ayS bnxlt mTh abtyw ydbqw bny ySral so not the inheritance of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards remove from branch to branch: for every one of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards keep himself to the inheritance of the branch of his fathers. velo tisob nakhalah libnei yisra’el mimateh ’el mateh, ki ’ish benakhalat mateh ’abotav yidbequ benei yisra’el.
wkl bt yrSt nxlh mmTwt bny ySral laxd mmSpxt mTh abyh thyh laSh lmen yyrSw bny ySral ayS nxlt abtyw and every daughter-hoof-bat-child, that possesseth an inheritance in any branch of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, be woman unto one of the family of the branch of her father, that children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards may enjoy every man the inheritance of his fathers. vekhal bat yoreshet nakhalah mimatot benei yisra’el le’ekhad mimishpakhat mateh ’abiha tihyeh le’ishah, lema‘an yireshu benei yisra’el ’ish nakhalat ’abotav.
wla tsb nxlh mmTh lmTh axr ky ayS bnxltw ydbqw mTwt bny ySral neither the inheritance remove from one branch to another branch; and every one of the branchs of children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards keep himself to his own inheritance. velo tisob nakhalah mimateh lemateh ’akher, ki ’ish benakhalato yidbequ matot benei yisra’el.
kaSr zwh yhwh at mSh kn eSw bnwt zlpxd even as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah direct mose-extracted, so did children-betweenesss of zelophehad-whip-sharp: ka’asher zivah yhvh mosheh, ken ‘asu benot zelafekhad.
wthyynh mxlh trzh wxglh wmlkh wneh bnwt zlpxd lbny ddyhn lnSym for mahlah-illness, tirzah-want-placate-solve, and hoglah-partridge, and milcah-queen, and noah-rest, children-betweenesss of zelophehad-whip-sharp, were married unto their father's brothers' children-betweens: vatihyenah makhlah tirzah vekhagelah umilkah veno‘ah benot zelafekhad, libnei dodehen lenashim.
mmSpxt bny mnSh bn ywsp hyw lnSym wthy nxltn el mTh mSpxt abyhn and they were married into the families of children-betweens of manasseh-place-of-sleep child-between of joseph-add, and their inheritance remained in the branch of the family of their father. mimishpekhot bene menasheh ben yosef hayu lenashim, vatehi nakhalatan ‘al mateh mishpakhat ’abihen.
alh hmzwt whmSpTym aSr zwh yhwh byd mSh al bny ySral berbt mwab el yrdn yrxw these are the directives and the decision-grammars, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah direct by the hand of mose-extracted unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards in the plains of moab-from-father by jordan-its-going-down near jericho-moon-smell. ’eleh hamizvot vehamishpatim ’asher zivah yhvh beyad mosheh ’el benei yisra’el, be‘arbot mo’ab ‘al yarden yerekho.
alh hdbrym aSr dbr mSh al kl ySral bebr hyrdn bmdbr berbh mwl swp byn parn wbyn tpl wlbn wxzrt wdy chb these be the bee-words which mose-extracted spake unto all israel-juicy-towards on this side jordan-its-going-down in the place-of-word-desert, in the plain over against the end sea, between-bin paran-magnificence, and tophel-bland, and laban-white, and hazerot-gardens, and dizahab-enough-gold. ’eleh hadebarim ’asher diber mosheh ’el kal yisra’el be‘eber hayarden, bamidbar ba‘arabah mol suf ben paran uben tofel velaban vakhazerot vedi zahab.
axd eSr ywm mxrb drk hr Seyr ed qdS brne (there are eleven days' journey from horeb-sword by the way of mount seir-hair-style unto kadeshbarnea-finished-desert-staggering.) ’akhad ‘asar yom mekhoreb derekh har se‘ir, ‘ad barnea‘.
wyhy barbeym Snh beSty eSr xdS baxd lxdS dbr mSh al bny ySral kkl aSr zwh yhwh atw alhm and it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that mose-extracted spake unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, according unto all that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had given him in directive unto them; vayhi be’arba‘im shanah be‘ashte ‘asar khodesh be’ekhad lakhodesh, diber mosheh ’el benei yisra’el kekhol ’asher zivah yhvh ’oto ’alehem.
axry hktw at syxn mlk hamry aSr ywSb bxSbwn wat ewg mlk hbSn aSr ywSb beStrt badrey after he had slain sihon-curly the king-moloch of the amorite-talkers, which dwelt in heshbon-score-supposition, and og-mock the king-moloch of bashan-at-tooth, which dwelt at astarot-you-gave-fire in edrei-live-prohibit: ’akharei hakoto sikhon melekh ha’emori ’asher yosheb bekheshbon, ve’et ‘og melekh habashan ’asher yosheb be‘ashtarot be’edre‘i.
bebr hyrdn barz mwab hwayl mSh bar at htwrh hcat lamr on this side jordan-its-going-down, in the land of moab-from-father, began mose-extracted to declare this teaching, saying, be‘eber hayarden be’erez mo’ab, ho’il mosheh be’er hatorah hazot lemor.
yhwh alhynw dbr alynw bxrb lamr rb lkm Sbt bhr hch yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these spake unto us in horeb-sword, saying, ye have dwelt long enough in this mount: yhvh ’elohenu diber ’elenu bekhoreb lemor, rab lakhem shebet bahar hazeh.
pnw wsew lkm wbaw hr hamry wal kl Sknyw berbh bhr wbSplh wbngb wbxwp hym arz hkneny whlbnwn ed hnhr hgdl nhr prt turn you, and take your journey, and go to the mount of the amorite-talkers, and unto all the places nigh thereunto, in the plain, in the hills, and in the vale, and in the south-dry, and by the sea side, to the land of the canaan-mobile-tradeites, and unto lebanon-build-white, unto the great river, the river euphrates-cow. penu use‘u lakhem ubo’u har ha’emori ve’el kal shekhenav ba‘arabah bahar ubashefelah ubanegeb ubekhof hayam, ’erez hakena‘ani vehalebanon ‘ad hanahar hagadol nehar perat.
rah ntty lpnykm at harz baw wrSw at harz aSr nSbe yhwh labtykm labrhm lyzxq wlyeqb ltt lhm wlcrem axryhm behold, i have set the land before-turns you: go in and possess the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sware unto your fathers, abraham-their-dick, isaac-laughter, and jacob-backstreet, to give unto them and to their seed after them. re’eh natati lifnekhem ha’arez, bo’u ureshu ha’arez ’asher nishba‘ yhvh la’abotekhem le’abraham leyizkhaq uleya‘aqob latet lahem ulezar‘am ’akharehem.
wamr alkm bet hhwa lamr la awkl lbdy Sat atkm and i spake unto you at that time, saying, i am not able to bear you myself alone: va’omar ’alekhem ba‘et hahiv lemor, lo ’ukhal lebadi se’et ’etkhem.
yhwh alhykm hrbh atkm whnkm hywm kkwkby hSmym lrb yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye are this day as the stars of namespaces for multitude. yhvh ’elohekhem hirbah ’etkhem, vehinekhem hayom kekhokhbei hashamayim larob.
yhwh alhy abwtkm ysp elykm kkm alp pemym wybrk atkm kaSr dbr lkm (yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of your fathers make you a thousand times so many more as ye are, and knee-fluffy-bless you, as he hath promised you!) yhvh ’elohei ’abotekhem yosef ‘alekhem kakhem ’elef pe‘amim, vibarekh ’etkhem ka’asher diber lakhem.
aykh aSa lbdy Trxkm wmSakm wrybkm how can i myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife? ’ekhah ’esa lebadi, tarekhakhem umasa’akhem veribekhem.
hbw lkm anSym xkmym wnbnym wydeym lSbTykm waSymm braSykm take you wise men, and understanding, and hand-known among your branchs, and i will make them rulers over you. habu lakhem ’anashim khakhamim unebonim vidu‘im leshibtekhem, va’asimem berashekhem.
wtenw aty wtamrw Twb hdbr aSr dbrt leSwt and ye answered me, and said, the thing which thou hast bee-spoken is good for us to do. vata‘anu ’oti, vatomeru tob hadabar ’asher dibarta la‘asot.
waqx at raSy SbTykm anSym xkmym wydeym watn atm raSym elykm Sry alpym wSry mawt wSry xmSym wSry eSrt wSTrym lSbTykm so i took the chief of your branchs, wise men, and hand-known, and made them heads over you, captains over thousands, and captains over hundreds, and captains over fifties, and captains over tens, and officers among your branchs. va’eqakh rashei shibtekhem ’anashim khakhamim vidu‘im va’eten ’otam rashim ‘alekhem, sarei ’alafim vesarei me’ot vesarei khamishim vesarei ‘asarot veshoterim leshibtekhem.
wazwh at SpTykm bet hhwa lamr Sme byn axykm wSpTtm zdq byn ayS wbyn axyw wbyn grw and i charged your decides at that time, saying, hear the causes between-bin your brethren, and decide justly between-bin every man and his brother, and the stranger that is with him. va’azaveh shofetekhem ba‘et hahiv lemor, shamoa‘ ben ’akhekhem ushefatem zedeq ben ’ish uben ’akhiv uben gero.
la tkyrw pnym bmSpT kqTn kgdl tSmewn la tgwrw mpny ayS ky hmSpT lalhym hwa whdbr aSr yqSh mkm tqrbwn aly wSmetyw ye not respect persons in decision-grammar; and ye hear the small as well as the great; ye not be afraid of the face-turns of man; for the decision-grammar is to-no-these's: and the cause that is too hard for you, bring it unto me, and i will hear it. lo takiru fanim bamishpat kaqaton kagadol tishma‘un lo taguru mipene ’ish ki hamishpat lelohim hu, vehadabar ’asher yiqsheh mikem taqribun ’elay ushema‘tiv.
wazwh atkm bet hhwa at kl hdbrym aSr teSwn and i direct you at that time all the things which ye should do. va’azaveh ’etkhem ba‘et hahiv, kal hadebarim ’asher ta‘asun.
wnse mxrb wnlk at kl hmdbr hgdwl whnwra hhwa aSr raytm drk hr hamry kaSr zwh yhwh alhynw atnw wnba ed qdS brne and when we departed from horeb-sword, we went through all that great and terrible place-of-word-desert, which ye saw by the way of the mountain of the amorite-talkers, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these direct us; and we came to kadeshbarnea-finished-desert-staggering. vanisa‘ mekhoreb vanelekh kal hamidbar hagadol vehanora hahu ’asher re’item derekh har ha’emori ka’asher zivah yhvh ’elohenu ’otanu, vanabo ‘ad barnea‘.
wamr alkm batm ed hr hamry aSr yhwh alhynw ntn lnw and i said unto you, ye are come unto the mountain of the amorite-talkers, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these doth give unto us. va’omar ’alekhem, batem ‘ad har ha’emori ’asher yhvh ’elohenu noten lanu.
rah ntn yhwh alhyk lpnyk at harz elh rS kaSr dbr yhwh alhy abtyk lk al tyra wal txt behold, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath set the land before-turns thee: go up and possess it, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of thy fathers hath said unto thee; fear not, neither be discouraged. re’eh natan yhvh ’elohekha lefanekha ha’arez, ‘aleh resh ka’asher diber yhvh ’elohei ’abotekha lakh ’al tira ve’al tekhat.
wtqrbwn aly klkm wtamrw nSlxh anSym lpnynw wyxprw lnw at harz wySbw atnw dbr at hdrk aSr nelh bh wat herym aSr nba alyhn and ye came near unto me every one of you, and said, we will send men before-turns us, and they search us out the land, and bring us bee-word again by what way we must go up, and into what cities we come. vatiqrebun ’elay kulekhem vatomeru nishlekhah ’anashim lefanenu veyakhperu lanu ha’arez, veyashibu ’otanu dabar ’et haderekh ’asher na‘aleh bah ve’et he‘arim ’asher nabo ’alehen.
wyyTb beyny hdbr waqx mkm Snym eSr anSym ayS axd lSbT and the saying pleased me well: and i took twelve men of you, one of a branch: vayitab be‘enay hadabar, va’eqakh mikem shenem ‘asar ’anashim ’ish ’ekhad lashabet.
wypnw wyelw hhrh wybaw ed nxl aSkl wyrglw ath and they turned and went up into the mountain, and came unto the valley of eshcol-fire-all, and searched it out. vayifnu vaya‘alu haharah vayabo’u ‘ad nakhal ’eshkol, vayragelu ’otah.
wyqxw bydm mpry harz wywrdw alynw wySbw atnw dbr wyamrw Twbh harz aSr yhwh alhynw ntn lnw and they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought it down unto us, and brought us bee-word again, and said, it is a good land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these doth give us. vayiqkhu beyadam miperi ha’arez vayoridu ’elenu, vayashibu ’otanu dabar vayomeru tobah ha’arez ’asher yhvh ’elohenu noten lanu.
wla abytm lelt wtmrw at py yhwh alhykm notwithstanding ye would not go up, and rebelled against the directive of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these: velo ’abitem la‘alot, vatamru pi yhvh ’elohekhem.
wtrgnw bahlykm wtamrw bSnat yhwh atnw hwzyanw marz mzrym ltt atnw byd hamry lhSmydnw and ye murmured in your tents, and said, because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hated us, he hath brought us forth out of the land of mizraim-narrows, to deliver us into the hand of the amorite-talkers, to destroy us. vateragenu be’aholekhem vatomeru besin’at yhvh ’otanu hozi’anu me’erez mizrayim, latet ’otanu beyad ha’emori lehashmidenu.
anh anxnw elym axynw hmsw at lbbnw lamr em gdwl wrm mmnw erym gdlt wbzwrt bSmym wgm bny enqym raynw Sm whither we go up? our brethren have discouraged our heart, saying, the with-mum-people is greater and taller than we; the cities are great and walled up to namespaces; and moreover we have seen children-betweens of the anak-giantims there. ’anah ’anakhnu ‘olim ’akhenu hemasu lebabenu lemor ‘am gadol varam mimenu ‘arim gedolot ubezurot bashamayim, vegam benei ‘anaqim ra’inu sham.
wamr alkm la terzwn wla tyrawn mhm then i said unto you, dread not, neither be afraid of them. va’omar ’alekhem, lo ta‘arzun velo tire’un mehem.
yhwh alhykm hhlk lpnykm hwa ylxm lkm kkl aSr eSh atkm bmzrym leynykm yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these which goeth before-turns you, he fight for you, according to all that he did for you in mizraim-narrows before-turns your eyes; yhvh ’elohekhem haholekh lifnekhem hu yilakhem lakhem, kekhol ’asher ‘asah ’itekhem bemizrayim le‘enekhem.
wbmdbr aSr rayt aSr nSak yhwh alhyk kaSr ySa ayS at bnw bkl hdrk aSr hlktm ed bakm ed hmqwm hch and in the place-of-word-desert, where thou hast seen how that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these conceived-of thee, as a man doth bear his child-between, in all the way that ye went, until ye came into this place. ubamidbar ’asher ra’ita ’asher nesa’akha yhvh ’elohekha ka’asher yisa ’ish beno, bekhal haderekh ’asher halakhtem ‘ad bo’akhem ‘ad hamaqom hazeh.
wbdbr hch aynkm mamynm byhwh alhykm yet in this thing ye did not be coached by yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, ubadabar hazeh, ’enekhem ma’aminim yhvh ’elohekhem.
hhlk lpnykm bdrk ltwr lkm mqwm lxntkm baS lylh lratkm bdrk aSr tlkw bh wbenn ywmm who went in the way before-turns you, to search you out a place to pitch your tents in, in fire by night, to show you by what way ye should go, and in a cloud by day. haholekh lifnekhem baderekh latur lakhem maqom lakhanotekhem, ba’esh laylah lar’otekhem baderekh ’asher telekhu bah ube‘anan yomam.
wySme yhwh at qwl dbrykm wyqzp wySbe lamr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah heard the voice of your bee-words, and was wroth, and sware, saying, vayishma‘ yhvh qol dibrekhem, vayiqzof vayishaba‘ lemor.
am yrah ayS banSym halh hdwr hre hch at harz hTwbh aSr nSbety ltt labtykm surely there not one of these men of this bad generation see that good land, which i sware to give unto your fathers. ’im yir’eh ’ish ba’anashim ha’eleh hador hara‘ hazeh, ha’arez hatobah ’asher nishba‘ti latet la’abotekhem.
cwlty klb bn ypnh hwa yranh wlw atn at harz aSr drk bh wlbnyw yen aSr mla axry yhwh save caleb-as-heart-dog child-between of jephuneh-turn; he see it, and to him will i give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his children-betweens, because he hath wholly followed yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. zulati kaleb ben yefuneh hu yir’enah velo ’eten ha’arez ’asher darakh bah ulebanav, ya‘an ’asher milei ’akharei yhvh.
gm by htanp yhwh bgllkm lamr gm ath la tba Sm also yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was angry with me for your sakes, saying, thou also not go in thither. gam bi hit’anaf yhvh biglalkhem lemor, gam ’atah lo tabo sham.
yhwSe bn nwn hemd lpnyk hwa yba Smh atw xcq ky hwa ynxlnh at ySral and joshua-jesus-save child-between of nun-fish, which standeth before-turns thee, he go in thither: encourage him: for he cause israel-juicy-towards to inherit it. yehoshua‘ bin nun ha‘omed lefanekha hu yabo shamah, ’oto khazeq ki hu yankhilenah yisra’el.
wTpkm aSr amrtm lbc yhyh wbnykm aSr la ydew hywm Twb wre hmh ybaw Smh wlhm atnnh whm yyrSwh moreover your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, and your children-betweens, which in that day had no knowledge between-bin good and bad, they go in thither, and unto them will i give it, and they possess it. vetapekhem ’asher ’amartem labaz yihyeh ubenekhem ’asher lo yade‘u hayom tob vara‘ hemah yabo’u shamah, velahem ’etenenah vehem yirashuha.
watm pnw lkm wsew hmdbrh drk ym swp and as for you, turn you, and take your journey into the place-of-word-desert by the way of the end sea. ve’atem penu lakhem, use‘u hamidbarah derekh yam suf.
wtenw wtamrw aly xTanw lyhwh anxnw nelh wnlxmnw kkl aSr zwnw yhwh alhynw wtxgrw ayS at kly mlxmtw wthynw lelt hhrh then ye answered and said unto me, we have missed to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, we will go up and fight, according to all that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these direct us. and when ye had girded on every man his weapons of war, ye were ready to go up into the hill. vata‘anu vatomeru ’elay khatanu yhvh ’anakhnu na‘aleh venilkhamnu kekhol ’asher zivanu yhvh ’elohenu, vatakhgeru ’ish ’et kelei milkhamto vatahinu la‘alot haharah.
wyamr yhwh aly amr lhm la telw wla tlxmw ky aynny bqrbkm wla tngpw lpny aybykm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, say unto them. go not up, neither fight; for i am not among you; lest ye be smitten before-turns your father-adversaries. vayomer yhvh ’elay ’emor lahem lo ta‘alu velo tilakhamu ki ’eneni beqirbekhem, velo tinagefu lifnei ’oyebekhem.
wadbr alykm wla Smetm wtmrw at py yhwh wtcdw wtelw hhrh so i spake unto you; and ye would not hear, and rebelled against the directive of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and went presumptuously up into the hill. va’adaber ’alekhem velo shema‘tem, vatamru pi yhvh vatazidu vata‘alu haharah.
wyza hamry hySb bhr hhwa lqratkm wyrdpw atkm kaSr teSynh hdbrym wyktw atkm bSeyr ed xrmh and the amorite-talkers, which dwelt in that mountain, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and destroyed you in seir-hair-style, even unto hormah-boycott-fishing-net. vayezei ha’emori hayosheb bahar hahu liqratkhem vayirdefu ’etkhem ka’asher ta‘asenah hadeborim, vayaketu ’etkhem bese‘ir ‘ad kharemah.
wtSbw wtbkw lpny yhwh wla Sme yhwh bqlkm wla hacyn alykm and ye returned and wept before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah would not hearken to your voice, nor give ear unto you. vatashubu vatibku lifnei yhvh, velo shama‘ yhvh beqolekhem velo he’ezin ’alekhem.
wtSbw bqdS ymym rbym kymym aSr ySbtm so ye abode in kadesh-dedicated-finished many days, according unto the days that ye abode there. vateshebu beqadesh yamim rabim, kayamim ’asher yeshabtem.
wnpn wnse hmdbrh drk ym swp kaSr dbr yhwh aly wnsb at hr Seyr ymym rbym then we turned, and took our journey into the place-of-word-desert by the way of the end sea, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto me: and we compassed mount seir-hair-style many days. vanefen vanisa‘ hamidbarah derekh yam suf ka’asher diber yhvh ’elay, vanasab har se‘ir yamim rabim.
wyamr yhwh aly lamr and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto me, saying, vayomer yhvh ’elay lemor.
rb lkm sb at hhr hch pnw lkm zpnh ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you hide-northward. rab lakhem sob ’et hahar hazeh, penu lakhem zafonah.
wat hem zw lamr atm ebrym bgbwl axykm bny eSw hySbym bSeyr wyyraw mkm wnSmrtm mad and direct thou the with-mum-people, saying, ye are to pass through the coast of your brethren children-betweens of esau-do, which dwell in seir-hair-style; and they be afraid of you: take ye good heed unto yourselves therefore: ve’et ha‘am zav lemor ’atem ‘oberim bigbul ’akhekhem bene ‘esav hayoshebim bese‘ir, veyire’u mikem venishmartem me’od.
al ttgrw bm ky la atn lkm marzm ed mdrk kp rgl ky yrSh leSw ntty at hr Seyr meddle not with them; for i will not give you of their land, no, not so much as a foot breadth; because i have given mount seir-hair-style unto esau-do for a possession. ’al titgaru bam ki lo ’eten lakhem me’arzam ‘ad midrakh kaf ragel, ki yerushah le‘esav natati har se‘ir.
akl tSbrw matm bksp wakltm wgm mym tkrw matm bksp wStytm ye buy meat of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye also buy from-waters of them for money, that ye may drink. ’okhel tishberu me’itam bakesef va’akhaltem, vegam mayim tikhru me’itam bakesef ushetitem.
ky yhwh alhyk brkk bkl meSh ydk yde lktk at hmdbr hgdl hch ch arbeym Snh yhwh alhyk emk la xsrt dbr for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath knee-fluffy-blessed thee in all the works of thy hand: he knoweth thy walking through this great place-of-word-desert: these forty years yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath been with thee; thou hast lacked nothing. ki yhvh ’elohekha berakhkha bekhol ma‘aseh yadekha yada‘ lekhtekha hamidbar hagadol hazeh, zeh ’arba‘im shanah yhvh ’elohekha ‘imakh lo khasarta dabar.
wnebr mat axynw bny eSw hySbym bSeyr mdrk herbh maylt wmezyn gbr wnpn wnebr drk mdbr mwab and when we passed by from our brethren children-betweens of esau-do, which dwelt in seir-hair-style, through the way of the plain from elath, and from eziongaber-wood-strong-man, we turned and passed by the way of the place-of-word-desert of moab-from-father. vana‘abor me’et ’akhenu bene ‘esav hayoshebim bese‘ir miderekh ha‘arabah me’elat ume‘ezyon gaber, vanefen vana‘abor derekh midbar mo’ab.
wyamr yhwh aly al tzr at mwab wal ttgr bm mlxmh ky la atn lk marzw yrSh ky lbny lwT ntty at er yrSh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, distress not the moab-from-fatherites, neither contend with them in battle: for i will not give thee of their land for a possession; because i have given ar-awake unto children-betweens of lot-cover for a possession. vayomer yhvh ’elay ’el tazar mo’ab ve’al titgar bam milkhamah, ki lo ’eten lekha me’arzo yerushah ki libne lot natati ‘ar yerushah
hamym lpnym ySbw bh em gdwl wrb wrm kenqym the emims dwelt therein in times past, a with-mum-people great, and many, and tall, as the anak-giantims; ha’emim lefanim yashebu bah, ‘am gadol verab varam ka‘anaqim.
rpaym yxSbw ap hm kenqym whmabym yqraw lhm amym which also were accounted giants, as the anak-giantims; and the moab-from-fatherites called them emims. refa’im yekhashebu ’af hem ka‘anaqim, vehamo’abim yiqre’u lahem ’emim.
wbSeyr ySbw hxrym lpnym wbny eSw yyrSwm wySmydwm mpnyhm wySbw txtm kaSr eSh ySral larz yrStw aSr ntn yhwh lhm the hori-my-holems also dwelt in seir-hair-style beforetime; and children-betweens of esau-do succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before-turns them, and dwelt in their stead; as israel-juicy-towards did unto the land of his possession, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah gave unto them. ubese‘ir yashebu hakhorim lefanim ubenei ‘esav yirashum vayashmidum mipenehem vayeshebu takhtam, ka’asher ‘asah yisra’el le’erez yerushato ’asher natan yhvh lahem.
eth qmw webrw lkm at nxl crd wnebr at nxl crd now rise up, said i, and get you over the brook zered-twig. and we went over the brook zered-twig. ‘atah qumu ve‘ibru lakhem nakhal zared, vana‘abor nakhal zared.
whymym aSr hlknw mqdS brne ed aSr ebrnw at nxl crd SlSym wSmnh Snh ed tm kl hdwr anSy hmlxmh mqrb hmxnh kaSr nSbe yhwh lhm and the space in which we came from kadeshbarnea-finished-desert-staggering, until we were come over the brook zered-twig, was thirty and eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from inward the troop-cluster, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sware unto them. vehayamim ’asher halakhnu miqadesh barnea‘ ‘ad ’asher ‘abarnu ’et nakhal zered sheloshim ushemoneh shanah, ‘ad tom kal hador ’anshei hamilkhamah miqereb hamakhaneh ka’asher nishba‘ yhvh lahem.
wgm yd yhwh hyth bm lhmm mqrb hmxnh ed tmm for indeed the hand of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was against them, to destroy them from inward the troop-cluster, until they were consumed. vegam yad yhvh hayetah bam lehumam miqereb hamakhaneh, ‘ad tumam.
wyhy kaSr tmw kl anSy hmlxmh lmwt mqrb hem so it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from inward the with-mum-people, vayhi kha’asher tamu kal ’anshei hamilkhamah lamut miqereb ha‘am..
wydbr yhwh aly lamr that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto me, saying, vaydaber yhvh ’elay lemor.
ath ebr hywm at gbwl mwab at er thou art to pass over through ar-awake, the coast of moab-from-father, this day: ’atah ‘ober hayom gebul mo’ab ‘ar.
wqrbt mwl bny emwn al tzrm wal ttgr bm ky la atn marz bny emwn lk yrSh ky lbny lwT nttyh yrSh and when thou comest nigh over against children-betweens of ammon-with, distress them not, nor meddle with them: for i will not give thee of the land of children-betweens of ammon-with any possession; because i have given it unto children-betweens of lot-cover for a possession. veqarabta mul benei ‘amon ’al tezurem ve’al titgar bam, ki lo ’eten me’erez bene ‘amon lekha yerushah ki libne lot netatiha yerushah.
arz rpaym txSb ap hwa rpaym ySbw bh lpnym whemnym yqraw lhm cmcmym (that also was accounted a land of giants: giants dwelt therein in old time; and the ammon-withites call them zamzumim-buzzers; ’erez refa’im tekhasheb ’af hi refa’im yashebu bah lefanim veha‘amonim yiqre’u lahem zamzumim.
em gdwl wrb wrm kenqym wySmydm yhwh mpnyhm wyyrSm wySbw txtm a with-mum-people great, and many, and tall, as the anak-giantims; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah destroyed them before-turns them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead: ‘am gadol verab varam ka‘anaqim, vayashmidem yhvh mipenehem vayirashum vayeshebu takhtam.
kaSr eSh lbny eSw hySbym bSeyr aSr hSmyd at hxry mpnyhm wyyrSm wySbw txtm ed hywm hch as he did to children-betweens of esau-do, which dwelt in seir-hair-style, when he destroyed the hori-my-holems from before-turns them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day: ka’asher ‘asah libnei ‘esav hayoshebim bese‘ir, ’asher hishmid hakhori mipenehem vayirashum vayeshebu takhtam ‘ad hayom hazeh.
whewym hySbym bxzrym ed ech kptrym hyzaym mkptwr hSmydm wySbw txtm and the avims-awful which dwelt in hazerim-premises, even unto azah-goat-courage, the caphtor-button-solvedim-buttonss, which came forth out of caphtor-button-solved, destroyed them, and dwelt in their stead.) veha‘avim hayoshebim bakhazerim ‘ad ‘azah, kaftorim hayoze’im mikaftor hishmidum vayeshebu takhtam.
qwmw sew webrw at nxl arnn rah ntty bydk at syxn mlk xSbwn hamry wat arzw hxl rS whtgr bw mlxmh rise ye up, take your journey, and pass over the river arnon-pine: behold, i have given into thine hand sihon-curly the amorite-talker, king-moloch of heshbon-score-supposition, and his land: begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle. qumu se‘u ve‘ibru nakhal ’arnon re’eh natati beyadekha sikhon melekh kheshbon ha’emori ve’et ’arzo hakhel rash, vehitgar bo milkhamah.
hywm hch axl tt pxdk wyratk el pny hemym txt kl hSmym aSr ySmewn Smek wrgcw wxlw mpnyk this day will i begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the nations that are under the whole namespaces, who hear report of thee, and tremble, and be in anguish because of thee. hayom hazeh ’akhel tet pakhdekha veyir’atekha ‘al penei ha‘amim takhat kal hashamayim, ’asher yishme‘un shim‘akha veragezu vekhalu mipanekha
waSlx mlakym mmdbr qdmwt al syxwn mlk xSbwn dbry Slwm lamr and i sent messengers out of the place-of-word-desert of kedemoth-advancement-old-days unto sihon-curly king-moloch of heshbon-score-supposition with bee-words of peace, saying, va’eshlakh mal’akhim mimidbar qedemot ’el sikhon melekh kheshbon, dibrei shalom lemor.
aebrh barzk bdrk bdrk alk la aswr ymyn wSmawl let me pass through thy land: i will go along by the high way, i will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left. ’e‘berah be’arzekha baderekh baderekh ’elekh, lo ’asur yamin usemol.
akl bksp tSbrny waklty wmym bksp ttn ly wStyty rq aebrh brgly thou sell me meat for money, that i may eat; and give me from-waters for money, that i may drink: only i will pass through on my feet; ’okhel bakesef tashbireni ve’akhalti umayim bakesef titen li veshatiti, raq ’e‘berah beraglay.
kaSr eSw ly bny eSw hySbym bSeyr whmwabym hySbym ber ed aSr aebr at hyrdn al harz aSr yhwh alhynw ntn lnw (as children-betweens of esau-do which dwell in seir-hair-style, and the moab-from-fatherites which dwell in ar-awake, did unto me;) until i pass over jordan-its-going-down into the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these giveth us. ka’asher ‘asu li benei ‘esav hayoshebim bese‘ir vehamo’abim hayoshebim be‘ar, ‘ad ’asher ’e‘ebor hayarden ’el ha’arez ’asher yhvh ’elohenu noten lanu.
wla abh syxn mlk xSbwn hebrnw bw ky hqSh yhwh alhyk at rwxw wamz at lbbw lmen ttw bydk kywm hch and sihon-curly king-moloch of heshbon-score-supposition would not let us pass by him: for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hardened his breath-spirit, and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into thy hand, as appeareth this day. velo ’abah sikhon melekh kheshbon ha‘abirenu bo, ki hiqshah yhvh ’elohekha rukho ve’imez lebabo lema‘an tito beyadekha kayom hazeh.
wyamr yhwh aly rah hxlty tt lpnyk at syxn wat arzw hxl rS lrSt at arzw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, behold, i have begun to give sihon-curly and his land before-turns thee: begin to possess, that thou mayest inherit his land. vayomer yhvh ’elay re’eh hakhiloti tet lefanekha sikhon ve’et ’arzo, hakhel rash lareshet ’arzo.
wyza syxn lqratnw hwa wkl emw lmlxmh yhzh then sihon-curly came out against us, he and all his with-mum-people, to fight at jahaz-stress. vayezei sikhon liqratenu hu vekhal ‘amo lamilkhamah yahezah.
wytnhw yhwh alhynw lpnynw wnk atw wat bnw bnyw wat kl emw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these delivered him before-turns us; and we smote him, and his children-betweens, and all his with-mum-people. vayitenehu yhvh ’elohenu lefanenu, vanakh ’oto ve’et banav ve’et kal ‘amo.
wnlkd at kl eryw bet hhwa wnxrm at kl eyr mtm whnSym whTp la hSarnw Sryd and we took all his cities at that time, and fishing-net-destroyed the men, and the women, and the little ones, of every light-city, we left none to remain: vanilkod kal ‘arav ba‘et hahiv vanakharem kal ‘ir metim vehanashim vehataf, lo hish’arnu sarid.
rq hbhmh bccnw lnw wSll herym aSr lkdnw only the in-them-animal we took for a prey unto ourselves, and the spoil of the cities which we took. raq habehemah bazaznu lanu, ushelal he‘arim ’asher lakhadenu.
merer aSr el Spt nxl arnn wheyr aSr bnxl wed hgled la hyth qryh aSr Sgbh mmnw at hkl ntn yhwh alhynw lpnynw from aroer-juniper-object, which is by the brink of the river of arnon-pine, and from the light-city that is by the river, even unto gilead-roll-until-heap, there was not one light-city too strong for us: yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these delivered all unto us: me‘aro‘er ’asher ‘al sefat nakhal ’arnon veha‘ir ’asher banakhal ve‘ad hagil‘ad lo hayetah qiryah ’asher sagebah mimenu, hakol natan yhvh ’elohenu lefanenu.
rq al arz bny emwn la qrbt kl yd nxl ybq wery hhr wkl aSr zwh yhwh alhynw only unto the land of children-betweens of ammon-with thou camest not, nor unto any place of the river jaboq-boxwood, nor unto the cities in the mountains, nor unto whatsoever yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these forbade us. raq ’el ’erez bene ‘amon lo qarabeta, kal yad nakhal yaboq ve‘arei hahar vekhol ’asher zivah yhvh ’elohenu.
wnpn wnel drk hbSn wyza ewg mlk hbSn lqratnw hwa wkl emw lmlxmh adrey then we turned, and went up the way to bashan-at-tooth: and og-mock the king-moloch of bashan-at-tooth came out against us, he and all his with-mum-people, to battle at edrei-live-prohibit. vanefen vana‘al derekh habashan, vayezei ‘og melekh habashan liqratenu hu vekhal ‘amo lamilkhamah ’edre‘i.
wyamr yhwh aly al tyra atw ky bydk ntty atw wat kl emw wat arzw weSyt lw kaSr eSyt lsyxn mlk hamry aSr ywSb bxSbwn and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, fear him not: for i will deliver him, and all his with-mum-people, and his land, into thy hand; and thou do unto him as thou didst unto sihon-curly king-moloch of the amorite-talkers, which dwelt at heshbon-score-supposition. vayomer yhvh ’elay ’al tira ’oto ki beyadekha natati ’oto ve’et kal ‘amo ve’et ’arzo, ve‘asita lo ka’asher ‘asita lesikhon melekh ha’emori ’asher yosheb bekheshbon.
wytn yhwh alhynw bydnw gm at ewg mlk hbSn wat kl emw wnkhw ed blty hSayr lw Sryd so yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these delivered into our hands og-mock also, the king-moloch of bashan-at-tooth, and all his with-mum-people: and we smote him until none was left to him remaining. vayiten yhvh ’elohenu beyadenu gam ‘og melekh habashan ve’et kal ‘amo, vanakehu ‘ad bilti hish’ir lo sarid.
wnlkd at kl eryw bet hhwa la hyth qryh aSr la lqxnw matm SSym eyr kl xbl argb mmlkt ewg bbSn and we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of argob-lump, the king-molochdom of og-mock in bashan-at-tooth. vanilkod kal ‘arav ba‘et hahiv lo hayetah qiryah ’asher lo laqakhnu me’itam, shishim ‘ir kal khebel ’argob mamlekhet ‘og babashan.
kl alh erym bzrwt xwmh gbhh dltym wbryx lbd mery hprcy hrbh mad all these cities were fenced with high walls, hair-gates, and bars; beside unwalled towns a great many. kal ’eleh ‘arim bezurot khomah gebohah delatayim uberiakh, lebad me‘arei haperazi harbeh me’od.
wnxrm awtm kaSr eSynw lsyxn mlk xSbwn hxrm kl eyr mtm hnSym whTp and we fishing-net-destroyed them, as we did unto sihon-curly king-moloch of heshbon-score-supposition, utterly destroying the men, women, and children-betweens, of every light-city. vanakharem ’otam ka’asher ‘asinu lesikhon melekh kheshbon, hakharem kal ‘ir metim hanashim vehataf.
wkl hbhmh wSll herym bcwnw lnw and all the in-them-animal, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a prey to ourselves. vekhal habehemah ushelal he‘arim bazonu lanu.
wnqx bet hhwa at harz myd Sny mlky hamry aSr bebr hyrdn mnxl arnn ed hr xrmwn and we took at that time out of the hand of the two king-molochs of the amorite-talkers the land that was on this side jordan-its-going-down, from the river of arnon-pine unto mount hermon-fishing-net; vaniqakh ba‘et hahiv ha’arez miyad shenei malkhei ha’emori ’asher be‘eber hayarden, minakhal ’arnon ‘ad har khermon.
zydnym yqraw lxrmwn Sryn whamry yqraw lw Snyr (which hermon-fishing-net the sidon-side-by-sideians call sirion-armor-plate; and the amorite-talkers call it meadow-tooth;) zidonim yiqre’u lekhermon siryon, veha’emori yiqre’u lo senir.
kl ery hmySr wkl hgled wkl hbSn ed slkh wadrey ery mmlkt ewg bbSn all the cities of the plain, and all gilead-roll-until-heap, and all bashan-at-tooth, unto salchah-poor and edrei-live-prohibit, cities of the king-molochdom of og-mock in bashan-at-tooth. kol ‘arei hamishor vekhal hagil‘ad vekhal habashan ‘ad salkhah ve’edre‘i, ‘arei mamlekhet ‘og babashan.
ky rq ewg mlk hbSn nSar mytr hrpaym hnh erSw erS brcl hlh hwa brbt bny emwn tSe amwt arkh warbe amwt rxbh bamt ayS for only og-mock king-moloch of bashan-at-tooth remained of the remnant of giants; behold his bedstead was a bedstead of iron; is it not in rabat-much of children-betweens of ammon-with? nine cubits was the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man. ki raq ‘og melekh habashan nish’ar miyeter harefa’im hineh ‘arso ‘eres barzel haloh hi berabat benei ‘amon, tesha‘ ’amot ’arekah ve’arba‘ ’amot rakhebah be’amat ’ish.
wat harz hcat yrSnw bet hhwa merer aSr el nxl arnn wxzy hr hgled weryw ntty lrawbny wlgdy and this land, which we possessed at that time, from aroer-juniper-object, which is by the river arnon-pine, and half mount gilead-roll-until-heap, and the cities thereof, gave i unto the reuben-see-childites and to the gad-tell-luckites. ve’et ha’arez hazot yarashnu ba‘et hahiv, me‘aro‘er ’asher ‘al nakhal ’arnon vakhazi har hagil‘ad ve‘arav natati laru’ubeni velagadi.
wytr hgled wkl hbSn mmlkt ewg ntty lxzy SbT hmnSh kl xbl hargb lkl hbSn hhwa yqra arz rpaym and the rest of gilead-roll-until-heap, and all bashan-at-tooth, being the king-molochdom of og-mock, gave i unto the half branch of manasseh-place-of-sleep; all the region of argob-lump, with all bashan-at-tooth, which was called the land of giants. veyeter hagil‘ad vekhal habashan mamlekhet ‘og natati lakhazi shebet hamnasheh, kol khebel ha’argob lekhal habashan hahu yiqarei ’erez refa’im.
yayr bn mnSh lqx at kl xbl argb ed gbwl hgSwry whmekty wyqra atm el Smw at hbSn xwt yayr ed hywm hch jair-glow child-between of manasseh-place-of-sleep took all the country of argob-lump unto the coasts of geshuri-bridge and maachathi; and called them after his own name, jair-at-tooth-ranches-shine-bashan-havot, unto this day. ya’ir ben menasheh laqakh kal khebel ’argob ‘ad gebul hageshuri vehama‘akhati, vayiqra ‘al shemo habashan khavot ya’ir ‘ad hayom hazeh.
wlmkyr ntty at hgled and i gave gilead-roll-until-heap unto machi-of-beatr-recognize. ulemakhir natati hagil‘ad.
wlrawbny wlgdy ntty mn hgled wed nxl arnn twk hnxl wgbl wed ybq hnxl gbwl bny emwn and unto the reuben-see-childites and unto the gad-tell-luckites i gave from gilead-roll-until-heap even unto the river arnon-pine half the valley, and the border even unto the river jaboq-boxwood, which is the border of children-betweens of ammon-with; velaru’ubeni velagadi natati min hagil‘ad ve‘ad nakhal ’arnon tokh hanakhal ugebul, ve‘ad yaboq hanakhal gebul benei ‘amon.
wherbh whyrdn wgbl mknrt wed ym herbh ym hmlx txt aSdt hpsgh mcrxh the plain also, and jordan-its-going-down, and the coast thereof, from kineret-like-candle even unto the sea of the plain, even the salt sea, under peak-fire-being right eastward. veha‘arabah vehayarden ugebul, mikineret ve‘ad yam ha‘arabah yam hamelakh takhat ’ashdot hapisgah mizrakhah.
wazw atkm bet hhwa lamr yhwh alhykm ntn lkm at harz hcat lrSth xlwzym tebrw lpny axykm bny ySral kl bny xyl and i direct you at that time, saying, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these hath given you this land to possess it: ye pass over armed before-turns your brethren children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, all that are until-witness for the war. va’azav ’etkhem ba‘et hahiv lemor, yhvh ’elohekhem natan lakhem ha’arez hazot lerishtah khaluzim ta‘abru lifnei ’akhekhem bene yisra’el kal bene khayil.
rq nSykm wTpkm wmqnkm ydety ky mqnh rb lkm ySbw berykm aSr ntty lkm and your women, and your little ones, and your in-them-animal, (for i hand-know that ye have much in-them-animal,) abide in your cities which i have given you; raq neshekhem vetapekhem umiqnekhem yada‘ti ki miqneh rab lakhem, yeshebu be‘arekhem ’asher natati lakhem.
ed aSr ynyx yhwh laxykm kkm wyrSw gm hm at harz aSr yhwh alhykm ntn lhm bebr hyrdn wSbtm ayS lyrStw aSr ntty lkm until yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah have given rest unto your brethren, as well as unto you, and until they also possess the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these hath given them beyond jordan-its-going-down: and then ye return every man unto his possession, which i have given you. ‘ad ’asher yaniakh yhvh la’akhekhem kakhem veyareshu gam hem ha’arez ’asher yhvh ’elohekhem noten lahem be‘eber hayarden, veshabtem ’ish lirushato ’asher natati lakhem.
wat yhwSwe zwyty bet hhwa lamr eynyk hrat at kl aSr eSh yhwh alhykm lSny hmlkym halh kn yeSh yhwh lkl hmmlkwt aSr ath ebr Smh and i direct joshua-jesus-save at that time, saying, thine eyes have seen all that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these hath done unto these two king-molochs: so yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah do unto all the king-molochdoms whither thou passest. ve’et yehoshua‘ ziveti ba‘et hahiv lemor, ‘enekha haro’ot kal ’asher ‘asah yhvh ’elohekhem lishnei hamelakhim ha’eleh ken ya‘aseh yhvh lekhal hamamlakhot ’asher ’atah ‘ober shamah.
la tyrawm ky yhwh alhykm hwa hnlxm lkm ye not fear them: for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these he fight for you. lo tira’um, ki yhvh ’elohekhem hu hanilkham lakhem.
watxnn al yhwh bet hhwa lamr and i besought yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah at that time, saying, va’etkhanan ’el yhvh, ba‘et hahiv lemor.
adny yhwh ath hxlwt lhrawt at ebdk at gdlk wat ydk hxcqh aSr my al bSmym wbarz aSr yeSh kmeSyk wkgbwrtk o base-lord to-no-these, thou hast begun to show thy worker thy greatness, and thy mighty hand: for what to-no-these is there in namespaces or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy might? ’adonay yhvh ’atah hakhilota lehar’ot ‘abdekha gadelekha ve’et yadekha hakhazaqah, ’asher mi ’el bashamayim uba’arez ’asher ya‘aseh khema‘asekha vekhigburotekha.
aebrh na warah at harz hTwbh aSr bebr hyrdn hhr hTwb hch whlbnwn i pray thee, let me go over, and see the good land that is beyond jordan-its-going-down, that goodly mountain, and lebanon-build-white. ’e‘berah na ve’er’eh ha’arez hatobah ’asher be‘eber hayarden, hahar hatob hazeh vehalebanon.
wytebr yhwh by lmenkm wla Sme aly wyamr yhwh aly rb lk al twsp dbr aly ewd bdbr hch and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was wroth with me for your sakes, and would not hear me: and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, let it suffice thee; speak no more unto me of this matter. vayit‘aber yhvh bi lema‘ankhem velo shama‘ ’elay, vayomer yhvh ’elay rab lakh ’al tosef daber ’elay ‘od badabar hazeh.
elh raS hpsgh wSa eynyk ymh wzpnh wtymnh wmcrxh wrah beynyk ky la tebr at hyrdn hch get thee up into the top of pisgah-summit, and lift up thine eyes sea-westward, and hide-northward, and south-dryward, and eastward, and behold it with thine eyes: for no go over this jordan-its-going-down. ‘aleh rosh hapisgah vesa ‘enekha yamah vezafonah vetemanah umizrakhah ure’eh be‘enekha, ki lo ta‘abor hayarden hazeh.
wzw at yhwSe wxcqhw wamzhw ky hwa yebr lpny hem hch whwa ynxyl awtm at harz aSr trah and charge joshua-jesus-save, and encourage him, and strengthen him: for he go over before-turns this with-mum-people, and he cause them to inherit the land which thou see. vezav yehoshua‘ vekhazeqehu ve’amezehu, ki hu ya‘abor lifnei ha‘am hazeh vehu yankhil ’otam ha’arez ’asher tir’eh.
wnSb bgya mwl byt pewr so we abode in the valley over against betpeor-house-gaping. vanesheb bagay mul bet pe‘or.
weth ySral Sme al hxqym wal hmSpTym aSr anky mlmd atkm leSwt lmen txyw wbatm wyrStm at harz aSr yhwh alhy abtykm ntn lkm now therefore hearken, o israel-juicy-towards, unto the statutes and unto the decision-grammars, which i teach you, for to do them, that ye may live, and go in and possess the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of your fathers giveth you. ve‘atah yisra’el shema‘ ’el hakhuqim ve’el hamishpatim ’asher ’anokhi melamed ’etkhem la‘asot, lema‘an tikhyu ubatem virishtem ha’arez ’asher yhvh ’elohei ’abotekhem noten lakhem.
la tspw el hdbr aSr anky mzwh atkm wla tgrew mmnw lSmr at mzwt yhwh alhykm aSr anky mzwh atkm ye not add unto the bee-word which i direct you, neither ye diminish ought from it, that ye may keep the directives of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these which i direct you. lo tosifu ‘al hadabar ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem velo tigre‘u mimenu, lishmor mizvot yhvh ’elohekhem ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem.
eynykm hrat at aSr eSh yhwh bbel pewr ky kl hayS aSr hlk axry bel pewr hSmydw yhwh alhyk mqrbk your eyes have seen what yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah did because of baalpeor-own-wide-open: for all the men that followed baalpeor-own-wide-open, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath destroyed them from inward you. ‘enekhem haro’ot ’asher ‘asah yhvh beba‘al pe‘or, ki khal ha’ish ’asher halakh ba‘al pe‘or hishmido yhvh ’elohekha miqirbekha.
watm hdbqym byhwh alhykm xyym klkm hywm and ye that did cleave unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these are alive every one of you this day. ve’atem hadebeqim yhvh ’elohekhem, khayim kulekhem hayom.
rah lmdty atkm xqym wmSpTym kaSr zwny yhwh alhy leSwt kn bqrb harz aSr atm baym Smh lrSth behold, i have taught you statutes and decision-grammars, even as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah my to-no-these direct me, that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to possess it. re’eh limadti ’etkhem khuqim umishpatim ka’asher zivani yhvh ’elohay, la‘asot ken beqereb ha’arez ’asher ’atem ba’im shamah lerishtah.
wSmrtm weSytm ky hwa xkmtkm wbyntkm leyny hemym aSr ySmewn at kl hxqym halh wamrw rq em xkm wnbwn hgwy hgdwl hch keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which hear all these statutes, and say, surely this great nation is a wise and understanding with-mum-people. ushemartem va‘asitem ki hi khakhematkhem ubinatkhem le‘enei ha‘amim, ’asher yishme‘un kal hakhuqim ha’eleh ve’ameru raq ‘am khakham venabon hago hagadol hazeh.
ky my gwy gdwl aSr lw alhym qrbym alyw kyhwh alhynw bkl qranw alyw for what nation is there so great, who hath to-no-these so nigh unto them, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these is in all things that we call upon him for? ki mi go gadol ’asher lo ’elohim qerobim ’elav, yhvh ’elohenu bekhal qare’enu ’elav.
wmy gwy gdwl aSr lw xqym wmSpTym zdyqm kkl htwrh hcat aSr anky ntn lpnykm hywm and what nation is there so great, that hath statutes and decision-grammars so just as all this teaching, which i set before-turns you this day? umi go gadol ’asher lo khuqim umishpatim zadiqim, kekhol hatorah hazot ’asher ’anokhi noten lifnekhem hayom.
rq hSmr lk wSmr npSk mad pn tSkx at hdbrym aSr raw eynyk wpn yswrw mlbbk kl ymy xyyk whwdetm lbnyk wlbny bnyk only take heed to thyself, and keep thy being diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes have seen, and lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life: and teach them thy children-betweens, and thy children-betweens' children-betweens; raq hishamer lekha ushemor nafshekha me’od pen tishkakh hadebarim ’asher ra’u ‘enekha ufen yasuru milebabekha kol yemei khayekha, vehoda‘tam lebanekha velibnei banekha.
ywm aSr emdt lpny yhwh alhyk bxrb bamr yhwh aly hqhl ly at hem waSmem at dbry aSr ylmdwn lyrah aty kl hymym aSr hm xyym el hadmh wat bnyhm ylmdwn specially the day that thou stoodest before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these in horeb-sword, when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, gather me the with-mum-people together, and i will make them hear my bee-words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live upon the earth, and that they may teach their children-betweens. yom ’asher ‘amadta lifnei yhvh ’elohekha bekhoreb be’emor yhvh ’elay haqhel li ha‘am ve’ashmi‘em debaray, ’asher yilmedun leyir’ah ’oti kal hayamim ’asher hem khayim ‘al ha’adamah ve’et benehem yelamedun.
wtqrbwn wtemdwn txt hhr whhr ber baS ed lb hSmym xSk enn werpl and ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire unto the midst of namespaces, with darkness, clouds, and thick darkness. vatiqrebun vata‘amdun takhat hahar, vehahar bo‘er ba’esh ‘ad leb hashamayim khoshekh ‘anan va‘arafel.
wydbr yhwh alykm mtwk haS qwl dbrym atm Smeym wtmwnh aynkm raym cwlty qwl and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye heard the voice of the bee-words, and saw no similitude; only ye heard a voice. vaydaber yhvh ’alekhem mitokh ha’esh, qol debarim ’atem shome‘im utemunah ’enekhem ro’im zulati qol.
wygd lkm at brytw aSr zwh atkm leSwt eSrt hdbrym wyktbm el Sny lxwt abnym and he declared unto you his covenant, which he direct you to perform, even ten directives; and he wrote them upon two tables of father-child-stone. vayaged lakhem berito ’asher zivah ’etkhem la‘asot ‘aseret hadebarim, vayikhtebem ‘al shenei lukhot ’abanim.
waty zwh yhwh bet hhwa llmd atkm xqym wmSpTym leStkm atm barz aSr atm ebrym Smh lrSth and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah direct me at that time to teach you statutes and decision-grammars, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it. ve’oti zivah yhvh ba‘et hahiv lelamed ’etkhem khuqim umishpatim, la‘asotekhem ’otam ba’arez ’asher ’atem ‘oberim shamah lerishtah.
wnSmrtm mad lnpStykm ky la raytm kl tmwnh bywm dbr yhwh alykm bxrb mtwk haS take ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner of similitude on the day that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto you in horeb-sword out of the midst of the fire: venishmartem me’od lenafshotekhem, ki lo re’item kal temunah beyom diber yhvh ’alekhem bekhoreb mitokh ha’esh.
pn tSxtwn weSytm lkm psl tmwnt kl sml tbnyt ckr aw nqbh lest ye corrupt yourselves, and make you a graven image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of rememberer or pierced, pen tashkhitun va‘asitem lakhem pesel temunat kal samel, tabnit zakhar ’o neqebah.
tbnyt kl bhmh aSr barz tbnyt kl zpwr knp aSr tewp bSmym the likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flieth in the ai-islandr, tabnit kal behemah ’asher ba’arez, tabnit kal zipor kanaf ’asher ta‘uf bashamayim.
tbnyt kl rmS badmh tbnyt kl dgh aSr bmym mtxt larz the likeness of any thing that creepeth on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the from-waters beneath the earth: tabnit kal romes ba’adamah, tabnit kal dagah ’asher bamayim mitakhat la’arez.
wpn tSa eynyk hSmymh wrayt at hSmS wat hyrx wat hkwkbym kl zba hSmym wndxt whStxwyt lhm webdtm aSr xlq yhwh alhyk atm lkl hemym txt kl hSmym and lest thou lift up thine eyes unto namespaces, and when thou seest the sun, and the moon, and the stars, even all the troop-cluster of namespaces, shouldest be driven to partake-shatakh them, and work for them, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath divided unto all nations under the whole namespaces. ufen tisa ‘enekha hashamaymah vera’ita hashemesh ve’et hayareakh ve’et hakokhabim kol zeba hashamayim venidakhta vehishtakhavita lahem va‘abadtam, ’asher khalaq yhvh ’elohekha lekhol ha‘amim takhat kal hashamayim.
watkm lqx yhwh wywza atkm mkwr hbrcl mmzrym lhywt lw lem nxlh kywm hch and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, even out of mizraim-narrows, to be unto him a with-mum-people of inheritance, as ye are this day. ve’etkhem laqakh yhvh vayozi ’etkhem mikur habarzel mimizrayim, lihyot lo le‘am nakhalah kayom hazeh.
wyhwh htanp by el dbrykm wySbe lblty ebry at hyrdn wlblty ba al harz hTwbh aSr yhwh alhyk ntn lk nxlh furthermore yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was angry with me for your sakes, and sware that i should not go over jordan-its-going-down, and that i should not go in unto that good land, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these giveth thee for an inheritance: yhvh hit’anef bi ‘al dibrekhem, vayishaba‘ lebilti ‘aberi hayarden ulebilti bo ’el ha’arez hatobah ’asher yhvh ’elohekha noten lekha nakhalah.
ky anky mt barz hcat aynny ebr at hyrdn watm ebrym wyrStm at harz hTwbh hcat and i must die in this land, i must not go over jordan-its-going-down: and ye go over, and possess that good land. ki ’anokhi met ba’arez hazot ’eneni ‘ober hayarden, ve’atem ‘oberim virishtem ha’arez hatobah hazot.
hSmrw lkm pn tSkxw at bryt yhwh alhykm aSr krt emkm weSytm lkm psl tmwnt kl aSr zwk yhwh alhyk take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, which he made with you, and make you a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath forbidden thee. hishameru lakhem pen tishkekhu berit yhvh ’elohekhem ’asher karat ‘imakhem, va‘asitem lakhem pesel temunat kol ’asher zivekha yhvh ’elohekha.
ky yhwh alhyk aS aklh hwa al qna for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these is a consuming fire, even a jealous to-no-these. ki yhvh ’elohekha ’esh ’okhelah hu, ’el qana.
ky twlyd bnym wbny bnym wnwSntm barz whSxtm weSytm psl tmwnt kl weSytm hre beyny yhwh alhyk lhkeysw when thou beget children-betweens, and children-betweens's children-betweens, and ye have remained long in the land, and corrupt yourselves, and make a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, and do bad in the sight of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, to provoke him to nose-anger: ki tolid banim ubenei banim venoshantem ba’arez, vehishkhatem va‘asitem pesel temunat kol va‘asitem hara‘ be‘enei yhvh ’elohekha lehakh‘iso.
heydty bkm hywm at hSmym wat harz ky abd tabdwn mhr mel harz aSr atm ebrym at hyrdn Smh lrSth la tarykn ymym elyh ky hSmd tSmdwn i call namespaces and earth to witness against you this day, that ye soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over jordan-its-going-down to possess it; ye not prolong your days upon it, and utterly be destroyed. ha‘idoti bakhem hayom hashamayim ve’et ha’arez ki ’abod tobedun maher me‘al ha’arez ’asher ’atem ‘oberim hayarden shamah lerishtah, lo ta’arikhun yamim ‘aleha ki hishamed tishamedun.
whpyz yhwh atkm bemym wnSartm mty mspr bgwym aSr ynhg yhwh atkm Smh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah scatter you among the nations, and ye be left few in number among the nations, whither yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah lead you. vehefiz yhvh ’etkhem ba‘amim, venish’artem metei mispar bagoyim ’asher yenaheg yhvh ’etkhem shamah.
webdtm Sm alhym meSh ydy adm ez wabn aSr la yrawn wla ySmewn wla yaklwn wla yryxn and there ye work for to-no-these, the work of men's hands, wood and father-child-stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell. va‘abadtem sham ’elohim ma‘aseh yedei ’adam, ‘ez va’eben ’asher lo yir’un velo yishme‘un velo yokhelun velo yerikhun.
wbqStm mSm at yhwh alhyk wmzat ky tdrSnw bkl lbbk wbkl npSk and if from thence thou seek yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, thou find him, if thou seek him with all thy heart and with all thy being. ubiqashtem misham yhvh ’elohekha umazata, ki tidreshenu bekhal lebabekha ubekhal nafshekha.
bzr lk wmzawk kl hdbrym halh baxryt hymym wSbt ed yhwh alhyk wSmet bqlw when thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, even in the latter days, if thou turn to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, and be hearing unto his voice; bazar lekha umeza’ukha kol hadebarim ha’eleh, be’akharit hayamim veshabta ‘ad yhvh ’elohekha veshama‘ta beqolo.
ky al rxwm yhwh alhyk la yrpk wla ySxytk wla ySkx at bryt abtyk aSr nSbe lhm (for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these is a merciful to-no-these;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them. ki ’el rakhum yhvh ’elohekha lo yarpekha velo yashkhitekha, velo yishkakh berit ’abotekha ’asher nishba‘ lahem.
ky Sal na lymym raSnym aSr hyw lpnyk lmn hywm aSr bra alhym adm el harz wlmqzh hSmym wed qzh hSmym hnhyh kdbr hgdwl hch aw hnSme kmhw for ask now of the days that are past, which were before-turns thee, since the day that to-no-these created man upon the earth, and ask from the one side of namespaces unto the other, whether there hath been any such thing as this great thing is, or hath been heard like it? ki she’al na leyamim rishonim ’asher hayu lefanekha lemin hayom ’asher bara ’elohim ’adam ‘al ha’arez ulemiqzeh hashamayim ve‘ad qezeh hashamayim, hanihyah kadabar hagadol hazeh ’o hanishma‘ kamohu.
hSme em qwl alhym mdbr mtwk haS kaSr Smet ath wyxy did ever with-mum-people hear the voice of to-no-these speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live? hashama‘ ‘am qol ’elohim medaber mitokh ha’esh ka’asher shama‘ta ’atah vayekhi.
aw hnsh alhym lbwa lqxt lw gwy mqrb gwy bmst batt wbmwptym wbmlxmh wbyd xcqh wbcrwe nTwyh wbmwraym gdlym kkl aSr eSh lkm yhwh alhykm bmzrym leynyk or hath to-no-these assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these did for you in mizraim-narrows before-turns your eyes? ’o hanisah ’elohim labo laqakhat lo go miqereb go bemasot be’otot ubemoftim ubemilkhamah ubeyad khazaqah ubizroa‘ netuyah ubemora’im gedolim, kekhol ’asher ‘asah lakhem yhvh ’elohekhem bemizrayim le‘enekha.
ath hrat ldet ky yhwh hwa halhym ayn ewd mlbdw unto thee it was showed, that thou mightest hand-know that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah he is to-no-these; there is none else beside him. ’atah hare’eta lada‘at ki yhvh hu ha’elohim, ’en ‘od milbado.
mn hSmym hSmyek at qlw lysrk wel harz hrak at aSw hgdwlh wdbryw Smet mtwk haS out of namespaces he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he showed thee his great fire; and thou heardest his bee-words out of the midst of the fire. min hashamayim hishmi‘akha qolo leyasereka, ve‘al ha’arez her’akha ’isho hagedolah udebarav shama‘ta mitokh ha’esh.
wtxt ky ahb at abtyk wybxr bcrew axryw wywzak bpnyw bkxw hgdl mmzrym and because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought thee out in his sight with his mighty dynamic out of mizraim-narrows; vetakhat ki ’ahab ’abotekha vayibkhar bezar‘o ’akharav, vayozi’akha befanav bekhokho hagadol mimizrayim.
lhwryS gwym gdlym wezmym mmk mpnyk lhbyak ltt lk at arzm nxlh kywm hch to drive out nations from before-turns thee greater and mightier than thou art, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an inheritance, as it is this day. lehorish goyim gedolim va‘azumim mimekha mipanekha, lahabi’akha latet lekha ’arzam nakhalah kayom hazeh.
wydet hywm whSbt al lbbk ky yhwh hwa halhym bSmym mmel wel harz mtxt ayn ewd hand-know therefore this day, and consider it in thine heart, that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah he is to-no-these in namespaces above, and upon the earth beneath: there is none else. veyada‘ta hayom vahashebota ’el lebabekha ki yhvh hu ha’elohim bashamayim mima‘al ve‘al ha’arez mitakhat, ’en ‘od.
wSmrt at xqyw wat mzwtyw aSr anky mzwk hywm aSr yyTb lk wlbnyk axryk wlmen taryk ymym el hadmh aSr yhwh alhyk ntn lk kl hymym thou keep therefore his statutes, and his directives, which i direct thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children-betweens after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days upon the earth, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these giveth thee, all days. veshamarta khuqav ve’et mizvotav ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom ’asher yitab lekha ulebanekha ’akharekha, ulema‘an ta’arikh yamim ‘al ha’adamah ’asher yhvh ’elohekha noten lekha kal hayamim.
ac ybdyl mSh SlS erym bebr hyrdn mcrxh SmS then mose-extracted severed three cities on this side jordan-its-going-down toward the sunrising; ’az yabdil mosheh shalosh ‘arim be‘eber hayarden, mizrekhah shamesh.
lns Smh rwzx aSr yrzx at rehw bbly det whwa la Sna lw mtmwl SlSwm wns al axt mn herym hal wxy that the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his neighbor unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live: lanus shamah rozeakh ’asher yirzakh re‘ehu bibli da‘at vehu lo sonei lo mitemol shilshom, venas ’el ’akhat min he‘arim ha’el vakhay.
at bzr bmdbr barz hmySr lrawbny wat ramt bgled lgdy wat gwln bbSn lmnSy namely, bezer-ore in the place-of-word-desert, in the plain country, of the reuben-see-childites; and ram-voicelessoth in gilead-roll-until-heap, of the gad-tell-luckites; and golan-wave-reveal in bashan-at-tooth, of the manassites-place-of-sleep. bezer bamidbar be’erez hamishor laru’ubeni, ve’et ramot bagil‘ad lagadi ve’et golan babashan lamnashi.
wcat htwrh aSr Sm mSh lpny bny ySral and this is the teaching which mose-extracted set before-turns children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards: vezot hatorah, ’asher sam mosheh lifnei benei yisra’el.
alh hedt whxqym whmSpTym aSr dbr mSh al bny ySral bzatm mmzrym these are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the decision-grammars, which mose-extracted spake unto children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards, after they came forth out of mizraim-narrows. ’eleh ha‘edot vehakhuqim vehamishpatim, ’asher diber mosheh ’el benei yisra’el bezetam mimizrayim.
bebr hyrdn bgya mwl byt pewr barz syxn mlk hamry aSr ywSb bxSbwn aSr hkh mSh wbny ySral bzatm mmzrym on this side jordan-its-going-down, in the valley over against betpeor-house-gaping, in the land of sihon-curly king-moloch of the amorite-talkers, who dwelt at heshbon-score-supposition, whom mose-extracted and children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards smote, after they were come forth out of mizraim-narrows: be‘eber hayarden bagay mul bet pe‘or be’erez sikhon melekh ha’emori ’asher yosheb bekheshbon, ’asher hikah mosheh ubenei yisra’el bezetam mimizrayim.
wyyrSw at arzw wat arz ewg mlk hbSn Sny mlky hamry aSr bebr hyrdn mcrx SmS and they possessed his land, and the land of og-mock king-moloch of bashan-at-tooth, two king-molochs of the amorite-talkers, which were on this side jordan-its-going-down toward the sunrising; vayireshu ’et ’arzo ve’et ’erez ‘og melekh habashan shenei malkhei ha’emori ’asher be‘eber hayarden, mizrakh shamesh.
merer aSr el Spt nxl arnn wed hr Syan hwa xrmwn from aroer-juniper-object, which is by the bank of the river arnon-pine, even unto mount sion-zenith, which is hermon-fishing-net, me‘aro‘er ’asher ‘al sefat nakhal ’arnon ve‘ad har si’on hu khermon.
wkl herbh ebr hyrdn mcrxh wed ym herbh txt aSdt hpsgh and all the plain on this side jordan-its-going-down eastward, even unto the sea of the plain, under the springs of pisgah-summit. vekhal ha‘arabah ‘eber hayarden mizrakhah ve‘ad yam ha‘arabah, takhat ’ashdot hapisgah.
wyqra mSh al kl ySral wyamr alhm Sme ySral at hxqym wat hmSpTym aSr anky dbr bacnykm hywm wlmdtm atm wSmrtm leStm and mose-extracted called all israel-juicy-towards, and said unto them, hear, o israel-juicy-towards, the statutes and decision-grammars which i speak in your ears this day, that ye may learn them, and keep, and do them. vayiqra mosheh ’el kal yisra’el vayomer ’alehem shema‘ yisra’el hakhuqim ve’et hamishpatim ’asher ’anokhi dober be’azenekhem hayom, ulemadtem ’otam ushemartem la‘asotam.
yhwh alhynw krt emnw bryt bxrb yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these made a covenant with us in horeb-sword. yhvh ’elohenu karat ‘imanu berit bekhoreb.
la at abtynw krt yhwh at hbryt hcat ky atnw anxnw alh ph hywm klnw xyym yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah made not this covenant with our fathers, and with us, even us, who are all of us here alive this day. lo ’et ’abotenu karat yhvh haberit hazot, ki ’itanu ’anakhnu ’eleh foh hayom kulanu khayim.
pnym bpnym dbr yhwh emkm bhr mtwk haS yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah talked with you face-turns to face-turns in the mount out of the midst of the fire, panim befanim diber yhvh ‘imakhem bahar mitokh ha’esh.
anky emd byn yhwh wbynykm bet hhwa lhgyd lkm at dbr yhwh ky yratm mpny haS wla elytm bhr lamr (i stood between-bin yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah and you at that time, to show you the bee-word of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: for ye were afraid by reason of the fire, and went not up into the mount;) saying, ’anokhi ‘omed ben yhvh ubenekhem ba‘et hahiv lehagid lakhem debar yhvh, ki yeretem mipenei ha’esh velo ‘alitem bahar lemor..
anky yhwh alhyk aSr hwzatyk marz mzrym mbyt ebdym i am yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, which brought thee out of the land of mizraim-narrows, from the daughter-house of bondage. ’anokhi yhvh ’elohekha ’asher hozetikha me’erez mizrayim mibet ‘abadim.
la yhyh lk alhym axrym el pny thou have none other to-no-these before-turns me. lo yihyeh lekha ’elohim ’akherim ‘al panaya.
la teSh lk psl kl tmwnh aSr bSmym mmel waSr barz mtxt waSr bmym mtxt larz no make thee any graven image, or any likeness of any thing that is in namespaces above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the from-waters beneath the earth: lo ta‘aseh lekha fesel kal temunah ’asher bashamayim mima‘al va’asher ba’arez mitakhat va’asher bamayim mitakhat la’arez.
la tStxwh lhm wla tebdm ky anky yhwh alhyk al qna pqd ewn abwt el bnym wel SlSym wel rbeym lSnay no bow down thyself unto them, nor work for them: for i yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these am a jealous to-no-these, visiting the torment of the fathers upon children-betweens unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate me, lo tishtakhaveh lahem velo ta‘abedem ki ’anokhi yhvh ’elohekha ’el qana poqed ‘avon ’abot ‘al banim ve‘al shileshim ve‘al ribe‘im lesone’ay.
weSh xsd lalpym lahby wlSmry mzwtw mzwty and showing mercy unto thousands of them that love me and keep my directives. ve‘oseh khesed la’alafim le’ohabay uleshomerei mizvotay.
la tSa at Sm yhwh alhyk lSwa ky la ynqh yhwh at aSr ySa at Smw lSwa no take the name of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these in vain: for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain. lo tisa shem yhvh ’elohekha lashav, ki lo yenaqeh yhvh ’asher yisa shemo lashav.
Smwr at ywm hSbt lqdSw kaSr zwk yhwh alhyk keep the sabbath-seven day to dedicate-finify it, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath direct thee. shamor yom hashabat leqadesho ka’asher zivekha yhvh ’elohekha
SSt ymym tebd weSyt kl mlaktk six days thou labor, and do all thy work: sheshet yamim ta‘abod ve‘asita kla melakhtekha.
wywm hSbyey Sbt lyhwh alhyk la teSh kl mlakh ath wbnk wbtk webdk wamtk wSwrk wxmrk wkl bhmtk wgrk aSr bSeryk lmen ynwx ebdk wamtk kmwk and the seventh day is the sabbath-seven of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these: in it no do any work, thou, nor thy child-between, nor thy daughter-hoof-bat-child, nor thy worker, nor thy mum-true-maid, nor thine wall-ox, nor thine ass, nor any of thy in-them-animal, nor thy stranger that is within thy hair-gates; that thy worker and thy mum-true-maid may rest as well as thou. veyom hashebi‘i shabat yhvh ’elohekha lo ta‘aseh khal melakhah ’atah ubinkha ubitekha ve‘abdekha va’amatekha veshorkha vakhamorekha vekhal behemtekha vegerekha ’asher bish‘arekha lema‘an yanuakh ‘abdekha va’amatekha kamokha.
wckrt ky ebd hyyt barz mzrym wyzak yhwh alhyk mSm byd xcqh wbcre nTwyh el kn zwk yhwh alhyk leSwt at ywm hSbt and remember that thou wast a worker in the land of mizraim-narrows, and that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these brought thee out thence through a mighty hand and by a stretched out arm: therefore yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these direct thee to keep the sabbath-seven day. vezakharta ki ‘ebed hayita be’erez mizrayim vayozi’akha yhvh ’elohekha misham beyad khazaqah ubizroa‘ netuyah ‘al ken zivekha yhvh ’elohekha la‘asot yom hashabat.
kbd at abyk wat amk kaSr zwk yhwh alhyk lmen yarykn ymyk wlmen yyTb lk el hadmh aSr yhwh alhyk ntn lk give weight to thy father and thy mother, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath direct thee; that thy days may be prolonged, and that it may go well with thee, in the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these giveth thee. kabed ’abikha ve’et ’imekha ka’asher zivekha yhvh ’elohekha, lema‘an ya’arikhun yamekha ulema‘an yitab lakh ‘al ha’adamah ’asher yhvh ’elohekha noten lakh.
la trzx no kill. lo trezakh.
wla tnap neither thou commit adultery. velo tne’af.
wla tgnb neither thou steal. velo tgenob.
wla tenh brek ed Swa neither thou bear false witness against thy neighbor. velo ta‘aneh bere‘akha ‘ed shav.
wla txmd aSt rek wla ttawh byt rek Sdhw webdw wamtw Swrw wxmrw wkl aSr lrek neither thou desire thy neighbor's woman, neither thou covet thy neighbor's daughter-house, his field, or his worker, or his mum-true-maid, his wall-ox, or his ass, or any thing that is thy neighbor's. velo takhmod ’eshet re‘ekha, velo tit’aveh bet re‘ekha sadehu ve‘abdo va’amato shoro vakhamoro vekhol ’asher lere‘ekha.
at hdbrym halh dbr yhwh al kl qhlkm bhr mtwk haS henn wherpl qwl gdwl wla ysp wyktbm el Sny lxt abnym wytnm aly these bee-words yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto all your assembly in the mount out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness, with a great voice: and he added no more. and he wrote them in two tables of father-child-stone, and delivered them unto me. hadebarim ha’eleh diber yhvh ’el kal qehalkhem bahar mitokh ha’esh he‘anan veha‘arafel qol gadol velo yasaf, vayikhtebem ‘al shenei lukhot ’abanim vayitenem ’elay.
wyhy kSmekm at hqwl mtwk hxSk whhr ber baS wtqrbwn aly kl raSy SbTykm wcqnykm and it came to pass, when ye heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, (for the mountain did burn with fire,) that ye came near unto me, even all the heads of your branchs, and your elders; vayhi keshame‘akhem haqol mitokh hakhoshekh vehahar bo‘er ba’esh, vatiqrebun ’elay kal rashei shibtekhem veziqnekhem.
wtamrw hn hranw yhwh alhynw at kbdw wat gdlw wat qlw Smenw mtwk haS hywm hch raynw ky ydbr alhym at hadm wxy and ye said, behold, yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these hath showed us his heaviness and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the midst of the fire: we have seen this day that to-no-these doth talk with man, and he liveth. vatomeru hen her’anu yhvh ’elohenu kebodo ve’et gadelo ve’et qolo shama‘nu mitokh ha’esh, hayom hazeh ra’inu ki yedaber ’elohim ’et ha’adam vakhay.
weth lmh nmwt ky taklnw haS hgdlh hcat am yspym anxnw lSme at qwl yhwh alhynw ewd wmtnw now therefore why should we die? for this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these any more, then we die. ve‘atah lamah namut ki tokhelenu ha’esh hagedolah hazot, ’im yosefim ’anakhnu lishmoa‘ qol yhvh ’elohenu ‘od vamatenu.
ky my kl bSr aSr Sme qwl alhym xyym mdbr mtwk haS kmnw wyxy for who is there of all flesh, that hath heard the voice of the living to-no-these speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived? ki mi khal basar ’asher shama‘ qol ’elohim khayim medaber mitokh ha’esh kamonu vayekhi.
qrb ath wSme at kl aSr yamr yhwh alhynw wat tdbr alynw at kl aSr ydbr yhwh alhynw alyk wSmenw weSynw go thou near, and hear all that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these say: and speak thou unto us all that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it. qerab ’atah ushama‘ kal ’asher yomar yhvh ’elohenu, ve’at tedaber ’elenu kal ’asher yedaber yhvh ’elohenu ’elekha veshama‘nu ve‘asinu.
wySme yhwh at qwl dbrykm bdbrkm aly wyamr yhwh aly Smety at qwl dbry hem hch aSr dbrw alyk hyTybw kl aSr dbrw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah heard the voice of your bee-words, when ye spake unto me; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, i have heard the voice of the bee-words of this with-mum-people, which they have bee-spoken unto thee: they have well said all that they have bee-spoken. vayishma‘ yhvh qol dibrekhem bedaberkhem ’elay, vayomer yhvh ’elay ma‘ti qol dibrei ha‘am hazeh ’asher diberu ’elekha hetibu kal ’asher diberu.
my ytn whyh lbbm ch lhm lyrah aty wlSmr at kl mzwty kl hymym lmen yyTb lhm wlbnyhm lelm o that there were such an heart in them, that they would fear me, and keep all my directives always, that it might be well with them, and with their children-betweens for ever! mi yiten vehayah lebabam zeh lahem leyir’ah ’oti velishmor kal mizvotay kal hayamim, lema‘an yitab lahem velibnehem le‘olam.
lk amr lhm Swbw lkm lahlykm go say to them, get you into your tents again. lekh ’emor lahem, shubu lakhem le’aholekhem.
wath ph emd emdy wadbrh alyk at kl hmzwh whxqym whmSpTym aSr tlmdm weSw barz aSr anky ntn lhm lrSth and as for thee, stand thou here by me, and i will speak unto thee all the directives, and the statutes, and the decision-grammars, which thou teach them, that they may do them in the land which i give them to possess it. ve’atah poh ‘amod ‘imadi va’adaberah ’elekha kal hamizvah vehakhuqim vehamishpatim ’asher telamedem, ve‘asu ba’arez ’asher ’anokhi noten lahem lerishtah.
wSmrtm leSwt kaSr zwh yhwh alhykm atkm la tsrw ymyn wSmal ye guard-observe to do therefore as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these hath direct you: ye not turn aside to the right hand or to the left. ushemartem la‘asot ka’asher zivah yhvh ’elohekhem ’etkhem, lo tasuru yamin usemol.
bkl hdrk aSr zwh yhwh alhykm atkm tlkw lmen txywn wTwb lkm wharktm ymym barz aSr tyrSwn ye walk in all the ways which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these hath direct you, that ye may live, and that it may be well with you, and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye possess. bekhal haderekh ’asher zivah yhvh ’elohekhem ’etkhem telekhu, lema‘an tikhyun vetob lakhem veha’arakhtem yamim ba’arez ’asher tirashun.
wcat hmzwh hxqym whmSpTym aSr zwh yhwh alhykm llmd atkm leSwt barz aSr atm ebrym Smh lrSth now these are the directives, the statutes, and the decision-grammars, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these direct to teach you, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go to possess it: vezot hamizvah hakhuqim vehamishpatim ’asher zivah yhvh ’elohekhem lelamed ’etkhem, la‘asot ba’arez ’asher ’atem ‘oberim shamah lerishtah.
