lmen tyra at yhwh alhyk lSmr at kl xqtyw wmzwtyw aSr anky mzwk ath wbnk wbn bnk kl ymy xyyk wlmen yarkn ymyk that thou mightest fear yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, to keep all his statutes and his directives, which i direct thee, thou, and thy child-between, and thy child-between's child-between, all the days of thy life; and that thy days may be prolonged. lema‘an tira yhvh ’elohekha lishmor kal khuqotav umizvotav ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha ’atah ubinkha uben binkha kol yemei khayekha, ulema‘an ya’arikhun yamekha.

whyw hdbrym halh aSr anky mzwk hywm el lbbk and these bee-words, which i direct thee this day, be in thine heart: vehayu hadebarim ha’eleh ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom ‘al lebabekha.

wbtym mlaym kl Twb aSr la mlat wbrt xzwbym aSr la xzbt krmym wcytym aSr la nTet waklt wSbet and daughter-houses full of all good things, which thou filledst not, and wells digged, which thou diggedst not, vineyards and olive trees, which thou plantedst not; when thou have eaten and be full; ubatim mele’im kal tub ’asher lo mileta uborot khazubim ’asher lo khazabta keramim vezetim ’asher lo nata‘eta, ve’akhalta vesaba‘eta.
hSmr lk pn tSkx at yhwh aSr hwzyak marz mzrym mbyt ebdym then beware lest thou forget yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, which brought thee forth out of the land of mizraim-narrows, from the daughter-house of bondage. hishamer lekha pen tishkakh yhvh, ’asher hozi’akha me’erez mizrayim mibet ‘abadim.

la tlkwn axry alhym axrym malhy hemym aSr sbybwtykm ye not go after other to-no-these, of the to-no-these of the with-mum-people which are round about you; lo telekhun ’akharei ’elohim ’akherim, me’elohei ha‘amim ’asher sebibotekhem.
ky al qna yhwh alhyk bqrbk pn yxrh ap yhwh alhyk bk whSmydk mel pny hadmh (for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these is a jealous to-no-these among you) lest the nose-anger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these be kindled against thee, and destroy thee from off the face-turns of the earth. ki ’el qana yhvh ’elohekha beqirbekha, pen yekhereh ’af yhvh ’elohekha bakh vehishmidekha me‘al penei ha’adamah.

Smwr tSmrwn at mzwt yhwh alhykm wedtyw wxqyw aSr zwk ye diligently keep the directives of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he hath direct thee. shamor tishmerun mizvot yhvh ’elohekhem, ve‘edotav vekhuqav ’asher zivakh.
weSyt hySr whTwb beyny yhwh lmen yyTb lk wbat wyrSt at harz hTbh aSr nSbe yhwh labtyk and thou do that which is right and good in the sight of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest go in and possess the good land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sware unto thy fathers. ve‘asita hayashar vehatob be‘enei yhvh, lema‘an yitab lakh ubata veyarashta ha’arez hatobah ’asher nishba‘ yhvh la’abotekha.

ky ySalk bnk mxr lamr mh hedt whxqym whmSpTym aSr zwh yhwh alhynw atkm and when thy child-between asketh thee in time to come, saying, what mean the testimonies, and the statutes, and the decision-grammars, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these hath direct you? ki yish’alekha binkha makhar lemor, mah ha‘edot vehakhuqim vehamishpatim ’asher zivah yhvh ’elohenu ’etkhem.
wamrt lbnk ebdym hyynw lpreh bmzrym wywzyanw yhwh mmzrym byd xcqh then thou say unto thy child-between, we were pharaoh-big-house's workers in mizraim-narrows; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah brought us out of mizraim-narrows with a mighty hand: ve’amarta lebinkha ‘abadim hayinu lefar‘oh bemizrayim, vayozi’enu yhvh mimizrayim beyad khazaqah.
wytn yhwh awtt wmptym gdlym wreym bmzrym bpreh wbkl bytw leynynw and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah showed signs and wonders, great and sore, upon mizraim-narrows, upon pharaoh-big-house, and upon all his daughter-household, before-turns our eyes: vayiten yhvh ’otot umofetim gedolim vera‘im bemizrayim befar‘oh ubekhal beto le‘enenu.
wawtnw hwzya mSm lmen hbya atnw ltt lnw at harz aSr nSbe labtynw and he brought us out from thence, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he sware unto our fathers. ve’otanu hozi misham, lema‘an habi ’otanu latet lanu ha’arez ’asher nishba‘ la’abotenu.
wyzwnw yhwh leSwt at kl hxqym halh lyrah at yhwh alhynw lTwb lnw kl hymym lxytnw khywm hch and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah direct us to do all these statutes, to fear yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as it is at this day. vayzavenu yhvh la‘asot kal hakhuqim ha’eleh leyir’ah ’et yhvh ’elohenu, letob lanu kal hayamim lekhayotenu kehayom hazeh.
wzdqh thyh lnw ky nSmr leSwt at kl hmzwh hcat lpny yhwh alhynw kaSr zwnw and it be our being right, if we guard-observe to do all these directives before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah our to-no-these, as he hath direct us. uzedaqah tihyeh lanu, ki nishmor la‘asot kal hamizvah hazot lifnei yhvh ’elohenu ka’asher zivanu.
ky ybyak yhwh alhyk al harz aSr ath ba Smh lrSth wnSl gwym rbym mpnyk hxty whgrgSy whamry whkneny whprcy whxwy whybwsy Sbeh gwym rbym wezwmym mmk when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these bring thee into the land whither thou goest to possess it, and hath cast out many nations before-turns thee, the hittite-cuts-tusk, and the girgashites-emotional, and the amorite-talkers, and the canaan-mobile-tradeites, and the perizzite-unwalleds, and the hivite-experiences, and the jebusite-tramplers, seven nations greater and mightier than thou; ki yebi’akha yhvh ’elohekha ’el ha’arez ’asher ’atah ba shamah lerishtah, venashal goyim rabim mipanekha hakhiti vehagirgashi veha’emori vehakena‘ani vehaperizi vehakhivi vehaybusi shib‘ah goyim rabim va‘azumim mimeka.

ky ysyr at bnk maxry webdw alhym axrym wxrh ap yhwh bkm whSmydk mhr for they will turn away thy child-between from following me, that they may work for other to-no-these: so will the nose-anger of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah be kindled against you, and destroy thee suddenly. ki yasir binkha me’akharay ve‘abedu ’elohim ’akherim, vekharah ’af yhvh bakhem vehishmidekha maher.
ky am kh teSw lhm mcbxtyhm ttzw wmzbtm tSbrw waSyrhm tgdewn wpsylyhm tSrpwn baS and thus ye deal with them; ye destroy their butcher-kitchens, and break down their images, and cut down their groves, and burn their graven images with fire. ki ’im koh ta‘asu lahem mizbekhotehem titozu umazebotam teshaberu, va’asherehem tegade‘un ufesilehem tisrefun ba’esh.
ky em qdwS ath lyhwh alhyk bk bxr yhwh alhyk lhywt lw lem sglh mkl hemym aSr el pny hadmh for thou art an dedicated-finished with-mum-people unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these: yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath chosen thee to be a special with-mum-people unto himself, above all with-mum-people that are upon the face-turns of the earth. ki ‘am qadosh ’atah yhvh ’elohekha, bekha bakhar yhvh ’elohekha lihyot lo le‘am segulah mikol ha‘amim ’asher ‘al penei ha’adamah.
la mrbkm mkl hemym xSq yhwh bkm wybxr bkm ky atm hmeT mkl hemym yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah did not set his love upon you, nor choose you, because ye were more in number than any with-mum-people; for ye were the fewest of all with-mum-people: lo merubekhem mikal ha‘amim khashaq yhvh bakhem vayibkhar bakhem, ki ’atem ham‘at mikal ha‘amim.
ky mahbt yhwh atkm wmSmrw at hSbeh aSr nSbe labtykm hwzya yhwh atkm byd xcqh wypdk mbyt ebdym myd preh mlk mzrym and because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah loved you, and because he would keep the toward-oath which he had sworn unto your fathers, hath yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah brought you out with a mighty hand, and redeemed you out of the daughter-house of workers, from the hand of pharaoh-big-house king-moloch of mizraim-narrows. ki me’ahabat yhvh ’etkhem umishamero hashebu‘ah ’asher nishba‘ la’abotekhem hozi yhvh ’etkhem beyad khazaqah, vayifdekha mibet ‘abadim miyad par‘oh melekh mizrayim.
wydet ky yhwh alhyk hwa halhym hal hnamn Smr hbryt whxsd lahbyw wlSmry mzwtw mzwtyw lalp dwr hand-know therefore that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, he is to-no-these, the faith-trainingful to-no-these, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his directives to a thousand generations; veyada‘ta ki yhvh ’elohekha hu ha’elohim, ha’el hane’eman shomer haberit vehakhesed le’ohabav uleshomerei mizvotav le’elef dor.
wmSlm lSnayw al pnyw lhabydw la yaxr lSnaw al pnyw ySlm lw and repayeth them that hate him to their face-turns, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him that hateth him, he will repay him to his face-turns. umeshalem lesone’av ’el panav leha’abido, lo ye’akher lesone’o ’el panav yeshalem lo.
wSmrt at hmzwh wat hxqym wat hmSpTym aSr anky mzwk hywm leSwtm thou therefore keep the directives, and the statutes, and the decision-grammars, which i direct thee this day, to do them. veshamarta hamizvah ve’et hakhuqim ve’et hamishpatim ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom la‘asotam.
whyh eqb tSmewn at hmSpTym halh wSmrtm weSytm atm wSmr yhwh alhyk lk at hbryt wat hxsd aSr nSbe labtyk wherefore it come to pass, if ye hearken to these decision-grammars, and keep, and do them, that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these keep unto thee the covenant and the mercy which he sware unto thy fathers: vehayah ‘eqeb tishme‘un hamishpatim ha’eleh ushemartem va‘asitem ’otam, veshamar yhvh ’elohekha lekha haberit ve’et hakhesed ’asher nishba‘ la’abotekha.
wahbk wbrkk whrbk wbrk pry bTnk wpry admtk dgnk wtyrSk wyzhrk Sgr alpyk weStrt zank el hadmh aSr nSbe labtyk ltt lk and he will love thee, and knee-fluffy-bless thee, and multiply thee: he will also knee-fluffy-bless the fruit of thy womb, and the fruit of thy land, thy corn-swimming, and thy wine-inherit, and thine name-from-oil, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep, in the land which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee. va’ahebekha uberakhkha vehirbekha, uberakh peri bitnekha uferi ’admatekha deganekha vetiroshekha veyizharekha shegar ’alafekha ve‘ashterot zonekha ‘al ha’adamah ’asher nishba‘ la’abotekha latet lakh.
brwk thyh mkl hemym la yhyh bk eqr weqrh wbbhmtk thou be knee-fluffy-blessed above all with-mum-people: there not be rememberer or pierced barren among you, or among your in-them-animal. barukh tihyeh mikal ha‘amim, lo yihyeh bekha ‘aqar va‘aqarah ubibhemtekha.
whsyr yhwh mmk kl xly wkl mdwy mzrym hreym aSr ydet la ySymm bk wntnm bkl Snayk and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah will take away from thee all sickness, and will put none of the bad diseases of mizraim-narrows, which thou knowest, upon thee; and will lay them upon all them that hate thee. vehesir yhvh mimekha kal kholi, vekhal madvei mizrayim hara‘im ’asher yada‘ta lo yesimam bakh unetanam bekhal sone’ekha.
waklt at kl hemym aSr yhwh alhyk ntn lk la txs eynk elyhm wla tebd at alhyhm ky mwqS hwa lk and thou consume all the with-mum-people which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these deliver thee; thine eye have no pity upon them: neither thou work for their to-no-these; for that will be a snare unto thee. ve’akhalta kal ha‘amim ’asher yhvh ’elohekha noten lakh lo takhos ‘enekha ‘alehem, velo ta‘abod ’elohehem ki moqesh hu lakh.
ky tamr blbbk rbym hgwym halh mmny aykh awkl lhwrySm if thou say in thine heart, these nations are more than i; how can i dispossess them? ki tomar bilbabekha rabim hagoyim ha’eleh mimeni, ’ekhah ’ukhal lehorisham.
la tyra mhm ckr tckr at aSr eSh yhwh alhyk lpreh wlkl mzrym no be afraid of them: and well remember what yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these did unto pharaoh-big-house, and unto all mizraim-narrows; lo tira mehem, zakhor tizkor ’asher ‘asah yhvh ’elohekha lefar‘oh ulekhal mizrayim.
hmst hgdlt aSr raw eynyk whatt whmptym whyd hxcqh whcre hnTwyh aSr hwzak yhwh alhyk kn yeSh yhwh alhyk lkl hemym aSr ath yra mpnyhm the great temptations which thine eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the stretched out arm, whereby yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these brought thee out: so yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these do unto all the with-mum-people of whom thou art afraid. hamasot hagedolot ’asher ra’u ‘enekha veha’otot vehamofetim vehayad hakhazaqah vehazeroa‘ hanetuyah ’asher hozi’akha yhvh ’elohekha, ken ya‘aseh yhvh ’elohekha lekhal ha‘amim ’asher ’atah yarei mipenehem.
wgm at hzreh ySlx yhwh alhyk bm ed abd hnSarym whnstrym mpnyk moreover yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these will send the wasp among them, until they that are left, and hide themselves from thee, be destroyed. vegam hazir‘ah yeshalakh yhvh ’elohekha bam, ‘ad ’abod hanish’arim vehanistarim mipanekha.
la terz mpnyhm ky yhwh alhyk bqrbk al gdwl wnwra no be affrighted at them: for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these is among you, a mighty to-no-these and terrible. lo ta‘aroz mipenehem, ki yhvh ’elohekha beqirbekha ’el gadol venora.
wnSl yhwh alhyk at hgwym hal mpnyk meT meT la twkl kltm mhr pn trbh elyk xyt hSdh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these will put out those nations before-turns thee by little and little: thou mayest not consume them at once, lest the beasts of the field increase upon thee. venashal yhvh ’elohekha hagoyim ha’el mipanekha me‘at me‘at, lo tukhal kalotam maher pen tirbeh ‘alekha khayat hasadeh.
wntnm yhwh alhyk lpnyk whmm mhwmh gdlh ed hSmdm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these deliver them unto thee, and destroy them with a mighty destruction, until they be destroyed. unetanam yhvh ’elohekha lefanekha, vehamam mehumah gedolah ‘ad hishamedam.
wntn mlkyhm bydk whabdt at Smm mtxt hSmym la ytyzb ayS bpnyk ed hSmdk atm and he deliver their king-molochs into thine hand, and thou destroy their name from under namespaces: there no man be able to stand before-turns thee, until thou have destroyed them. venatan malkhehem beyadekha veha’abadta shemam mitakhat hashamayim, lo yityazeb ’ish befanekha ‘ad hishmidkha ’otam.
psyly alhyhm tSrpwn baS la txmd ksp wchb elyhm wlqxt lk pn twqS bw ky twebt yhwh alhyk hwa the graven images of their to-no-these ye burn with fire: no desire the silver or gold that is on them, nor take it unto thee, lest thou be snared therein: for it is an abomination to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these. pesilei ’elohehem tisrefun ba’esh, lo takhmod kesef vezahab ‘alehem velaqakhta lakh pen tivaqesh bo ki to‘abat yhvh ’elohekha hu.
wla tbya twebh al bytk whyyt xrm kmhw Sqz tSqznw wteb ttebnw ky xrm hwa neither thou bring an abomination into thine daughter-house, lest thou be a cursed thing like it: and thou utterly detest it, and thou utterly crave-abhor it; for it is a cursed thing. velo tabi to‘ebah ’el betekha vehayita kherem kamohu, shaqez teshaqezenu veta‘eb teta‘abenu ki kherem hu.
kl hmzwh aSr anky mzwk hywm tSmrwn leSwt lmen txywn wrbytm wbatm wyrStm at harz aSr nSbe yhwh labtykm all the directives which i direct thee this day ye guard-observe to do, that ye may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sware unto your fathers. kal hamizvah ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom tishmerun la‘asot, lema‘an tikhyun urebitem ubatem virishtem ha’arez ’asher nishba‘ yhvh la’abotekhem.
wckrt at kl hdrk aSr hlykk yhwh alhyk ch arbeym Snh bmdbr lmen entk lnstk ldet at aSr blbbk htSmr mzwtw mzwtyw am la and thou remember all the way which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these led thee these forty years in the place-of-word-desert, to humble thee, and to prove thee, to hand-know what was in thine heart, whether thou wouldest keep his directives, or no. vezakharta kal haderekh ’asher holikhakha yhvh ’elohekha zeh ’arba‘im shanah bamidbar, lema‘an ‘anotekha lenasotekha lada‘at ’asher bilbabekha hatishmor mizvotav ’im lo.
wyenk wyrebk wyaklk at hmn aSr la ydet wla ydewn abtyk lmen hwdek ky la el hlxm lbdw yxyh hadm ky el kl mwza py yhwh yxyh hadm and he humbled thee, and suffered thee to hunger, and fed thee with manna-whats-that, which thou hand-knewest not, neither did thy fathers hand-know; that he might make thee hand-know that man doth not live by bread only, and by every bee-word that proceedeth out of the mouth of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah doth man live. vay‘anekha vayar‘ibekha vaya’akhilkha haman ’asher lo yada‘ta velo yade‘un ’abotekha, lema‘an hodi‘akha ki lo ‘al halekhem lebado yikhyeh ha’adam ki ‘al kal moza fi yhvh yikhyeh ha’adam.
Smltk la blth melyk wrglk la bzqh ch arbeym Snh thy raiment waxed not old upon thee, neither did thy foot swell, these forty years. simlatekha lo baletah me‘alekha veraglekha lo bazeqah, zeh ’arba‘im shanah.
wydet em lbbk ky kaSr yysr ayS at bnw yhwh alhyk mysrk thou also consider in thine heart, that, as a man chasteneth his child-between, so yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these chasteneth thee. veyada‘ta ‘im lebabekha, ki ka’asher yeyaser ’ish beno yhvh ’elohekha meyasereka.
wSmrt at mzwt yhwh alhyk llkt bdrkyw wlyrah atw therefore thou keep the directives of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, to walk in his ways, and to fear him. veshamarta mizvot yhvh ’elohekha, lalekhet bidrakhav uleyir’ah ’oto.
ky yhwh alhyk mbyak al arz Twbh arz nxly mym eynt wthmt yzaym bbqeh wbhr for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these bringeth thee into a good land, a land of brooks of from-waters, of fountains and depths that spring out of valleys and hills; ki yhvh ’elohekha mebi’akha ’el ’erez tobah, ’erez nakhalei mayim ‘ayanot utehomot yoze’im babiq‘ah ubahar.
arz xTh wSerh wgpn wtanh wrmwn arz cyt Smn wdbS a land of wheat, and gates-barley, and vines, and fig trees, and high-pomegranates; a land of name-from-oil olive, and honey; ’erez khitah use‘orah vegefen ute’enah verimon, ’erez zet shemen udebash.
arz aSr la bmsknt takl bh lxm la txsr kl bh arz aSr abnyh brcl wmhrryh txzb nxSt a land wherein thou eat bread without scarceness, no lack any thing in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills thou mayest dig brass. ’erez ’asher lo bemiskenut tokhal bah lekhem lo tekhsar kol bah, ’erez ’asher ’abaneha barzel umeharareha takhzob nekhoshet.
waklt wSbet wbrkt at yhwh alhyk el harz hTbh aSr ntn lk when thou hast eaten and art full, then thou knee-fluffy-bless yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these for the good land which he hath given thee. ve’akhalta vesaba‘eta, uberakhta yhvh ’elohekha ‘al ha’arez hatobah ’asher natan lakh.
hSmr lk pn tSkx at yhwh alhyk lblty Smr mzwtyw wmSpTyw wxqtyw aSr anky mzwk hywm beware that thou forget not yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, in not keeping his directives, and his decision-grammars, and his statutes, which i direct thee this day: hishamer lekha pen tishkakh yhvh ’elohekha, lebilti shemor mizvotav umishpatav vekhuqotav ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom.
pn takl wSbet wbtym Twbym tbnh wySbt lest when thou hast eaten and art full, and hast between-built goodly daughter-houses, and dwelt therein; pen tokhal vesaba‘eta, ubatim tobim tibneh veyashabeta.
wbqrk wzank yrbyn wksp wchb yrbh lk wkl aSr lk yrbh and when thy visit-cattles and thy flocks multiply, and thy silver and thy gold is multiplied, and all that thou hast is multiplied; ubeqarekha vezonekha yirbeyun vekhesef vezahab yirbeh lakh, vekhol ’asher lekha yirbeh.
wrm lbbk wSkxt at yhwh alhyk hmwzyak marz mzrym mbyt ebdym then thine heart be lifted up, and thou forget yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, which brought thee forth out of the land of mizraim-narrows, from the daughter-house of bondage; veram lebabekha, veshakhakhta yhvh ’elohekha hamozi’akha me’erez mizrayim mibet ‘abadim.
hmwlykk bmdbr hgdl whnwra nxS Srp weqrb wzmawn aSr ayn mym hmwzya lk mym mzwr hxlmyS who led thee through that great and terrible place-of-word-desert, wherein were fiery serpents, and scorpions, and drought, where there was no from-waters; who brought thee forth from-waters out of the rock of flint; hamolikhakha bamidbar hagadol vehanora nakhash saraf ve‘aqrab vezima’on ’asher ’en mayim, hamozi lekha mayim mizur hakhalamish.
hmaklk mn bmdbr aSr la ydewn abtyk lmen entk wlmen nstk lhyTbk baxrytk who fed thee in the place-of-word-desert with manna-whats-that, which thy fathers hand-knew not, that he might humble thee, and that he might prove thee, to do thee good at thy latter end; hama’akhilkha man bamidbar ’asher lo yade‘un ’abotekha, lema‘an ‘anotekha ulema‘an nasotekha lehetibkha be’akharitekha.
wamrt blbbk kxy wezm ydy eSh ly at hxyl hch and thou say in thine heart, my dynamic and the might of mine hand hath gotten me this wealth. ve’amarta bilbabekha, kokhi ve‘ozem yadi ‘asah li hakhayil hazeh.
wckrt at yhwh alhyk ky hwa hntn lk kx leSwt xyl lmen hqym at brytw aSr nSbe labtyk kywm hch and thou remember yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these: for it is he that giveth thee dynamic to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day. vezakharta yhvh ’elohekha ki hu hanoten lekha koakh la‘asot khayil, lema‘an haqim berito ’asher nishba‘ la’abotekha kayom hazeh.
whyh am Skx tSkx at yhwh alhyk whlkt axry alhym axrym webdtm whStxwyt lhm hedty bkm hywm ky abd tabdwn and it be, if thou do at all forget yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, and walk after other to-no-these, and work for them, and partake-shatakh them, i testify against you this day that ye surely perish. vehayah ’im shakhoakh tishkakh yhvh ’elohekha vehalakhta ’akharei ’elohim ’akherim va‘abadtam vehishtakhavita lahem, ha‘idoti bakhem hayom ki ’abod tobedun.
kgwym aSr yhwh mabyd mpnykm kn tabdwn eqb la tSmewn bqwl yhwh alhykm as the nations which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah destroyeth before-turns your face-turns, so ye perish; because ye would not be hearing unto the voice of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these. kagoyim ’asher yhvh ma’abid mipenekhem ken tobedun, ‘eqeb lo tishme‘un beqol yhvh ’elohekhem.
Sme ySral ath ebr hywm at hyrdn lba lrSt gwym gdlym wezmym mmk erym gdlt wbzrt bSmym hear, o israel-juicy-towards: thou art to pass over jordan-its-going-down this day, to go in to possess nations greater and mightier than thyself, cities great and fenced up to namespaces, shema‘ yisra’el ’atah ‘ober hayom hayarden labo lareshet goyim gedolim va‘azumim mimeka, ‘arim gedolot ubezurot bashamayim.
em gdwl wrm bny enqym aSr ath ydet wath Smet my ytyzb lpny bny enq a with-mum-people great and tall, children-betweens of the anak-giantims, whom thou knowest, and of whom thou hast heard say, who can stand before-turns children-betweens of anak-giant! ‘am gadol varam benei ‘anaqim, ’asher ’atah yada‘ta ve’atah shama‘ta mi yityazeb lifnei benei ‘anaq.
wydet hywm ky yhwh alhyk hwa hebr lpnyk aS aklh hwa ySmydm whwa yknyem lpnyk whwrStm whabdtm mhr kaSr dbr yhwh lk understand therefore this day, that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these is he which goeth over before-turns thee; as a consuming fire he destroy them, and he inward them down before-turns thy face-turns: so thou drive them out, and destroy them quickly, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath said unto thee. veyada‘ta hayom ki yhvh ’elohekha hu ha‘ober lefanekha ’esh ’okhelah hu yashmidem vehu yakhni‘em lefanekha, vehorashtam veha’abadtam maher ka’asher diber yhvh lakh.
al tamr blbbk bhdp yhwh alhyk atm mlpnyk lamr bzdqty hbyany yhwh lrSt at harz hcat wbrSet hgwym halh yhwh mwrySm mpnyk speak not thou in thine heart, after that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath cast them out from before-turns thee, saying, for my being right yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath brought me in to possess this land: and for the wickedness of these nations yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah doth drive them out from before-turns thee. ’al tomar bilbabekha bahadof yhvh ’elohekha ’otam milefanekha lemor bezidqati hebi’ani yhvh lareshet ha’arez hazot, uberish‘at hagoyim ha’eleh yhvh morisham mipanekha.
la bzdqtk wbySr lbbk ath ba lrSt at arzm ky brSet hgwym halh yhwh alhyk mwrySm mpnyk wlmen hqym at hdbr aSr nSbe yhwh labtyk labrhm lyzxq wlyeqb not for thy being right, or for the uprightness of thine heart, dost thou go to possess their land: and for the wickedness of these nations yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these doth drive them out from before-turns thee, and that he may perform the bee-word which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sware unto thy fathers, abraham-their-dick, isaac-laughter, and jacob-backstreet. lo bezidqatekha ubeyosher lebabekha ’atah ba lareshet ’arzam, ki berish‘at hagoyim ha’eleh yhvh ’elohekha morisham mipanekha ulema‘an haqim hadabar ’asher nishba‘ yhvh la’abotekha le’abraham leyizkhaq uleya‘aqob.
wydet ky la bzdqtk yhwh alhyk ntn lk at harz hTwbh hcat lrSth ky em qSh erp ath understand therefore, that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these giveth thee not this good land to possess it for thy being right; for thou art a stiffnecked with-mum-people. veyada‘ta ki lo bezidqatekha yhvh ’elohekha noten lekha ha’arez hatobah hazot lerishtah, ki ‘am qesheh ‘oref ’atah.
ckr al tSkx at aSr hqzpt at yhwh alhyk bmdbr lmn hywm aSr yzat marz mzrym ed bakm ed hmqwm hch mmrym hyytm em yhwh remember, and forget not, how thou provokedst yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these to wrath in the place-of-word-desert: from the day that thou didst depart out of the land of mizraim-narrows, until ye came unto this place, ye have been rebellious to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. zekhor ’al tishkakh ’asher hiqzafta yhvh ’elohekha bamidbar, lemin hayom ’asher yazata me’erez mizrayim ‘ad bo’akhem ‘ad hamaqom hazeh mamrim heyitem ‘im yhvh.
wbxrb hqzptm at yhwh wytanp yhwh bkm lhSmyd atkm also in horeb-sword ye provoked yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to wrath, so that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was angry with you to have destroyed you. ubekhoreb hiqzaftem yhvh, vayit’anaf yhvh bakhem lehashmid ’etkhem.
belty hhrh lqxt lwxt habnym lwxt hbryt aSr krt yhwh emkm waSb bhr arbeym ywm warbeym lylh lxm la aklty wmym la Styty when i was gone up into the mount to receive the tables of father-child-stone, even the tables of the covenant which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah made with you, then i abode in the mount forty days and forty nights, i neither did eat bread nor drink from-waters: ba‘aloti haharah laqakhat lukhot ha’abanim lukhot haberit ’asher karat yhvh ‘imakhem, va’esheb bahar ’arba‘im yom ve’arba‘im laylah lekhem lo ’akhalti umayim lo shatiti.
wytn yhwh aly at Sny lwxt habnym ktbym bazbe alhym welyhm kkl hdbrym aSr dbr yhwh emkm bhr mtwk haS bywm hqhl and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah delivered unto me two tables of father-child-stone written with the finger of to-no-these; and on them was written according to all the bee-words, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake with you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly. vayiten yhvh ’elay shenei lukhot ha’abanim ketubim be’ezba‘ ’elohim, va‘alehem kekhal hadebarim ’asher diber yhvh ‘imakhem bahar mitokh ha’esh beyom haqahal.
wyhy mqz arbeym ywm warbeym lylh ntn yhwh aly at Sny lxt habnym lxwt hbryt and it came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights, that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah gave me the two tables of father-child-stone, even the tables of the covenant. vayhi miqez ’arba‘im yom ve’arba‘im layelah, natan yhvh ’elay shenei lukhot ha’abanim lukhot haberit.
wyamr yhwh aly qwm rd mhr mch ky Sxt emk aSr hwzat mmzrym srw mhr mn hdrk aSr zwytm eSw lhm mskh and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, arise, get thee down quickly from hence; for thy with-mum-people which thou hast brought forth out of mizraim-narrows have corrupted themselves; they are quickly turned aside out of the way which i direct them; they have made them a molten image. vayomer yhvh ’elay qum red maher mizeh ki shikhet ‘amekha ’asher hozeta mimizrayim, saru maher min haderekh ’asher zivitim ‘asu lahem masekhah.
wyamr yhwh aly lamr rayty at hem hch whnh em qSh erp hwa furthermore yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto me, saying, i have seen this with-mum-people, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked with-mum-people: vayomer yhvh ’elay lemor, ra’iti ha‘am hazeh vehineh ‘am qesheh ‘oref hu.
hrp mmny waSmydm wamxh at Smm mtxt hSmym waeSh awtk lgwy ezwm wrb mmnw let me alone, that i may destroy them, and blot out their name from under namespaces: and i will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they. heref mimeni ve’ashmidem ve’emkheh shemam mitakhat hashamayim, ve’e‘eseh ’otkha lego ‘azum varab mimenu.
wapn ward mn hhr whhr ber baS wSny lxt hbryt el Sty ydy so i turned and came down from the mount, and the mount burned with fire: and the two tables of the covenant were in my two hands. va’efen va’ered min hahar vehahar bo‘er ba’esh, ushenei lukhot haberit ‘al shetei yaday.
wara whnh xTatm lyhwh alhykm eSytm lkm egl mskh srtm mhr mn hdrk aSr zwh yhwh atkm and i looked, and, behold, ye had missed to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, and had made you a molten calf: ye had turned aside quickly out of the way which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had direct you. va’ere vehineh khatatem yhvh ’elohekhem ‘asitem lakhem ‘egel masekhah, sartem maher min haderekh ’asher zivah yhvh ’etkhem.
watpS bSny hlxt waSlkm mel Sty ydy waSbrm leynykm and i took the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and brake them before-turns your eyes. va’etpos bishnei halukhot va’ashlikhem me‘al shetei yaday, va’ashaberem le‘enekhem.
watnpl lpny yhwh kraSnh arbeym ywm warbeym lylh lxm la aklty wmym la Styty el kl xTatkm aSr xTatm leSwt hre beyny yhwh lhkeysw and i fell down before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, as at the first, forty days and forty nights: i did neither eat bread, nor drink from-waters, because of all your misses which ye missed, in doing wickedly in the sight of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, to provoke him to nose-anger. va’etnapal lifnei yhvh karishonah ’arba‘im yom ve’arba‘im laylah lekhem lo ’akhalti umayim lo shatiti, ‘al kal khatatkhem ’asher khatatem la‘asot hara‘ be‘enei yhvh lehakh‘iso.
ky ygrty mpny hap whxmh aSr qzp yhwh elykm lhSmyd atkm wySme yhwh aly gm bpem hhwa for i was afraid of the nose-anger and hot displeasure, wherewith yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was wroth against you to destroy you. and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hearkened unto me at that time also. ki yagoreti mipenei ha’af vehakhemah ’asher qazaf yhvh ‘alekhem lehashmid ’etkhem, vayishma‘ yhvh ’elay gam bapa‘am hahiv.
wbahrn htanp yhwh mad lhSmydw watpll gm bed ahrn bet hhwa and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was very angry with aaron-cabinet to have destroyed him: and i prayed for aaron-cabinet also the same time. ube’aharon hit’anaf yhvh me’od lehashmido, va’etpalel gam be‘ad ’aharon ba‘et hahiv.
wat xTatkm aSr eSytm at hegl lqxty waSrp atw baS wakt atw Txwn hyTb ed aSr dq lepr waSlk at eprw al hnxl hyrd mn hhr and i took your miss, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it with fire, and stamped it, and ground it very small, even until it was as small as dust: and i cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount. ve’et khatatkhem ’asher ‘asitem ha‘egel laqakhti va’esrof ’oto ba’esh va’ekot ’oto takhon heteb ‘ad ’asher daq le‘afar, va’ashlikh ‘afaro ’el hanakhal hayored min hahar.
wbtberh wbmsh wbqbrt htawh mqzpym hyytm at yhwh and at taberah-conflagration, and at massa-loadh, and at hatavah-graveyard-of-craving-kibrot, ye provoked yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to wrath. ubetab‘erah ubemasah ubeqibrot hata’avah, maqzifim heyitem yhvh.
wbSlx yhwh atkm mqdS brne lamr elw wrSw at harz aSr ntty lkm wtmrw at py yhwh alhykm wla hamntm lw wla Smetm bqlw likewise when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sent you from kadeshbarnea-finished-desert-staggering, saying, go up and possess the land which i have given you; then ye rebelled against the directive of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, and ye was coached by him not, nor hearkened to his voice. ubishloakh yhvh ’etkhem miqadesh barnea‘ lemor ‘alu ureshu ha’arez ’asher natati lakhem, vatamru pi yhvh ’elohekhem velo he’emantem lo velo shema‘tem beqolo.
mmrym hyytm em yhwh mywm dety atkm ye have been rebellious to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah from the day that i hand-knew you. mamrim heyitem ‘im yhvh, miyom da‘ti ’etkhem.
watnpl lpny yhwh at arbeym hywm wat arbeym hlylh aSr htnplty ky amr yhwh lhSmyd atkm thus i fell down before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah forty days and forty nights, as i fell down at the first; because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had said he would destroy you. va’etnapal lifnei yhvh ’arba‘im hayom ve’et ’arba‘im halaylah ’asher hitnapaleti, ki ’amar yhvh lehashmid ’etkhem.
watpll al yhwh wamr adny yhwh al tSxt emk wnxltk aSr pdyt bgdlk aSr hwzat mmzrym byd xcqh i prayed therefore unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and said, o base-lord to-no-these, destroy not thy with-mum-people and thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed through thy greatness, which thou hast brought forth out of mizraim-narrows with a mighty hand. va’etpalel ’el yhvh va’omar ’adonay yhvh ’al tashkhet ‘amekha venakhalatekha ’asher padita begadelekha, ’asher hozeta mimizrayim beyad khazaqah.
ckr lebdyk labrhm lyzxq wlyeqb al tpn al qSy hem hch wal rSew wal xTatw remember thy workers, abraham-their-dick, isaac-laughter, and jacob-backstreet; look not unto the stubbornness of this with-mum-people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their miss: zekhor la‘abadekha le’abraham leyizkhaq uleya‘aqob, ’al tefen ’el qeshi ha‘am hazeh ve’el rish‘o ve’el khatato.
pn yamrw harz aSr hwzatnw mSm mbly yklt yhwh lhbyam al harz aSr dbr lhm wmSnatw awtm hwzyam lhmtm bmdbr lest the land whence thou broughtest us out say, because yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah was not able to bring them into the land which he promised them, and because he hated them, he hath brought them out to slay them in the place-of-word-desert. pen yomeru ha’arez ’asher hozetanu misham mibeli yekholet yhvh lahabi’am ’el ha’arez ’asher diber lahem, umisin’ato ’otam hozi’am lahamitam bamidbar.
whm emk wnxltk aSr hwzat bkxk hgdl wbcrek hnTwyh yet they are thy with-mum-people and thine inheritance, which thou broughtest out by thy mighty dynamic and by thy stretched out arm. vehem ‘amekha venakhalatekha, ’asher hozeta bekhokhakha hagadol ubizro‘akha hanetuyah.
bet hhwa amr yhwh aly psl lk Sny lwxt abnym kraSnym welh aly hhrh weSyt lk arwn ez at that time yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, hew thee two tables of father-child-stone like unto the first, and come up unto me into the mount, and make thee an cabinet of wood. ba‘et hahiv ’amar yhvh ’elay pesal lekha shene lukhot ’abanim karishonim va‘aleh ’elay haharah, ve‘asita lekha ’aron ‘ez.
waktb el hlxt at hdbrym aSr hyw el hlxt hraSnym aSr Sbrt wSmtm barwn and i will write on the tables the bee-words that were in the first tables which thou brakest, and thou put them in the cabinet. ve’ekhtob ‘al halukhot hadebarim ’asher hayu ‘al halukhot harishonim ’asher shibarta, vesamtam ba’aron.
waeS arwn ezy STym wapsl Sny lxt abnym kraSnym wael hhrh wSny hlxt bydy and i made an cabinet of shitim-sailing wood, and hewed two tables of father-child-stone like unto the first, and went up into the mount, having the two tables in mine hand. va’a‘as ’aron ‘azei shitim va’efsol shene lukhot ’abanim karishonim, va’a‘al haharah ushenei halukhot beyadi.
wyktb el hlxt kmktb hraSwn at eSrt hdbrym aSr dbr yhwh alykm bhr mtwk haS bywm hqhl wytnm yhwh aly and he wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten directives, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah spake unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah gave them unto me. vayikhtob ‘al halukhot kamikhtab harishon ‘aseret hadebarim ’asher diber yhvh ’alekhem bahar mitokh ha’esh beyom haqahal, vayitenem yhvh ’elay.
wapn ward mn hhr waSm at hlxt barwn aSr eSyty wyhyw Sm kaSr zwny yhwh and i turned myself and came down from the mount, and put the tables in the cabinet which i had made; and there they be, as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah direct me. va’efen va’ered min hahar va’asim halukhot ba’aron ’asher ‘asiti, vayihyu sham ka’asher zivani yhvh.
wbny ySral nsew mbart bny yeqn mwsrh Sm mt ahrn wyqbr Sm wykhn alecr bnw txtyw and children-betweens of israel-juicy-towards took their journey from beer-welloth of children-betweens of jaakan to mosera: there aaron-cabinet died, and there he was buried; and eleazar-towards-stop his child-between ed in the dimmer-server's office in his stead. ubenei yisra’el nase‘u mibe’erot bene ya‘aqan moserah, sham met ’aharon vayiqaber sham vaykhahen ’el‘azar beno takhtav.
mSm nsew hgdgdh wmn hgdgdh yTbth arz nxly mym from thence they journeyed unto gudelohimah-tickling; and from gudelohimah-tickling to jotbat-good-daughter, a land of rivers of from-waters. misham nase‘u hagudgodah, umin hagudgodah yatebatah ’erez nakhalei mayim.
bet hhwa hbdyl yhwh at SbT hlwy lSat at arwn bryt yhwh lemd lpny yhwh lSrtw wlbrk bSmw ed hywm hch at that time yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah separated the branch of levi-join, to bear the cabinet of the covenant of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, to stand before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to unto him, and to knee-fluffy-bless in his name, unto this day. ba‘et hahiv hibdil yhvh shebet halevi laset ’aron berit yhvh, la‘amod lifnei yhvh leshareto ulebarekh bishmo ‘ad hayom hazeh.
el kn la hyh llwy xlq wnxlh em axyw yhwh hwa nxltw kaSr dbr yhwh alhyk lw wherefore levi-join hath no part nor inheritance with his brethren; yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah is his inheritance, according as yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these promised him. ‘al ken lo hayah lelevi kheleq venakhalah ‘im ’ekhav, yhvh hu nakhalato ka’asher diber yhvh ’elohekha lo.
wanky emdty bhr kymym hraSnym arbeym ywm warbeym lylh wySme yhwh aly gm bpem hhwa la abh yhwh hSxytk and i stayed in the mount, according to the first time, forty days and forty nights; and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hearkened unto me at that time also, and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah would not destroy thee. ve’anokhi ‘amadti bahar kayamim harishonim ’arba‘im yom ve’arba‘im layelah, vayishma‘ yhvh ’elay gam bapa‘am hahiv lo ’abah yhvh hashkhitekha.
wyamr yhwh aly qwm lk lmse lpny hem wybaw wyrSw at harz aSr nSbety labtm ltt lhm and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah said unto me, arise, take thy journey before-turns the with-mum-people, that they may go in and possess the land, which i sware unto their fathers to give unto them. vayomer yhvh ’elay qum lekh lemasa‘ lifnei ha‘am, veyabo’u veyirshu ha’arez ’asher nishba‘ti la’abotam latet lahem.
weth ySral mh yhwh alhyk Sal memk ky am lyrah at yhwh alhyk llkt bkl drkyw wlahbh atw wlebd at yhwh alhyk bkl lbbk wbkl npSk and now, israel-juicy-towards, what doth yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these require of thee, and to fear yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to work for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these with all thy heart and with all thy being, ve‘atah yisra’el mah yhvh ’elohekha sho’el me‘imakh, ki ’im leyir’ah yhvh ’elohekha lalekhet bekhal derakhav ule’ahabah ’oto vela‘abod yhvh ’elohekha bekhal lebabekha ubekhal nafshekha.
lSmr at mzwt yhwh wat xqtyw aSr anky mzwk hywm lTwb lk to keep the directives of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, and his statutes, which i direct thee this day for thy good? lishmor mizvot yhvh ve’et khuqotav ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom, letob lakh.
hn lyhwh alhyk hSmym wSmy hSmym harz wkl aSr bh behold, the namespaces and the namespaces of namespacess is yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah's thy to-no-these, the earth also, with all that therein is. hen yhvh ’elohekha hashamayim ushemei hashamayim, ha’arez vekhal ’asher bah.
rq babtyk xSq yhwh lahbh awtm wybxr bcrem axryhm bkm mkl hemym kywm hch only yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all with-mum-people, as it is this day. raq ba’abotekha khashaq yhvh le’ahabah ’otam, vayibkhar bezar‘am ’akharehem bakhem mikal ha‘amim kayom hazeh.
wmltm at erlt lbbkm werpkm la tqSw ewd scribe-circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked. umaltem ‘arelat lebabkhem, ve‘arepekhem lo taqshu ‘od.
ky yhwh alhykm hwa alhy halhym wadny hadnym hal hgdl hgbr whnwra aSr la ySa pnym wla yqx Sxd for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these is to-no-these of to-no-these, and base-lord of base-lords, a great to-no-these, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward: ki yhvh ’elohekhem hu ’elohei ha’elohim va’adonei ha’adonim, ha’el hagadol hagibor vehanora ’asher lo yisa fanim velo yiqakh shokhad.
eSh mSpT ytwm walmnh wahb gr ltt lw lxm wSmlh he doth execute the decision-grammar of the fatherless and widow, and loveth the stranger, in giving him food and raiment. ‘oseh mishpat yatom ve’almanah, ve’oheb ger latet lo lekhem vesimlah.
wahbtm at hgr ky grym hyytm barz mzrym love ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of mizraim-narrows. va’ahabtem hager, ki gerim heyitem be’erez mizrayim.
at yhwh alhyk tyra atw tebd wbw tdbq wbSmw tSbe thou fear yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these; him thou work for, and to him thou cleave, and swear by his name. yhvh ’elohekha tira ’oto ta‘abod, ubo tidbaq ubishmo tishabea‘.
hwa thltk whwa alhyk aSr eSh atk at hgdlt wat hnwrat halh aSr raw eynyk he is thy praise, and he is thy to-no-these, that hath done for thee these great and terrible things, which thine eyes have seen. hu tehilatekha vehu ’elohekha, ’asher ‘asah ’itekha hagedolot ve’et hanora’ot ha’eleh ’asher ra’u ‘enekha.
bSbeym npS yrdw abtyk mzrymh weth Smk yhwh alhyk kkwkby hSmym lrb thy fathers went down into mizraim-narrows with threescore and ten persons; and now yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath made thee as the stars of namespaces for multitude. beshib‘im nefesh yaredu ’abotekha mizrayemah, ve‘atah samekha yhvh ’elohekha kekhokhbei hashamayim larob.
wahbt at yhwh alhyk wSmrt mSmrtw wxqtyw wmSpTyw wmzwtyw kl hymym therefore thou love yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, and keep his charge, and his statutes, and his decision-grammars, and his directives, alway. ve’ahabta yhvh ’elohekha, veshamarta mishmarto vekhuqotav umishpatav umizvotav kal hayamim.
wydetm hywm ky la at bnykm aSr la ydew waSr la raw at mwsr yhwh alhykm at gdlw at ydw hxcqh wcrew hnTwyh and hand-know ye this day: for i speak not with your children-betweens which have not hand-known, and which have not seen the chastisement of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his stretched out arm, vida‘tem hayom ki lo ’et benekhem ’asher lo yade‘u va’asher lo ra’u musar yhvh ’elohekhem, gadelo yado hakhazaqah uzero‘o hanetuyah.
wat attyw wat meSyw aSr eSh btwk mzrym lpreh mlk mzrym wlkl arzw and his miracles, and his acts, which he did in the midst of mizraim-narrows unto pharaoh-big-house the king-moloch of mizraim-narrows, and unto all his land; ve’et ’ototav ve’et ma‘asav ’asher ‘asah betokh mizrayim, lefar‘oh melekh mizrayim ulekhal ’arzo.
waSr eSh lxyl mzrym lswsyw wlrkbw aSr hzyp at my ym swp el pnyhm brdpm axrykm wyabdm yhwh ed hywm hch and what he did unto the army of mizraim-narrows, unto their horses, and to their chariots; how he made the from-waters of the end sea to overflow them as they pursued after you, and how yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath destroyed them unto this day; va’asher ‘asah lekhel mizrayim lesusav ulerikhbo ’asher hezif mei yam suf ‘al penehem beradefam ’akharekhem, vay’abedem yhvh ‘ad hayom hazeh.
waSr eSh lkm bmdbr ed bakm ed hmqwm hch and what he did unto you in the place-of-word-desert, until ye came into this place; va’asher ‘asah lakhem bamidbar, ‘ad bo’akhem ‘ad hamaqom hazeh.
waSr eSh ldtn wlabyrm bny alyab bn rawbn aSr pzth harz at pyh wtblem wat btyhm wat ahlyhm wat kl hyqwm aSr brglyhm bqrb kl ySral and what he did unto dathan-their-faith-training and abiram-my-father-high, children-betweens of elia-my-towardsb-my-towards-dad, child-between of reuben-see-child: how the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up, and their daughter-households, and their tents, and all the substance that was in their possession, in the midst of all israel-juicy-towards: va’asher ‘asah ledatan vela’abiram benei ’eli’ab ben re’uben ’asher pazetah ha’arez piha vatibla‘em ve’et batehem ve’et ’aholehem, ve’et kal hayqum ’asher beraglehem beqereb kal yisra’el.
ky eynykm hrat at kl meSh yhwh hgdl aSr eSh and your eyes have seen all the great acts of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah which he did. ki ‘enekhem haro’ot kal ma‘aseh yhvh hagadol, ’asher ‘asah.
wSmrtm at kl hmzwh aSr anky mzwk hywm lmen txcqw wbatm wyrStm at harz aSr atm ebrym Smh lrSth therefore ye keep all the directives which i direct you this day, that ye may be strong, and go in and possess the land, whither ye go to possess it; ushemartem kal hamizvah ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom, lema‘an tekhezqu ubatem virishtem ha’arez ’asher ’atem ‘oberim shamah lerishtah.
wlmen tarykw ymym el hadmh aSr nSbe yhwh labtykm ltt lhm wlcrem arz cbt xlb wdbS and that ye may prolong your days in the land, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sware unto your fathers to give unto them and to their seed, a land that floweth with milk and honey. ulema‘an ta’arikhu yamim ‘al ha’adamah ’asher nishba‘ yhvh la’abotekhem latet lahem ulezar‘am, ’erez zabat khalab udebash.
ky harz aSr ath ba Smh lrSth la karz mzrym hwa aSr yzatm mSm aSr tcre at crek whSqyt brglk kgn hyrq for the land, whither thou goest in to possess it, is not as the land of mizraim-narrows, from whence ye came out, where thou sowedst thy seed, and wateredst it with thy foot, as a garden of herbs: ki ha’arez ’asher ’atah ba shamah lerishtah lo khe’erez mizrayim hi ’asher yezatem misham, ’asher tizra‘ zar‘akha vehishqita beraglekha kegan hayaraq.
wharz aSr atm ebrym Smh lrSth arz hrym wbqet lmTr hSmym tSth mym and the land, whither ye go to possess it, is a land of hills and valleys, and drinketh from-waters of the rain of namespaces: veha’arez ’asher ’atem ‘oberim shamah lerishtah ’erez harim ubeqa‘ot, limtar hashamayim tishteh mayim.
arz aSr yhwh alhyk drS ath tmyd eyny yhwh alhyk bh mrSyt hSnh wed axryt Snh a land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these careth for: the eyes of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these are always upon it, from the beginning of the year even unto the end of the year. ’erez ’asher yhvh ’elohekha doresh tamid ‘enei yhvh ’elohekha bah mereshit hashanah ve‘ad ’akharit shanah.
whyh am Sme tSmew al mzwty aSr anky mzwh atkm hywm lahbh at yhwh alhykm wlebdw bkl lbbkm wbkl npSkm and it come to pass, if ye hearken diligently unto my directives which i direct you this day, to love yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, and to work for him with all your heart and with all your being, vehayah ’im shamoa‘ tishme‘u ’el mizvotay ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem hayom, le’ahabah yhvh ’elohekhem ule‘abedo bekhal lebabkhem ubekhal nafshekhem.
wntty mTr arzkm betw ywrh wmlqwS waspt dgnk wtyrSk wyzhrk that i will give you the rain of your land in his due season, the first rain and the latter rain, that thou mayest gather in thy corn-swimming, and thy wine-inherit, and thine name-from-oil. venatati metar ’arzekhem be‘ito yoreh umalqosh, ve’asafta deganekha vetiroshekha veyizharekha.
wntty eSb bSdk lbhmtk waklt wSbet and i will send grass in thy fields for thy in-them-animal, that thou mayest eat and be full. venatati ‘eseb besadekha libhemtekha, ve’akhalta vesaba‘eta.
hSmrw lkm pn ypth lbbkm wsrtm webdtm alhym axrym whStxwytm lhm take heed to yourselves, that your heart be not deceived, and ye turn aside, and work for other to-no-these, and partake-shatakh them; hishameru lakhem pen yifteh lebabkhem, vesartem va‘abadtem ’elohim ’akherim vehishtakhavitem lahem.
wxrh ap yhwh bkm wezr at hSmym wla yhyh mTr whadmh la ttn at ybwlh wabdtm mhrh mel harz hTbh aSr yhwh ntn lkm and then yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah's wrath be kindled against you, and he shut up the namespaces, that there be no rain, and that the land yield not her fruit; and lest ye perish quickly from off the good land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah giveth you. vekharah ’af yhvh bakhem ve‘azar hashamayim velo yihyeh matar veha’adamah lo titen yebulah, va’abadtem meherah me‘al ha’arez hatobah ’asher yhvh noten lakhem.
wSmtm at dbry alh el lbbkm wel npSkm wqSrtm atm lawt el ydkm whyw lTwTpt byn eynykm therefore ye lay up these my bee-words in your heart and in your being, and bind them for a sign upon your hand, that they may be as frontlets between-bin your eyes. vesamtem debaray ’eleh ‘al lebabkhem ve‘al nafshekhem, uqeshartem ’otam le’ot ‘al yedkhem vehayu letotafot ben ‘enekhem.
wlmdtm atm at bnykm ldbr bm bSbtk bbytk wblktk bdrk wbSkbk wbqwmk and ye teach them your children-betweens, speaking of them when thou sittest in thine daughter-house, and when thou walkest by the way, when thou liest down, and when thou risest up. velimadtem ’otam benekhem ledaber bam, beshibtekha bebetekha ubelekhtekha baderekh ubeshakhebekha ubequmekha.
wktbtm el mcwcwt bytk wbSeryk and thou write them upon the opening posts of thine daughter-house, and upon thy hair-gates: ukhetabtam ‘al mezuzot betekha ubish‘arekha.
lmen yrbw ymykm wymy bnykm el hadmh aSr nSbe yhwh labtykm ltt lhm kymy hSmym el harz that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children-betweens, in the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah sware unto your fathers to give them, as the days of namespaces upon the earth. lema‘an yirbu yemekhem vimei benekhem ‘al ha’adamah ’asher nishba‘ yhvh la’abotekhem latet lahem, kimei hashamayim ‘al ha’arez.
ky am Smr tSmrwn at kl hmzwh hcat aSr anky mzwh atkm leSth lahbh at yhwh alhykm llkt bkl drkyw wldbqh bw for if ye diligently keep all these directives which i direct you, to do them, to love yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, to walk in all his ways, and to cleave unto him; ki ’im shamor tishmerun kal hamizvah hazot ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem la‘asotah, le’ahabah yhvh ’elohekhem lalekhet bekhal derakhav uledabeqah bo.
whwryS yhwh at kl hgwym halh mlpnykm wyrStm gwym gdlym wezmym mkm then will yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah drive out all these nations from before-turns you, and ye possess greater nations and mightier than yourselves. vehorish yhvh kal hagoyim ha’eleh milifnekhem, virishtem goyim gedolim va‘azumim mikem.
kl hmqwm aSr tdrk kp rglkm bw lkm yhyh mn hmdbr whlbnwn mn hnhr nhr prt wed hym haxrwn yhyh gblkm every place whereon the soles of your feet tread be yours: from the place-of-word-desert and lebanon-build-white, from the river, the river euphrates-cow, even unto the uttermost sea your coast be. kal hamaqom ’asher tidrokh kaf raglekhem bo lakhem yihyeh, min hamidbar vehalebanon min hanahar nehar perat ve‘ad hayam ha’akharon yihyeh gebulkhem.
la ytyzb ayS bpnykm pxdkm wmwrakm ytn yhwh alhykm el pny kl harz aSr tdrkw bh kaSr dbr lkm there no man be able to stand before-turns you: for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the land that ye tread upon, as he hath said unto you. lo yityazeb ’ish bifnekhem, pakhdekhem umora’akhem yiten yhvh ’elohekhem ‘al penei khal ha’arez ’asher tidrekhu bah ka’asher diber lakhem.
rah anky ntn lpnykm hywm brkh wqllh behold, i set before-turns you this day a knee-fluffy-blessing and a curse; re’eh ’anokhi noten lifnekhem hayom, berakhah uqelalah.
at hbrkh aSr tSmew al mzwt yhwh alhykm aSr anky mzwh atkm hywm a knee-fluffy-blessing, if ye obey the directives of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, which i direct you this day: ’et haberakhah, ’asher tishme‘u ’el mizvot yhvh ’elohekhem ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem hayom.
whqllh am la tSmew al mzwt yhwh alhykm wsrtm mn hdrk aSr anky mzwh atkm hywm llkt axry alhym axrym aSr la ydetm and a curse, if ye will not obey the directives of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, and turn aside out of the way which i direct you this day, to go after other to-no-these, which ye have not hand-known. vehaqelalah ’im lo tishme‘u ’el mizvot yhvh ’elohekhem vesartem min haderekh ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem hayom, lalekhet ’akharei ’elohim ’akherim ’asher lo yeda‘tem.
whyh ky ybyak yhwh alhyk al harz aSr ath ba Smh lrSth wntth at hbrkh el hr grcym wat hqllh el hr eybl and it come to pass, when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath brought thee in unto the land whither thou goest to possess it, that thou put the knee-fluffy-blessing upon mount gerizim-grasses, and the curse upon mount ebal-mourning. vehayah ki yebi’akha yhvh ’elohekha ’el ha’arez ’asher ’atah ba shamah lerishtah, venatatah haberakhah ‘al har gerizim ve’et haqelalah ‘al har ‘ebal.
hla hmh bebr hyrdn axry drk mbwa hSmS barz hkneny hySb berbh mwl hglgl azl alwny mrh are they not on the other side jordan-its-going-down, by the way where the sun goeth down, in the land of the canaan-mobile-tradeites, which dwell in the champaign over against gilgal-roll, beside the plains of moreh-teacher? halo hemah be‘eber hayarden ’akharei derekh mebo hashemesh be’erez hakena‘ani hayosheb ba‘arabah, mul hagilgal ’ezel ’elonei moreh.
ky atm ebrym at hyrdn lba lrSt at harz aSr yhwh alhykm ntn lkm wyrStm ath wySbtm bh for ye pass over jordan-its-going-down to go in to possess the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these giveth you, and ye possess it, and dwell therein. ki ’atem ‘oberim hayarden labo lareshet ha’arez ’asher yhvh ’elohekhem noten lakhem, virishtem ’otah vishabtem bah.
wSmrtm leSwt at kl hxqym wat hmSpTym aSr anky ntn lpnykm hywm and ye guard-observe to do all the statutes and decision-grammars which i set before-turns you this day. ushemartem la‘asot kal hakhuqim ve’et hamishpatim, ’asher ’anokhi noten lifnekhem hayom.
alh hxqym whmSpTym aSr tSmrwn leSwt barz aSr ntn yhwh alhy abtyk lk lrSth kl hymym aSr atm xyym el hadmh these are the statutes and decision-grammars, which ye guard-observe to do in the land, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah to-no-these of thy fathers giveth thee to possess it, all the days that ye live upon the earth. ’eleh hakhuqim vehamishpatim ’asher tishmerun la‘asot ba’arez ’asher natan yhvh ’elohei ’abotekha lekha lerishtah, kal hayamim ’asher ’atem khayim ‘al ha’adamah.
abd tabdwn at kl hmqmwt aSr ebdw Sm hgwym aSr atm yrSym atm at alhyhm el hhrym hrmym wel hgbewt wtxt kl ez renn ye utterly destroy all the places, wherein the nations which ye possess worked for their to-no-these, upon the high mountains, and upon the hills, and under every green tree: ’abed te’abedun kal hameqomot ’asher ‘abedu sham hagoyim ’asher ’atem yoreshim ’elohehem, ‘al heharim haramim ve‘al hageba‘ot vetakhat kal ‘ez ra‘anan
wntztm at mcbxtm wSbrtm at mzbtm waSryhm tSrpwn baS wpsyly alhyhm tgdewn wabdtm at Smm mn hmqwm hhwa and ye overthrow their butcher-kitchens, and break their column-stands, and burn their groves with fire; and ye hew down the graven images of their to-no-these, and destroy the names of them out of that place. venitaztem mizbkhotam veshibartem mazebotam va’asherehem tisrefun ba’esh ufesilei ’elohehem tegade‘un, ve’ibadtem shemam min hamaqom hahu.
la teSwn kn lyhwh alhykm ye not do so unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these. lo ta‘asun ken yhvh ’elohekhem.
ky am al hmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh alhykm mkl SbTykm lSwm at Smw Sm lSknw tdrSw wbat Smh and unto the stand-up-place which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these choose out of all your branchs to put his name there, even unto his habitation ye seek, and thither thou come: ki ’im ’el hamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh ’elohekhem mikal shibtekhem lasum shemo sham, leshikhno tidreshu ubata shamah.
whbatm Smh eltykm wcbxykm wat meSrtykm wat trwmt ydkm wndrykm wndbtykm wbkrt bqrkm wzankm and thither ye inward your on-ups, and your butchers, and your tithes, and raise-rums of your hand, and your vows, and your volunteers, and the firstlings of your visit-cattles and of your flocks: vahabetem shamah ‘olotekhem vezibkhekhem ve’et ma‘serotekhem ve’et terumat yedkhem, venidrekhem venidbotekhem ubekhorot beqarkhem vezonekhem.
wakltm Sm lpny yhwh alhykm wSmxtm bkl mSlx ydkm atm wbtykm aSr brkk yhwh alhyk and there ye eat before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, and ye rejoice in all that ye put your hand unto, ye and your daughter-households, wherein yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath knee-fluffy-blessed thee. va’akhaltem sham lifnei yhvh ’elohekhem usemakhtem bekhol mishlakh yedkhem ’atem ubatekhem, ’asher berakhkha yhvh ’elohekha.
la teSwn kkl aSr anxnw eSym ph hywm ayS kl hySr beynyw ye not do after all the things that we do here this day, every man whatsoever is right in his own eyes. lo ta‘asun kekhol ’asher ’anakhnu ‘osim poh hayom, ’ish kal hayashar be‘enav.
ky la batm ed eth al hmnwxh wal hnxlh aSr yhwh alhyk ntn lk for ye are not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these giveth you. ki lo batem ‘ad ‘atah, ’el hamenukhah ve’el hanakhalah ’asher yhvh ’elohekha noten lakh.
webrtm at hyrdn wySbtm barz aSr yhwh alhykm mnxyl atkm whnyx lkm mkl aybykm msbyb wySbtm bTx and when ye go over jordan-its-going-down, and dwell in the land which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these giveth you to inherit, and when he giveth you rest from all your father-adversaries round about, so that ye dwell in safety; va‘abartem hayarden vishabtem ba’arez ’asher yhvh ’elohekhem mankhil ’etkhem, veheniakh lakhem mikal ’oyebekhem misabib vishabtem betakh.
whyh hmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh alhykm bw lSkn Smw Sm Smh tbyaw at kl aSr anky mzwh atkm ewltykm wcbxykm meSrtykm wtrmt ydkm wkl mbxr ndrykm aSr tdrw lyhwh then there be a place which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these choose to cause his name to dwell there; thither ye bring all that i direct you; your on-ups, and your butchers, your tithes, and the raise-rum of your hand, and all your choice vows which ye vow unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah: vehayah hamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh ’elohekhem bo leshaken shemo sham shamah tabi’u kal ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem, ‘olotekhem vezibkhekhem ma‘serotekhem uterumat yedkhem vekhol mibkhar nidrekhem ’asher tideru yhvh.
wSmxtm lpny yhwh alhykm atm wbnykm wbntykm webdykm wamhtykm whlwy aSr bSerykm ky ayn lw xlq wnxlh atkm and ye rejoice before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, ye, and your children-betweens, and your children-betweenesss, and your workers, and your maid-mothers, and the levi-jointe that is within your hair-gates; forasmuch as he hath no part nor inheritance with you. usemakhtem lifnei yhvh ’elohekhem ’atem ubenekhem ubenotekhem ve‘abdekhem ve’amhotekhem, vehalevi ’asher besha‘arekhem ki ’en lo kheleq venakhalah ’itekhem.
hSmr lk pn telh eltyk bkl mqwm aSr trah take heed to thyself that thou inward not thy on-ups in every place that thou seest: hishamer lekha pen ta‘aleh ‘olotekha, bekhal maqom ’asher tir’eh.
ky am bmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh baxd SbTyk Sm telh eltyk wSm teSh kl aSr anky mzwk and in the stand-up-place which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah choose in one of thy branchs, there thou up-to thy on-ups, and there thou do all that i direct thee. ki ’im bamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh be’akhad shebatekha sham ta‘aleh ‘olotekha, vesham ta‘aseh kol ’asher ’anokhi mezaveka.
rq bkl awt npSk tcbx waklt bSr kbrkt yhwh alhyk aSr ntn lk bkl Seryk hTma whThwr yaklnw kzby wkayl notwithstanding thou mayest kill and eat flesh in all thy hair-gates, whatsoever thy being lusteth after, according to the knee-fluffy-blessing of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these which he hath given thee: the stained-ceased and the bright-climaxing may eat thereof, as of the swollen-gazelle, and as of the to-hart. raq bekhal ’avat nafshekha tizbakh ve’akhalta basar kebirkat yhvh ’elohekha ’asher natan lekha bekhal she‘arekha, hatamei vehatahor yokhelenu kazebi vekha’ayal.
rq hdm la taklw el harz tSpknw kmym only ye not eat the blood; ye pour it upon the earth as from-waters. raq hadam lo tokhelu, ‘al ha’arez tishpekhenu kamayim.
la twkl lakl bSeryk meSr dgnk wtyrSk wyzhrk wbkrt bqrk wzank wkl ndryk aSr tdr wndbtyk wtrwmt ydk thou mayest not eat within thy hair-gates the tithe of thy corn-swimming, or of thy wine-inherit, or of thy name-from-oil, or the firstlings of thy visit-cattles or of thy flock, nor any of thy vows which thou vowest, nor thy volunteers, or raise-rum of thine hand: lo tukhal le’ekhol bish‘arekha ma‘sar deganekha vetiroshekha veyizharekha ubekhorot beqarekha vezonekha, vekhal nedarekha ’asher tidor venidbotekha uterumat yadekha.
ky am lpny yhwh alhyk taklnw bmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh alhyk bw ath wbnk wbtk webdk wamtk whlwy aSr bSeryk wSmxt lpny yhwh alhyk bkl mSlx ydk and thou must eat them before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these in the stand-up-place which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these choose, thou, and thy child-between, and thy daughter-hoof-bat-child, and thy worker, and thy mum-true-maid, and the levi-jointe that is within thy hair-gates: and thou rejoice before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these in all that thou puttest thine hands unto. ki ’im lifnei yhvh ’elohekha tokhelenu bamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh ’elohekha bo ’atah ubinkha ubitekha ve‘abdekha va’amatekha vehalevi ’asher bish‘arekha, vesamakhta lifnei yhvh ’elohekha bekhol mishlakh yadekha.
hSmr lk pn tecb at hlwy kl ymyk el admtk take heed to thyself that thou forsake not the levi-jointe as long as thou livest upon the earth. hishamer lekha pen ta‘azob halevi, kal yamekha ‘al ’admatekha.
ky yrxyb yhwh alhyk at gbwlk kaSr dbr lk wamrt aklh bSr ky tawh npSk lakl bSr bkl awt npSk takl bSr when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these enlarge thy border, as he hath promised thee, and thou say, i will eat flesh, because thy being longeth to eat flesh; thou mayest eat flesh, whatsoever thy being lusteth after. ki yarkhib yhvh ’elohekha gebulekha ka’asher diber lakh ve’amarta ’okhelah basar ki te’aveh le’ekhol basar, bekhal ’avat nafshekha tokhal basar.
ky yrxq mmk hmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh alhyk lSwm Smw Sm wcbxt mbqrk wmzank aSr ntn yhwh lk kaSr zwytk waklt bSeryk bkl awt npSk if the stand-up-place which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath chosen to put his name there be too far from thee, then thou kill of thy visit-cattle and of thy flock, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath given thee, as i have direct thee, and thou eat in thy hair-gates whatsoever thy being lusteth after. ki yirkhaq mimekha hamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh ’elohekha lasum shemo sham vezabakhta mibeqarekha umizonekha ’asher natan yhvh lekha ka’asher zivitikha, ve’akhalta bish‘arekha bekhol ’avat nafshekha.
ak kaSr yakl at hzby wat hayl kn taklnw hTma whThwr yxdw yaklnw even as the swollen-gazelle and the to-hart is eaten, so thou eat them: the stained-ceased and the bright-climaxing eat of them alike. ’akh ka’asher ye’akhel hazebi ve’et ha’ayal ken tokhelenu, hatamei vehatahor yakhdav yokhelenu.
rq xcq lblty akl hdm ky hdm hwa hnpS wla takl hnpS em hbSr only be sure that thou eat not the blood: for the blood is the life; and thou mayest not eat the life with the flesh. raq khazaq lebilti ’akhol hadam ki hadam hu hanafesh, velo tokhal hanefesh ‘im habasar.
la taklnw el harz tSpknw kmym no eat it; thou pour it upon the earth as from-waters. lo tokhelenu, ‘al ha’arez tishpekhenu kamayim.
la taklnw lmen yyTb lk wlbnyk axryk ky teSh hySr beyny yhwh no eat it; that it may go well with thee, and with thy children-betweens after thee, when thou do that which is right in the sight of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah. lo tokhelenu, lema‘an yitab lekha ulebanekha ’akharekha ki ta‘aseh hayashar be‘enei yhvh.
rq qdSyk aSr yhyw lk wndryk tSa wbat al hmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh only thy dedicated-finished things which thou hast, and thy vows, thou take, and go unto the stand-up-place which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah choose: raq qadashekha ’asher yihyu lekha unedarekha, tisa ubata ’el hamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh.
weSyt eltyk hbSr whdm el mcbx yhwh alhyk wdm cbxyk ySpk el mcbx yhwh alhyk whbSr takl and thou inward thy on-ups, the flesh and the blood, upon the butcher-kitchen of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these: and the blood of thy butchers be poured out upon the butcher-kitchen of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, and thou eat the flesh. ve‘asita ‘olotekha habasar vehadam ‘al mizbakh yhvh ’elohekha, vedam zebakhekha yishafekh ‘al mizbakh yhvh ’elohekha vehabasar tokhel.
Smr wSmet at kl hdbrym halh aSr anky mzwk lmen yyTb lk wlbnyk axryk ed ewlm ky teSh hTwb whySr beyny yhwh alhyk observe and hear all these bee-words which i direct thee, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children-betweens after thee for ever, when thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these. shemor veshama‘ta kal hadebarim ha’eleh ’asher ’anokhi mezaveka, lema‘an yitab lekha ulebanekha ’akharekha ‘ad ‘olam ki ta‘aseh hatob vehayashar be‘enei yhvh ’elohekha.
ky ykryt yhwh alhyk at hgwym aSr ath ba Smh lrSt awtm mpnyk wyrSt atm wySbt barzm when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these cut off the nations from before-turns thee, whither thou goest to possess them, and thou succeedest them, and dwellest in their land; ki yakhrit yhvh ’elohekha hagoyim ’asher ’atah ba shamah lareshet mipanekha, veyarashta ’otam veyashabta be’arzam.
hSmr lk pn tnqS axryhm axry hSmdm mpnyk wpn tdrS lalhyhm lamr aykh yebdw hgwym halh at alhyhm waeSh kn gm any take heed to thyself that thou be not snared by following them, after that they be destroyed from before-turns thee; and that thou inquire not after their to-no-these, saying, how did these nations work for their to-no-these? even so will i do likewise. hishamer lekha pen tinaqesh ’akharehem ’akharei hishamedam mipanekha, ufen tidrosh lelohehem lemor ’ekhah ya‘abdu hagoyim ha’eleh ’elohehem ve’e‘eseh ken gam ’ani.
la teSh kn lyhwh alhyk ky kl twebt yhwh aSr Sna eSw lalhyhm ky gm at bnyhm wat bntyhm ySrpw baS lalhyhm no do so unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these: for every abomination to yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah, which he hateth, have they done unto their to-no-these; for even their children-betweens and their children-betweenesss they have burnt in the fire to their to-no-these. lo ta‘aseh khen yhvh ’elohekha, ki kal to‘abat yhvh ’asher sane ‘asu lelohehem ki gam benehem ve’et benotehem yisrefu ba’esh lelohehem.
at kl hdbr aSr anky mzwh atkm atw tSmrw leSwt la tsp elyw wla tgre mmnw what thing soever i direct you, guard-observe to do it: no add thereto, nor diminish from it. kal hadabar ’asher ’anokhi mezaveh ’etkhem tishmeru la‘asot, lo tosef ‘alav velo tigra‘ mimenu.
ky yqwm bqrbk nbya aw xlm xlwm wntn alyk awt aw mwpt if there arise among you a bringer, or a dreamer of dreams, and giveth thee a sign or a wonder, ki yaqum beqirbekha nabi ’o kholem khalom, venatan ’elekha ’ot ’o mofet.
wba hawt whmwpt aSr dbr alyk lamr nlkh axry alhym axrym aSr la ydetm wnebdm and the sign or the wonder come to pass, whereof he spake unto thee, saying, let us go after other to-no-these, which thou hast not hand-known, and let us work for them; uba ha’ot vehamofet ’asher diber ’elekha lemor, nelekhah ’akharei ’elohim ’akherim ’asher lo yeda‘tam vena‘abedem.
la tSme al dbry hnbya hhwa aw al xwlm hxlwm hhwa ky mnsh yhwh alhykm atkm ldet hySkm ahbym at yhwh alhykm bkl lbbkm wbkl npSkm no hearken unto the bee-words of that bringer, or that dreamer of dreams: for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these proveth you, to hand-know whether ye love yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these with all your heart and with all your being. lo tishma‘ ’el dibrei hanabi hahu ’o ’el kholem hakhalom hahu, ki menaseh yhvh ’elohekhem ’etkhem lada‘at hayishkhem ’ohabim yhvh ’elohekhem bekhal lebabkhem ubekhal nafshekhem.
axry yhwh alhykm tlkw watw tyraw wat mzwtyw tSmrw wbqlw tSmew watw tebdw wbw tdbqwn ye walk after yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, and fear him, and keep his directives, and obey his voice, and ye work for him, and cleave unto him. ’akharei yhvh ’elohekhem telekhu ve’oto tira’u, ve’et mizvotav tishmoru ubeqolo tishma‘u ve’oto ta‘abodu ubo tidbaqun.
whnbya hhwa aw xlm hxlwm hhwa ywmt ky dbr srh el yhwh alhykm hmwzya atkm marz mzrym whpdk mbyt ebdym lhdyxk mn hdrk aSr zwk yhwh alhyk llkt bh wbert hre mqrbk and that bringer, or that dreamer of dreams, be put to death; because he hath bee-spoken to turn you away from yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these, which brought you out of the land of mizraim-narrows, and redeemed you out of the daughter-house of bondage, to thrust thee out of the way which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these direct thee to walk in. so thou put the bad away from the midst of thee. vehanabi hahu ’o kholem hakhalom hahu yumat ki diber sarah ‘al yhvh ’elohekhem hamozi ’etkhem me’erez mizrayim vehapodekha mibet ‘abadim lehadikhakha min haderekh ’asher zivekha yhvh ’elohekha lalekhet bah, ubi‘arta hara‘ miqirbekha.
ky ysytk axyk bn amk aw bnk aw btk aw aSt xyqk aw rek aSr knpSk bstr lamr nlkh wnebdh alhym axrym aSr la ydet ath wabtyk if thy brother, child-between of thy mother, or thy child-between, or thy daughter-hoof-bat-child, or the woman of thy bosom, or thy friend, which is as thine own being, entice thee secretly, saying, let us go and work for other to-no-these, which thou hast not hand-known, thou, nor thy fathers; ki yesitekha ’akhikha ben ’imekha ’o binkha ’o bitekha ’o ’eshet kheqekha ’o re‘akha ’asher kenafshekha baseter lemor, nelekhah vena‘abdah ’elohim ’akherim ’asher lo yada‘ta ’atah va’abotekha.
malhy hemym aSr sbybtykm hqrbym alyk aw hrxqym mmk mqzh harz wed qzh harz namely, of the to-no-these of the with-mum-people which are round about you, nigh unto thee, or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth; me’elohei ha‘amim ’asher sebibotekhem haqerobim ’elekha ’o harekhoqim mimeka, miqzeh ha’arez ve‘ad qezeh ha’arez.
la tabh lw wla tSme alyw wla txws eynk elyw wla txml wla tksh elyw no consent unto him, nor hearken unto him; neither thine eye pity him, neither thou spare, neither thou conceal him: lo tobeh lo velo tishma‘ ’elav, velo takhos ‘enekha ‘alav velo takhmol velo tekhaseh ‘alav.
ky hrg thrgnw ydk thyh bw braSwnh lhmytw wyd kl hem baxrnh and thou surely kill him; thine hand be first upon him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the with-mum-people. ki harog tahargenu yadekha tihyeh bo barishonah lahamito, veyad kal ha‘am ba’akharonah.
wsqltw babnym wmt ky bqS lhdyxk mel yhwh alhyk hmwzyak marz mzrym mbyt ebdym and thou father-child-stone him with stones, that he die; because he hath sought to thrust thee away from yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, which brought thee out of the land of mizraim-narrows, from the daughter-house of bondage. useqalto ba’abanim vamet, ki biqesh lehadikhakha me‘al yhvh ’elohekha hamozi’akha me’erez mizrayim mibet ‘abadim.
wkl ySral ySmew wyrawn wla ywspw leSwt kdbr hre hch bqrbk and all israel-juicy-towards hear, and fear, and do no more any such wickedness as this is among you. vekhal yisra’el yishme‘u veyira’un, velo yosifu la‘asot kadabar hara‘ hazeh beqirbekha.
ky tSme baxt eryk aSr yhwh alhyk ntn lk lSbt Sm lamr if thou hear say in one of thy cities, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath given thee to dwell there, saying, ki tishma‘ be’akhat ‘arekha ’asher yhvh ’elohekha noten lekha lashebet sham lemor.
yzaw anSym bny blyel mqrbk wydyxw at ySby eyrm lamr nlkh wnebdh alhym axrym aSr la ydetm certain men, children-betweens of belial-in-good-time-wear-out, are gone out from inward you, and have withdrawn the inhabitants of their light-city, saying, let us go and work for other to-no-these, which ye have not hand-known; yaze’u ’anashim bene beliya‘al miqirbekha vayadikhu yoshebei ‘iram lemor, nelekhah vena‘abdah ’elohim ’akherim ’asher lo yeda‘tem.
wdrSt wxqrt wSalt hyTb whnh amt nkwn hdbr neSth htwebh hcat bqrbk then thou inquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and, behold, if it be truth, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought among you; vedarashta vekhaqarta vesha’alta heteb, vehineh ’emet nakhon hadabar ne‘estah hato‘ebah hazot beqirbekha.
hkh tkh at ySby heyr hhwa hhya lpy xrb hxrm ath wat kl aSr bh wat bhmth lpy xrb thou surely hit the inhabitants of that light-city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein, and the in-them-animal thereof, with the edge of the sword. hakeh takeh yoshebei ha‘ir hahu hahi lefi khareb, hakharem ’otah ve’et kal ’asher bah ve’et behemtah lefi khareb.
wat kl Sllh tqbz al twk rxbh wSrpt baS at heyr wat kl Sllh klyl lyhwh alhyk whyth tl ewlm la tbnh ewd and thou gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the street thereof, and burn with fire the light-city, and all the spoil thereof every whit, for yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these: and it be an heap for ever; it not be between-built again. ve’et kal shelalah tiqboz ’el tokh rekhobah vesarafta ba’esh ha‘ir ve’et kal shelalah kalil yhvh ’elohekha, vehayetah tel ‘olam lo tibaneh ‘od.
wla ydbq bydk mawmh mn hxrm lmen ySwb yhwh mxrwn apw wntn lk rxmym wrxmk whrbk kaSr nSbe labtyk and there cleave nought of the cursed thing to thine hand: that yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah may turn from the fierceness of his nose-anger, and give thee womb-mercies, and have uterus-compassion on thee, and multiply thee, as he hath sworn unto thy fathers; velo yidbaq beyadekha me’umah min hakherem, lema‘an yashub yhvh mekharon ’apo venatan lekha rakhamim verikhamkha vehirbekha ka’asher nishba‘ la’abotekha.
ky tSme bqwl yhwh alhyk lSmr at kl mzwtyw aSr anky mzwk hywm leSwt hySr beyny yhwh alhyk when thou hearken to the voice of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, to keep all his directives which i direct thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these. ki tishma‘ beqol yhvh ’elohekha lishmor kal mizvotav ’asher ’anokhi mezavekha hayom, la‘asot hayashar be‘enei yhvh ’elohekha.
bnym atm lyhwh alhykm la ttgddw wla tSymw qrxh byn eynykm lmt ye are children-betweens of yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah your to-no-these: ye not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between-bin your eyes for the dead. banim ’atem yhvh ’elohekhem, lo titgodedu velo tasimu qarekhah ben ‘enekhem lamet.
ky em qdwS ath lyhwh alhyk wbk bxr yhwh lhywt lw lem sglh mkl hemym aSr el pny hadmh for thou art an dedicated-finished with-mum-people unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, and yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah hath chosen thee to be a peculiar with-mum-people unto himself, above all the nations that are upon the earth. ki ‘am qadosh ’atah yhvh ’elohekha, ubekha bakhar yhvh lihyot lo le‘am segulah mikol ha‘amim ’asher ‘al penei ha’adamah.
la takl kl twebh no eat any abominable thing. lo tokhal kal to‘ebah.
cat hbhmh aSr taklw Swr Sh kSbym wSh ecym these are the beasts which ye eat: the wall-ox, the sheep, and the intense-goat, zot habehemah ’asher tokhelu, shor seh khesabim veseh ‘izim.
ayl wzby wyxmwr waqw wdySn wtaw wcmr the to-hart, and the swollen-gazelle, and the grave-donkey, and the wild intense-goat, and the fertilize-pygarg, and the wild wall-ox, and the singer-chamois. ’ayal uzebi veyakhmur, ve’aqo vedishon ute’o vazamer.
wkl bhmh mprst prsh wSset Sse Sty prswt melt grh bbhmh ath taklw and every beast that parteth the part-hoof, and cleaveth the cleft into two claws, and cheweth the cud among the beasts, that ye eat. vekhal behemah mafreset parsah veshosa‘at shesa‘ shetei ferasot ma‘alat gerah babehemah, tokhelu.
ak at ch la taklw mmely hgrh wmmprysy hprsh hSsweh at hgml wat harnbt wat hSpn ky melh grh hmh wprsh la hprysw Tmaym hm lkm nevertheless these ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the cloven part-hoof; as the ripen-camel, and the pine-house-hare, and the turn-coney: for they chew the cud, and divide not the part-hoof; therefore they are stained-ceased unto you. ’akh zeh lo tokhelu mima‘alei hagerah umimafrisei haparsah hashesu‘ah, hagamal ve’et ha’arnebet ve’et hashafan ki ma‘aleh gerah hemah ufarsah lo hifrisu teme’im hem lakhem.
wat hxcyr ky mprys prsh hwa wla grh Tma hwa lkm mbSrm la taklw wbnbltm la tgew and the return-swine, because it divideth the part-hoof, yet cheweth not the cud, it is stained-ceased unto you: ye not eat of their flesh, nor touch their dead carcass. ve’et hakhazir ki mafris parsah hu velo gerah tamei hu lakhem, mibesaram lo tokhelu ubeniblatam lo tiga‘u.
at ch taklw mkl aSr bmym kl aSr lw snpyr wqSqSt taklw these ye eat of all that are in the from-waters: all that have fins and scales ye eat: zeh tokhelu mikol ’asher bamayim, kol ’asher lo senapir veqasqeset tokhelu.
wkl aSr ayn lw snpyr wqSqSt la taklw Tma hwa lkm and whatsoever hath not fins and scales ye may not eat; it is stained-ceased unto you. vekhol ’asher ’en lo senapir veqasqeset lo tokhelu, tamei hu lakhem.
kl zpwr Thrh taklw of all bright-climaxing birds ye eat. kal zipor tehorah tokhelu.
wch aSr la taklw mhm hnSr whprs whecnyh and these are they of which ye not eat: the drop-eagle, and the slize-spread-ossifrage, and the daring-ospray, vezeh ’asher lo tokhelu mehem, hanesher vehaperes veha‘azeniyah.
whrah wat hayh whdyh lmynh and the view-glede, and the where-buzzard, and the enough-kite after his kind, vehara’ah ve’et ha’ayah vehadayah leminah.
wat kl erb lmynw and every evening-raven after his kind, ve’et kal ‘oreb lemino.
wat bt hyenh wat htxms wat hSxp wat hnz lmynhw and the daughter-of-dove-ostrich, and the rob-night-go-out-hawk, and the sprocket-seagull, and the go-out-hawk after his kind, ve’et bat haya‘anah ve’et hatakhmas ve’et hashakhaf, ve’et hanez leminehu.
at hkws wat hynSwp whtnSmt the cup-daughter-of-dove-ostrich, and the blow-daughter-of-dove-ostrich, and the give-that-dead-barn-daughter-of-dove-ostrich, hakos ve’et hayanshuf vehatinshamet.
whqat wat hrxmh wat hSlk and the now-pelican, and the gier drop-eagle, and the send-cormorant, vehaqa’at ve’et harakhamah ve’et hashalakh.
whxsydh whanph lmynh whdwkypt wheTlp and the charity-stork, and the sift-heron after her kind, and the pushing-lapwing, and the hoof-bat. vehakhasidah veha’anafah leminah, vehadukhifat veha‘atalef.
wkl Srz hewp Tma hwa lkm la yaklw and every creeping thing that flieth is stained-ceased unto you: they not be eaten. vekhol sherez ha‘of tamei hu lakhem, lo ye’akhelu.
kl ewp Thwr taklw and of all bright-climaxing fowls ye may eat. kal ‘of tahor tokhelu.
la taklw kl nblh lgr aSr bSeryk ttnnh waklh aw mkr lnkry ky em qdwS ath lyhwh alhyk la tbSl gdy bxlb amw ye not eat of anything that dieth of itself: thou give it unto the stranger that is in thy hair-gates, that he may eat it; or thou mayest sell it unto an alien: for thou art an dedicated-finished with-mum-people unto yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these. no seethe a kid in his mother's milk. lo tokhelu khal nebelah lager ’asher bish‘arekha titenenah va’akhalah ’o makhor lenakheri ki ‘am qadosh ’atah yhvh ’elohekha, lo tebashel gedi bakhaleb ’imo.
eSr teSr at kl tbwat crek hyza hSdh Snh Snh thou truly tithe all the increase of thy seed, that the field bringeth forth year by year. ‘aser te‘aser kal tebu’at zar‘ekha, hayozei hasadeh shanah shanah.
waklt lpny yhwh alhyk bmqwm aSr ybxr lSkn Smw Sm meSr dgnk tyrSk wyzhrk wbkrt bqrk wzank lmen tlmd lyrah at yhwh alhyk kl hymym and thou eat before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, in the stand-up-place which he choose to place his name there, the tithe of thy corn-swimming, of thy wine-inherit, and of thine name-from-oil, and the firstlings of thy visit-cattles and of thy flocks; that thou mayest learn to fear yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these always. ve’akhalta lifnei yhvh ’elohekha bamaqom ’asher yibkhar leshaken shemo sham ma‘sar deganekha tiroshekha veyizharekha ubekhorot beqarekha vezonekha, lema‘an tilmad leyir’ah yhvh ’elohekha kal hayamim.
wky yrbh mmk hdrk ky la twkl Satw ky yrxq mmk hmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh alhyk lSwm Smw Sm ky ybrkk yhwh alhyk and if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it; or if the place be too far from thee, which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these choose to set his name there, when yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these hath knee-fluffy-blessed thee: vekhi yirbeh mimekha haderekh ki lo tukhal se’eto ki yirkhaq mimekha hamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh ’elohekha lasum shemo sham, ki yebarekhkha yhvh ’elohekha.
wntth bksp wzrt hksp bydk whlkt al hmqwm aSr ybxr yhwh alhyk bw then thou turn it into money, and bind up the money in thine hand, and go unto the stand-up-place which yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these choose: venatatah bakasef, vezarta hakesef beyadekha vehalakhta ’el hamaqom ’asher yibkhar yhvh ’elohekha bo.
wntth hksp bkl aSr tawh npSk bbqr wbzan wbyyn wbSkr wbkl aSr tSalk npSk waklt Sm lpny yhwh alhyk wSmxt ath wbytk and thou bestow that money for whatsoever thy being lusteth after, for wall-oxen, or for sheep, or for wine-inherit, or for strong drink, or for whatsoever thy being desireth: and thou eat there before-turns yhwh-aeiou-ohyeah thy to-no-these, and thou rejoice, thou, and thine daughter-household, venatatah hakesef bekhol ’asher te’aveh nafshekha babaqar ubazon ubayayin ubashekhar ubekhol ’asher tish’alekha nafshekha, ve’akhalta sham lifnei yhvh ’elohekha vesamakhta ’atah ubetekha.
whlwy aSr bSeryk la tecbnw ky ayn lw xlq wnxlh emk and the levi-jointe that is within thy hair-gates; no forsake him; for he hath no part nor inheritance with thee. vehalevi ’asher bish‘arekha lo ta‘azbenu, ki ’en lo kheleq venakhalah ‘imakh.
